description: A four-part docuseries that sheds new light on the infamous 1958 Charles Starkweather and Caril Ann Fugate murder case, in which the teenage couple was charged and convicted of brutally killing 11 victims at random.

title: Hello Tomorrow!
description: Set in a retro-future world, traveling salesmen Jack (Billy Crudup) and his co-workers sell timeshares on the moon in this dramedy from Amit Bhalla and Lucas Jansen.

title: Animal Control
description: Cynical Animal Control officer Frank Shaw (Joel McHale) has a new rookie partner, the optimistic Fred "Shred" Taylor (Michael Rowland) in this workplace comedy from Bob Fisher, Rob Greenberg and Dan Sterling.

title: Red Rose
description: 16-year-old Rochelle (Isis Hainsworth) and her friends download the Rose Red app, but they soon discover the sinister consequences of using it in this British horror created by Michael and Paul Clarkson. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Three on 15 Aug 2022 and in the US on Netflix on 15 Feb 2023]

title: Full Swing
description: The documentary series that follows pro golfers Joel Dahmen, Tony Finau, Matt Fitzpatrick, Rory McIlroy, Dustin Johnson, Brooks Koepka, Collin Morikawa, Mito Pereira, Ian Poulter, Scottie Scheffler, Jordan Spieth, Sahith Theegala, Justin Thomas, and Cameron Young as they compete during the PGA tour including: the Masters/Augusta National...

title: African Queens: Njinga
description: Queen Njinga of Angola is the focus of this documentary series executive produced by Jada Pinkett Smith.

title: Love Trip: Paris
description: The reality dating series features four American young women who traveled to Paris hoping to find love.

title: Perfect Match
description: Nick Lachey hosts the dating reality series that features singles from Love Is Blind, Selling Tampa, Sexy Beasts, The Circle, The Mole, The Ultimatum: Marry or Move On, Too Hot to Handle, and Twentysomethings: Austin seeking to find love.

title: Marc Maron: From Bleak To Dark
description: Marc Maron's first HBO stand-up comedy special filmed at New York City's Town Hall in Dec 2022 includes topics such as aging, abortion clinics and the death of his partner, director Lynn Shelton.

title: Marvel's Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur
description: 13-year old Lunella Lafayette (voiced by Diamond White) teams up with her best friend Casey (voiced Libe Bare) and a T-Rex (voiced by Fred Tatasciore) to protect the Lower East Side in this animated series based on the comic series of the same name.

title: Funny Woman
description: Set in the 1960s, Blackpool beauty queen Barbara Parker (Gemma Arterton) heads to London aiming for a sitcom role in this British comedy-drama series based on Nick Hornby's 2014 novel Funny Girl. [Premiered originally in the UK on Sky Max on 9 Feb 2023 and in the US on PBS on 7 Jan 2024]

title: Stolen Youth: Inside the Cult at Sarah Lawrence
description: The three-part documentary series directed by Zach Heinzerling features personal footage and interviews with the Sarah Lawrence College students who became victims of Larry Ray's cult that spanned over a decade before he was arrested.

title: Bill Russell: Legend
description: Narrated by Corey Stoll and Jeffrey Wright, the two-part documentary from Sam Pollard includes the last interview with Boston Celtic's Bill Russell before he passed away in 2022 and personal archival material.

title: Not Dead Yet
description: Nell Serrano (Gina Rodriguez) returns from living abroad to start over and gets a job as an obituary writer in the adaptation of Alexandra Potter's book Confessions of a 40-something F**k Up.

title: Murf the Surf: Jewels, Jesus, and Mayhem in the USA
description: The four-part documentary series directed by R.J. Cutler looks into the life of Jack Roland Murphy, who stole the Star of India sapphire from New York's Museum of Natural History in 1964 and committed other crimes.

title: Murder In Big Horn
description: The three-part documentary series directed by Razelle Benally and Matthew Galkin focuses on three cases of murdered and missing Indigenous women in Montana.

title: Dear Edward
description: 12-year-old Edward Adler (Colin O'Brien), the only survivor of a plane crash and the family and friends of the other victims make connections with each other after the tragic accident in the Jason Katims drama series based on the novel of the same name by Ann Napolitano.

title: Nolly
description: The three-part drama from Russell T Davies about Noele "Nolly" Gordon (Helena Bonham Carter), who was fired in 1981 after 18 years on the British soap, Crossroads.

title: Freeridge
description: The "On My Block" spinoff series follows Gloria (Keyla Monterroso Mejia), Ines (Bryana Salaz), Demi (Ciara Riley Wilson) and Cameron (Tenzing Norgay Trainor) as they try to reverse a curse they unwittingly released.

title: Gunther's Millions
description: The four-part docuseries about the connection Maurizio Mian has to a German shepherd named Gunther who inherited $80 million from his late owner.

title: The Ark
description: With their destination still a year away, the crew of Ark One struggles to survive after their ship suffers damage and loss of crew members in this sci-fi drama created by Dean Devlin.

title: Schoolhouse Rock! 50th Anniversary Singalong
description: Jason Biggs, Jenny Mollen, Black Eyed Peas, Fozzie Bear, Derek Hough, Julianne Hough, Kermit the Frog, Ne-Yo, Kal Penn, Raven-Symoné, and Retta performs some of the beloved songs in the Schoolhouse Rock! singalong special hosted by Ryan Seacrest.

title: Fight the Power: How Hip Hop Changed the World
description: The four-part series about hip-hop and its impact on America from Chuck D and Lorrie Boula features interviews and archival footage from such artists as B-Real, Chuck D, Fat Joe, John Forté, Grandmaster Caz, Ice-T, Lupe Fiasco, MC Lyte, Melle Mel, Abiodun Oyewole, Roxanne Shanté, Run DMC, and will.i.am.

title: Cunk on Earth
description: Philomena Cunk (Diane Morgan) hosts a series of documentaries about human development in this British mockumentary series created by Black Mirror's Charlie Brooker. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Two on 19 Sep 2022; in the US on Netflix on 31 Jan 2023]

title: The Watchful Eye
description: Elena Santos (Mariel Molino) takes a live-in nanny job to take care of the young son of a rich widower but soon learns everyone in the Manhattan apartment building has secrets in this series created by Julie Durk.

title: Wild at Heart (UK)
description: This is a British show about Danny Trevanion (Stephen Tompkinson), a Bristol-based veterinarian and his family as they relocate to South Africa to set up a game park. Danny's wife Sarah (Amanda Holden) and her two children Evan (Luke Ward-Wilkinson) and Olivia (Rafaella Hutchinson) joined Danny's child Rosie (Lucy Jo-Hudson) who met Ande...

title: Frozen Planet II
description: Narrated by Sir David Attenborough, the sequel to 2011's Frozen Planet features a return to Arctic and Antarctic as well as other frozen environments farther afield. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 11 Sep 2022 and in the US on BBC America and AMC+ on 28 Jan 2023]

title: Lockwood & Co.
description: Psychic teen Lucy Carlyle (Ruby Stokes) joins a London ghost-hunting agency run by two teenagers named Anthony Lockwood (Cameron Chapman) and George Karim (Ali Hadji-Heshmati) in this supernatural series created by Joe Cornish.

title: Shrinking
description: Still suffering from his own loss, a therapist (Jason Segel), disregards rules and ethics by telling his patients what he actually thinks in this comedy series created by Segel, Bill Lawrence and Brett Goldstein.

title: Wolf Pack
description: Teens Everett Lang (Armani Jackson) and Blake Navarro (Bella Shepard) are attacked by a supernatural creature during a wildfire and discover a connection to twins Luna (Chloe Rose Robertson) and Harlan (Tyler Lawrence Gray) Briggs in this series based on the novels by Edo Van Belkom.

title: Poker Face (2023)
description: With the gift of telling when someone is lying, Charlie (Natasha Lyonne) travels across the country and helps solve crimes in this drama series created by Rian Johnson.

title: The 1619 Project
description: The six-part documentary series expands on Nikole Hannah-Jones and the New York Times Magazine's "The 1619 Project" and delves into slavery's impact on such topics as capitalism, democracy, music, and race.

title: Killing County
description: The three-part documentry series executive produced by Colin Kaepernick and narrated by André Holland focuses on the police shooting death of Jorge Ramirez and its link to corruption and cover up within Kern County's law enforcement.

title: Sexy Beast
description: Set in 1990s East London, the series prequel to Jonathan Glazer's 2000 film of the same name focuses on the relationships between Gal Dove (James McArdle), Don Logan (Emun Elliott), Teddy Bass (Stephen Moyer) and Deedee (Sarah Greene).

title: Extraordinary
description: Jen (Máiréad Tyers) is about to turn 25-years-old and has yet to manifest any powers like everyone else had by their 18th birthday. With help from her best friend Carrie (Sofia Oxenham) and Carrie’s boyfriend Kash (Bilal Hasna), she seeks to find her superpower in this British comedy series created by Emma Moran.

title: Accused (2023)
description: Each episode features a new defendant preparing to hear the verdict before flashbacks tell how they ended up on trial in the Howard Gordon crime drama anthology series based on the British series of the same name.

title: For the Love of DILFs
description: Stormy Daniels hosts the dating competition reality series where 10 gay singles split into two groups - Himbos and Daddies - seek to find love and win $10,000.

title: The Real Friends of WeHo
description: The reality show set in West Hollywood follows the lives of The Rachel Zoe Project's Brad Goreski; Todrick Hall; Curtis Hamilton; Dorión Renaud; Jaymes Vaughan; and Joey Zauzig.

title: That '90s Show
description: Set in 1995, Red (Kurtwood Smith) and Kitty Forman (Debra Jo Rupp) invite their granddaughter Leia (Callie Haverda) to stay for the summer in this sequel to That '70s Show.

title: Stonehouse
description: In November 1974, British politician John Stonehouse (Matthew Macfadyen) faked his death in Miami to start a new life with his mistress in Australia in this three-part drama based on a true story. [Premiered originally in the Uk on ITV on 2 Jan 2023 and in the US on BritBox on 17 Jan 2023]

title: Night Court (2023)
description: Abby Stone (Melissa Rauch), the daughter of the late Judge Harry Stone, takes over the night shift at a New York City court full of eccentrics and skeptics including former prosecutor Dan Fielding (John Larroquette) in the sequel to the 1980s legal comedy series of the same name.

title: The Price of Glee
description: The three-part docuseries features interviews with crew members, reporters, friends of the cast and Naya Rivera's father as it looks into the rapid rise of "Glee" and the tragic death of three cast members.

title: MILF Manor
description: Eight women ranging from 40 to 60 years-old seek love with one of the eight younger men in this dating reality series.

title: The Last of Us
description: Set 20 years after the destruction of civilization, Joel (Pedro Pascal) is hired to smuggle 14-year-old Ellie (Bella Ramsey) out of a quarantine zone in this drama series based on the PlayStation video game of the same name.

title: Break Point (2023)
description: The documentary series follows a group of professional tennis players as they compete in tennis tournaments around the world.

title: The Climb
description: The rock climbing competitive series hosted by Jason Momoa and Chris Sharma features 10 amateur climbers compete to win a prAna sponsorship and $100,000 grand prize.

title: The Makanai: Cooking for the Maiko House
description: Kiyo (Nana Mori) becomes a Makanai (a cook) at a Maiko (apprentice geishas) house in Kyoto in Hirokazu Kore-eda series based on a manga by Aiko Koyaman.

title: The Traitors
description: Hosted by Alan Cummings, 20 contestants (including 10 from such reality shows as The Bachelor, Big Brother, and Survivor) compete in challenges at a Scottish castle to win part of the $250,000 prize, but three competitors have a plan to steal from the others.

title: Velma
description: Velma Dinkley (voiced by Mindy Kaling) teams up with Daphne (Constance Wu), Shaggy (Sam Richardson) and Fred (Glenn Howerton) to solve a murder in the adult animated comedy series from Charlie Grandy that does not include Scooby-Doo.

title: Lingo (2023)
description: Before Wordle, there was Lingo. RuPaul hosts the latest version of the game show that first aired in 1987 that feature teams of two guessing the mystery words over several rounds.

title: Koala Man
description: Australian middle-aged dad Kevin (voiced by Michael Cusack) tries to stop minor crimes in his hometown of Dapto as Koala Man in this animated series created by Cusack.

title: Alert: Missing Persons Unit
description: After the disappearance of Nikki's (Dania Ramirez) son she joins Philadelphia Police Department's Missing Person's Unit where her ex-husband Jason Grant (Scott Caan) also works at the department in this procedural from John Eisendrath and Jamie Foxx.

title: Mayfair Witches
description: Neurosurgeon Rowan Fielding (Alexandra Daddario) learns she descends from a family of witches that are haunted by a dark spirit in this series based on Anne Rice's Lives of the Mayfair Witches series.

title: Boys in Blue
description: The four-part documentry series from Peter Berg focuses on the North Community High School football team who are coached by members of the Minneapolis Police Department as they seek a championship in the aftermath of the police killing of George Floyd.

title: The Rig
description: Magnus MacMillan (Iain Glen) and his crew on an oil rig off the coast of Scotland are ready to return home when they suddenly find themselves enveloped by fog and find communication to the outside world cut off in this thriller created by David Macpherson.

title: Pressure Cooker
description: 11 chefs live together and judge each other's cooking in the reality cooking competition.

title: Copenhagen Cowboy
description: Miu (Angela Bundalovic), a young woman with supernatural gifts, travels to Copenhagen to find out about her past and seek justice in this six-part series from Nicolas Winding Refn. [Premiered at the Venice Film Festival on 9 Sep 2022; set to air in the US on Netflix sometime in 2022]

title: The Lying Life of Adults
description: The Italian-language series adaptation of Elena Ferrante's novel of the same name is centered on the coming-of-age of Giovanna (Giordana Marengo) in 1990s Naples.

title: Special Forces: World's Toughest Test
description: Danny Amendola, Mel B, Hannah Brown, Tyler Florence, Kate Gosselin, Dwight Howard, Montell Jordan, Gus Kenworthy, Nastia Liukin, Carli Lloyd, Beverley Mitchell, Kenya Moore, Mike Piazza, Dr. Drew Pinsky, Anthony Scaramucci and Jamie Lynn Spears compete in challenges used by the Special Forces to select recruits.

title: MADOFF: The Monster of Wall Street
description: The four-part documentary series from Joe Berlinger looks at Bernie Madoff's life and the $64 billion dollar Ponzi scheme with recreations, Madoff's deposition footage, interviews with experts and former employees.

title: Will Trent
description: Special Agent Will Trent (Ramón Rodríguez), who grew up in the foster care system, solves cases for the Georgia Bureau of Investigation (GBI) in this drama series based on Karin Slaughter's book series.

title: America's Got Talent: All-Stars
description: Terry Crews hosts and Simon Cowell, Howie Mandel and Heidi Klum judge 60 former contestants from "America's Got Talent" as well as the "Got Talent" shows from other countries.

title: Paul T. Goldman
description: The relationship single father Paul T. Goldman had with a woman who was hiding many secrets leads to Goldman's book and the series from director Jason Woliner.

title: Kaleidoscope
description: A thief (Giancarlo Esposito) and his crew plan to steal $7 billion from an unbreakable bank vault in this crime drama anthology series. Episodes will be listed in different order for each viewer, except for the final one.

title: Live to Lead
description: The seven-part documentary series features interviews with New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, South Africa rugby team captain Siya Kolisi, former Justice of the Constitutional Court of South Africa Albie Sachs, Gloria Steinem, and Greta Thunberg.

title: The Glory
description: Elementary teacher Moon Dong-eun (Song Hye-kyo) plans revenge on those who tormented her in high school in this South Korean drama series.

title: Coach Prime
description: The four-part documentary series follows Deion Sanders as he coaches the Jackson State Tigers for its 2022 Southwestern Athletic Conference championship season.

title: Treason
description: MI6's Adam Lawrence (Charlie Cox) begins questioning his life when he's reunited with Kara, a Russian spy from his past, and his wife becomes involved in this limited series created by Matt Charman.

title: The Witcher: Blood Origin
description: The six-part prequel to The Witcher set 1200 years before Geralt of Rivia tells the story of the first Witcher and the events that led to the conjunction of the spheres.

title: The Best Man: The Final Chapters
description: Harper (Taye Diggs), Robyn (Sanaa Lathan), Jordan (Nia Long), Lance (Morris Chestnut), Shelby (Melissa De Sousa), Candace (Regina Hall) and Murch (Harold Perrineau) come together as Quentin (Terrence Howard) prepares to get married in the limited series that concludes "The Best Man" film franchise.

title: Mary Berry's Ultimate Christmas
description: Mary Berry shares her recipes for a traditional Christmas dinner including roast turkey, roast potatoes, stuffing, Christmas pudding and a trifle. She is joined by Chef Angela Hartnett, Chef Monica Galetti and Rylan Clark, who include own recipes.

title: The Wheel
description: Created and hosted by British comedian Michael McIntyre, the game show based on the British series of the same name features six celebrities helping contestants answer trivia and a chance to win $100,000.

The second prequel to Yellowstone follows Jacob (Harrison Ford) and Cara Dutton (Helen Mirren) as their family faces challenges such as pandemics, a drought, the end of Prohibition and the Great Depression in 1920s Wyoming.

title: The Recruit (2022)
description: Newly hired CIA lawyer Owen Hendricks (Noah Centineo) discovers a former asset (Laura Haddock) is threatening to expose the agency's secrets unless they clear her for a serious crime in this spy thriller from Alexi Hawley.

title: Litvinenko
description: Former Russian spy Alexander Litvinenko (David Tennant) was poisoned with polonium-210 in London and his widow Marina (Margarita Levieva) seeks to have the Russian State named as perpetrators by the British government in the four-part drama written by George Kay.

title: The Parent Test
description: 12 families let cameras into their homes to see how they parent in this reality series hosted by Ali Wentworth and Dr. Adolph Brown that is based on Australian series Parental Guidance.

title: Beauty and the Beast: A 30th Celebration
description: The latest live musical special features clips from the 1991 animated movie "Beauty and the Beast" and performances from H.E.R. as Belle; Josh Groban as the Beast; Joshua Henry as Gaston; Martin Short as Lumière; David Alan Grier as Cogsworth; Shania Twain as Mrs. Potts; and Rita Moreno as narrator.

title: Sonic Prime
description: Sonic (voiced by Deven Mack) must save his friends and universes after a fight with Dr. Eggman (voiced by Brian Drummond) sends him to a parallel world in the animated series.

title: National Treasure: Edge of History
description: 20-year-old Jess Valenzuela (Lisette Alexis) searches for answers about her deceased father and a lost treasure with the help of her friends in this television series that expands the National Treasure film franchise.

title: Kindred
description: Young Black aspiring writer Dana (Mallori Johnson) has just moved to Los Angeles when she is suddenly pulled back into 1800s at a planation that has ties to her family in this adaptation of Octavia E. Butler's novel of the same name.

title: Bloods
description: The British comedy focuses on London paramedic Mareek (Samson Kayo) and his new partner Wendy (Jane Horrocks) as they deal with medical emergencies and learn to work together. [Premiered originally in the UK on Sky One on 5 May 2021.]

title: Harry & Meghan
description: The six-part documentary series directed by Liz Garbus features interviews, personal videos and pictures about how Duke and Duchess of Sussex, better known as Prince Harry and Meghan, met, fell in love and the challenges that led to move to the United States.

title: Connect
description: Dong-soo (Jung Haein) loses an eye to organ hunters but soon discovers he can see what the person who has his eye is seeing in Miike Takashi's adaptation of Shin Dae-sung's webtoon of the same name.

title: Back in the Groove
description: Three 40-something single ladies date men half their age in this dating reality series hosted by Taye Diggs and inspired by the 1991 film "How Stella Got Her Groove" that was based on Terry McMillan's book of the same name.

title: George & Tammy
description: The relationship between country stars George Jones (Michael Shannon) and Tammy Wynette (Jessica Chastain) is explored in this six-part limited series created by Abe Sylvia.

title: Riches
description: When businessmen Stephen Richards (Hugh Quarshie) passes suddenly, control of his business is fought over by the two estranged adult children from his first marriage and the three adult children of his second wife in this family drama written and created by Abby Ajayi.

title: Three Pines
description: Chief Inspector Armand Gamache (Alfred Molina) and his team investigate murders in a Québec village in this crime drama series adaptation of Louise Penny's mystery novel series.

title: Branson
description: The four-part documentary series from Chris Smith looks at the life and career of the man who created the Virgin brand with interviews with Richard Branson, his colleagues, employees and family, as well as industry experts and journalists.

title: Irreverent
description: After trouble with the Chicago Mob, Paulo Keegan (Colin Donnell) leaves the United States and hides in a small Australian town assuming the identity of Reverend Mackenzie "Mack" Boyd.

title: Willow
description: Willow Ufgood (Warwick Davis) leads a disparate group of heroes to help save the world in this television sequel series to George Lucas's 1988 film "Willow."

title: The Guardians of the Galaxy Holiday Special
description: The holiday special written and directed by James Gunn sees the Guardians looking for a Christmas present for Peter Quill.

title: Shaq
description: The four-part documentry series directed by Robert Alexander about the life and career of NBA's Shaquille O'Neal features interviews with O'Neal, his teammates, coaches, and family members.

title: Pitch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin
description: The TV spinoff of the Pitch Perfect films finds Bumper (Adam DeVine) moving to Germany when one of his songs suddenly becomes a hit there.

title: Echo 3
description: After scientist Amber Chesborough (Jessica Ann Collins) disappears near the Colombia-Venezuela border, her brother (Luke Evans) and her husband (Michiel Huisman) set out to find her in this series based on Omri Givon's Israeli series "When Heroes Fly" and inspired by Amir Gutfreund novel of the same name.

title: Wednesday
description: Wednesday Addams (Jenna Ortega) discovers mysteries in town and about her parents, while learning to control her psychic powers at Nevermore Academy, the boarding school she is sent to after being kicked out of her public high school.

title: Blood, Sex & Royalty
description: The docudrama features input from historians and a modern language dramatization of Anne Boleyn (Amy James-Kelly) and her relationship with Henry VIII (Max Parker).

title: Our Universe
description: The six-part documentary series narrated by Morgan Freeman uses animation, CGI and wildlife footage to illustrate how everything in the natural world is connected.

title: Welcome to Chippendales
description: The limited darkly comedic crime drama series created by Robert Siegel chronicles how Indian immigrant Somen "Steve" Banerjee (Kumail Nanjiani) created The Chippendales and the deadly actions he took against potential competitors.

title: Planet Sex With Cara Delevingne
description: Cara Delevingne travels around the world to talk to experts about a variety of topics related to gender, sexuality and identity. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Three on 3 Dec 2022 and will air in the US on Hulu in Spring 2023]

title: Pickled
description: Hosted by Stephen Colbert, the sports comedy special features Jimmie Allen, Murray Bartlett, Dierks Bentley, Jaime Camil, Will Ferrell, Max Greenfield, Luis Guzman, Phil Keoghan, Daniel Dae Kim, Sugar Ray Leonard, Tig Notaro, June Diane Raphael, Kelly Rowland, Paul Scheer, Aisha Tyler and Emma Watson playing pickleball to support Comic R...

Dr. Maura Franklin (Emily Beecham) is one of the passengers on a ship bound for New York City in 1899 that comes across a ship reported missing months ago in this mystery series from Jantje Friese and Baran bo Odar.

title: Leopard Skin
description: Alba (Carla Gugino) and Batty (Gaite Jansen) are preparing for a dinner party when a trio of jewel robbers invade their house in this thriller created, written and directed by Sebastian Gutierrez.

title: Pepsi, Where's My Jet?
description: The four-part documentry series from Andrew Renzi looks into the 1990s case of then college student John Leonard attempts to force Pepsico to send him a Harrier fighter jet after buying the required Pepsi points seen in an advertisement.

title: Fleishman Is in Trouble
description: 41-year-old Dr. Toby Fleishman (Jesse Eisenberg) is recently divorced and starts using dating apps with great success when his ex-wife, Rachel (Claire Danes), disappears, so he has to take care of their two children in this series based on Taffy Brodesser-Akner's book of the same name.

title: The Santa Clauses (2022)
description: After more than 25 years as Santa, Scott Calvin (Tim Allen) decides it's time to retire and begins looking for a possible successor in this sequel series to The Santa Clause movies.

title: Limitless With Chris Hemsworth
description: Chris Hemsworth tests some of the methods describes by some longevity experts in the documentary series created by Darren Aronofsky.

title: Tulsa King
description: After spending 25 years in jail, Dwight "The General" Manfredi (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself sent to Tulsa, Oklahoma to set up operations for his Mafia boss in the drama series created by Taylor Sheridan.

title: Mammals
description: Jamie (James Corden) recruits the help of his brother-in-law Jeff (Colin Morgan) to find the answers regarding his pregnant wife's secret in this six-part dark comedy-drama series written by Jez Butterworth.

title: The English
description: Set in the 1890s, Lady Cornelia Locke (Emily Blunt) seeks to avenge her son's death with the help of Eli Whipp (Chaske Spencer), a Pawnee ex-cavalry scout in this limited series written and directed by Hugo Blick.

title: The Big Brunch
description: Dan Levy hosts this cooking competitive reality series where ten chefs are judged by Levy, Sohla El-Waylly and Will Guidara to determine who wins the $300,000 grand prize.

title: The Calling
description: NYPD Detective Avraham Avraham (Jeff Wilbusch) beliefs are challenged by a missing persons case is this series based on Dror A. Mishani's novel The Missing File.

title: Save Our Squad with David Beckham
description: David Beckham joins East London's under-14 football (soccer) team, the Westward Boys, to help them return to its winning ways of its past.

title: Spector
description: The four-part documentary series from directors Sheena M. Joyce and Don Argott about the life of actress Lana Clarkson and how music producer Phil Spector was convicted of her murder. [Premieres on the Showtime app and on-demand on 4 Nov 2022 and on the Showtime network on 6 Nov 2022]

title: Dangerous Liaisons
description: Camille (Alice Englert) is being mentored by the current Marquise de Merteuil (Lesley Manville) when she meets Pascal Valmont (Nicholas Denton) in Paris before the French Revolution in this series created and written by Harriet Warner.

title: Lopez vs. Lopez
description: George (George Lopez), his adult daughter Mayan (Mayan Lopez) and ex-wife (Selenis Leyva) are at the center of this family comedy written by Debby Wolfe and Bruce Helford.

title: Blockbuster
description: Timmy Yoon (Randall Park) and the staff at the last Blockbuster store in America seek to keep it open in this comedy series created by Vanessa Ramos.

title: The Suspect
description: Psychologist Dr. Joe O'Loughlin (Aidan Turner) helps the police on a case of murdered girl found in a shallow grave in this five-part thriller based on Michael Robotham's novel of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 29 Aug 2022 and in the US on Sundance Now/AMC+ on 3 Nov 2022]

title: Rogue Heroes
description: During World War II in 1941, Lt. David Stirling (Connor Swindells), Lt. Robert Blair ‘Paddy’ Mayne (Jack O’Connell) and Lt. John ‘Jock’ Lewes (Alfie Allen) are some of the soldiers who formed the British Army's Special Air Service (SAS) in Steven Knight's adaptation of Ben McIntyre's book "SAS: Rogue Heroes." [Premieres in the UK unde...

title: The Devil's Hour
description: Lucy (Jessica Raine) awakens at 3:33am every single night and becomes involved in a murder case where the mysterious Gideon (Peter Capaldi) is the prime suspect in this British thriller created by Tom Moran.

title: The Bastard Son & The Devil Himself
description: As the illegitimate son of a witch known as the "most dangerous in the world," 16-year-old Nathan Byrn (Jay Lycurgo) has been under watch by the Witch Council for years in this fantasy series created by Joe Barton and based on the "Half Bad" book trilogy written by Sally Green.

title: Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities
description: The horror anthology series from Oscar-winning director Guillermo Del Toro features two originals from Del Toro and two based on short stories by H.P. Lovecraft.

title: Criss Angel's Magic With The Stars
description: Celebrities are trained on three types of magic by professional magicians as they compete to win the golden wand. They will perform in front of Criss Angel and a panel of judges who will determine who executed the illusions the best.

title: The Hair Tales
description: Chlöe Bailey, Chika, Marsai Martin, Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley, Issa Rae, and Oprah Winfrey are some of the guests who impart their own personal story of Black hair culture and its connection to identity, beauty, and society in this docuseries executive produced by Tracee Ellis Ross and Michaela Angela Davis. [Premiering on OWN and...

title: From Scratch
description: American student Amahle "Amy" Wheeler (Zoe Saldaña) and Sicilian chef Lino (Eugenio Mastrandrea) overcome a number of obstacles to their love in this limited series based on Tembi Locke's memoir of the same name.

title: The Peripheral
description: Flynne Fisher (Chloe Grace Moretz) earns extra money playing VR games for others and one night she finds herself in a futuristic London that is not a game but real life in this adaptation of William Gibson sci-fi novel of the same name.

title: The Paloni Show! Halloween Special!
description: Siblings Leroy (voiced by Justin Roiland), Reggie (Zach Hadel), and Cheruce Paloni (voice by Pamela Adlon) host a Halloween special that features scary animated shorts from other animators.

title: High School
description: Twins Tegan and Sara Quin (Railey Gilliland and Seazynn Gilliland) struggle with high school and identity in this series based on the Quin's memoir of the same name.

title: Shantaram
description: A fugitive from the law, Lin Ford (Charlie Hunnam) must choose between freedom or love with a woman he meets in 1980s Bombay in this series based on the novel of the same name by Gregory David Roberts.

title: The Watcher (2022)
description: Based on a true story, Dean (Bobby Cannavale) and Nora Brannock (Naomi Watts) discover their dream house has a very unwelcoming neighborhood, including letters about someone watching them in this thriller series created by Ryan Murphy and Ian Brennan.

title: The Playlist
description: The development of Spotify led by Daniel Ek (Edvin Endre) is dramatized in this Swedish six-part limited series.

title: I Love You, You Hate Me
description: The two-part documentary series explores how Barney, the purple singing dinosaur became a target of hate.

title: Professionals
description: Vincent Corbo (Tom Welling) and his security team are hired by billionaire Peter Swann (Brendan Fraser) to protect his interests.

title: The Winchesters
description: The prequel to "Supernatural" tells the story of how John (Drake Rodger) and Mary Winchester (Meg Donnelly) fell in love as they fought demons with fellow hunters Latika (Nida Khurshid) and Carlos (Jonathan "Jojo" Fleites).

title: Maxine
description: The three-part miniseries focuses on the relationship between teaching assistant Maxine Carr (Jemma Carlton) and her fiancée, Ian Huntley (Scott Reid), who murdered 10-year-old girls Jessica Chapman and Holly Wells in 2002. [Premiered originally in the UK on Channel 5 on 10 Oct 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 30 Dec 2022]

title: Let the Right One In
description: Mark (Demián Bichir) tries to provide enough blood for his daughter (Madison Taylor Baez) who was turned into a vampire 10 years ago as a 12-year-old in this series inspired by John Ajvide Lindqvist's Swedish novel and the 2008 film of the same name.

title: Conversations with a Killer: The Jeffrey Dahmer Tapes
description: Joe Berlinger's third Conversations with a Killer's series features audio interview tapes of Jeffrey Dahmer recorded by his attorneys.

title: The Midnight Club
description: A group terminally ill teenagers (Adia, Igby Rigney, Ruth Codd, William Chris Sumpter, Aya Furukawa, Annarah Shephard and Sauriyan Sapkota) at a hospice meet at midnight to tell each other scary tales in this series adaptation of on Christopher Pike's novel of the same name from Mike Flanagan and Leah Fong.

title: The Mole (2022)
description: 12 contestants complete challenges to add money to the final prize but also must try to figure out who is the "mole" that is trying to thwart their efforts in this reboot of the 2000s ABC reality show hosted by Alex Wagner.

title: Fire Country
description: Bode Donovan (Max Thieriot) looks to shorten his prison sentence by volunteering to be part of an inmate firefighting program, but feels uneasy when assigned to work in his hometown.

title: Werewolf by Night
description: After the death of their leader, a group of monster hunters, including werewolf Jack Russell (Gael García Bernal), are sent on a deadly competition to find a relic weapon in this special directed by Michael Giacchino.

title: A Friend of the Family
description: Nick Antosca's limited series based on the true story of the Broberg family centers on how Jan Broberg (Mckenna Grace) was kidnapped multiple times over several years by family friend Robert "B" Berchtold (Jake Lacy).

title: Walker: Independence
description: Set in late 1800s, Bostonian Abby Walker (Katherine McNamara) seeks the killer of her husband in Independence, Texas, where she meets con artist Hoyt Rawlins (Matt Barr), Apache tracker Calian (Justin Johnson Cortez), dancer Kate Carver (Katie Findlay), Chinese immigrant Kai (Lawrence Kao), deputy sheriff Augustus (Philemon Chambers), an...

title: Alaska Daily
description: After making a career-ending mistake, New York investigative journalist Eileen Fitzgerald (Hilary Swank) starts over working at a newspaper in Anchorage in this drama series from Tom McCarthy.

title: The Real Love Boat
description: Singles seeking love take on challenges and go on dates while traveling around the Mediterranean on a Princess Cruises ship on this dating reality series co-hosted by Rebecca Romijn and Jerry O'Connell.

title: Reginald the Vampire
description: Newly turned vampire, Reginald Andres (Jacob Batalon) deals with being bullied by his manager, being in love with a human and the vampire chieftain who wants to kill him in this adaptation of Johnny B. Truant's Fat Vampire book series from Harley Peyton.

title: Hasan Minhaj: The King's Jester
description: The second comedy special on Netflix for Hasan Minhaj was filmed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: East New York
description: Deputy Inspector Regina Haywood (Amanda Warren) takes over the 74th Precinct and with help from her mentor Chief John Suarez (Jimmy Smits) and her police squad as she seeks to change how the community and police interact.

title: Interview With the Vampire
description: Louis de Pointe (Jacob Anderson) tells a reporter about his life in 1900s New Orleans, becoming a vampire companion to Lestat De Lioncourt (Sam Reid) and the arrival of child vampire Claudia (Bailey Bass) in the series adaptation of Anne Rice's novel of the same name.

title: Family Law (2022)
description: After losing her job, Abigail "Abby" Bianch (Jewel Staite) returns home to Vancouver to work at her estranged father's (Victor Garber) law firm with her two half-siblings in this Canadian series. [Premiered originally in Canada on Global TV on 16 Sep 2021 and set to air in the US on The CW on 2 Oct 2022]

title: Jungle
description: British rap and drill music play a part in this series where Gogo (Ezra Elliott) and Slim (RA) are some of the young people who struggle with a number of issues in London.

title: Entergalactic
description: Young artist Jabari (voiced by Scott "Kid Cudi" Mescudi) moves to New York City where he meets a successful photographer (voiced by Jessica Williams) in this animated series co-created by Kid Cudi and Ian Edelman.

title: So Help Me Todd
description: Attorney Margaret Wright (Marcia Gay Harden) hires her aimless ex-private detective son (Skylar Astin) as her law firm's in-house investigator in this legal drama created by Scott Prendergast.

title: Hostages (2022)
description: The four-part documentary series focuses on what led to the Iran Hostage Crisis of 1979 and its effects on international relations as well as those involved.

title: Eat the Rich: The GameStop Saga
description: The three-part documentary series looks into the phenomenon of GameStop's stock in 2021 and features interviews with journalists, hedge fund managers and members of Reddit's wallstreetbets community.

title: Reasonable Doubt (2022)
description: Los Angeles defense attorney Jax Stewart (Emayatzy Corinealdi) is at the center of this legal drama executive produced by Kerry Washington.

title: Nick Kroll: Little Big Boy
description: The first stand-up special on Netflix for Nick Kroll was filmed at Washington, D.C.'s Warner Theatre.

title: The Rookie: Feds
description: FBI rookie Simone Clark (Niecy Nash-Betts) is paired with by-the-books FBI agent Carter Hope (James Lesure) in the spinoff of "The Rookie."

title: Suspect
description: Detective Danny Frater (James Nesbitt) discovers an unidentified body is his daughter and seeks to find her killer in this British crime drama based on the Danish series Forhøret. [Premiered originally in the UK on Channel 4 on 19 Jun 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 27 Sep 2022]

title: Inside Man (2022)
description: A misunderstanding between vicar Harry Watling (David Tennant) and a math tutor (Dolly Wells) leads journalist Beth Davenport (Lydia West) to American death row inmate Jefferson Grieff (Stanley Tucci) in this drama from Steven Moffat. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 26 Sep 2022 and in the US on Netflix on 31 Oct 2022]

title: Karen Pirie
description: Scottish police detective DS Karen Pirie (Karen Pirie) investigates a 25-year-old cold case in this British crime series based on Val McDermid's novels. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 25 Sep 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 25 Oct 2022]

title: Celebrity Jeopardy!
description: What was once just a Saturday Night Live skit is now reality as famous contestants compete to win money for their charity in the celebrity primetime edition of the long-running game show.

title: Thai Cave Rescue
description: The limited series focuses on the 12 boys from a Thai youth football (soccer) team, their coach and the efforts to rescued them in 2018 from the flooded Tham Luang caves.

title: Shadowland
description: Conspiracy theorists are profiled in this six-part documentary series that explores how conspiracy theories take hold of some people.

title: Super/Natural (2022)
description: The nature documentary series produced by James Cameron and narrated by Benedict Cumberbatch examines the extraordinary abilities of some animals.

title: Andor
description: The prequel Star War series follows Cassian Andor's (Diego Luna) journey to become the Rebel leader first introduced in 2016's Rogue One.

title: Dahmer - Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story
description: The 10-part limited series centers on Jeffrey Dahmer's (Evan Peters) life, his victims and the police who failed to capture him for over a decade.

title: The Real Bling Ring: Hollywood Heist
description: The three-part documentry series features interviews with Nick Purgo and Alexis Neiers as well as reenactments to illustrate how they began their theft from the homes of Hollywood stars and were caught.

title: Patton Oswalt: We All Scream
description: The fourth stand-up special on Netflix for Patton Oswalt was directed by Oswalt and filmed at Denver's at Paramount Theatre.

title: Reboot (2022)
description: Reed (Keegan-Michael Key), Clay (Johnny Knoxville), Bree (Judy Greer), and Zack (Calum Worthy) are reluctantly reunited for a reboot of their 2000 sitcom in this comedy series created by Steven Levitan.

title: Quantum Leap (2022)
description: Physicist Ben Seong (Raymond Lee) takes an unauthorized leap into the past leaving behind the team that helped him restart the Quantum Leap accelerator project 30 years after Dr. Sam Beckett disappeared.

title: The U.S. and the Holocaust
description: Narrated by Peter Coyote, the three-part documentry series directed by Ken Burns, Lynn Novick and Sarah Botstein examines the United States' response to the rise of Nazism and the Holocaust through interviews, first-person accounts and archival footage.

title: Crossfire
description: Former police officer Jo (Keeley Hawes) is on vacation in the Canary Islands with family and friends when gunfire erupts at the luxury resort in this three-part British thriller created by Louise Doughty. [Premiered originally in the UK on 20 Oct 2022 on BBC One and in the US on 15 Nov 2022 on BritBox]

title: Sins of our Mother
description: The three-part Skye Borgman documentary series looks at the what was a missing children's case where Lori Vallow and her husband refused to answer questions that soon became multiple murder investigations.

title: Heartbreak High (2022)
description: The reboot of the Australian 1990s teen series centers on Hartley High best friends Amerie (Ayesha Madon) and Harper (Asher Yasbincek).

title: The Come Up
description: The reality series follows six Gen Z New Yorkers as they seek love and continue their goals in modeling, fashion design, photography, acting and nightlife organizing.

title: Cyberpunk: Edgerunners
description: Set in the future, teenager David Martinez travels to Night City where he becomes an edgerunner — a mercenary outlaw also known as a cyberpunk in this anime series from CD PROJEKT RED and Studio Trigger.

title: The Jennifer Hudson Show
description: The daytime talk show hosted by actress/singer Jennifer Hudson features interviews and music performances.

title: Monarch
description: The legacy of country music legends Dottie Cantrell Roman (Susan Sarandon) and Albie Roman (Trace Adkins) is threatened and their daughter (Anna Friel) will do everything to protect it in this drama series created by Melissa London Hilfers.

title: The Serpent Queen
description: Catherine de Medici (Samantha Morton) tells how she rose to power after being married off at the age of 14 to a French count in this drama series based on Leonie Frieda's book "Catherine de Medici: Renaissance Queen of France."

title: Gutsy
description: Dr. Jane Goodall, Goldie Hawn, Kate Hudson, Kim Kardashian, Megan Thee Stallion, Amy Schumer, Gloria Steinem, and Wanda Sykes are some the women Hillary and Chelsea Clinton talk to in this documentary series based on their book, The Book of Gutsy Women.

title: American Gigolo
description: Julian Kaye (Jon Bernthal) tries to restart his life and find who is responsible for his wrongful conviction for murder after being released from a 15-year jail sentence in this series reimagining of the 1980 movie of the same name. [Premieres on the Showtime app and on-demand on 9 Sep 2022 and on the Showtime network on 11 Sep 2022]

title: Last Light
description: Oil engineer Andy Yeats (Matthew Fox) is in the Middle East when a global energy crisis causes chaos around the world in this limited thriller series based on Alex Scarrow's novel of the same name.

title: Wedding Season
description: The eight-year relationship between Lucy Albright (Grace Van Patten) and Stephen DeMarco (Stephen DeMarco) becomes more toxic over the years in this adaptation of Carola Lovering's novel of the same name.

title: Wedding Season
description: Food writer Maria "Tannie Maria" Purvis (Maria Doyle Kennedy) answers a letter from a abused wife for an advice column at her paper. When the women turns up dead, Tannie and her fellow reporter Jessie (Kylie Fisher) investigate in this South African series based on Sally Andrew's novels.

title: Tell Me Lies
description: Psychiatrist Dr. Suzanne Mathis (Emily Deschanel) takes in a young girl (Madeleine Arthur) who escaped from a cult in this thriller limited series based on Daria Polatin's book of the same name.

title: Recipes for Love and Murder
description: The alleged sexual assaults by actor Armie Hammer and the Hammer family are at the center of three-part documentry series that features interviews with his accuser Courtney Vucekovich, attorney Gloria Allred, and his estranged aunt, Casey Hammer.

title: Devil in Ohio
description: Bullied teen Maddie (voiced by Katie Chang) gets help online from her recently deceased father (voiced by Daniel Dae Kim), whose consciousness has been uploaded to the Cloud after an experimental brain scan in this animated sci-fi series based on short stories by Ken Liu.

title: House of Hammer
description: The series is set several millennia before the events of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings when the rings of power were forged by Sauron.

title: Pantheon
description: Psychotherapist Alan Strauss (Steve Carell) is held prisoner by his patient Sam Fortner (Domhnall Gleeson), who divulges he's a serial killer and wants Alan to stop his deadly impulses in this limited series from Joel Fields and Joe Weisberg.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
description: Retired detective inspector Alex Ridley (Adrian Dunbar) is back consulting on cases with DI Carol Farman (Bronagh Waugh) in this British crime drama created by Paul Matthew Thompson. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 28 August 2022 and in the US on PBS on 18 Jun 2023]

title: The Patient
description: Ingrid's (Arden Cho) ambitions to be named partner at a law firm battle with her morals, family expectations and romance in this drama series based on Helen Wan's novel of the same name.

title: Ridley
description: Bill Nye shows the science behind potential global disasters and how we can either lessen, stop or survive them.t them.

title: Partner Track
description: Laura (Aubrey Plaza) and her daughter Chrissy (Lucy DeVito) have to deal with numerous foes including Chrissy's father, Satan (Danny DeVito), who wants her soul as they try to lead a normal life in Delaware in this animated horror comedy from Darcy Fowler, Seth Kirschner and Kieran Valla.

title: The End is Nye
description: The life and career of boxer Mike Tyson (Trevante Rhodes) is dramatized in an eight-part limited series created by Steven Rogers.

title: Little Demon
description: The documentry series follows what happens to a Welsh football (soccer) club and the town it represents when Ryan Renolds and Rob McElhenney becomes owners of the Wrexham Red Dragons in 2020.

title: Mike
description: Palestinian refugee Mo Najjar (Mo Amer)and his family try to adapt to life in in Houston as Mo seeks U.S. Citizenship in this comedy series created by Amer and Ramy Youssef.

title: Welcome to Wrexham
description: Ollie (voiced by Jonathan Groff), a stuffed rabbit toy and a young boy named Billy (Kesler Talbot) search for each other after they are separated in this live-action/animation hybrid limited series inspired by William Joyce's book Ollie's Odyssey.

title: Mo
description: After Chad (Tom Allen) and JT (John Parr) get cancelled, they decide to use their activism to gain back support this comedy series produced by Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim.

title: Lost Ollie
description: Set 200 years before the events of “Game of Thrones,” the prequel focuses on House Targaryen that includes King Viserys Targaryen (Paddy Considine), his younger brother Prince Daemon Targaryen (Matt Smith) and the king's daughter Princess Rhaenyra Targaryen (Emma D’Arcy).

title: Chad and JT Go Deep
description: Best friends Sam (YaYa Gosselin) and Jade (Miya Cech) investigate supernatural mysteries in their hometown of Surfside in this series based on the graphic novels by Kim Dwinell.

title: House of the Dragon
description: Identical twins, Leni and Gina (both played by Michelle Monaghan), have switched lives over the years, but now one is missing in this Australian thriller created by Vanessa Gazy.

title: Surfside Girls
description: A group of ex-inmates are released from prison early due to the pandemic and use their skills to target those who took advantage of the underprivileged in this comedy series created by Greg Garcia.

title: Echoes
description: The Garvey sisters (Sharon Horgan, Anne-Marie Duff, Eva Birthistle, Sarah Greene and Eve Hewson) come under suspicion from life insurance investigators after their brother-in-law's death in this dark comedy series from Horgan.

title: Sprung (2022)
description: The latest Marvel dramedy series finds attorney Jennifer Walters (Tatiana Maslany) juggling superhuman legal cases, dating, and the fact she transforms into a 6-foot-7-inch green hulk when she feel anger or fear.

title: Bad Sisters
description: On the first day of work at GCHQ, 21-year-old intern Saara (Hannah Khalique-Brown) sees the beginnings of a cyber war between Russia and the UK in this six-episode limited series thriller created by Peter Kosminsky.

title: She-Hulk: Attorney at Law
description: In 1506, Leonardo da Vinci (Aidan Turner) recounts his life and career under questioning by Stefano Giraldi (Freddie Highmore) in this drama created by Frank Spotnitz and Steve Thompson.

title: The Undeclared War
description: The 10-part documentary series about the 40-year history of the NBA basketball franchise from Antoine Fuqua features interviews from Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, LeBron James, Magic Johnson, Shaquille O’Neal, as well as members of Jerry Buss' family.

title: Leonardo
description: The five-part documentary series about Faye Yager and the network of people and safe houses she used to help hundreds of mothers and children hide from alleged abusers.

title: Legacy: The True Story of the LA Lakers
description: The comedy series from Abbi Jacobson and Will Graham about the 1940s All-American Girls Professional Baseball League is a reimagining of Penny Marshall's 1992 film of the same name.

title: Children of the Underground
description: The miniseries adaptation of Sheri Fink's non-fiction book of the same name centers on the five days after Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans and the decisions medical staff had to make at Memorial Medical Center.

title: A League of Their Own (2022)
description: 30-year-old Julio Lopez (Chris Estrada) lives with his parents, is dating his high school girlfriend and works at a gang rehabilitation nonprofit called Hugs Not Thugs in this comedy inspired by Estrada's life.

title: Five Days At Memorial
description: All of 17-year-old Olympia "Oly" Chalmers-Davis' plans are changed when she discovers she is pregnant in this Australian comedy-drama series. [Premiered originally in Australia on Stan on 1 Jan 2021, in the UK on BBC One on 20 Oct 2021 and in the US on the CW on 11 Aug 2022]

title: This Fool
description: An animated shorts series featuring Baby Groot (voiced by Vin Diesel) as he grows up and causes mischief.

title: Bump
description: Keke Palmer hosts this revival of the game show where contestants are paired with Jimmy Fallon and other celebrities as they seek to guess the secret password with only one-word clues to win up to $25,000.

title: I Am Groot
description: The three-part documentary series directed by Skye Borgman uses archival news footage, police interrogation tapes; home video and audio; and interviews with law enforcement officials, family members and Anthony Templet, who confessed to killing his father, to examine the events that led to the shooting in 2019.

title: Password (2022)
description: Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Ronnie Wood, and the late Charlie Watts are the focus of this four-part documentary directed by Oliver Murray and Clare Tavernor. [Set to premiere in the UK on BBC Two on 2 Jul 2022; in the US on Epix on 7 Aug 2022]

title: I Just Killed My Dad
description: Morpheus/Dream (Tom Sturridge) escapes from a 100+ years sleep and seeks to revive his kingdom in this series adaptation of Neil Gaiman's comic book series of the same name.

title: My Life as a Rolling Stone
description: The documentary series follows the London-based soccer/football club Arsenal during the 2021-22 season as they play before fans again after a COVID-19 pandemic-interrupted season.

title: The Sandman
description: Beavis and Butt-Head are back in the reboot of the Mike Judge animated comedy that is already promised a second season on Paramount+.

title: All or Nothing: Arsenal
description: The four-part documentry series directed by Alexa Danner examines The Hillside Strangler case with archival recordings of Kenneth Bianchi (who plead guilty and testified against his cousin) as well as new interviews with law enforcement, reporters and Bianchi's ex-girlfriend.

title: Mike Judge's Beavis and Butt-Head
description: The three-part documentary series features interviews with those involved in the disastrous revival of the 1969 festival including Korn's Jonathan Davis, Jewel, Fatboy Slim, Bush's Gavin Rossdale, and the late Woodstock organizer Michael Lang.

title: The Hillside Strangler: Devil in Disguise
description: Four singles seek to find love among 16 other singles based on astrological advice from the Astro Chamber (voiced by Cree Summer) and astrologers Ophira and Tali Edut on this reality dating series.

title: Trainwreck: Woodstock '99
description: 11-year-old Amber Brown (Carsyn Rose) begins sixth grade with her best friend moving away and dealing with her parent's divorce in this comedy series based on the Paula Danziger's book series of the same name.

title: Cosmic Love
description: Sophie (Gugu Mbatha-Raw) begins to question what she is being told about her life before her head injury from a suicide attempt left her with memory loss in this thriller created by Veronica West.

title: Amber Brown
description: Michael (Neil Patrick Harris) finds himself single again in New York City when his husband abruptly leaves him after 17 years in this comedy series from Darren Star and Jeffrey Richman.

title: Surface (2022)
description: The day after Halloween in 1988, Erin, Mac, Tiffany, and KJ were delivering newspapers when they are accidently transported into the future by battling time-travelers. The girls must learn to work together to save the world and get back to 1988 in this series based on the graphic novels written by Brian K. Vaughan and illustrated by Clif...

title: Uncoupled
description: Lenard "Charlamagne" McKelvey late-night series gets a new slightly shorter name and will features discussions with guests about current events.

title: Paper Girls
description: New York attorney Liv (Melissa Barrera) is stranded in the Canadian wilderness after her private plane crashes in this survival thriller Limited series.

title: Hell of a Week with Charlamagne Tha God
description: The town of Millwood was nearly torn apart and an unknown person wants to punish the daughters of those who caused it 20 years ago in Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa and Lindsay Calhoon Bring's reboot of Freeform's Pretty Little Liars.

title: Keep Breathing
description: Emma (Cristin Milioti) and Noah (William Jackson Harper) are at a Mexican resort for their 10th anniversary when they become involved in a 15-year-old mystery.

title: Pretty Little Liars: Original Sin
description: The three-part documentary series looks at how Charlotte and Kayla Laws shut down Hunter Moore's revenge porn site.

title: The Resort
description: The six-part Ethan Hawke documentary about Joanne Woodward and Paul Newman features archival interviews of Woodward and Newman as well as new interviews with Sally Field, Melanie Griffith, and Martin Scorsese.

title: The Most Hated Man on the Internet
description: Former high school friends Shawna (Aida Osman) and Mia (KaMillion) reunite in Miami to form a rap group in this comedy series from Issa Rae.

title: The Last Movie Stars
description: The seven-episode documentary series directed by Randy Wilkins looks into the life and career of New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter.

title: Rap Sh!t
description: Emergency call operator Gabriel (Iain De Caestecker) searches for a woman (Joanna Vanderham) who calls in and seems to know him in this British three-part miniseries. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 17 Jul 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 28 Dec 2022]

title: The Captain
description: The eight-part documentary series about the rise and fall of the Roman Empire with stories of those who interacted with the Colosseum.

title: The Control Room
description: Prince Fichael (voiced by Dana Snyder) and his crew set out from Farzar to fight aliens that are threatening their world in this animated adult sci-fi comedy from Roger Black & Waco O'Guin.

title: Colosseum
description: Nathan Fielder helps people "rehearse" major decisions and/or discussions with the aide of actors and realistic sets in this comedy series written and directed by Fielder.

title: Farzar
description: The three-part Hulu documentry series directed by Matt Tyrnauer looks into the history of the lingerie brand, CEO Les Wexner, and his connection to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: The Rehearsal
description: The sci-fi/horror series inspired by the video game franchise features the story of Jade Wesker (Ella Balinska), her father Albert (Lance Reddick), the Umbrella Corporation, and how New Raccoon City became the origin of a deadly virus that led to a global apocalypse in 2036.

title: Victoria's Secret: Angels and Demons
description: Phoebe (Phoebe Robinson), a 30-something podcaster is forced to get her life in order when her older brother runs for office in this comedy series inspired by Robinson's own book, Everything's Trash But It’s Ok.

title: Resident Evil (2022)
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Marina Zenovich looks into the infamous case of the man who hijacked a passenger plane and escaped with $200,000 by parachuted out of it in November 1971.

title: Everything's Trash
description: Directed by Alison Ellwood and Lucy Walker, the four-part documentary hosted by Michael Pollan focuses on the history and the new ways LSD, psilocybin, MDMA, and mescaline could be used.

title: D.B. Cooper: Where Are You?!
description: 12 celebrity relatives are in one house, competing in challenges, trying to eliminate the other relatives and hide their real identity to win the $100,000 grand prize in tis reality series hosted by Kevin and Frankie Jonas.

title: How to Change Your Mind
description: The three-part documentary from Alex Holder features footage of Donald Trump's 2020 presidential campaign with interviews with Trump, Jared Kushner and former Vice President Mike Pence.

title: Claim to Fame
description: First responders saves lives with air ambulances in the remote parts of Canada in this drama series created by Julie Puckrin.

title: Unprecedented
description: Four teams try pull out objects from a tower made of a variety of everyday items without knocking it over in this game show hosted by Janelle James.

title: SkyMed
description: The six-part documentary series directed by Todd Schramke explores how an anarchy conference in Acapulco started up in 2015 by Canadian entrepreneur Jeff Berwick led to cryptocurrency, drugs, and murder.

title: The Final Straw
description: The prequel series follows Olivia Winfield (Jemima Rooper) as she marries Malcom Foxworth (Max Irons) and discovers the dark secrets at Foxworth Hall that ultimately leads to her locking her grandchildren in the attic.

title: The Anarchists
description: Designer Melanie Rose helps her clients renovate spaces into dedicated erotic rooms.

title: Flowers in the Attic: The Origin
description: Metropolitan Police Bomb Disposal Squad officers Lana Washington (Vicky McClure) and her partner Joel Nutkins (Adrian Lester) work to stop a terrorist bomber in this British thriller executive produced by Jed Mercurio. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 23 Jan 2022; in the US on Peacock on 8 Jul 2022]

title: How To Build a Sex Room
description: High school seniors Erika Vu (Lana Condor) and Gia (Zoe Colletti) are in a car accident which leaves Erika a ghost in this teen comedy series co-created by Erin Ehrlich and Lauren Lungerich.

title: Trigger Point
description: Jimmy Keene (Taron Egerton) was sentenced to 10 years in a minimum security prison with no possibility of parole but is given a choice of a shorter sentence if he enters a maximum-security prison for the criminally insane and can elicit a confession from serial killer Larry Hall (Paul Walter Hauser) in the Dennis Lehane adaptation of Jam...

title: Boo, Bitch
description: The comedic game show hosted by Kelly Ripa features teams of older adults and their grandchildren answering pop culture questions.

title: Black Bird
description: Lunar pilot Bella Sway (Emma McDonald) teams up with detective Paul Serno (Dominic Monaghan) to stop a conspiracy to take control of a moon colony in this sci-fi series set 100 years in the future.

title: Generation Gap
description: Psychic Maggie (Rebecca Rittenhouse) suddenly begins seeing her future after meeting a stranger in this comedy co-written by Justin Adler and Maggie Mull.

title: Moonhaven
description: 28 contestants from "Big Brother," "The Amazing Race," "Love Island," and "Survivor" compete for a chance to win up to $500,000 and to appear on the upcoming series, The Challenge: Global Championship.

title: Maggie (2022)
description: The nature documentry series narrated by Michael B. Jordan explores North America's wildlife and their environments.

title: The Challenge: USA
description: James Reece (Chris Pratt) returns home under investigation after 12 in his Navy SEALs platoon are killed in an ambush in this series based on Jack Carr's novel of the same name.

title: America the Beautiful
description: The two-part documentary about the evolution of Black comedy in the 20th and 21st centuries features interviews with W Kamau Bell, Alonzo Bodden, Wayne Brady, Michael Che, Tiffany Haddish, Kevin Hart, Steve Harvey, DL Hughley, Lil Rel Howery, Amber Ruffin, Sherri Shepherd, Kenan Thompson, Aisha Tyler, and Katt Williams.

title: The Terminal List
description: The cooking competitive reality series hosted by Alejandra Ramos features 10 cooks looking to have their recipe named as America's greatest by judges Leah Cohen, Tiffany Derry and Graham Elliot.

title: Right to Offend: The Black Comedy Revolution
description: The three-part documentary directed by Erica Gornall examines how British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell became involved with Jeffrey Epstein and features interviews with people who knew her.

title: The Great American Recipe
description: Newly single and now billionaire Molly Novak (Maya Rudolph) looks to be more involved with her charity foundation run by Sofia Salinas (Mj Rodriguez) with the help of her assistant Nicholas (Joel Kim Booster), accountant Arthur (Nat Faxon) and her cousin Howard (Ron Funches) in this comedy from Matt Hubbard and Alan Yang.

title: Who is Ghislaine Maxwell?
description: With reunification of North and South Korea in sight, the Professor (Yoo Ji-tae) and the thieves he recruits, aim to steal the newly printed currency from the mint in this Korean adaptation of Money Heist.

title: Loot
description: Trevor Bingley (Rowan Atkinson) causes chaos in his battles with a bee while housesitting a mansion in this comedy series created by Atkinson and William Davies.

title: Money Heist: Korea - Joint Economic Area
description: John Early and Kate Berlant are sitcom stars who are reunited years after they had a very public falling out in this one-hour sketch comedy special.

title: Man Vs Bee
description: Becky Green (Erin Doherty) takes on a new identity to learn more about the mysterious death of the woman (Poppy Gilbert) she is obsessed with in this thriller from Alice Seabright. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 6 Feb 2022 and in the US on Prime Video on 24 Jun 2022]

title: Would It Kill You to Laugh?
description: The four-part documentary series from Ángel Manuel Soto and Kristofer Ríos about the history of the Latin American boy band.

title: Chloe
description: Set in 1985, Cucu "Gordita" Castelli (Olivia Goncalves) and her family moves from Santo Domingo to Miami in this comedic coming-of-age series.

title: Menudo: Forever Young
description: Chef Carmen "Carmy" Berzatto (Jeremy Allen White) returns home to run his family's sandwich shop in Chicago where he faces issues with running a small business, his new employees and his family.

title: Gordita Chronicles
description: The comedy special from Joel Kim Booster was filmed at Catch One in Los Angeles and features topics such as growing up Asian, sex, and sexuality.

title: The Bear
description: The six-part documentary series directed by Nanfu Wang examines the conviction (which was later overturned by DNA evidence in 2009) of six people who admitted to the 1985 murder of a 68-year-old grandmother in Beatrice, Nebraska.

title: Joel Kim Booster: Psychosexual
description: Set in the 1920s, Bella Ainsworth (Natascha McElhone) and her family open an upscale British hotel near the Italian Riviera in this drama based on J.P. O'Connell's novel of the same name.

title: Mind Over Murder
description: Justin (Jordan Gavaris) looks to bond with his biological daughter (Madison Shamoun) he gave up for adoption by spending time together at his family's lakeside cottage, but soon learns it's currently owned by his stepsister (Julia Stiles) in this comedy written by Julian Doucet.

title: Hotel Portofino
description: 16-year-old Isabel "Belly" Conklin (Lola Tung) suddenly finds she has the attention of two boys: Conrad Fisher (Christopher Briney) and Jeremiah (Gavin Casalegno) in this adaptation of Jenny Han’s novel of the same name.

title: The Lake
description: A League of Legends esports team that includes a 17-year-old rookie and a pro with 27 years of experience must learn to work together if they want the championship after failing over the years in this mockumentary series co-created by Tony Yacenda and Dan Perrault.

title: The Summer I Turned Pretty
description: Ex-CIA officer Dan Chase (Jeff Bridges) has been living off-grid for years when an assassin tries to kill him in this series based on Thomas Perry's novel of the same name.

title: Players (2022)
description: A group of Challenger Chefs battle against Iron Chefs Gabriela Camara, Dominique Crenn, Marcus Samuelsson, Curtis Stone, and Ming Tsai in this reboot of the competitive cooking series that sees the return of Chairman Mark Dacascos and is hosted by Alton Brown and Kristen Kish.

title: The Old Man
description: Mid-level tech support employee Clark Thompson (Ben Falcone) suddenly begins to glow and learns needs to get his co-workers to help him save mankind from Satan (Leslie Bibb) in this comedy created by Falcone nd Melissa McCarthy.

title: Iron Chef: Quest for an Iron Legend
description: In the British village of Sherwood, DCS Ian St Clair (David Morrissey) investigation into the murder of a local may be related to the 1980s miners strike and brings the arrival of Metropolitan Police DI Kevin Salisbury (Robert Glenister) in this crime drama created by James Graham. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 13 Jun 2022...

title: God's Favorite Idiot
description: With the death of King Henry VIII, the people around Elizabeth Tudor (Alicia von Rittberg), her sister Mary (Romola Garai), and their newly crowned nine-year-old brother Edward (Oliver Zetterström), seek control over them in the drama series created by Anya Reiss.

title: Sherwood
description: Set in 1971, Navajo Tribal Police Lieutenant Joe Leaphorn (Zahn McClarnon) and his new deputy, Jim Chee (Kiowa Gordon), investigate a double murder in this Graham Roland adaptation of Tony Hillerman's book series.

title: Becoming Elizabeth
description: Flipping Out's Jeff Lewis is back in this reality series where he helps celebrities such as Anthony Anderson, Fortune Feimster, Lamorne Morris, Melissa Rivers, Ashlee Simpson Ross, Evan Ross, Roselyn Sanchez, Mira Sorvino, and Wilmer Valderrama redesign their houses.

title: Dark Winds
description: The tribute show to the late comedian Bob Saget recorded at the Comedy Store features appearances from his family and friends including Jim Carrey, Darren Criss, Seth Green, Michael Keaton, John Mayer, Chris Rock, Jeff Ross, and John Stamos.

title: Hollywood Houselift with Jeff Lewis
description: New vampire Juliette (Sarah Catherine Hook) and vampire hunter Calliope (Imani Lewis) both seek their first kill but they develop romantic feelings for each other in this series based on the V.E. Schwab's short story.

title: Dirty Daddy: The Bob Saget Tribute
description: The reimagining of the Russell T. Davies' Queer as Folk from Stephen Dunn is set in New Orleans where a group of friends are changed by a violent attack on their community.

title: First Kill
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Rachel Dretzin features never-before-scene footage and interviews with survivors as it examines the polygamous sect of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (FLDS) led by Warren Jeffs.

title: Queer As Folk (2022)
description: 16-year-old Pakistani-American Kamala Khan is struggling to find her place at her Jersey City school and at home when she suddenly gets superpowers like her favorite superhero, Captain Marvel.

title: Keep Sweet: Pray and Obey
description: Set in 2012, best friends Maggie (Emma Appleton) and Birdy (Bel Powley) have moved to London where they juggle work and relationships post-university with with friends Amara and Nell in this fictional adaptation of Dolly Alderton's memoir of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Three on 7 Jun 2022 and in the US on Pea...

title: Ms. Marvel
description: Disillusioned American actress Mira (Alicia Vikander) comes to France to film a remake of the French silent film classic, "Les Vampires." She begins to find it difficult to separate herself from the character she plays in this eight-episode limited series based on 1996 film of the same name from Olivier Assayas.

title: Everything I Know About Love
description: The three-part miniseries from Neil McKay and Jeff Pope focuses on the Anthony Walgate (Tim Preston), Gabriel Kovari (Jakub Svec), Daniel Whitworth (Leo Flanagan), and Jack Taylor (Paddy Rowan), who were killed by Stephen Port (Stephen Merchant) aka The Grindr Killer in 2014-15. [Premiered originally in the UK under the title Four Liv...

title: Irma Vep
description: The adaptation of Adam Kay's memoir of the same name follows Adam (Ben Whishaw) as he deals with the challenges of working the OB-GYN ward of a British NHS hospital. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 8 Feb 2022 and in the US on AMC+/Sundance Now on 2 Jun 2022]

title: The Barking Murders
description: Influencer Nina Ali, supermodel Chanel Ayan, entrepreneur Caroline Brooks, Dr. Sara Al Madani, fashion designer Lesa Milan, and Ladies of London's Caroline Stanbury are some of the women in the Real Housewives franchise set in the United Arab Emirates.

title: This Is Going To Hurt
description: 12 dancers learn dance moves demonstrated by Shakira, Nick Jonas, and Liza Koshy as they seek to be named Best Dancer of the Night by the studio audience in this competitive dance series hosted by Camille Kostek.

title: The Real Housewives of Dubai
description: The Nancy Drew spin-off follows wealthy inventor Tom Swift (Tian Richards) as he seeks to find out the truth behind his father's disappearance with the help of his best friend Zenzi (Ashleigh Murray), his bodyguard Isaac (Marquise Vilsón), and his AI, Barclay (voiced by LeVar Burton).

title: Dancing with Myself
description: The limited series from Danny Boyle about the beginnings of The Sex Pistols is based on the memoir of its guitarist, Steve Jones (Toby Wallace).

title: Tom Swift
description: The five-hour documentary series executive produced by Doris Kearns Goodwin, Jennifer Davisson and Leonardo DiCaprio explores the life of Theodore Roosevelt with archival material, reenactments, and interviews with historians and authors as well as Roosevelt’s great-grandson Tweed Roosevelt.

title: Pistol
description: The posthumous comedy special was self-recorded by Norm Macdonald in 2020 and includes comments recorded at the Netflix Is A Joke festival from Dave Chappelle, David Letterman, Conan O'Brien, Adam Sandler, Molly Shannon, and David Spade.

title: Theodore Roosevelt
description: The latest Star Wars series is set 10 years after the end of Revenge of the Sith with Obi-Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGregor) in Tatooine.

title: Norm Macdonald: Nothing Special
description: The Letterkenny spin-off follows Shoresy (Jared Keeso) as he moves to Sudbury and joins their Northern Ontario Senior Hockey team.

title: Obi-Wan Kenobi
description: Working as a Liverpool police officer has taken a toll on Chris Carson's (Martin Freeman) marriage as he gets a new partner, tries to help a young addict (Emily Fairn), and sees a therapist in the British drama series created by Tony Schumacher.

title: Shoresy
description: British South Asian Detective Inspector Rachita Ray (Parminder Nagra) investigates homicides in Birmingham in this crime drama written by Maya Sondhi and executive produced by Jed Mercurio. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 2 May 2022 and in the US on PBS on 9 Jul 2023]

title: The Responder
description: British spy Sylvia Fox (Emilia Fox) travels to Italy for her niece's wedding only to find herself investigating the groom's disappearance, and a dead body appearing in his garden.

title: D.I. Ray
description: Carlton McCoy, a CEO of a Napa winery and master sommelier explores different cultures and cuisine in such locations as Ghana, the Mississippi Delta, Paris, Seoul, Toronto, and Washington, DC.

title: Signora Volpe
description: Vivien Epstein (Agnes O'Casey) moves to London in 1962 to find her ex-boyfriend Jack Morris (Tom Varey) and soon finds herself involved in spying on the National Socialist Movement in this four-part drama series based on the novel by Jo Bloom. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 3 Oct 2021 and in the US on PBS on 1 May 2022]

title: Nomad with Carlton McCoy
description: Kirby Mazrachi (Elisabeth Moss) teams with reporter Dan Velazquez (Wagner Moura) to identify her attacker after she learns a murder case resembles the assault she suffered years ago in this drama based on The Shining Girls novel by Lauren Beukes.

title: Ridley Road
description: Sam Jessop (Jude Morgan-Collie) films his family over the course of a year in this British comedy written by Tom Basden. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 29 Apr 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 10 Jan 2023]

title: Shining Girls
description: Detective Jeb Pyre (Andrew Garfield) finds his faith tested while investigating a double murder that may be connected to an LDS family in this limited series from Dustin Lance Black and inspired by the true crime book by Jon Krakauer.

title: Here We Go
description: The limited series dramatizes producer Albert S. Ruddy's (Miles Teller) experience while making Francis Ford Coppola's "The Godfather."

title: Under the Banner of Heaven
description: The agents and assistants at a small London talent agency juggle their personal and professional lives in this comedy series based on the French series Call My Agent!

title: The Offer
description: The limited series co-created by David Simon and George Pelecanos centers on members of the Baltimore Police Department's Gun Trace Task Force that robbed and extorted citizens for several years before a federal investigation uncovered their crimes in this adaptation of Justin Fenton's non-fiction book.

title: Ten Percent
description: An alien (Chiwetel Ejiofor) seeks Justin Falls (Naomie Harris), a scientist who he believes can help save his species in this continuation inspired by Walter Tevis' novel by Walter Tevis and the 1976 film with David Bowie.

title: We Own This City
description: The drama series written by Michael Hirst centers on of how William H. Bonney became the famous outlaw Billy the Kid (Tom Blyth).

title: The Man Who Fell to Earth (2022)
description: Martha Mitchell (Julia Roberts), the wife of Nixon's Attorney General (Sean Penn) and the Nixon administrations attempts to keep her from talking about Watergate are at the center of the limited series based on the first season of the Slate podcast Slow Burn.

title: Billy the Kid
description: The four-part Apple documentary series from Rick Famuyiwa looks at Earvin "Magic" Johnson's career from his days playing high school basketball to his current business ventures.

title: Gaslit
description: Openly gay Charlie (Kit Connor) and rugby player Nick (Joe Locke) becomes friends at a British high school in this adaptation of Alice Oseman's graphic novel of the same name.

title: They Call Me Magic
description: The three-part miniseries written by Sarah Phelps, focuses on the 1963 divorce of the Duke and Duchess of Argyll (Paul Bettany and Claire Foy). [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 26 Dec 2021; in the US on Prime Video on 22 Apr 2022]

title: Heartstopper
