description: The three-part documentary series directed by Jessica Dimmock features interviews, archival footage, and clips from the NBC miniseries "I Know My First Name is Steven" as it looks at the media's role in the tragic story that began with Steven Stayner's 1972 kidnapping and years later, the arrest of his older brother, Cary, for killing fo...

title: A Very British Scandal
description: The three-part documentary from Joe Berlinger about serial killer John Wayne Gacy features interviews with survivors, officers, and attorneys as well as select audio from the 60 hours of tapes recorded by investigators while he was on death row.

title: Captive Audience
description: DS Emer Berry (Angeline Bell) of Ireland’s Criminal Assets Bureau must work with Belgian Counter-Terrorist Unit's Inspector Christian De Jong (Wouter Hendrickx) after discovering a bag of diamonds during a drug raid. [Premiered originally in Ireland on RTE One on 7 Nov 2021 and in the US on Acorn TV on 18 Apr 2022]

title: Conversations with a Killer: The John Wayne Gacy Tapes
description: The anthology series created by Aaron Cooley focuses on the personal and political lives of the First Ladies. The first season will feature Michelle Obama (Viola Davis), Betty Ford (Michelle Pfeiffer) and Eleanor Roosevelt (Gillian Anderson).

title: Hidden Assets
description: Childhood cancer survivor Joanna Gold (Vanessa Bayer) seeks to become a home shopping channel host in this semi-autobiographical comedy series co-created by Bayer and Jeremy Beiler.

title: The First Lady
description: The four-part British series created by Chris Lang is based on the true story of John Darwin (Eddie Marsan) and his wife Anne (Monica Dolan) faked his death to claim his life insurance in 2002. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 17 Apr 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 23 August 2022]

title: I Love That for You
description: The competitive dancing reality series hosted by Philip Lawrence features dancers aged between 9 and 15 paired with a family member with no dance training. Jenna Dewan, Dexter Mayfield; and choreographer Tricia Miranda will judge which pair will win the $100,000 grand prize.

title: The Thief, His Wife and the Canoe
description: The anthology series about how women deal with the world today from Carly Mensch and Liz Flahive is based on the book of short stories by Cecilia Ahern.

title: Come Dance With Me
description: The legal thriller anthology co-created by David Kelley with Melissa James Gibson is based on the Sarah Vaughan novel of the same name about the scandal that endangers the marriage of an ambitious minister (Rupert Friend) in parliament and the barrister Kate Woodcroft (Michelle Dockery) who prosecutes the case.

title: Roar (2022)
description: Wyoming rancher Royal Abbott (Josh Brolin) and his family are dealing with the disappearance of a family member, a rival family wanting to buy them out when a mysterious void appears on their land in this Western thriller created by Brian Watkins.

title: Anatomy of a Scandal
description: Originally slated for Quibi, the series inspired by George Huang's 1994 comedy of the same name follows intern Lou Simms (Kiernan Shipka) as she becomes obsessed with her boss, Joyce Holt, studio head of Fountain Pictures.

title: Outer Range
description: The reboot of Nickelodeon's "The Brothers Garcia" follows the San Antonio, Texas-based family as they get together at a beach vacation house in Mexico.

title: Swimming with Sharks
description: Narrated by Keke Palmer, the four-part documentary from Kirby Dick and Amy Ziering explores the possible dangers contained in cosmetics and personal care products.

title: The Garcias
description: Kris, Kourtney, Kim, Khloé, Kendall and Kylie are back in this Hulu reality series.

title: Not So Pretty
description: Narrated by President Barack Obama, the five-part documentary series from the executive producer of Blue Planet II explores a variety of national parks on five continents.

title: The Kardashians
description: The prison mockumentary is set in the fictional female prison, HMP Woldsley, where the inmates (at least three played by Catherine Tate) rehearse a musical directed by ex-EastEnders star Cheryl Fergison.

title: Our Great National Parks
description: Public Defender Franklin Roberts (Courtney B. Vance) takes up the case of Moses Johnson (Tosin Cole), a Chicago high school track star accused of being involved in the death of an officer during a drug bust in his neighborhood.

title: Hard Cell
description: Hosted by Aasif Mandvi, Matt Walsh and Sabrina Jalees each lead a team of celebrities as they try to determine who is lying in this series based on the British show of the same name.

title: 61st Street
description: Set in the 1990s, reporter Jake Adelstein (Ansel Elgort) covers the Tokyo Metropolitan Police beat for a Japanese newspaper in this crime drama series loosely inspired Jake Adelstein's memoir.

title: Would I Lie to You? (2022)
description: The two-part documentary from Rowan Deacon looks at how Top of the Pops/Jim'll Fix It host Jimmy Savile used his position to sexually abuse children and adults for decades.

title: Tokyo Vice
description: Six couples exam their readiness for marriage by living with a different person for 3 weeks before deciding to go down the aisle or to move on in this reality series hosted by Nick and Vanessa Lachey.

title: Jimmy Savile: A British Horror Story
description: The three-part documentary series directed by Phil Lott and Ari Mark looks into the story of an Arkansas pilot named Gary Betzner, who was thought dead by his family but he had instead became involved in drug/weapons smuggling for the Contras.

title: The Ultimatum: Marry or Move On (2022)
description: The life of Benjamin Franklin, one of the founding fathers of the US, is explored in the two-part documentary written by Dayton Duncan and directed by Ken Burns.

title: The Invisible Pilot
description: The third stand-up special for Jerrod Carmichael was recorded at New York City's Blue Note Jazz Club.

title: Benjamin Franklin
description: A group of MI5 agents demoted to desk duty led by Jackson Lamb (Gary Oldman) seek redemption in the espionage drama based on Mick Herron's novels.

title: Jerrod Carmichael: Rothaniel
description: After being laid off, Tom (Pete Holmes) aims to become a professional bowler with encouragement from his mentor (Chi McBride), his wife (Katie Lowes), son (Mason Wells), and mother (Julie White) in this comedy based on professional bowler Tom Smallwood's life, from writer Mark Gross.

title: Slow Horses
description: After failing to secure a loan for his business idea, Craig (Craig Robinson) learns of the prize money available for hunting pythons from his Australian Uber driver (Claudia O'Doherty) in this comedy series from Dan Goor and Luke Del Tredici.

title: How We Roll
description: Timmy Turner's cousin Vivian "Viv" Turner (Audrey Grace Marshall) and her new stepbrother Roy (Tyler Wladis) adapt to life in Dimmsdale with help from Fairy Godparents Wanda and Cosmo in this spin-off of Nickelodeon's The Fairly OddParents featuring both live action and animation.

title: Killing It
description: The comedy series from Daniel Goldfarb is based on the life of Julia Child (Sarah Lancashire) and her TV show, The French Chef.

title: The Fairly OddParents: Fairly Odder
description: Steven Grant (Oscar Isaac) is hearing voices and having vivid dreams that he soon discovers is related to sharing a body with a mercenary named Marc Spector in this series created by Jeremy Slater and based on the Marvel character.

title: Julia (2022)
description: The seven-part documentry series about Rupert Murdoch and his family's media empire was based on the New York Magazine article by Jonathan Mahler and Jim Rutenberg.

title: Moon Knight
description: The limited series based on an Esquire article by Jesse Barron focuses on Michelle Carter's (Elle Fanning) relationship with Conrad Roy III (Colton Ryan), his death and her conviction of involuntary manslaughter.

title: The Murdochs: Empire of Influence
description: The drama series based on the novel of the same name by Min Jin Lee follows four generations of a Korean family that moves to Japan and deal with war, love and making a living.

title: The Girl From Plainville
description: Created by Ava DuVernay and inspired by a Twitter account of the same name, filmmakers such as Jon M. Chu, Malcolm D. Lee, Kasi Lemmons, Patty Jenkins, Michael Mann, and Aaron Sorkin discuss how their iconic shots were done.

title: Pachinko
description: Dr. Catherine Elizabeth Halsey (Natascha McElhone) and Master Chief Petty Officer John-117 (Pablo Schreiber) are introduced in the long-gestating sci-fi series based on the Xbox video game franchise set in 26th-century.

title: One Perfect Shot
description: The series based on the “Eurovision Song Contest” will feature live original performances from contestants from all 50 states, five U.S. territories and Washington, D.C. competing to win the America's vote for the Best Original Song.

title: Halo
description: Adele performs songs from her album "30", as well as some of her previous hits at the London Palladium in this special recorded on 6 November 2021. [Aired originally in the UK on ITV on 21 Nov 2021; in the US on NBC on 20 Mar 2022]

title: American Song Contest
description: Detective Inspector Hannah Laing (Lesley Sharp) seeks to find the killer of her colleague/lover with the help of his informant in this British adaptation of a Swedish series of the same name. [Aired originally in the UK on Channel 4 on 26 May 2021; in the US on PBS on 20 Mar 2022]

title: An Audience with Adele
description: A panel of celebrity judges will guess which object is really cake and each episode the winning baker will win $10,000. The final three bakers compete for a $50,000 grand prize in this competitive reality series hosted by Mikey Day.

title: Before We Die
description: Seven people serving their community service sentence discover a bag of cash in this British comedy thriller co-created by Stephen Merchant and Elgin James.

title: Is It Cake?
description: The "Big Mouth" spinoff series looks at the lives of Hormone Monsters, Depression Kitties, Shame Wizards and the other creatures that guide humans through their own lives.

title: The Outlaws
description: An incident causes Beth (Amy Schumer) to look back into her past and reassess who she is in this comedy series written, directed and produced by Schumer.

title: Human Resources
description: The relationship between WeWork founder Adam Neumann (Jared Leto) and his wife, Rebekah (Anne Hathaway), is at the center of the story of the rise and fall of shared workspace company in this limited series from Lee Eisenberg and Drew Crevello.

title: Life & Beth
description: The spaghetti western drama centers on the eight-day conflict between sheriff Arthur McCoy (Dominic Cooper) and bounty hunter Red Bill (Douglas Booth).

title: WeCrashed
description: Eric Stonestreet hosts this competitive reality series where 16 domino teams of three are judged by Vernon Davis, Danica McKellar, and Steven Price.

title: The Newsreader
description: The six-part documentary series from Ryan Murphy and director Andrew Rossi looks at Andy Warhol's life based on the diaries he kept.

title: Minx
description: The 2011 murder of Betsy Faria (Katy Mixon) was originally pinned on her husband (Glenn Fleshler) but a retrial soon revealed her co-worker Pam Hupp's (Renée Zellweger) involvement in this limited series based on the real-life case.

title: Welcome to Flatch
description: The dating reality completive series hosted by Rick Edwards features 16 men seek win the heart of Nicole Remy and the approval of her court (i.e. family) the old-fashioned way with letter writing, archery, fencing, and attending balls at a British 19th century castle.

title: DMZ
description: Pat and Terry Phelps (Courteney Cox and Greg Kinnear) move from a small Brooklyn apartment into a Victorian mansion with a terrible history in Shining Vale, Connecticut in this horror comedy series created by Jeff Astrof and Sharon Horgan.

title: Beyond The Edge (2022)
description: The Adam McKay drama series centers on the Los Angeles Lakers during the 1980s when they won five NBA championships.

title: Bad Vegan: Fame. Fraud. Fugitives.
description: The discovery of a dead body soon reveals long-held secrets as Irish police sergeant PJ Collins (Conleth Hill) seeks to solve his first major crime case in this adaptation of Graham Norton's novel of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 14 Mar 2022 and in the US on Acorn TV on 6 Mar 2023]

title: Phoenix Rising
description: The animated anthology spinoff of The Boys features short (less than 15 minutes) stories written by Awkwafina, Garth Ennis, Ilana Glazer, Evan Goldberg, Seth Rogen, Justin Roiland, Andy Samberg, and Aisha Tyler.

title: The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey
description: After 30-year-old Andy Oliver (Bella Heathcote) and her mother Laura (Toni Collette) are involved in a violent incident in their small Georgia town, Andy searches for answers in this adaptation of Karin Slaughter's book of the same name.

title: Bust Down
description: The limited series based on the Wondery podcast "Joe Exotic" focuses on Carole Baskin (Kate McKinnon) and how her rivalry with Joe "Exotic" Schreibvogel (John Cameron Mitchell) grew.

title: That Dirty Black Bag
description: The two-part documentary narrated by Kieran Culkin looks at the story behind Reddit, GameStop stock and Robinhood in January 2021.

title: Domino Masters
description: The comedy series from David Jenkins and Taika Waititi is loosely based on the true story Stede Bonnet (Rhys Darby), an 18th-century wealthy landowner who gave it all up to become a pirate.

title: The Andy Warhol Diaries
description: The eight-part series based on the podcast from ABC News' Rebecca Jarvis tells the story of the rise and fall of Theranos and its CEO Elizabeth Holmes (Amanda Seyfried).

title: The Thing About Pam
description: A British man (Jamie Dornan) tries to figure out why someone tried to drive him off the road in the Australian outback in the thriller series from Harry and Jack Williams.

title: The Courtship
description: After the death of Marvelous Man, The Guardians of Justice must regroup as humanity descends into chaos in the superheroes series from Adi Shankar.

title: Shining Vale
description: The anthology series based on Mike Isaac's book of the same name will focus on Uber and its CEO, Travis Kalanick (Joseph Gordon-Levitt).

title: Winning Time: The Rise of the Lakers Dynasty
description: The Vikings sequel picks up more than a 100 years after the end of the History series and features Leif Erikson (Sam Corlett), Freydis Eriksdotter (Frida Gustavsson), Harald Harada (Leo Suter) and King William the Conqueror.

title: Holding
description: Nicole Beharie, Colman Domingo, Jonathan Majors, Denzel Whitaker and Jeffrey Wright perform five of Frederick Douglass’ speeches in the special about the life of the 19th century activist inspired by David Blight’s biography, "Frederick Douglass: Prophet of Freedom."

title: The Boys Presents: Diabolical
description: 14-year-old Penny Proud (voiced by Kyla Pratt) and her family are back with new (mis)adventures in this animated revival of Disney Channel's The Proud Family.

title: Pieces of Her
description: Rowdy the Cat looks to steal art from a museum guarded by Peanut the Security Dog in the Charlie Brooker animated interactive special that was inspired by Tex Avery cartoons.

title: Joe vs Carole
description: The documentary series focuses on NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace, his decision to speak out in 2020 about social justice issues and driving for Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing in 2021.

title: Gaming Wall Street

title: The Dropout
description: The seven-and-a-half-hour miniseries on President Lincoln life airing over three consecutive nights is based on Doris Kearns Goodwin's book "Leadership: In Turbulent Times."

title: The Tourist
description: Delayed originally after a contestant was injured during filming, the "America's Got Talent” spinoff hosted by Terry Crews features contestants being judged on their "extreme" talents by Simon Cowell, WWE's Nikki Bella and motocross/rally car driver Travis Pastrana.

title: The Guardians of Justice
description: The sci-fi horror series created by John Griffin centers on a town where everyone who ends up there is trapped and while trying to find a way out, they also must try to avoid creatures that come out at night from the surrounding forests.

title: Super Pumped: The Battle for Uber
description: The four-part documentary series narrated by Jeffrey Wright looks at the life of President Lincoln and his decision to end slavery.

title: Vikings: Valhalla
description: The animated comedy series based on the Cuphead video game follows the adventures of Cuphead and his brother Mugman.

title: Frederick Douglass: In Five Speeches
description: Mark Scout (Adam Scott) is one of several employees at Lumon Corporation who undergo a procedure which separates their work and home memories so they can only recall the ones related to where they are in this sci-fi thriller from Ben Stiller and created by Dan Erickson.

title: The Proud Family: Louder and Prouder
description: The three-part documentary from Clarence "Coodie" Simmons and Chike Ozah about the life and career of rapper Kanye West features footage shot over 20+ years.

title: Cat Burglar
description: The third Netflix stand-up special for Ali Wong was directed by Nahnatchka Khan at New Jersey's The Count Basie Theater in November 2021.

title: Race: Bubba Wallace
description: The dramatic reboot of NBC's 1990s sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" follows Will (Jabari Banks) as he moves from West Philadelphia to the Bel-Air mansion of his uncle and aunt (Adrian Holmes and Cassandra Freeman).

title: The Endgame
description: The three-part documentry series directed by Sacha Jenkins looks at the history of racism.

title: All American: Homecoming
description: Vivian (Anna Chlumsky), a journalist investigates purported German heiress Anna Delvey (Julia Garner), who may be a con woman in this limited series from Shonda Rhimes inspired by the New York Magazine article by Jessica Pressler.

title: Abraham Lincoln
description: Jane (Gugu Mbatha-Raw) moves into a house designed by architect (David Oyelowo), but there are very specific rules she must follow in this adaptation of JP Delaney’s novel of the same name.

title: America's Got Talent: Extreme
description: Book editor Susan Ryeland's (Leslie Manville) search for the missing final chapter to an unfinished mystery manuscript leads to a real murder case in this adaptation of Anthony Horowitz's novel of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on BritBox on 10 Feb 2022 and in the US as a part of PBS' Masterpiece on 16 Oct 2022]

title: From
description: Politics causes drama in the small town of Fairview in this adult animated series created and executive produced by RJ Fried with Stephen Colbert.

title: Lincoln's Dilemma
description: Mayim Bialik hosts the primetime Jeopardy! series featuring students from 15 colleges and universities competing for the grand prize of $100,000.

title: The Cuphead Show!
description: The solo stand-up special for Ms. Pat was directed by Robert Townsend at the Atlanta Comedy Theater.

title: Severance
description: Angela Black (Joanne Froggatt) seeks to find out what her husband (Michiel Huisman) has planned after a private investigator (Samuel Adewunmi) approaches her with shocking information in this thriller series. [Premiered in the UK on ITV on 10 Oct 2021 and in the US on Spectrum on 7 Feb 2022]

title: jeen-yuhs: A Kanye Trilogy
description: Tommy Egan (Joseph Sikora) ends up in Chicago and becoming involved in the drug trade in this latest Power spinoff.

title: Ali Wong: Don Wong
description: Big Mick (Tom Davis) and his friends Albert (Allan Mustafa), Sidney (Steve Stamp), and Phil (Hugo Chegwin) plan to steal £50,000 in cash but find gold worth more than £30 million in 1980s East London instead in this British comedy crime drama. [Premiered originally in the UK on Channel 4 on 6 Feb 2022 and in the US on BritBox on 7 Nov...

title: Bel-Air
description: The history and influence of Guy Torry's all-black comedy night at The Comedy Store is discussed by such guests as Anthony Anderson, Tichina Arnold, Nick Cannon, Dave Chappelle, Snoop Dogg, Cedric the Entertainer, Tiffany Haddish, Steve Harvey, Lil Rel Howery, Regina King, Jo Koy, Luenell, Flame Monroe, Jay Pharoah, Craig Robinson, JB Sm...

title: everything's gonna be all white
description: Retired Military Police Officer Jack Reacher (Alan Ritchson) is arrested for murder just as he arrives at the small Georgia town of Margrave in this drama series based on the Lee Child's Reacher novels.

title: Inventing Anna
description: When the 21-year-old son of a well-known American businesswoman (Uma Thurman) is kidnapped from his New York hotel, four British citizens staying at the same hotel become suspects in this adaptation of the Israeli drama False Flag.

title: The Girl Before
description: In this adaptation of the British series, Murder in Successville, each episode features Homicide Detective Terry Seattle (Will Arnett) with a new murder case and a new guest star as his partner. With no script, Kumail Nanjiani, Conan O'Brien, Annie Murphy, Sharon Stone, Ken Jeong, and Marshawn Lynch must improvise and try to figure out t...

title: Magpie Murders
description: The marriage between Pamela Anderson (Lily James) and Tommy Lee (Sebastian Stan) and how their sex tape became public is at the center of this limited series from Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg.

title: Fairview
description: Brie Bella, Corbin Bleu, Tyler Cameron, Cat Cora, Howie Dorough, Antonio Gates, Anjelah Johnson-Reyes and Loni Love team up in pairs to learn the dance moves in Dirty Dancing and seek to be named the best "Baby" and "Johnny" in this celebrity competitive dance series hosted by Stephen "tWitch" Boss.

title: Jeopardy! National College Championship
description: W. Kamau Bell's four-part documentary series looks into Bill Cosby’s career and his eventual disgrace in light of accusations from over 60 women of sexual assault.

title: Ms. Pat: Y'all Wanna Hear Something Crazy?
description: 10 home bakers compete to be named champion and win $50,000 grand prize in this competitive baking series from Canada's Food Network.

title: Angela Black
description: Queer Eye's Jonathan Van Ness explores a variety of topics including hair, insects, skyscrapers and figure skating with experts in the series based on his podcast of the same name.

title: Power Book IV: Force
description: The animated fantasy-adventure series about seven adventurers who go on a journey to save Exandria from dark magic after running up a large bar tab in this adaptation of a role-playing game (RPG) campaign.

title: The Curse
description: The South Korean horror series based on the webtoon "Now at Our School" focuses on a group of high school students trapped by zombies invading their school.

title: Phat Tuesdays
description: The four-hour, two-night documentary about the life and career of Janet Jackson airs on both Lifetime and A&E.

title: Reacher
description: Each episode features one character's point-of-view of what happened when someone was murdered at a high school reunion afterparty in this comedy mystery series created by Chris Miller.

title: Suspicion (2022)
description: Jenny (Margarita Levieva) is forced back into espionage by CIA to locate a killer to keep her daughter safe in this spy thriller written by Adam Glass.

title: Murderville
description: Anna (Kristen Bell) spends her days drinking wine and watching her neighbors when one day she thinks she sees someone murdered at her new neighbor's (Tom Riley) house in this limited series from Rachel Ramras, Hugh Davidson, and Larry Dorf.

title: Pam & Tommy
description: Best friends Astrid (Jana Morrison) and Lilly (Samantha Maureen Aucoin) accidentally opened a portal and must save the world from monsters.

title: The Real Dirty Dancing
description: The Aziz Ansari stand-up comedy special was recorded at a New York City surprise appearance at The Comedy Cellar in December 2021.

title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
description: The documentary series follows Prairie View A&M's student marching band as they seek to rise up from being ranked eighth in the nation.

title: Great Chocolate Showdown
description: The Sandoval family's vineyard in California's Sonoma Valley is under threat in this Matt Lopez drama.

title: Getting Curious With Jonathan Van Ness
description: Set in 1882, Marian Brook (Louisa Jacobson) moves from Pennsylvania to live in New York City with her aunts Agnes van Rhijn (Chrstine Baranski) and Ada Brook (Cynthia Nixon) after the death of her father in this Julian Fellowes drama.

title: The Legend of Vox Machina
description: Gobo, Red, Boober, Mokey, Wembley and Uncle Travelling Matt return with new music and adventures in this reboot of the "Fraggle Rock" series.

description: The drama series from Jason Katims focuses on Jack (Rick Glassman), Harrison (Albert Rutecki), and Violet (Sue Ann Pien), twentysomething roommates on the autism spectrum, as they juggle work, families, relationships and independence.

title: JANET JACKSON.
description: Young diplomat Álex Ventura (Álvaro Mel) joins archival clerk Lucía (Ana Polvorosa) and maritime lawyer Jonas Pierce (Clarke Peters), to recover the sunken treasure stolen by Frank Wild (Stanley Tucci) in this Spanish co-production. [Premiered originally in Spain on Movistar+ on 30 Sep 2021 and in the US on AMC+ on 20 Jan 2022]

title: The Afterparty
description: A public breakdown forces 20-something Samantha Fink (Sofia Black-D'Elia) to move in with her mother, Carol (Ally Sheedy) and try to sober up in this comedy created and written by Simone Finch.

title: In From The Cold
description: The documentary series looks into Robert Hendy-Freegard, a British conman who claimed to work for MI5 and convinced several people to give him money for various reasons.

title: The Woman In The House Across The Street From The Girl In The Window
description: Sophie (Hilary Duff) tells her son how she met his father in 2021 in this spinoff of How I Met Your Mother created and written by Isaac Aptaker and Elizabeth Berger.

title: Astrid & Lilly Save the World
description: Kansas native Sam (Bridget Everett) feels out of place in her hometown but singing helps her discover a community with a group of outsiders in this comedy inspired by Everett's own life.

title: Aziz Ansari: Nightclub Comedian
description: Home and Away is an Australian series that has been in production since January 1988. It was originally centered around Pippa and Tom Fletcher and the children that they foster, set in the small coastal fictional town, Summer Bay, just north of "The City," (Sydney). Now, however, this classic Australian soap depicts the trials and tr...

title: March
description: Archivist Dan Turner (Mamoudou Athie) becomes obsessed with the subject of the old videotapes he was hired to restore: documentary filmmaker Melody Pendras (Dina Shihabi) and her investigation into a cult in this supernatural horror series loosely based on the podcast of the same name.

title: Promised Land (2022)
description: The Japanese thriller follows reporter Anna Matsuda (Ryoko Yonekura) as she investigates government corruption.

title: The Gilded Age
description: Peacemaker (John Cena) joins a new team in the Suicide Squad spinoff series.

title: Fraggle Rock: Back to the Rock
description: Widower and single father Gary (Josh Gad) meets Mary (Isla Fisher), who has a secret she is keeping from everyone in this romantic comedy written and created by Abe Forsythe.

title: As We See It
description: Naomi (Kaci Walfall) learns more about her origins after a supernatural event happens in her home town of Port Oswego in this superhero series based on the comic book series of the same name.

title: La Fortuna
description: The drama series created by Janine Sherman Barrois centers on the Kings, an African-American family of winemakers in California's Napa Valley.

title: Single Drunk Female
description: The death of the childhood friend of Amy (Eliza Coupe), Jodie (Ginnifer Goodwin) and Sarah (Maggie Q) causes the three best friends to make big and spontaneous changes to their lives in this comedy series written by Liz Astrof.

title: The Puppet Master: Hunting the Ultimate Conman
description: The six-episode limited series centers on how Mamie Till-Mobley (Adrienne Warren) sought justice for her son, Emmett Till (Cedric Joe), who was murdered in 1955 Mississippi and helped spur the civil rights movement.

title: How I Met Your Father
description: Joe Millionaire is back with two single men, but only one is a millionaire and the 20 women who will be dating them will not know who has the larger bank balance in this reboot of the dating reality series.

title: Somebody Somewhere
description: Heart surgeon Dr. Sam Griffith (Sophia Bush) clashes with her father (who was also her boss) when he returns to work after recovering from a coma.

title: Home and Away
description: Steven Toast (Matt Berry) is back and relocates to Hollywood in this new series/season of Berry's Toast of London series. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Two on 4 Jan 2022 and in the US on The Roku Channel on 11 Aug 2023]

title: Archive 81
description: Thony (Elodie Yung), a Cambodian doctor, is forced to find work with a crime organization to help pay for treatment for her ill son in this adaptation of the Argentinean drama of the same name.

title: The Journalist
description: Anne Williams (Maxine Peake) worked for 24 years to prove the death of her 15-year-old-son Kevin at the 1989 FA Cup semi-final wasn't accidental but due to gross negligence by emergency services and faulty designs of the stadium in this miniseries based on real events. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 2 Jan 2022 and in the US...

title: Peacemaker
description: Phileas Fogg (David Tennant), his valet Jean Passepartout (Ibrahim Koma), and journalist Abigail "Fix" Fortescue (Leonie Benesch) set out on their journey to travel the world in 80 days in the latest adaptation of Jules Verne's novel of the same name. [Airs as a part of PBS' Masterpiece series]

title: Wolf Like Me
description: Chefs are mentored by Gordan Ramsay, Nyesha Arrington and Richard Blais as they compete for a chance to win the $250,000 grand prize in this competitive cooking series that will feature a three stories-tall set.

title: Naomi
description: The documentry brings together many of the cast and directors to talk about the Harry Potter film franchise.

title: The Kings of Napa
description: Conceited and DJ Diamond Kuts hosts this new version of the long-running MTV MTV hip hop series that will include cyphers, interviews, live performances, and music videos.

title: Pivoting
description: Steve Harvey rules on real-life disputes in this comedic courtroom reality series.

title: Women of the Movement
description: The 10-part documentary series directed by Alexandra Dean features archival footage and interviews with former employees and girlfriends of Hugh Hefner about the Playboy empire, allegations of sexual misconduct and drug use.

title: Joe Millionaire: For Richer or Poorer
description: 10 women compete for a chance to join Lizzo on tour as one of her Big Grrrls in this competition reality series.

title: Good Sam
description: The documentary series follows seven young people on the spectrum as they look for love with the support of family, friends and experts.

title: Toast of Tinseltown
description: The Walking Dead spinoff anthology series will feature both new and original characters from the zombie series.

title: The Cleaning Lady
description: The animated series focuses on the journey of future Jedis Ahsoka Tano and Count Dooku.

title: Anne (2022)
description: Bobby Jones (Will Poulter) and his friend, Lady Frances "Frankie" Derwent (Lucy Boynton) find a dying man while playing golf in this three-part adaptation of Agatha Christie's book of the same name from Hugh Laurie (who also had a minor part and directed).

title: Around the World in 80 Days
description: Vampire-human hybrid Rosemarie Hathaway (Sisi Stringer) and her Moroi vampire best friend Princess Vasilisa "Lissa" Dragomir (Daniela Nieves) are some of the students at St Vladimir's Academy in Julie Plec and Marguerite MacIntyre's adaptation of Richelle Mead's book series of the same name.

title: Next Level Chef
description: 38-year-old Natasha (Michelle De Swarte) didn't want a child but finds herself saddled with a baby in this horror comedy limited series co-created by Siân Robins-Grace and Lucy Gaymer.

title: Harry Potter 20th Anniversary: Return to Hogwarts
description: Secrets from the past threatens the lives of Megan (Cush Jumbo), a working mother of three; photographer Ray (Richard Armitage); Detective Broome (James Nesbitt); and Megan's friend Lorraine (Sarah Parish) in this adaptation of Harlan Coben's novel of the same name.

title: Yo! MTV Raps
description: Bounty hunter Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen) return to Tatooine in this spinoff of The Mandalorian.

title: Judge Steve Harvey
description: The sequel to the Death to 2020 mockumentary special adds Stockard Channing, William Jackson Harper, and Lucy Liu as new characters reflect on their 2021 experiences.

title: Secrets of Playboy
description: Scottish DCI Amy Silva (Suranne Jones) investigates a death onboard the top-secret British Royal Navy submarine HMS Vigil in this thriller created by Tom Edge. [Premiered originally on BBC One on 29 Aug 2021 and in the US on Peacock on 23 Dec 2021]

title: Lizzo's Watch Out for the Big Grrrls
description: The Yellowstone prequel set in the 1880s follows James and Margaret Dutton (Tim McGraw and Faith Hill) as they move their family to start a new life on Montana.

title: Love on the Spectrum
description: University student Eun Yeong-ro (Jisoo) hides Lim Soo-ho (Jung Hae-in) in her dorm room in this drama series set during South Korea's 1987 Democracy Movement.

title: Tales of the Walking Dead
description: Guests such as Young Thug, Lil Yachty, Rosalía, Gunna, Killer Mike, Ski Mask the Slump God, Lil Tecca, Coi Leray, and Vampire Weekend’s Ezra Koening spend time with Alec “Despot” Reinstein, Ashok “Dap” Kondabolu, and Aleksey “Lakutis” Weintraub in different natural environments (desert, swamps or the ocean) to talk about humanity.

title: Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi
description: Siblings Lily (Emeraude Toubia) and Jorge Diaz (Mark Indelicato) search for love in the romantic comedy created and written by Calderón Kellet.

title: Why Didn't They Ask Evans?
description: Indigenous Australian vampire hunters Tyson (Rob Collins) and 17-year-old Shanika (Shantae Barnes-Cowan) seek to stop the final vampire colony located in the middle of the South Australian desert in this drama created by Warwick Thornton and Brendan Fletcher.

title: Vampire Academy (2022)
description: Survivors of a flu pandemic try to rebuild in the Patrick Somerville post-apocalyptic limited series based on a novel of the same name by Emily St. John Mandel.

title: The Baby
description: MacGruber (Will Forte) is finally released from jail after 10 years and with help from Vicki St. Elmo (Kristen Wiig) and Dixon Piper (Ryan Phillippe), seeks to stop Brigadier Commander Enos Queeth (Billy Zane) from destroying the world.

title: Stay Close
description: Jo Harding (Connie Nielsen) slowly discovers her life with husband Rob (Christopher Eccleston) may not be so perfect after losing a year of her memories from a head injury in this drama series based on the novel of the same name by Amanda Reynolds. [Premiered originally in the UK on Channel 4 on 7 Nov 2021 and in the US on Sundance No...

title: The Book Of Boba Fett
description: The spinoff of Selling Tampa focuses on the all Black female Allure Realty real estate firm owned by Sharelle Rosado.

title: Death To 2021

title: Vigil

Set in 1950s England, the latest British dramedy adaptation of the H. E. Bates novel "The Darling Buds of May" follows The Larkin family led by Ma (Joanna Scanlan) and Pop (Bradley Walsh) Larkin. [Premiered originally in the UK on IV on 10 Oct 2021 and in the US on Acorn TV on 13 Dec 2021]

description: The Quinta Brunson comedy centers on a group of teachers working at a Philadelphia public elementary school.

title: Selling Tampa
description: The documentary series from David Fincher and David Prior features personal visual essays about cinema.

description: Wyoming game warden Joe Pickett (Michael Dorman) and his family become targets as outsiders seek to profit from the lands he is protecting in this drama series based on the C.J. Box book series of the same name.

description: The Jimmy Fallon-hosted game show features a group of celebrities competing in music and dance-related games seen on The Tonight Show, including "Wheel of Musical Impressions," "Musical Genre Challenge" and "History of Rap."

title: Voir

While TV journalist Bae Young-jae (Park Jeong-min) and lawyer Min Hey-jin (Kim Hyun-joo) look into the New Truth Church led by Jung Jin-soo (Yoo Ah-in) in this s...

description: Moiraine (Rosamund Pike), a member of a powerful all-female organization and five young people, one who is prophesied to be the one who could save or destroy the world, begin a long journey in this adaptation of the Robert Jordan's novel series of the same name.

description: Bryan Cranston, Rashida Jones, Rebel Wilson and Pedro Pascal are some of the narrators for the nature series filmed over 16 months in a number of countries.

description: Dexter has been living in upstate New York for 10 years as Jim Lindsay when events threaten to bring back his Dark Passenger.

description: 4,400 people who had disappeared over a period of over a hundred years have reappeared all at once with no memory of what had happened in this reboot of the 2004 USA Network sci-fi series.

title: Tampa Baes
description: An alien invasion is at the center of the science fiction drama series from Simon Kinberg and David Weil.

title: Glória (2021)
description: The adult animated comedy follows Reagan Ridley (Lizzy Caplan) and her dysfunctional team as they try to manages all the world conspiracy theories.

description: Warrior princess Maya (voiced by Zoe Saldaña) goes on a journey to carry out an ancient prophecy that will help her save the world from gods of the underworld in this animated series created by Jorge Gutierrez.

description: Inspired by George A. Romero's zombie films, the horror-comedy series follows a group of people in a small Pennsylvania town trying to survive a zombie invasion.

Entrepreneurs will pitch their products live to the viewing audience who can then immediately buy them online. The competitors with the most sales will get a chance to close a deal with major retailers like HSN, Lowe's, Macy, and QVC.

title: Invasion (2021)

description: The sixth Netflix stand-up comedy special for Dave Chappelle.

description: Each episode of the Jon Stewart-hosted series features in-depth interviews and discussions about one current event or issue.

description: The four-part documentary series about the how the Chippendales first started in Los Angeles in 1975 and ended in the 1990s with its founder arrested for murder/attempted murder.

description: The latest spin-off of Dick Wolf's FBI series focuses on the Federal Bureau of Investigation’s International Fly Team in Budapest.

title: La Brea
description: Amateur dancers join a competitive reality series casting for a live updated version of Swan Lake in this dramedy from Liz Heldens, Jason Winer, Sue Naegle.

description: The newest NCIS spinoff is focused on NCIS Pearl Harbor, where Special Agent in Charge Jane Tennant (Vanessa Lachey) leads her team as they investigate cases involving the military in the state of Hawai'i.

description: The documentry series based on Leon Neyfakh's podcast of the same name about historic events features archival footage and interviews about the Iran-Contra affair in its first season.

description: The four-part Ken Burns documentary about the life and career of the three-time heavyweight boxing champion features archival footage, photographs, and interviews with journalists, boxers, historians, as well as friends and family of Ali.

title: Foundation
description: The three-part documentary series from Steve McQueen and James Rogan features archival footage and interviews to illustrate the impact of the 1981 New Cross Fire which 13 young Black people died, the Black People’s Day of Action, and the Brixton riots on the Black community in Britain. [Originally premiered in the UK on BBC One on 20 ...

title: Jaguar
description: The documentary film directed By George Amponsah and narrated by Daniel Kaluuya features interviews and archival footage of Black activists who sought for racial equality in Britain in the 1960s and 70s. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Two on 25 Mar 2021 and in the US on Prime Video on 17 Sep 2021]

title: The Wonder Years (2021)
description: The film directed By Lyttanya Shannon features interviews, archival footage and documents about how the British education system sent black students to generally inferior "Educationally Subnormal" (ESN) schools in the 1960s and 70s (but the term would not be abolished until 1981). [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 20 May 2...

title: Star Wars: Visions
description: Diane Dunbrowski (voiced by Lauren Ash), AKA The Chicago Party Aunt takes in her nephew Daniel (voiced by Rory O'Malley) after he decides to take a gap year before attending Stanford in this animated comedy based on Chris Witaske's twitter account of the same name.

title: Our Kind of People
description: The South Korean drama series about a group of indebted people who are invited to compete in (deadly) series of children's games to win millions of dollars.

description: After Debbie Harper (voiced by Rhea Seehorn) loses her job, she moves her family to a fixer-upper Victorian house she inherited in this adult animated comedy created by Brad Neely.

description: The marriage between tech executive Mira (Jessica Chastain) and her philosophy professor husband Jonathan (Oscar Isaac) has been slowly falling apart in this five-episode limited series based on Ingmar Bergman’s Swedish series of the same name.

description: The Jenner Furst and Julia Willoughby Nason four-part documentry series looks at the multilevel marketing company LuLaRoe and the accusations of it being a pyramid scheme.

title: Chicago Party Aunt
description: Guns and Gangs detective Samantha Wazowski (Meredith MacNeill) and Drugs Squad detective Kelly Duff (Adrienne C. Moore) must learn to work together to take down a Toronto street gang in this Canadian dramedy from Tassie Cameron and Sherry White. [Aired originally in Canada on CBC on 3 Feb 2021 and in the US on IMDb TV on 10 Sep 2021]

title: Squid Game

title: Scenes From A Marriage
description: Trophy Fantasy (voiced by Maria Bamford) left her daughter, Euthanasia "Annie" Fantasy (voiced by Jo Firestone) to be raised by her own mother Baba (voiced by Bebe Neuwirth) and her Uncle Pete (voiced by Tim Robinson) 15 years ago and returns as a corpse brought back to life in this animated adult comedy series co-created by Alissa Nutti...

[Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Scotland on 24 Oct 2019 and on BBC Two on 30 Oct 2019; set to air in the US as a part of PBS's Masterpiece on 5 Sep 202...

title: The Smurfs (2021)
description: Del Harris (Jeff Daniels), the chief of police in a small Pennsylvania Rust Belt town is tested on how far would he go to protect the son (Alex Neustaedter) of a woman (Maura Tierney) he loves from murder charges in this drama series based on Philipp Meyer's novel of the same name.

description: The reality series follows TikTok star Charli D'Amelio, her sister Dixie and her parents as they deal with their growing fame and living in Los Angeles.

title: Frogger
description: After coming out as gay, Steve Maryweather, AKA Agent Mary (voiced by Sean Hayes) was exiled by the American Intelligence Agency (AIA) to West Hollywood where he recruited mechanic Deb (Wanda Sykes), master of drag and disguise Twink (Matt Rogers), and hacker Stat (Patti Harrison) to form the Q-Force. After finding and solving a case, th...

title: Kin
description: The documentary directed by Adam Wishart and narrated by Jeff Daniels looks at what was happening at the White House 12 hours after the 9/11 attacks with interviews from President George W. Bush, Dick Cheney, Condoleezza Rice, Ari Fleischer, and Karl Rove.

title: Doogie Kameāloha, M.D.
description: The backyard adventures of talking dog Dug (from 2009 film Up) are at the center of this series of shorts written and directed by Bob Peterson.

title: On the Verge
description: The documentary series directed by Brian Knappenberger examines the 9/11 attacks and the War on Terror including the beginnings of al Qaeda after the Soviet-Afghan war and the most recent events in Afghanistan.

title: Days of our Lives: Beyond Salem
description: Marie Kondo returns in a new series helping people balance home life and work with her organizational skills.

title: Countdown: Inspiration4 Mission to Space
description: After a death in their apartment building, fellow tenants Charles (Steve Martin), Mabel (Selena Gomez) and Oliver (Martin Short) discover they share a love for true crime and decide to investigate the case themselves in this comedic murder mystery co-created by John Hoffman and Steve Martin.

title: Teenage Euthanasia
description: The six-part documentary series made in official collaboration with the 9/11 Memorial & Museum features archival footage and first-person interviews from first responders and those who survived the attacks on 9/11.

title: Harry & Meghan: Escaping the Palace
description: Nick Brewer (Adrian Grenier) disappears one day and reappears in an online video. As his family try to find him, they discover another side of Nick in this Tony Ayres and David Heyman thriller.

title: Guilt (2021)
description: 14 contestants engage in both individual and team challenges to win the title of The Ultimate Surfer and the opportunity to compete on the WSL World Tour in this series hosted by Jesse Palmer with commentary from Erin Coscarelli and Joe Turpel as well as special correspondence from Kelly Slater.

title: American Rust
description: The four-part documentry from Spike Lee looks at not only 9/11 but also recent events that impacted New York City.

title: The D'Amelio Show
description: The four-part documentry directed by Jenny Carchman looks at the rise of New York's tabloid gossip press from the 1970s to the present with interviews with New York Post's Cindy Adams, Flo Anthony, A.J. Benza, Paula Froelich, Perez Hilton, Fred Mwangaguhunga, Maury Povich, and Ben Widdicombe.

title: Q-Force
description: Set in the 1850s, Captain Charles Boone (Adrien Brody) moves with his three children to his ancestral home in a small Maine town after his wife's death in this drama based on the Stephen King short story Jerusalem's Lot.

title: 9/11: Inside the President's War Room
description: Dr. Ji-Yoon Kim (Sandra Oh) becomes the first woman of color named Chair of the English department at Pembroke University in this dramedy series written by Amanda Peet.

title: Dug Days
description: Sophia Nahli Allison's documentary about the influence of the award-winning civil rights movement PBS documentary series features new interviews and discussions about the movement in the 21st century.

title: Turning Point: 9/11 and the War on Terror
description: Brooklyn police officer Max McLoughlin (Taylor Kitsch) secretly searches for his brother while helping organize the post-war Berlin police force led by Elsie Garter (Nina Hoss) in this drama previously known as Shadowplay from Måns Mårlind.

title: Sparking Joy with Marie Kondo
description: Nine people attend a 10-day retreat at a health and wellness resort run by its director (Nicole Kidman) in this series based on Liane Moriarty's novel of the same name.

title: Only Murders in the Building
description: The anthology series written by Jimmy McGovern focuses on prisoner Mark Cobden (Sean Bean) and warden Eric McNally (Stephen Graham) in its first season and three women prisoners Orla (Jodie Whittaker), Kelsey (Bella Ramsey), and Abi (Tamara Lawrance) in its second. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 6 Jun 2021 and in the US...

title: 9/11: One Day in America
description: DI Annika Strandhed (Nicola Walker) balances investigating cases for Glasgow's new Marine Homicide Unit and raising her teenage daughter in this crime drama based on the BBC Radio 4 drama, Annika Stranded. [Premiered originally in the UK on Alibi on 17 Aug 2021 and set to air in the US as a part of PBS' Masterpiece on 16 Oct 2022]

title: Clickbait
description: Set in Georgia, wrestler Jack Spade (Stephen Amell) acts as the villainous antagonist to the hero played by younger brother Ace (Alexander Ludwig) as they seek to continue their late father's dream of an independent wrestling league in this drama series created by Michael Waldron.

title: The Ultimate Surfer
description: Aspiring filmmaker Lisa N. Nova (Rosa Salazar) wants revenge after producer Lou Burke (Eric Lange) breaks a promise in 1990s Hollywood in the horror/thriller limited series based on Todd Grimson's novel of the same name.

title: NYC Epicenters 9/11 -> 2021 1/2
description: The animated series explores Marvel's multiverse concept with alternative scenarios of what was seen in the MCU films such as Peggy Carter taking the super soldier serum.

title: Gossip
description: Guests fantasies come true at a luxury resort run by Elena Roarke (Roselyn Sanchez) with help from Ruby Okoro (Kiara Barnes), and pilot Javier (John Gabriel Rodriquez) in this new version of the 1970s series of the same name.

title: Chapelwaite
description: The comedy series from Sterlin Harjo and Taika Waititi follows four Indigenous teenagers in rural Oklahoma as they find ways (including stealing) to save money to move to California.

title: The Chair (2021)
description: Kristen Bell and Dax Shepard compete against each other by joining a family of four as the two families enter in series of games for a chance to win $100,000.

title: Eyes on the Prize: Hallowed Ground
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Mark Monroe and Paul Crowder looks at the UFO phenomena, including eyewitness accounts and theories on possible cover-ups by the government, the military and private companies.

title: The Defeated
description: The hit-and-run accident that killed Segev Azulai's (Lior Raz) wife may not have been an accident in this thriller from Lior Raz and Avi Issacharoff.

title: Nine Perfect Strangers
description: Failed-musician-turned-fifth-grade-teacher Josh Corman (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) struggles with how his life is going after a breakup with his girlfriend in this dramedy created and directed by Gordon-Levitt.

title: Time
description: Paris Hilton joins the celebrity home cooking reality crowd with her own series with guest appearances from Nikki Glaser, Kim Kardashian West, Demi Lovato, Lele Pons, Saweetie, plus her mother Kathy Hilton and sister Nicky Hilton.

title: Annika
description: Billy Corben continues his Cocaine Cowboys franchise with a six-part documentary series about the rise and fall of drug traffickers Willy Falcon and Sal Magluta, who were indicted in the 1991 for smuggling over 75 tons of cocaine into Miami.

title: Heels
description: The three-part documentary miniseries directed by Peter Kunhardt features interviews with friends, colleagues, journalists, activists as well as archival footage about Obama's challenges to become the first Black president of the United States.

title: Brand New Cherry Flavor
description: The six-part documentary series looks at the people who help run an independently owned Nevada TV station as they seek to expand its market and grow viewership.

title: Marvel's What If...?
description: Bob Costas returns to HBO with new one-on-one interviews with people in sports, entertainment and popular culture and a roundtable discussion about current issues in sports.

title: Fantasy Island
description: The adaptation of Nancy Mitford's novel about Fanny Logan (Emily Beecham) and her cousin Linda Radlett's (Lily James) search for love that includes Lord Merlin (Andrew Scott), Tony Kroesig (Freddie Fox), Christian Talbot (James Frecheville), and Fabrice De Sauveterre (Assaad Bouab). [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 9 May ...

title: Reservation Dogs
description: The animated musical series created by Megan Nicole Dong where a warhorse (voiced by Kimiko Glenn) falls and wakes up in a world full of talking and singing centaurs.

title: Family Game Fight!
description: The documentary series hosted by Mark Ronson features discussions with artists such as Charli XCX, Dave Grohl, King Princess, Paul McCartney, Questlove about music creation and techniques. Each episode ends with a new piece of music which showcases the methodologies examined.

title: UFO (2021)
description: The three-part documentary series from Mike Connolly about the rise and fall of the car, the company and the man behind the car that was featured in the "Back to the Future" films.

title: Hit & Run (2021)
description: Huckleberry Hound (voiced by Jim Conroy), Boo Boo (voiced by C.H. Greenblatt), Cindy (voiced by Grace Helbig) and Yogi Bear (voiced by Jeff Bergman) are just some of the residents bringing hijinks to Jellystone in this animated comedy series produced by Greenblatt and Warner Bros. Animation.

title: Mr. Corman
description: The satirical animated series from Gary Janetti features the young Prince George (voiced by Gary Janetti) and the royal family.

title: Cooking With Paris (2021)
description: The reality dating series hosted by Nikki Glaser features three single women looking for love among 24 bachelors. However, half of the men are not looking for long-term relationships, but the cash prize.

title: Cocaine Cowboys: The Kings of Miami
description: Behind The Music returns on Paramount+ with new episodes as well as remastered originals with new interviews with such artists as Busta Rhymes, Duran Duran, Fat Joe, LL Cool J, Huey Lewis, Jennifer Lopez, Ricky Martin, and Bret Michaels.

title: Obama: In Pursuit of a More Perfect Union
description: Matt Beckerich, Rose Hardy, Tommy Montoya, Miryam Lumpini and Twig Sparks are the tattoo artists who help fix tattoos for people who are brought in by friends or family members in this reality show hosted by Jessimae Peluso.

title: Small Town News: KPVM Pahrump
description: The two troublemaking chipmunks are back with new adventures in a large city park in this animated series produced with Xilam Animation.

title: Back on the Record With Bob Costas
description: The nature documentary narrated by Helena Bonham Carter explores Borneo, the Namib Desert, the Luangwa Valley, the Galapagos Islands, Patagonia, and Alaska. [Premieres on AMC, AMC+ and BBC America simultaneously on 24 Jul 2021]

title: The Pursuit of Love
description: The animated stand-up comedy special from Tig Notaro features such topics as the Kool-Aid Man, medical procedures, and Jenny Slate.

title: Centaurworld
description: The animated series from Kevin Smith picks up from the end of the 1980s cartoon series with Prince Adam/He-Man (voiced by Chris Wood) fighting Skeletor (Mark Hamill).

title: Watch the Sound with Mark Ronson
description: The four-part series features four 30-minute-long films focusing on children's perspectives on such issues as being homeless, having a parent return from the military with an injury, having a parent in jail and losing a home due to a natural disaster.

title: Myth & Mogul: John DeLorean
description: Detectives Gail Johnson (voiced by Da'Vine Joy Randolph) and David Mills (voiced by Jimmi Simpson) look into the disappearance of Ultra City mayoral candidate Carpenter K. Smith (voiced by Kurtwood Smith) in this stop-motion animated baby doll series from Steve Conrad and Stoopid Buddy Stoodios.

title: Jellystone!
description: U.S. Marshall Scott Turner (Jeff Peck) inherits a French Mastiff named Hooch in this comedy series inspired by the 1989 film of the same name.

title: The Prince
description: The series looks behind-the-scenes and the history of such Disney attractions as the Haunted Mansion, it's a small world, Jungle Cruise, Space Mountain, Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge and how the Twilight Zone Tower of Terror was changed into the Guardians of the Galaxy – Mission: BREAKOUT!

title: FBoy Island
description: Narrated by Rob Delaney, singles go on blind dates disguised as animals or fantasy creatures with the help of prosthetics in this series based on the BBC Three series of the same name (there was also a version by A&E in 2015).

title: Behind the Music (2021)
description: Set in Australia, palliative care Dr. Kate Brennan (Frances O'Connor) brings her mother Edie (Harriet Walter) out from England to a Gold Coast retirement community after her suicide attempt in this dark comedy created and written by Samantha Strauss. [Premiered originally in Australia on Fox Showcase on 2 Feb 2021, in the UK on Sky At...

title: Tattoo Redo
description: The prequel to the Power series is set in 1991 in South Jamaica, Queens, where 15-year-old Kanan Stark (Mekai Curtis) comes of age.

title: Chip 'N' Dale: Park Life
description: The six-part documentary series features surfer Garrett McNamara's decade-long search for the biggest wave which led him to Nazaré, Portugal.

title: Eden: Untamed Planet
description: The documentary series directed by Garrett Bradley follows champion tennis player Naomi Osaka as juggles the pressures of competing as she trains for the Tokyo Olympics and reflects on her heritage.

title: Tig Notaro: Drawn
description: Melissa (Cecily Strong) and Josh (Keegan-Michael Key) go on a backpacking trip to help their relationship only to end up trapped in a town where everyone appears to be in a 1940s movie musical and they can only leave if they find their true love in this comedy inspired by Brigadoon.

title: Masters of the Universe: Revelation
description: The six-part documentary series features Paul McCartney talking with producer Rick Rubin about music as well as his career with the Beatles, Wings and as a solo artist.

title: Through Our Eyes
description: Based on the podcast of the same name, the limited series tells the true story of Dr. Christopher Duntsch (Joshua Jackson), a Dallas surgeon who left more than 30 patients dead or permanently injured until two doctors (Alec Baldwin and Christian Slater) and an Assistant District Attorney (AnnaSophia Robb) work to stop him.

title: Ultra City Smiths
description: Each episode will feature a new horror story in this spin-off of American Horror Story.

title: Turner & Hooch
description: Set in the late 1850s, Patrick Sumner (Jack O'Connell), a disgraced ex-army surgeon finds a job as a doctor on an Arctic whaling ship where he faces not only harsh conditions but also brutal crewmates including harpooner Henry Drax (Colin Farrell) in this drama miniseries based on Ian McGuire's novel of the same name.

title: Behind the Attraction
description: The six-part documentary series focuses on three major heists: the 1993 theft of about $3 million from a Las Vegas armored truck, the 2005 theft of over $7 million that was being transported from the Miami International Airport, and the 2013 theft of over 200 bottles of rare Kentucky bourbon.

title: Sexy Beasts
description: The six-part documentary based on Ronan Farrow's podcast and book "Catch and Kill: Lies, Spies and A Conspiracy to Protect Predators" features interviews with journalists, sources, and investigators about the obstacles involved in the Harvey Weinstein investigation.

title: The End
description: Jasper Tempest (Ben Miller), a Cambridge University professor with OCD helps his former student, Detective Sergeant Lisa Donckers (Emma Naomi) with some of her cases in this British series based on the Belgian series of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on BritBox on 3 Jun 2021 and in the US on PBS on 11 Jul 2021]

title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
description: The satirical limited series created by Mike White gradually reveals the truth behind the seemingly perfect guests and staff at an exclusive Hawaiian resort over the course of a week.

title: 100 Foot Wave
description: Officers O'Leary (Karen O'Leary) and Minogue (Mike Minogue) are recruited by Sergeant Maaka (Maaka Pohatu) to investigate paranormal cases in this spin-off of the 2014 film What We Do in the Shadows. [Premiered originally in New Zealand on TVNZ 2 on 11 Jul 2018; in the US on The CW on 11 Jul 2021]

title: Naomi Osaka
description: Hosted by Nischelle Turner, the reality series features celebrities such as Paula Abdul, Wayne Brady, Eve, Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Chris Paul, Anthony Ramos, and Emmitt Smith helping with surprise renovations to people who helped them before they became stars.

title: Schmigadoon!
description: Ex-rain-cloud-turned-postman Parker J. Cloud (voiced by Becky Robinson) works at the Middlemost Post Office with his boss Angus (voiced by John DiMaggio) and Russell, their magical pet walrus in the animated series from SpongeBob SquarePants' John Trabbic III.

title: McCartney 3,2,1
description: Eight years later, Parker (Beth Riesgraf), Eliot Spencer (Christian Kane), and Alec Hardison (Aldis Hodge) bring Sophie Devereaux (Gina Bellman) back into the fold and add corporate attorney Harry Wilson (Noah Wyle) and Hardison's foster sister Breanna Casey (Aleyse Shannon) to the crew as they take down corrupt people and organizations.

title: Dr. Death
description: The SpongeBob SquarePants spinoff follows a younger Patrick Star (voiced by Bill Fagerbakke) when he was living with his family and hosted a variety show from his bedroom.

title: American Horror Stories
description: Set in 2006, zombies attack the White House just as Leon S. Kennedy (voiced by Nick Apostolides) arrives to investigate a hacking attempt there, meanwhile in Penamstan, Claire Redfield looks into a strange drawing in this CG anime series based on the video game franchise.

title: The North Water
description: New York private school students discover they are being watched by Gossip Girl (voiced by Kristen Bell), who returns eight years later on Instagram in this follow-up series to The CW series of the same name.

title: Heist (2021)
description: New Monsters University graduate Tylor Tuskmon (Ben Feldman) joins Monsters, Inc. where he learns about laughs instead of scares in this animated sequel to the 2001 film Monsters, Inc.

title: Catch and Kill: The Podcast Tapes
description: The animated musical series about civics produced by Barack and Michelle Obama features songs from such artists as Brandi Carlile, Andra Day, Daveed Diggs, poet Amanda Gorman, H.E.R., Brittany Howard, Adam Lambert, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Janelle Monáe, and Bebe Rexha.

title: Professor T
description: Gail Simmons hosts this competitive cooking series where each episode features two home cooks competing head-to-head with the help of one previous Top Chef competitors for a chance to win $5,000.

title: The White Lotus
description: Set in County Clare, Ireland, Val Ahern (Dervla Kirwan) discovers her husband dead after a party and seeks to find out what happened in this Irish thriller created by Kate O' Riordan. [Aired originally in Ireland on RTÉ One on 7 Mar 2021; in the US on 1 Jul 2021 on Peacock]

title: Wellington Paranormal
description: The people of the border town of Allende become targets of the cartel after a DEA operation goes wrong in this six-part drama from James Schamus that was based on true events described in a ProPublica article by Ginger Thompson.

title: Secret Celebrity Renovation
description: The three-part documentary series looks into the 1996 murder of French TV producer Sophie Toscan du Plantier in the West Cork town of Schull.

title: Middlemost Post
description: Guests sit for David Choe as he paints their portrait and interviews them in his childhood home.

title: Leverage: Redemption
description: Billie Connelly (Sarah Shahi), a married mother of two fantasies about her more wild past are discovered by her husband in this dramedy based on B.B. Easton’s book named 44 Chapters About 4 Men.

title: The Patrick Star Show
description: The mysterious and eccentric Mr. Benedict (Tony Hale) enlists a group of orphans to go undercover at a boarding school to stop a scheme that threatens the world in this series based on the Trenton Lee Stewart book of the same name.

title: RESIDENT EVIL: Infinite Darkness
description: Helen Mirren hosts this comedic nature series based on the BBC series Walk on the Wild Side.

title: Gossip Girl (2021)
description: The three-part documentary series profiles the background Ghislaine Maxwell, her connection to Jeffrey Epstein and the crimes she is awaiting trial for.

title: Monsters at Work
description: Peyton Manning hosts the revival of the game show where college students test their knowledge against each other for a chance for scholarships and the College Bowl trophy.

title: We The People
description: Douglas Petersen (Tom Hollander) hopes to use his family's three week European vacation with their son (Tom Taylor) to change his wife Connie's (Saskia Reeves) mind about leaving him in this adaptation of David Nicholls' novel of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 20 Sep 2020 and to air in the US on PBS in 20...

title: Top Chef Amateurs
description: Set in the 1980s, San Diego housewife Sheila Rubin (Rose Byrne) finds direction with the help of aerobics in this dramedy created, written, and executive produced by Annie Weisman.

title: Smother
description: The eight-part nature documentary series narrated by Patton Oswalt follows a group of penguins as they lay eggs, raise their chicks and mate during the summer months at Simon's Town, just outside of Cape Town, South Africa.

title: Somos.
description: Iggy Azalea, former Bachelorette Hannah Brown, and Taye Diggs and are some of the contestants for this celebrity Dating Game reboot hosted by Michael Bolton and Zooey Deschanel.

title: Sophie: A Murder in West Cork
description: New Hampshire High school teacher Sarah Cooper (Stella Baker) saves her hometown from a mining country by discovering a loophole allowing it to become an independent nation in this drama written by Jeffrey Paul King.

title: The Choe Show
description: After Miles (Rafael Casal) is arrested, Ashley (Cephas Jones) has to move in with Miles' mother (Helen Hunt) and half-sister (Jaylen Barron) in this dramedy series that is set six months after the 2018 film of the same name.

title: Sex/Life
description: Allison McRoberts (Annie Murphy) has been living like a stereotypical sitcom housewife but after 10 years, she reaches her breaking point in this dark comedy created by Valerie Armstrong. [Premieres on AMC+ on 13 Jun 2021 and then on AMC on 20 Jun 2021]

title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
description: The crime thriller created by Chris Brandon follows Northern Irish officer Tom Brannick (James Nesbitt) as he investigates a suspected suicide case that includes a clue to an assassin connected to deaths during the Troubles. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 21 Feb 2021 and in the US on Acorn TV on 15 Mar 2021]

title: When Nature Calls with Helen Mirren
description: Twenty-somethings Carly Shay (Miranda Cosgrove) and her friends juggle work, family and relationships in this series which picks up 10 years after the original Nickelodeon iCarly series ended.

title: Epstein's Shadow: Ghislaine Maxwell
description: The one-night stand London twenty-something Jessie (Rose Matafeo) has with the famous movie star Tom Kapoor (Nikesh Patel) becomes something more in this British comedy created by Matafeo. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC Three on 25 Apr 2021 and on BBC One on 26 Apr 2021. In the US on HBO Max on 10 Jun 2021]

title: Capital One College Bowl
description: Top Gear's Jeremy Clarkson gets involved with his Oxfordshire farm with help from tractor driver Kaleb, stone wall worker Gerald, advisor ‘Cheerful’ Charlie, and Jeremy's girlfriend Lisa.

title: Us
description: Dwyane Wade hosts this game show based on the UK series of the same name, where contestant pairs try to complete seven physical and mental tasks inside a glass box for a chance to win $250,000.

title: Physical
description: Loki (Tom Hiddleston) returns as the God of Mischief after the circumstances of 2019's "Avengers: Endgame."

title: Penguin Town
description: In 1955, New York heiress Lucy Savage (Juno Temple) arrives in Tangier to marry Hugo (Hugh Skinner) but she finds more excitement in her new city in this drama series inspired by Anais Nin's erotic short stories collection of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on Sky Atlantic on 4 August 2020]

title: The Celebrity Dating Game
description: Livia Drusilla (Nadia Parkes/Kasia Smutniak) lives through political strife to become Emperor Augustus Caesar's third wife in this historical drama miniseries created and written by Simon Burke. [Premiered originally in the UK on Sky Atlantic on 14 May 2021 and in the US on Epix on 6 Jun 2021]

title: The Republic of Sarah
description: A series of events forces Lisey Landon (Julianne Moore) to face her memories of her marriage to her husband (Clive Owen), a famous novelist who died two years earlier in this thriller based on Stephen King's novel of the same name.

title: Blindspotting
description: A half human and half deer-boy (Christian Convery) leaves his isolated home to find a post-apocalyptic world as he befriends other hybrids and humans in this series based on the DC comic by Jeff Lemire.

title: Kevin Can F**k Himself
description: PhD student Amina Hussain (Anjana Vasan) is convinced to join a Muslim female punk band named Lady Parts as its lead guitarist in the British music comedy created, written and directed by Nida Manzoor. [Premieres in the UK on Channel 4 on 20 May 2021 and in the US on 3 Jun 2021 on Peacock]

title: Bloodlands
description: The game show hosted by Lil Rel Howery based on the British series of the same name has teams of three competing in miniature-sized challenges for chance to win $250,000.

title: iCarly (2021)
description: The documentary narrated by Michel Martin and directed by Jonathan Silvers looks at the history of the Tulsa Race Massacre, and recent events that include the search and excavation for the mass graves of the victims, the killing of Terence Crutcher in 2016, and Black Lives Matter protests.

title: Starstruck (2021)
description: A group of pets and strays work on their issues in a therapy group led by a poodle named Honey (voiced by Lisa Kudrow) in this animated comedy from Gabrielle Allan, Jennifer Crittenden, Clea Duvall, and Sharon Horgan.

title: Clarkson's Farm
description: Directed by Stanley Nelson and Marco Williams, the documentary looks at the formation of Black Wall Street and how it was destroyed as well as the current excavation recover and identify the victims.

title: The Cube
description: The musical comedy special was filmed by the comedian over the past year by himself, with no crew or audience.

title: Loki
description: After the rules are changed for its yearly challenge, graduating seniors in a small Texas town must decide if they are willing to risk everything for a chance for a better life in this drama written and created by Lauren Oliver (who also wrote the novel it is based on).

title: Little Birds
description: Tommy Pickles (E.G. Daily), his cousin Angelica (Cheryl Chase), Chuckie Finster (Nancy Cartwright), Susie Carmichael (Cree Summer), and the twins Phil and Lil DeVille (Kath Soucie) are back with a CGI-animation reboot that will feature the adults voiced by Nicole Byer, Anna Chlumsky, Tony Hale, Michael McKean, Natalie Morales, and Timoth...

title: Domina
description: The cast of "Friends" return to the original soundstage where they filmed the series to reminisce and test their knowledge of the show against each other in the special that also includes appearances from David Beckham, Justin Bieber, BTS, James Corden, Cindy Crawford, Cara Delevingne, Lady Gaga, Elliott Gould, Kit Harington, Larry Hanki...

title: Lisey's Story
description: Joel McHale hosts this series where contestants must recreate deserts for judges Curtis Stone and Yolanda Gampp based only on small clues such as crumbs and leftover ingredients.

title: Sweet Tooth
description: Stephen Satterfield explores the history and influence of African American cuisine in this documentary series based on Dr. Jessica B. Harris's book.

title: We Are Lady Parts
description: Pearl (Kerry Godliman) opens up a private detective agency at her family restaurant at a English coastal town but runs into conflict with new DCI Mike McGuire (Howard Charles) in this series based on the books by Julie Wassmer.

title: Small Fortune
description: The comedy series based on Kevin Iso and Dan Perlman award-winning 2017 digital series of the same name about two friends (Kevin Iso and Dan Perlman) struggling to progress in Flatbush, Brooklyn.

title: Tulsa: The Fire and the Forgotten
description: The documentary series co-created by Oprah Winfrey and Prince Harry about mental health features discussions with chef Rashad Armstead, Glenn Close, NBA player DeMar DeRozan, Olympic boxer Virginia "Ginny" Fuchs, Lady Gaga, NBA player Langston Galloway, and Zak Williams.

title: Housebroken
description: The eight-part documentary features archival footage and interviews about how musicians such as The Rolling Stones, Aretha Franklin, Marvin Gaye, Bob Marley, Joni Mitchell, Lou Reed and The Who influenced changes in culture and politics.

title: Tulsa Burning: The 1921 Race Massacre
description: Supervillain M.O.D.O.K. (voiced by Patton Oswalt) has been kicked out as leader of his evil organization A.I.M. and struggles with family life in this animated adult comedy series based on the Marvel comic characters.

title: Bo Burnham: Inside
description: The late night talk show takes place while Sam Jay is hosting a party at her apartment with other interviews, sketches, and animations adding to the topic discussed each week.

title: Panic
description: Each episode will be set in different time periods and vantage points in this anthology series about human connection even in isolation created by David Weil.

title: Rugrats (2021)
description: The documentary series looks into the 1980s Massachusetts case where the murder of three young women was blamed on a satanic cult led by Carl Drew. One of the investigators re-examines the case 20 years later and finds evidence that they may have convicted the wrong person.

title: Friends: The Reunion
description: Allan Cubitt's three-part miniseries adaptation of Eugene McCabe's novel set in 1883 where 23-year-old Beth (Ann Skelly) plans to kill her step-father Billy Winters (Matthew Rhys) with the help of one of his tenants, Liam Ward (Jaime Dornan). [Premiered originally in Ireland on RTE on 26 Nov 2018, in the UK on BBC 2 on 28 Nov 2018 an...

title: Crime Scene Kitchen
description: Set in Harlem, 30-somethings best friends Whitney (Amber Stevens West), Ella (Andrea Bordeaux), Renee (Bresha Webb) and Sondi (Corbin Reid) support each other with both personal and career issues in this series created by Leigh Davenport.

title: High on the Hog: How African American Cuisine Transformed America
description: The six-part documentary series looks at the history of LGBTQ+ rights movement beginning with the 1950s to the present day.

title: Whitstable Pearl
description: Cora (Thuso Mbedu) and Caesar (Aaron Pierre) escape from a plantation and learn the Underground Railroad is an actual physical underground railway line. But a bounty hunter named Ridgeway (Joel Edgerton) is determined to bring Cora back in this Barry Jenkins adaptation of Colson Whitehead's novel of the same name.

title: Flatbush Misdemeanors
description: The Ryan Murphy limited series based on Steven Gaines's book Simply Halston tells how American fashion designer Halston (Ewan McGregor) built a fashion empire in the 1970s only to lose control of it in the 1980s.

title: The Me You Can't See
description: Deborah Vance (Jean Smart), a Las Vegas comedian, mentors Ava (Hannah Einbinder), a 25-year-old writer in this dark comedy from Paul W. Downs, Lucia Aniello and Jen Statsky.

title: 1971: The Year That Music Changed Everything
description: The family comedy co-created by Regina Hicks and Wanda Sykes focuses on Bennie Upshaw (Mike Epps) and his family that includes wife Regina (Kim Fields), two young daughters, a younger son, and his teenage son (Diamond Lyons) he had in a previous relationship plus his sister-in-law (Wanda Sykes).

title: Marvel's M.O.D.O.K.
description: The late-night variety show from writer/comedian Ziwe will feature interviews, unscripted segments and sketches.

title: Pause With Sam Jay
description: After many decades of protecting the world, the first superheroes who had emerged in the 1930s are ready to pass on the torch to their children who struggle with the responsibility and expectations in this adaptation of the graphic novels by Mark Millar and Frank Quitely.

title: Solos
description: Jodie (Jill Halfpenny) spots a teenager who resembles her missing son (who was presumed drowned nine years ago). After the police are unwilling to investigate, she begins her own investigation in this British thriller created by Francesca Brill and Luke Watson.
