He searches for a rare pair of sneakers to recoup his money with the help of a group of sneakerheads in this comedy from Jay Longino.

title: Emily in Paris
description: Mossad agent Tamar Rabinyan (Niv Sultan) goes undercover in Tehran in this series created by Moshe Zonder, Dana Eden, and Maor Kohn. [Premiered originally in Israel on Kan 11 on 22 Jun 2020]

title: A World of Calm
description: Becky (Ashleigh LaThrop), Ian (Dan Byrd), Samantha (Jessica Rothe), Wilson Wilson (Desmin Borges) and Grant (Javon "Wanna" Walton) are fans of the Utopia comic and discover secret messages within its pages that predict major world events. They then find the comic protagonist, Jessica Hyde (Sasha Lane), is real and together they seek to s...

title: Let's Be Real
description: Based on the 1985 murders, the miniseries begins with Jeremy Bamber (Freddie Fox) calling the police that his sister Sheila (Cressida Bonas) was threatening the family with a rifle. When they arrive, DCI Taff Jones (Stephen Graham) and DS Stan Jones (Mark Addy) determine it was a murder-suicide. But as the investigation continues, the tr...

title: Soulmates
description: The two-part documentary directed by Alex Gibney and Javier Alberto Botero delves into Russia's interference with the 2016 U.S. election with videos of troll farms and interviews with the lead prosecutor for the Mueller Investigation Andrew Weissmann, former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCab, former CIA Director John Brennan, and Trump ca...

title: The Walking Dead: World Beyond
description: Hosted by Ken Jeong, the game show based on the South Korean series of the same name features a contestant trying to determine if the singers are good singers with the help of a rotating judging panel that includes Cheryl Hines and The Masked Singer season two finalist Adrienne Bailon-Houghton.

title: The Salisbury Poisonings
description: The documentary directed by Jonah Tulis and Blake J. Harris examines the years when Sega took on Nintendo in the 1990s beginning with the launch of the Sega Genesis and Sonic the Hedgehog.

title: Weakest Link
description: Kal Penn hosts this series which includes interviews with guests and comedic segments on political topics including education, the environment, judges, healthcare, and voting.

title: Emergency Call
description: Margaret Monreaux (Kim Cattrall) and her family are shocked to learn three illegitimate children of her recently deceased husband may inherit their very successful Christian television network, the Sunshine Network in this drama series based on the New Zealand series of the same name.

title: The Comey Rule
description: Elizabeth Stanton hosts the reality series that features clips, outtakes and viral videos from movies, TV shows and from the internet.

title: A Wilderness of Error
description: Dan (Martin Compston) and Emily (Sophie Rundle) have a wonderful life in Glasgow, but have been trying to have child together for years. Emily meets troubled 18-year-old Kaya (Mirren Mack), who is willing to carry their child in this drama created by Nicole Taylor.

title: Sneakerheads
description: The series inspired by the novel "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest," Mildred Ratched (Paulson) begins her work as a nurse at a Northern California psychiatric hospital in 1947.

title: Tehran
description: Six teenagers at the new adventure camp at Jurassic World are stranded and must band together to survive on the opposite side of Isla Nublar as the dinosaurs cause havoc in the animated series.

title: Utopia (2020)
description: More than 10 years after "Long Way Round" and "Long Way Down," Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman return for a new road trip, traveling from the tip of South America to Mexico on electric Harley-Davidsons over 100 days.

title: The Murders at White House Farm
description: After a passenger plane with 256 people disappears over the Atlantic, aviation investigator Kendra Malley (Archie Panjabi) is called in by her former boss and mentor, Howard Lawson (Christopher Plummer) to help locate it.

title: Agents of Chaos
description: The reality series similar to The Great British Bake Off features 10-12 potters creating different types of pottery to be named the top British potter. [Premiered originally in the UK with the first two seasons on BBC Two, Season 3 on More4 and Season 4 on Channel 4; In the US, the first four seasons are on HBO Max]

title: I Can See Your Voice
description: Tituss Burgess hosts the singing competition series where contestants singing is judged by computer that selects those who sing the closest to the original song.

title: Console Wars
description: The four-part documentary series takes a look back at the events that led to the Challenger explosion that killed everyone onboard on January 28, 1986.

title: Kal Penn Approves This Message
description: Sam (Jude Law) ends up on an island and finds inhabitants who want to protect their rituals at all costs while Helen (Naomie Harris) comes to the island looking for answers in this limited series created by Dennis Kelly and Felix Barrett.

title: Filthy Rich
description: 14-year-old Fraser (Jack Dylan) adjust to moving from New York City to an Italian military base and connects with other teens around the base including 14-year-old Caitlin (Jordan Kristine Seamón) in this Luca Guadagnino coming-of-age drama series.

title: World's Funniest Animals
description: After taking a DNA test, Samuel L. Jackson traces his family to the Benga tribe in Gabon. While Simcha Jacobovici and Afua Hirsch research the possible locations of sunken slave ships with the help of 3D mapping and ground-penetrating radar in the six-part documentary series about the transatlantic slave trade.

title: The Nest
description: Piet van der Valk (Marc Warren) with his team that includes Lucienne Hassell (Maimie McCoy) and Job Cloovers (Elliot Barnes-Worrell) investigate crimes in Amsterdam in this reboot of the long-running (ran on ITV between 1972-92) British crime drama based on the novels by Nicolas Freeling. [Premiered originally in the UK on ITV on 26 A...

title: Ratched
description: Miriam Nessler (Bette Midler), a New York teacher; Sharynn Tarrows (Kaitlyn Dever), a nurse from Wyoming; actor Mark Hesterman (Dan Levy); Youtuber Clarissa Montgomery (Sarah Paulson) and philanthropist Callie Josephson (Issa Rae) all deal with the coronavirus pandemic in different ways in this satire from Paul Rudnick.

title: Jurassic World: Camp Cretaceous
description: Astronaut Emma Green (Hilary Swank) leaves behind her husband (Josh Charles) and daughter (Talitha Bateman) to lead a dangerous mission to Mars in this drama written by Jason Katims and Jessica Goldberg.

title: Long Way Up
description: Canadian couple Maggie (Rachelle Lefevre) and Tom Cabbott (Matt Whelan) have settled in New Zealand in this thriller created by Sarah-Kate Lynch.

title: Departure
description: Two androids (Amanda Collin and Abubakar Salim) raise human children on a new planet, but their peaceful lives are changed when a ship from Earth arrives in the sci-fi drama created by Aaron Guzikowski.

title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
description: Set in contemporary Sweden, a young 20-something Kurt Wallander (Adam Pålsson) investigates his first case in the series inspired by Henning Mankell's character that had previously been central in both a Swedish and British series.

title: Sing On!
description: After losing his job, Jeremy (Na'im Lynn) and his family move back to Georgia to live with his grandfather (J. Anthony Brown), who has bought a senior living home for the elderly. Luckily Mr. Brown (David Mann) and Cora (Tamela Mann) want to help out.

title: Challenger: The Final Flight
description: Dr. Bashir "Bash" Hamed (Hamza Haq), a Syrian refugee now living in Toronto with his younger sister joins York Memorial's Emergency Department led by Dr. Jed Bishop (John Hannah). [Premiered originally on Canada's CTV on 26 Feb 2020]

title: The Third Day
description: Narrated by Tom Hardy, the latest installment of the All or Nothing sports anthology docuseries follows the 2019-2020 season of the Premier League's Tottenham Hotspur as José Mourinho takes over as manager of the football (soccer) club.

title: We Are Who We Are
description: The four-part documentary series from Rachel Grady and Heidi Ewing follows the victims defrauded by conman Richard Scott Smith as they band together to seek justice by finding him before he steals another woman's money and disappears again.

title: Enslaved
description: The four-part documentary series follows Ravi Patel travels to Mexico, Japan, South Korea and Denmark with his family and friends to seek answers to questions such as growing older, immigration, gender roles and work/life balance.

title: Van der Valk
description: When new Mennonite pastor Noah Funk (Ryan Robbins) turns in a follower invoked in illegal dealings to the police, it only puts him and his wife (Alex Paxton-Beesley) in danger in this Canadian crime drama created and written by Michael Amo.

title: Coastal Elites
description: Jimmy, J.B, Michael, Noel, and Peggy are some of the realtors working the Hamptons market for Nest Seekers International in this real estate reality series.

title: The Duchess
description: The documentary series directed by Jehane Noujaim and Karim Amer looks into the NXIVM self-help program where Smallville actress Allison Mack recruited women to eventually join a secret society that allegedly included sexual slavery to co-founder Keith Raniere.

title: Julie and the Phantoms
description: The two-night, four-part limited drama series filmed remotely follows three married couples and a pair of roommates, as they deal with love and life under quarantine.

title: Woke
description: The documentary series follows Yvie Oddly (Season 11 winner), Asia O'Hara (Season 10), Derrick Barry (Season 8 and Season 5 of RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars), Kameron Michaels (Season 10), Naomi Smalls (Season 8 and Season 4 of All Stars), and Vanessa "Vanjie" Mateo (Season 10 and Season 11) as they ready for the "RuPaul's Drag Race Live!...

title: Power Book II: Ghost
description: Coach Ben Hopkins (Jake Johnson) helps a terrible high school basketball team in hopes it will lead to opportunities to the big leagues in this comedy created by Ben Hoffman.

title: The South Westerlies
description: Private detectives Cassie Dewell (Kylie Bunbury) and Cody Hoyt (Ryan Phillippe) work with his estranged wife and former cop, Jenny Hoyt (Katheryn Winnick), to locate two kidnapped sisters but they soon discover there are others missing in this David E. Kelley thriller based on the books by C.J. Box.

title: Noughts + Crosses
description: Narrated by Charles Martinet, the six-part documentary about the history of video games features interviews with creators and other contributors of such games as Final Fantasy, Mortal Kombat, Pac-Man, and Space Invaders.

title: Away
description: Meg (Alexa Davies), Nicky (Will Merrick) and Usman (Sargon Yelda) are big fans of the computer multi-player role playing game, Kingdom Scrolls in this British sitcom.

title: The Sounds
description: The adaptation of Matt Ruff book follows Atticus Black (Jonathan Majors) as he goes on a roadtrip through segregated 1950s America with his friend Letitia (Jurnee Smollett-Bell) and uncle George (Courtney B. Vance) to find his missing father (Michael K. Williams).

title: Raised by Wolves
description: The Cornley Polytechnic Drama Society puts on ambitious productions in this comedy series based on Mischief Theatre's play, The Play That Goes Wrong. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 23 Dec 2019]

title: Young Wallander
description: 66 teams of five people from 30 countries race across 671 kilometers over 11 days in this competitive reality series hosted by Bear Grylls and executive produced by Mark Burnett.

title: Tyler Perry's Assisted Living
description: Kansas college football coach Ted Lasso (Jason Sudeikis) is hired by an English professional soccer team in this comedy from Sudeikis and Bill Lawrence.

title: Transplant
description: Fraternal twins Sterling and Blair (Maddie Phillips and Anjelica Bette Fellini) join bounty hunter Bowser Jenkins (Kadeem Hardison) on the job while juggling high school and relationships in this comedy created by Kathleen Jordan.

title: All or Nothing: Tottenham Hotspur
description: The cooking show with actress/singer Selena Gomez features a professional chef joining her remotely to help teach her how to cook a meal.

title: Love Fraud
description: DS Lola Franks (Eve Myles) and DI Jackson Mendy (Babou Ceesay) search for two killers in the form of the free spirited Freddy (Hermione Corfield) and ex-child soldier Baba (Dipo Ola) in the thriller written by Gaby Hull.

title: Ravi Patel's Pursuit of Happiness
description: The two-night, four-hour documentary directed by Anne Sundberg and Ricki Stern features stories about eight survivors of Epstein's alleged sex trafficking scheme.

title: Pure
description: Diego Luna hosts a variety of Latin American guests to discuss serious topics including the drug war, Central American refugees and COVID-19 over dinner.

title: Million Dollar Beach House
description: The comedy about best friends Fran (Sue Perkins) and Jamie (Mel Giedroyc) who go into the murder-for hire business.

title: The Vow (2020)
description: Set in 2380, the animated comedy from Mike McMahan follows the crew of the U.S.S. Cerritos as they try to balance working and living on a Starfleet ship.

title: Love in the Time of Corona
description: The Canadian adaptation of M.R. Hall's novels about Jenny Cooper (Serinda Swan), a recently widowed and single-mother coroner in Toronto.

title: RuPaul's Drag Race: Vegas Revue
description: The one-hour primetime special about the life and career of Rep. John Lewis is hosted by Gayle King, Brad Pitt, Tyler Perry, and Oprah Winfrey.

title: Hoops
description: The documentary directed by Daniel DiMauro and Morgan Pehme follows Republican House representatives Matt Gaetz (R-FL), Thomas Massie (R-KY), and Ken Buck (R-CO) as they juggle legislation and demands to fundraise by the RNC.

title: Big Sky (2020)
description: Recently paroled, Mike Ferro (Boyd Holbrook) is accused in a subway bombing and LAPD's Counter Terrorism Bureau Detective Clay Bryce (Kiefer Sutherland) is determined to capture Mike in this reboot of the classic series.

title: High Score
description: The six-part documentary series about America's current immigration system directed by Christina Clusiau and Shaul Schwarz features candid interviews with agents of Immigrations and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Border Patrol, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) and detainees as well as footage of raids and the detentions centers.

title: Dead Pixels
description: Kermit the Frog and the rest of the Muppet gang go unscripted in this short-form series that will also feature celebrity guests.

title: Lovecraft Country
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Tiller Russell looks into the 1985 kidnapping and murder of DEA Agent Enrique "Kiki" Camarena.

title: The Goes Wrong Show
description: Filmed remotely, Oprah's new talk show includes interviews with Emmanuel Acho, Ibram X. Kendi, and Bryan Stevenson.

title: World's Toughest Race: Eco-Challenge Fiji
description: The British documentary series set at Wood Green, a British dog rescue charity, where staff help match unwanted dogs with new owners.

title: Ted Lasso
description: Set in 1988, London housewife Sammy Cooper (Sarah Kendall) returns to her hometown in Australia with her two children after the death of her husband and move in with her mother (Kerry Armstrong) and brother (Ben Mingay) in this Australian/British dramedy created by Kendall.

title: Teenage Bounty Hunters
description: The hour-long documentary narrated by Michael Phelps and directed by Brett Rapkin features interviews about the mental toll of competing from such Olympians as Sasha Cohen, Gracie Gold, Lolo Jones, Bode Miller, Apolo Anton Ohno and Shaun White.

title: Selena and Chef
description: Ex-boyband star Maxxx (O-T Fagbenle) looks to make a solo comeback and win back his ex-girlfriend (Jourdan Dunn). He seeks help from his former manager (Chris Meloni), with his very supportive cousin (Helen Monks) and his new ambitious manager (Pippa Bennett-Warner) in this British comedy.

title: We Hunt Together
description: The adaptation of comedian Liam Williams' BBC Radio 4 show where he reflects on his current situation and how his adolescence in a Leeds suburb in the 2000s may play a part in his behavior. [Originally premiered in the UK on BBC3 on 24 Nov 2019]

title: Surviving Jeffrey Epstein
description: 12 Canadians compete for the title "Canada's First Drag Superstar," a year of free Hilton hotel stays and $100,000 prize on the Canadian spin-off hosted by RuPaul's Drag Race Season 11 runner-up Brooke Lynn Hytes with judges Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman and Stacey McKenzie.

title: Pan y Circo
description: The six-part docuseries directed by Lesley Chilcott features archival footage, photos as well as interviews with journalists and former members of the Manson Family.

title: Hitmen
description: The second comedy special for the comedian on Amazon's Prime Video was filmed in Canada and Spain.

title: Star Trek: Lower Decks
description: Bob Woodruff and his 28-year-old son Mack travel to former conflict zones in Colombia, Ethiopia, Lebanon, Pakistan, Papua New Guinea, and Ukraine.

title: Coroner
description: 8-year-old Tiggy works at the Department of Lost and Found in Wee-Gee City with his partner, his cat, Gweeseek, in this animated series from Myke Chilian.

title: John Lewis: Celebrating a Hero
description: The reality series follows nine people over three weeks at a Costa Rican wellness resort where a team of alternative healers help them release their rage, express their vulnerabilities and learn about themselves through exotic experiences.

title: The Swamp
description: The three-part documentary from Sam Hobkinson looks at the five Mafia families (Bonanno, Colombo, Gambino, Genovese, and Lucchese) that ostensibly controlled many industries New York City and how the RICO statute and the Mafia Commission trial helped in dismantling their hold.

title: The Fugitive (2020)
description: The food series features chefs and food from six different countries including: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Mexico, and Peru.

title: Immigration Nation
description: Hosted by Rayvon Owen, 12 players complete challenges in The Sims 4 for a chance to win a $100,000 cash prize in this new ELeague series which will be judged by Maxis game developer Dave Miotke, YouTube personality Kelsey Impicciche, and singer-songwriter Tayla Parx.

title: Muppets Now

title: The Last Narc
description: The 30 Rock reunion is part of an Upfront special that will introduce some of the upcoming series on the various NBCUniversal networks. Some local NBC affiliates will preempt it due to fear it is little more than an infomercial for Peacock (who will stream the special the next day).

title: The Oprah Conversation
description: 11 people come to an '80s inspired lakeside camp in Lithuania where they learn they're not just on a summer camp series, but they must figure out who is the "killer" among them to win the cash prize.

title: The Dog House: UK
description: Matchmaker Sima Taparia helps people both in India and abroad with arrange marriages in this docuseries executive-produced by Smriti Mundhra.

title: Frayed
description: The documentary follows 2016 Olympics swimmer Ryan Lochte as he tries to gain a spot in Team USA.

title: The Weight of Gold
description: Jo (Christina Vidal Mitchell) and Bill (Will Sasso) are raising their two kids, while getting constant input from Jo's large Catholic family and Bill's mom (Jane Curtin), who lives with them.

title: Maxxx
description: The series hosted by Dale Earnhardt Jr. explores past speedways no longer in use with racing alumni.

title: Ladhood
description: NSA agent Jerry Bernstein (David Schwimmer) is transferred to GCHQ, the UK's NSA-like equivalent. Computer analyst Joseph Harries (Nick Mohammed) helps Jerry in his attempt to take over control in this comedy written by Mohammed.

title: Canada's Drag Race
description: CCTV footage shows Shaun Emery (Callum Turner) kidnapping and assaulting his barrister, but as Detective Inspector Rachel Carey (Holliday Grainger) looks into the case, she finds evidence of a conspiracy in this Ben Chanan crime drama.

title: Helter Skelter: An American Myth
description: In the adaptation of Aldous Huxley's 1932 novel of the same name, the seemingly utopian life in New London is threatened by the arrival John the Savage (Alden Ehrenreich), a man Bernard Marx (Harry Lloyd) and Lenina Crowne (Brown Findlay) met while on vacation in the Savage Lands.

title: Jim Gaffigan: The Pale Tourist
description: The sequel to 2017's Psych: The Movie sees Gus and Shawn returning to Santa Barbara after Police Chief Carlton Lassiter (Timothy Omundson) starts seeing supernatural phenomena while recovering at a clinic.

title: Rogue Trip
description: Alex Winter's documentary about child actors features interviews with former child stars including Cameron Boyce, Todd Bridges, Diana Serra Cary, Milla Jovovich, Jada Pinkett Smith, Henry Thomas, Wil Wheaton, Mara Wilson, and Evan Rachel Wood.

title: Tig n' Seek
description: The half-hour drama from Katori Hall explores the lives of those who work and visit the Mississippi Delta strip club, The Pynk.

title: Lost Resort
description: A monthly documentary anthology series from the same people from FX's The Weekly. Each episode also airs on Hulu the day after its FX airing.

title: Fear City: New York vs. the Mafia
description: Tom Brady, Usain Bolt, LeBron James, Katie Ledecky, Alex Morgan, Kelly Slater, and Shaun White are some of the athletes profiled on the moment that defined their career in this short-form docuseries directed by Gotham Chopra.

title: Street Food: Latin America
description: 20-something aspiring singer Bess King (Brittany O'Grady) juggles life in New York City, love and her dreams in this dramedy from J.J. Abrams, Sara Bareilles and Jessie Nelson.

title: The Sims Spark'd
description: Zac Efron travels around the world with wellness expert Darin Olien to look at environmentally sustainable ways of living.

title: Cursed (2020)
description: Hosted by WWE's Mike "The Miz" Mizanin and Rocsi Diaz, 16 contestants race through a variety of water-based challenges for a chance to win $10,000 in the competition reality series based on the British show of the same name.

title: 30 Rock: A One-Time Special
description: The three-part documentary series follows comedian Amy Schumer throughout her pregnancy and includes behind-the-scenes of her life on tour as well as planning out a stand-up special.

title: Killer Camp
description: A major earthquake changes the lives of the Muto family that includes 14-year-old Ayumu (voiced by Faye Mata); her younger brother, Go (voiced by Ryan Bartley); her mother, Mari (voiced by Grace Lynn Kung); and her father, Koichiro (voiced by Masaki Terasoma), in this Japanese anime based on Sakyo Komatsu's novel, Japan Sinks.

title: Indian Matchmaking
description: Originally set for TBS, the adult animated comedy series created by JG Quintel is about a husband-and-wife and their five-year-old daughter living with their two divorced best friends in Los Angeles.

title: In Deep with Ryan Lochte
description: Inspired by real events, the lives of German-Australian flight attendant Sofie Werner (Yvonne Strahovski), Afghani Ameer (Fayssal Bazzi), as well as Clare Kowitz (Asher Keddie), the new general manager and Cam Sandford (Jai Courtney), a new guard at the Australian immigration detention centre, become entwined in this drama series co-crea...

title: United We Fall
description: The five-part documentary series directed by Pat Kondelis looks into high school football player Greg Kelley's controversial conviction for sexual assault of a child and the appeals process to overturn it.

title: Lost Speedways
description: Stoneybrook, Connecticut middle schooler Kristy Thomas (Sophie Grace) and her friends: Mary-Anne Spier (Malia Baker), Claudia Kishi (Momona Tamada), Stacey McGill (Shay Rudolph), and Dawn Schafer (Xochitl Gomez) start a babysitting business in this series based on the popular children's book series by Ann M. Martin.

title: Intelligence (2020)
description: Yasuo Odajima (Yoshiyoshi Arakawa), a paranormal investigator looks into strange sounds coming from the house Haruka Honjo (Yuina Kuroshima) is living in and uncovers a number of violent acts connected to it in this series based on the Japanese horror franchise also known as The Grudge.

title: The Capture
description: Ava (Alba Baptista), a 19-year-old woman wakes up in a morgue and learns the ring on her back means she was chosen to be a part of a secret group of demon-hunting nuns in this series inspired by Ben Dunn's comic book series, Warrior Nun Areala.

title: Brave New World
description: The revival of the mystery documentary series will be hostless and each episode will be a self-contained case.

title: Psych 2: Lassie Come Home
description: George Lopez's first Netflix Comedy special was filmed at San Francisco's Warfield Theatre in December 2019.

title: Showbiz Kids
description: The Liz Garbus-directed six-part documentary series based on Michelle McNamara's nonfction book about her search for the Golden State Killer features interviews with investigators, survivors and family of the killer as well as original recordings and archival footage.

title: P-Valley
description: The behind-the-scenes making-of documentary of Frozen 2 features directors Chris Buck and Jennifer Lee, Bobby and Kristen Anderson-Lopez as well as the voice cast of the animated film.

title: The New York Times Presents
description: Based on the animated series Adventure Time created by Pendleton Ward, the first of four specials finds BMO (voiced by Niki Yang) crash-landing on a alien planet on the brink of destruction.

title: Greatness Code
description: The first Netflix comedy special for the comedian was filmed In New Orleans in October 2019.

title: Little Voice
description: Hosted by Mayim Bialik, each week five celebrities including Action Bronson, Diplo, Dwight Howard, Ja Rule, Nene Leakes, Kevin Smith, Tori Spelling, and Bella Thorne compete for the most views of their self-shot videos to win money for the charity of their choice in this the series adaptation of the Korean series My Little Television.

title: Down to Earth with Zac Efron
description: The reality competition series hosted by Jason Sudeikis features 32 comics who compete in a single-elimination, head-to-head competition with funny performance videos. The audience votes to decide who wins each week.

title: Cannonball (2020)
description: Set in the 1930s, Perry Mason (Matthew Rhys) is a private detective who beings looking into a child kidnapping case.

title: Expecting Amy
description: Padma Lakshmi travels across the United States to look into the connection between food and the community it comes from.

title: Japan Sinks: 2020
description: Celebrities such as Mayim Bialik, Lauren Lapkus, Orlando Jones, Brian Posehn, Adam Savage, Aisha Tyler, and Reggie Watts argue about various pop culture topics in the series inspired by the live panels at San Diego and New York Comic Cons.

title: Close Enough
description: The competitive reality series hosted by Michelle Khare features 16 contestants between the ages of 12 to 15 who will solve puzzles and tackle physical challenges.

title: Stateless
description: The series set in the same universe as 2018 film Love, Simon follows new Creekwood High student Victor (Michael Cimino) as he adjusts to a new school, deals with family issues and comes to terms with his sexual orientation.

title: Outcry

title: The Baby-Sitters Club (2020)
description: New squire Patrick (voiced by Nicholas Hoult) discovers the kingdom is rife with corrupt people and that his delinquent siblings have returned to make his life difficult in this adult animated comedy.

title: JU-ON: Origins
description: A murder case may be connected to the disappearance of prosecutor Pawel Kopinski's (Grzegorz Damiecki sister that had happened 25 years ago in this Polish mystery drama based on Harlan Coben's book of the same name.

title: Warrior Nun
description: Released on the YouTube channel Netflix Is A Joke, the surprise comedy special from Dave Chappelle filmed on June 6 in Yellow Springs, Ohio features topics such as police brutality and racism.

title: Unsolved Mysteries (2020)
description: The game show hosted by Adam Scott and executive produced by Ryan Reynolds features four-person teams as they take on challenges that features not doing something for a chance to win up to $100,000.

title: George Lopez: We'll Do It For Half
description: The eight-part docuseries follows four doctors at New York's Lenox Hill Hospital over an 18-month period as they juggle their personal lives while trying to save lives.

title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark
description: During the COVID-19 lockdown, Michael Sheen and David Tennant (playing fictional versions of themselves) rehearse Luigi Pirandello's Six Characters in Search of an Author while under quarantine in this six-part comedy written and directed by Simon Evans. [Premiered originally in the UK on BBC One on 10 Jun 2020]

title: Into the Unknown: Making Frozen 2
description: Arabella (Michaela Coel), an up-and-coming writer was living her best life in London, but after she is assaulted at a nightclub, she begins to reconsider parts of her life.

title: Adventure Time: Distant Lands
description: The first HBO comedy special for the Nigerian-American comedian was filmed at Washingto D.C.'s Howard Theatre.

title: Eric Andre: Legalize Everything
description: The third stand-up comedy special for the comedian from the Bronx covers everything from her childhood to her marriage to a Midwesterner.

title: Celebrity Show-Off
description: The biographies of individuals such as Big Bird, Misty Copeland, Spike Lee, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Aly Raisman, Yara Shahidi, Gloria Steinem, Oprah Winfrey, and Stevie Wonder are told via letters from people impacted by them.

title: Tournament of Laughs
description: Milla Strachan (Rolanda Marais), a new low-level analyst with the Presidential Bureau of Intelligence (the PBI) uncovers a conspiracy that involves the mysterious Lukas Becker (Ed Stoppard) and Lemmer (James Alexander Gracie), a former PBI operative in this thriller based on the novel of the same name by Deon Meyer.

title: Perry Mason (2020)
description: Psychic medium Thomas John travels across America and offers readings to help people find clarity or closure with loved ones who have died.

title: Taste the Nation with Padma Lakshmi
description: Cathy Walcott's (Ellie White) life is turned upside down when her father dies suddenly, revealing he had another family, including a daughter (Lauren Socha) also named Catherine Walcott in this comedy written by Holly Walsh. [Originally premiered as a pilot episode on BBC 2 on 13 Sep 2017, a full season on BBC1 on 12 Jun 2020. Airs i...

title: Syfy Wire's The Great Debate
description: The two-part documentary about the artists who lived in the Los Angeles neighborhood in the 1960s-70s was directed by Alison Ellwood and features audio clips, footage and new interviews with Jackson Browne, Don Henley, Roger McGuinn, Graham Nash, Michelle Phillips, Bonnie Raitt, and Linda Ronstadt.

title: Karma
description: The three-part limited series based on the cheating scandal where Charles Ingram (Matthew Macfadyen), his wife (Sian Clifford) and Tecwen Whittock (Michael Jibson) worked together to cheat on the British version of the Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? game show in the 2001.

title: Love, Victor
description: Central Park manager Owen Tillerman (voiced by Leslie Odom, Jr.), his wife (voiced by Kathryn Hahn) and two kids Molly (voiced by Kristen Bell) and Cole (voiced by Tituss Burgess) try to stop hotel heiress Bitsy Brandenham (voiced by Stanley Tucci) and her assistant Helen (voiced by Daveed Diggs) from buying the park and turning it into ...

title: Beecham House
description: General Mark R. Naird (Steve Carell) moves his family to a secret base in Colorado to help run the new Space Force branch of the Armed Forces ordered by the President in this workplace comedy from Carell and Greg Daniels.

title: Crossing Swords
description: Hosted by Lauren Riihimaki aka (LaurDIY) the competition series features contestants between 9 and 15-years-old creating crafts.

title: The Woods (2020)

title: Dave Chappelle: 8:46
description: Stath (Jamie Demetriou) seeks to prove to his father he can take over the family business of property rentals in this BAFTA-winning comedy created by Demetriou. [Originally premiered in the UK on Channel 4 on 27 Jun 2018 and in the US on 27 May 2020 on HBO Max.]

title: Don't

title: Lenox Hill

title: Staged

title: The Bachelor: The Greatest Seasons - Ever!
description: Each season this anthology series created by Sam Boyd focuses on one person's search for love. In season one, 20-something Darby (Anna Kendrick) searches for love in New York.

title: I May Destroy You

title: Yvonne Orji: Momma, I Made It!

title: Gina Brillon: The Floor Is Lava

title: Dear...
description: The six-hour documentary about the life and career of President and General Ulysses S. Grant was executive produced by Leonardo DiCaprio and Jennifer Davisson.

title: Trackers

title: The Thomas John Experience
description: In the U.S. Supreme Court's most polarizing decision, is a woman as controversial as the case. Norma McCorvey, a.k.a. "Jane Roe," reveals the truth behind her story at a critical moment in America's abortion debate.

description: Kid contestants determine who is the real expert and who is the liar on the game show hosted by Yvette Nicole Brown and Rhys Darby as her robot sidekick, C.L.I.V.E.

title: Laurel Canyon
description: Elmo hosts a talk show that includes guests from Sesame Street and celebrities such as Jimmy Fallon, The Jonas Brothers, Lil Nas X, Blake Lively, John Mullaney, and John Oliver.

title: Quiz
description: 15 men compete to be the future father and partner of a successful woman in this dating reality show hosted by Kristin Davis.

title: Space Force
description: Contestants move through three-dimensional courses, while avoiding being tagged by the professional chasig after them in this series co-hosted by NFL's JJ, TJ and Derek Watt.

title: Craftopia
description: Four couples film themselves as they handle major life decisions while under the pandemic including planning a wedding, the birth of their children, and visa issues separating newlyweds.

title: Legendary

description: 10 teams of duos are judged each episode by lead judge Kristen Griffith-VanderYacht and a guest specialist to win a chance to create a floral showcase at London's Kew Gardens in this reality series hosted by Natasia Demetriou and Vic Reeves.

description: Set in 1880s Dublin, memorial photographer Brock Blennerhasset (Michael Smiley), his niece Nancy Vickers (Eileen O'Higgins) and new assistant Conall Molloy (Kerr Logan) are pulled into the Detective Frederick Regan's (Aidan O’Hare) investigation into a serial killer in this darkly comedic mystery series.

title: Love Life
description: High schooler Courtney Whitmore (Bassinger) discovers the Cosmic Staff and brings together a new group of heroes to fight villains seeking to destroy the world.

title: The Genetic Detective

title: Hannah Gadsby: Douglas
description: The long-gestating series based on the 2013 film by Bong Joon Ho finds humans living on perpetually running trains for over seven years after the world froze but after so many years, class divisions have brought tensions to a breaking point.

title: I Was Lorena Bobbitt
description: The comedy series created and written by Tony McNamara follows Catherine the Great (Elle Fanning) as she marries Peter III of Russia (Nicholas Hoult) and rises in power.

title: The Big Fib
description: The five-part documentary series narrated by Daniel Dae Kim and Tamlyn Tomita looks into the challenges and accomplishments of Asian Americans from the mid-19th century through today.

title: The Not Too Late Show with Elmo
description: Amy Schumer (who worked as a bartender) makes cocktails and learns how to cook from her husband Chris Fischer in this series filmed at their home.

title: Labor of Love
description: Ryan Seacrest returns as host of the second at home singalong special with such stars as: Merle Dandridge, Billy Eichner, Josh Gad, Donald Glover, Halsey, Heather Headley, Derek Hough, Julianne Hough, Adam Jacobs, Caissie Levy, Kara Lindsay, Kevin Massey, Idina Menzel, Miguel, Keke Palmer, Ben Platt, Seth Rogen, Anika Noni Rose, Walter R...

description: The two-hour comedy special will feature such comedians as: Louie Anderson, Judd Apatow, Jack Black, Wayne Brady, Adam Carolla, Cedric the Entertainer, Margaret Cho, Andrew Dice Clay, Deon Cole, Billy Crystal, Whitney Cummings, Tommy Davidson, Bill Engvall, Mike Epps, Billy Gardell, Brad Garrett, Whoopi Goldberg, Tiffany Haddish, Kevin H...

title: Ultimate Tag
description: The six-episode limited series finds identical twin brothers Dominick and Thomas Birdsey (both played by Mark Ruffalo) dealing with metal illness, relationship issues and secrets in this adaptation of Wally Lamb's novel of the same name.

description: Alicia Keys, Kevin Hart, Nick Jonas are some of the celebrities introducing stories of essential workers who help their communities during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Blood & Water
description: The arrival of Elliot Udo's (Andre Holland) teenage daughter Julie (Amandla Stenberg) at his failing Paris jazz club forces him to face his issues in this musical drama series from Damien Chazelle.

title: Patton Oswalt: I Love Everything
description: The animated sitcom created by Justin Roiland and Mike McMaha about aliens who end up in middle America after their planet is destroyed.

title: Sweet Magnolias
description: The debut comedy special for the comedian best known from HBO's Silcon Valley was filmed at Seattle's Neptune Theater.

title: The Big Flower Fight
description: Joe Buck, Robert and Kym Herjavec, Rob Lowe, Master P and Romeo, Raven-Symoné, JoJo Siwa, Curtis Stone, Meghan Trainor, and Steve Wozniak are some of the celebrities who will share videos of themselves as they react to recent news and television shows in this series based on the UK show, Gogglebox.

title: Dead Still

title: DC's Stargirl
description: The latest comedy special for Jerry Seinfeld was filmed at New York City's Beacon Theatre.

title: Hightown
description: Mary Winchenbach's moose scat (moose-poop) art and jewelry business in rural Maine is the focus of this reality series.

title: Snowpiercer
description: The documentary directed by Laurent Bouzereau features personal photos, home movies and Natasha Gregson Wagner interviewing friends and family about her mother, Natalie Wood.

title: The Great
description: The reality show takes a look at the young counselors and guests at Connecticut's Camp Getaway, a summer camp for adults.

title: White Lines
description: The eight-part documentary series about the making of The Mandalorian features interviews and behind-the-scenes footage.

title: The Happy Days of Garry Marshall
description: Dan Lanigan talks about props with those who created them and the film makers of such movies as The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe, Honey, I Shrunk The Kids, Mary Poppins, The Muppet Movie, The Nightmare Before Christmas, Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl, Tron and Who Framed Roger Rabbit?

title: Trial by Media
description: Janay (Dede Lovelace), Honeybear (Moonbear), Kirt (Nina Moran), Indigo (Ajani Russell), and Camille (Rachelle Vinberg) are a group of young women skateboarders living in New York City and dealing with the male-dominated world of skateboarding in this series based on Crystal Moselle's 2018 film, Skate Kitchen.

title: Asian Americans
description: Ryan Murphy's limited series for Netflix is set during the "Golden Age" of Hollywood.

title: Amy Schumer Learns to Cook
description: After a near fatal accident, app developer Nathan (Robbie Amell) is uploaded into a virtual afterlife called Lakeside by his girlfriend in this sci-fi comedy created and written by Greg Daniels.

title: The Disney Family Singalong: Volume II
description: Jason (Rafe Spall) and Nikki (Esther Smith) want to have children but are unable to in this British comedy written by Andy Wolton.

title: Feeding America Comedy Festival

title: I Know This Much Is True
description: Leslie Knope checks in with her friends while under self-isolating at home in this special episode that will raise money for Feeding America’s COVID-19 Response Fund.

title: Regular Heroes

title: The Eddy
description: First-generation Indian-American teenager Devi Vishwakumar (Maitreyi Ramakrishnan) deals with issues with high school and growing up in this series inspired by creator Mindy Kaling's childhood.

title: Solar Opposites

title: Jimmy O Yang: Good Deal
description: Jacob (Jaeden Martell), the 14-year-old son of assistant district attorney Andy Barber (Chris Evans), is accused of murder in this limited series thriller based on the novel of the same name by William Landay.

title: Celebrity Watch Party
description: Robin Roberts hosts this one-hour special that features stories with baby wild animals and their threatened environments around the world.

title: Robbie
description: The British crime drama created by Gareth Evans begins with the assassination of crime lord Finn Wallace (Colm Meaney), which creates a power vacuum. His son, Sean Wallace (Joe Cole), seeks to take over with the help of Ed Dumani (Lucian Msamati), but the Albanian Mafia, the Kurds, the Pakistanis, and Welsh travellers all see an opening ...

title: Jerry Seinfeld: 23 Hours to Kill
description: Bob the Drag Queen, Eureka O'Hara and Shangela Laquifa Wadley travel to small towns to select and teach participants to perform at an one-night only drag show.

title: Tirdy Works
description: Set in 1938 Los Angeles, detective Tiago Vega (Daniel Zovatto) and his partner Lewis Michener (Nathan Lane) investigate a shocking murder and soon find themselves facing strange and powerful forces like Magda (Natalie Dormer) in this next (but unrelated) chapter of John Logan's Penny Dreadful.

title: Natalie Wood: What Remains Behind
description: The 3-D reboot of the anime series is set in 2045 with ex-members of Japan's Section 9 including Major Motoko Kusanagi deal with a new threat: post humans.

title: Camp Getaway
description: Narrated by Sandra Oh, the documentary filmed by Caitlin and Mark Starowicz is about the work of Jane Goodall, Dian Fossey and Biruté Galdikas.

description: Gobo, Red, Boober, Mokey, Wembley and Uncle Traveling Matt are back together again with the help of Doozertubes in the mini-episodes filmed from the homes of the creatives on iPhones.

title: Betty
description: Three of Thomas Middleditch and Ben Schwartz's stage improv shows in New York were filmed for Netflix.

title: Hollywood
description: Hosted by Kelis and Leather Storrs, the latest cooking show that involves cannabis for Netflix (in 2018 it had Cooking On High) features contestants creating CBD-infused dishes for a chance to win $10,000.

title: Upload
description: Podcaster Clancy is forced to leave his home to interview beings in other worlds after his multiverse simulator malfunctions in this adult animated series co-created by Pendleton Ward and Duncan Trussell.

title: Trying
description: The 10-part documentary series directed by Jason Hehir about Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls' 1997-98 championship season includes interviews and never-before-seen footage.

title: Into the Night
description: The World Health Organization (WHO) and Global Citizen special celebrating health workers is hosted by Jimmy Kimmel, Jimmy Fallon and Stephen Colbert features appearances from such artists as Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong, David Beckham, Andrea Bocelli, Billie Eilish, Idris and Sabrina Elba, Elton John, John Legend, Lizzo, Chris Mart...

title: A Parks and Recreation Special
description: The documentary series looks at innovative homes and the people who designed and built them.

title: Normal People
description: The talk show hosted by Jeffrey Dean Morgan and Hilarie Burton Morgan at their upstate New York farm will include video chats from Walking Dead alums Sarah Wayne Callies, Christian Serratos, as well as actor-director Mark Duplass, and Supernatural's Jensen and Danneel Ackles.

title: Never Have I Ever
description: 10 single contestants ensconced at a luxury resort must refrain from any intimate contact - each infraction results in a cut into the the $100,000 prize on the reality dating series.

title: RuPaul’s Secret Celebrity Drag Race
description: The family comedy loosely based on the life of creator Kenya Barris, with Barris playing a fictionalized version of himself and Rashida Jones as his wife Joya, who raise six children together.

title: Defending Jacob
description: Christina Aguilera, Michael Bublé, Kristin Chenoweth, Darren Criss, Luke Evans, Elle Fanning, Josh Gad, Ariana Grande, Josh Groban, the High School Musical cast, Tori Kelly, Little Big Town, Demi Lovato, Alan Menken, Donny Osmond, Thomas Rhett, Marcus Scribner, and John Stamos are just some of the artists set to sing Disney songs from ho...

title: Born Wild: The Next Generation
description: A teenaged Cleopatra (voiced by Lilimar Hernandez) finds herself 30,000 years into the future on a planet ruled by cats. She attends high school and learns skills to fight bad guys in this animated series based on a graphic novel by Mike Maihack.

title: Gangs of London
description: The documentary series from Liz Garbus, Alex Gibney, and Roger Ross Williams focuses on eight cases from The Innocence Project.

title: We're Here
description: The documentary series from Liz Garbus, Alex Gibney, and Roger Ross Williams focuses on eight cases from The Innocence Project.

title: Penny Dreadful: City Of Angels
description: John B (Chase Stokes) and his friends search for his missing father and the treasure he was searching for off the Outer Banks of North Carolina in this teen drama created by Jonas Pate, Josh Pate, and Shannon Burke.

title: Ghost in the Shell: SAC_2045
description: Phyllis Schlafly (Cate Blanchett) seeks to stop the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment championed by feminists such as Gloria Steinem (Rose Byrne), Betty Friedan (Tracy Ullman), Shirley Chisholm (Uzo Aduba), Bella Abzug (Margo Martindale) and Jill Ruckelshaus (Elizabeth Banks) in the limited series created and written by Dahvi Wa...

title: She Walks With Apes
description: The third comedy special for comedian Chris D'Elia was filmed at Minneapolis' State Theater.

title: Fraggle Rock: Rock On!
description: The spin-off of ABC's dating reality show The Bachelor features 20 singles with music backgrounds going on dates and being tested with challenges that include singing live in front of music professionals.

title: Let's Go Crazy: The Grammy Salute to Prince
description: Miami baker Daniel Garcia's (Victor Rasuk) life is changed after he meets model-turned-fashion mogul Noa Hamilton (Nathalie Kelley) in this romantic comedy based on an Israeli series.

title: Middleditch & Schwartz
description: Celebrities including Michael Buble, Viola Davis, Melissa McCarthy, Brad Pitt, Jeremy Renner, and Rebel Wilson surprise people who helped or influenced their career and lives with home renovations with the help of Drew and Jonathan Scott.

title: Cooked with Cannabis
description: Julien Baptiste (Tchéky Karyo) is helps the Dutch police investigation into a missing sex worker in Amsterdam in this spinoff of The Missing.

title: The Midnight Gospel

title: The Last Dance
description: Ruby Richardson (Merritt Wever) decides to leave her dull life to travel across America with her old college boyfriend Billy (Domhnall Gleeson) after receiving a text message from him to fulfill a pact they made 17 years ago in this romantic comedy thriller written by Vicky Jones.

title: One World: Together at Home
description: The TV movie recounts the story of the Staple sisters (Christina Bell, Kierra Sheard, Sheléa Frazier, Raven Goodwin, and Angela Birchett) rise in the Gospel music industry.

title: Home (2020)
description: Estranged brothers Wilhelm (Alan Aisenberg) and Adam Rodman (Mike Castle) are forced to run a brewery together in this comedy from Greg and Jeff Schaffer.

title: Friday Night In with The Morgans
description: The documentary series narrated by Samuel L. Jackson follows former NBA player Shaquille O'Neal as he works on a film, shoots commercials, go on an international DJ tour, runs his restaurant, does speaking engagements and spending time with is family.

title: Too Hot to Handle
description: Jimmy Kimmel hosts this special primetime season of the game show featuring celebrity contestants playing for charity including Will Forte, Eric Stonestreet and Nikki Glaser.

title: #blackAF
description: The animated comedy series from the creators of Our Cartoon President features mocking daily news segments and interviews with real people including Dan Abrams, Alan Dershowitz, Thomas Friedman, Nicholas Kristof, Rep. Barbara Lee, Olivia Nuzzi, Rep. Donna Shalala and Rep. Eric Swalwell.

title: The Disney Family Singalong
description: Former WWE wrestler the Big Show (playing a fictional version of himself) finds himself outmanned when his oldest daughter comes to live with him, his second wife and their two younger daughters in this comedy written by Jason Berger and Josh Bycel.

title: Cleopatra in Space
description: The documentary features Kim Kardashian West as she talks to inmates, lawyers and officials about criminal justice reform.

title: The Innocence Files
description: The five-part documentary series looks into the cases of kidnapping and murder of at least 30 African-American children, aged 7 to 17, in Atlanta between 1979 and 1981 that were recently reopened by the Atlanta Police Department in 2019 (and dramatized in the second season of Netflix's Mindhunter).

title: The Innocence Files
description: Set during World War II, the drama written by Peter Bowker follows the lives of British Army translator Harry Chase (Jonah Hauer-King); his Polish lover Kasia (Zofia Wichłacz;, Lois (Julia Brown), his girlfriend in Manchester; American journalist Nancy Campbell (Helen Hunt); American surgeon Webster O’Connor (Brian J. Smith) and his love...

title: Outer Banks
description: A group of children rescued from Nazi concentration camps were brought to the Calgarth Estate by Lake Windermere in August 1945 to recuperate with the help of child psychologist Oscar Friedmann (Thomas Kretschmann), art therapist Marie Paneth (Romola Garai), philanthropist Leonard Montefiore (Tim McInnerny) and sports coach Jock Lawrence...

title: Mrs. America
description: Pregnant mommy blogger Meghan (Jessica de Gouw) and pregnant supermarket worker Agatha (Laura Carmichael) both have secrets in this six-part Australian thriller based on a novel by Michael Robotham. [Premiered originally on Australia's Network 10 on 16 Jun 2020, aired in the US on Sundance Now on 16 Jul 2020 and on AMC on 19 Apr 2021]

title: Chris D'Elia: No Pain
description: A young investigative reporter (Brooklyn Prince) moves to her father's (Jim Sturgess) hometown from Brooklyn where she discovers the truth behind a cold case everyone else wanted buried forever in this mystery series inspired by real-life pre-teen investigative journalist Hilde Lysiak.

title: The Bachelor: Listen to Your Heart
description: The sci-fi series based on the art book by Simon Stålenhag focuses on the people who live in a town above The Loop, a machine built by by a group led by Russ (Jonathan Pryce), that allows the impossible to be possible.

title: The Baker and the Beauty
