title: Celebrity IOU
description: The documentary series directed and written by Jay Cheel looks at the problems behind the making of such films as Poltergeist, The Exorcist, The Omen, The Crow, and Twilight Zone: The Movie.

title: Baptiste
description: The sketch comedy from actress/comedian Iliza Shlesinger includes skits where she plays a newlywed, a daytime talk show co-host, an infomercial spokeswoman and a reality show narrator.

title: Belgravia
description: The four-part docuseries directed by Erin Lee Carr looks into the cases against two Massachusetts drug lab chemists Sonja Farak and Annie Dookhan, who used and stole drugs from evidence she was suppose to test or faked test results.

title: Run (2020)
description: Pat Kondelis' documentary centers on Christian Dawkins, who became the focus of the FBI's two-year investigation into a much larger college basketball corruption scandal that included Adidas executives and assistant coaches.

title: The Clark Sisters: First Ladies of Gospel
description: A comedy about three housewives (Sandy Honig, Mitra Jouhari and Alyssa Stonoha) who are all named Debra.

title: Brews Brothers
description: Slacker Tim (Tim Heidecker) moves in with his best friend Eric (Eric Warheim), Eric's wife (Jamie-Lynn Sigler) and three others (Ron Austar, Tennessee Winston Luke, and Ben Hur) in the sitcom from Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim.

title: Shaq Life
description: The Henry Danger spin-off series follows Captain Man (Cooper Barnes) and Schwoz (Michael D. Cohen) as they train four new young superheroes.

title: Who Wants to be a Millionaire? (2020)
description: Set just as the US-led Coalition takes over Baghdad, ex-Iraqi policeman Muhsin al-Khafaji (Waleed Zuaiter) searches for his estranged eldest daughter Sawsan (Leem Lubany) in this series written by Stephen Butchard and based on the novel of the same name by Elliott Colla.

title: Stephen Colbert Presents Tooning Out the News
description: Elida (Adriyan Rae) is hiding from the Republic government, including Commander Lazaro (Paul du Toit), who wish to kill her. Her friend Isaac (Tim Rozon) arrives with news her mother is still alive. They set out to rescue her mother with the help of Amae (Alex McGregor) in this adaptation from Jem Garrard of the comic book series.

title: The Big Show Show
description: The cooking competition series hosted by features families competing to cook Disney-inspired dishes for a chance to have their dish featured at Disney World.

title: Kim Kardashian West: The Justice Project
description: Prime Video gets into the fashion designing reality competitive show arena with a series hosted by Tim Gunn and Heidi Klum with judging by Joseph Altuzarra, Naomi Campbell, Chiara Ferragni, Nicole Richie, and Carine Roitfeld.

title: Atlanta's Missing and Murdered: The Lost Children
description: Finnish hacker and election security expert Harri Hursti shows how easy it can be to hack (or even buy) the technology used in the U.S. voting systems in this documentary from directors Simon Ardizzone, Russell Michaels and Sarah Teale.

title: World On Fire
description: The four-part drama inspired by Deborah Feldman's memoir, Esther "Esty" Shapiro (Shira Haas) flees her Hasidic Brooklyn home for Berlin, while her husband Yanky (Amit Rahav) and his cousin Moische (Jeff Wilbusch) seek to bring her back.

title: The Windermere Children
description: After being diagnosed with a terminal illness, Scott Perry (Tom Everett Scott) and his wife Robin (Sarah Wayne Callies) asked his best friend Anthony Lavelle (Clive Standen); his AA sponsor, Larry Mills (Michael O’Neill); and Dr. Oliver Post (J. August Richards), his surgeon and wife's best friend, to be the father figures for their kids...

title: The Secrets She Keeps
description: Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis) frees Shirin Abbas (Izabella Yena) from a Jerusalem prison and while looking into the disappearance of Shirin's family, discovers a larger mystery of priceless jewels, curses and secrets in this feature-length adventure.

title: Home Before Dark
description: Jamie Oliver's latest cooking show features lockdown-ready recipes created with pantry staples or leftovers.

title: Tales From the Loop
description: Set in 1880s Vienna, young Sigmund Freud (Robert Finster) is joined by psychic medium Fleur Salomé (Ella Rumpf) and policeman Alfred Kiss (Georg Friedrich) in his investigation into multiple murders in this Austrian thriller series.

title: Broke
description: Arthur Kinnaird (Edward Holcroft) and Fergus Suter (Kevin Guthrie) are the two men who help bring football (soccer) to the general public in 1870s England in the six-part Julian Fellowes' drama.

title: Cursed Films
description: Eric Goode and Rebecca Chaiklin's documentary series about Joe Exotic, self-proclaimed Tiger King, who ran a zoo in Oklahoma and plotted to kill animal activist Carole Baskin also reveals the dark underbelly of breeding and selling big exotic cats.

title: The Iliza Shlesinger Sketch Show
description: Octavia Spencer stars as Madam C.J. Walker, the first self-made African-American woman millionaire in this four-part limited series based on Walker's great-great-grandaughter's book On Her Own Ground.

title: How to Fix a Drug Scandal
description: Teenage squire Tiuri (Amir Wilson) and his friends travels across several kingdoms to deliver a secret letter to the King in this fantasy series based on the Dutch novel by Tonke Dragt.

title: The Scheme
description: The anime spin-off of Altered Carbon finds Takeshi Kovacs (voiced by Tatsuhisa Suzuki) in a new sleeve to help look into the murder of the brother of a yakazu boss.

title: Three Busy Debras
description: Ruth (Melissa L. Williams) takes her daughter with her to join a religious cult in this spin-off of Tyler Perry’s The Oval.

title: Beef House
description: Canadian comedian Mae (Mae Martin) juggles living in London, dealing with her parents (Adrian Lukis and Lisa Kudrow), her recovery from addiction and falling for heterosexual girl named George (Charlotte Ritchie).

title: Danger Force
description: In an alternative America where witches avoided the witch trials by agreeing to cooperate with the government, three young witches: Raelle (Taylor Hickson), Tally (Jessica Sutton) and Abigail (Ashley Nicole Williams) undergo combat magic training and fight a dangerous foe in this drama series created by Eliot Laurence.

title: Baghdad Central
description: The seemingly perfect life of The Richardsons (Reese Witherspoon and Joshua Jackson) is turned upside down by Mia Warren (Kerry Washington) and her daughter in the adaptation of Celeste Ng novel of the same name.

title: Vagrant Queen
description: The three-part documentary series hosted by historian Niall Ferguson and based on his book, "The Square and the Tower: Networks and Power, from the Freemasons to Facebook," looks into the history of social networks beginning with the invention of the printing press to the World Wide Web and the ways nations and terrorists are using socia...

title: Be Our Chef
description: The six-part miniseries based on novel of the same name by Philip Roth is set in an alternate universe where a President Charles Lindbergh favors anti-Semitism and fascism is experienced by a working-class Jewish-American family (Zoe Kazan, Morgan Spector and Winona Ryder).

title: Making the Cut
description: Mark Easterbrook (Rufus Sewell) looks into why his name was on a list found in a dead woman's shoe in Sarah Phelps' latest Agatha Christie adaptation.

title: Kill Chain: The Cyber War on America's Elections
description: The Japanese anime based on the manga is set at a boarding school where wolf Legoshi (voiced by Jonah Scott), dwarf rabbit Haru (voice by Lara Jill Miller), red deer Louis (voiced by Griffin Puatu) deal not only with school and love, but their own nature (carnivore vs. herbivore).

title: Unorthodox
description: Hosted by Justine Marino and Heidi Heasle, comedians learn dance numbers and compete in dance-offs to win $10,000 for their charity of choice.

title: Council Of Dads
description: The interactive special where viewers help choose how Carmen (voiced by Gina Rodriguez) rescues Ivy (Abby Trot) and Zack (Michael Hawley) from V.I.L.E. in Shanghai.

title: Miss Fisher and the Crypt of Tears
description: The second comedy special from Marc Maron on Netflix was filmed at the REDCAT Roy and Edna Disney/CalArts Theater in Los Angeles in October 2019.

title: Jamie: Keep Cooking & Carry On
description: Airing on FOX and National Geographic, Neil deGrasse Tyson returns as host of the second installment of the reboot of Carl Sagan's 80s series.

title: Freud
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Nanette Burstein about the former First Lady and Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton features interviews as well as behind the scenes footage from her 2016 campaign for President.

title: The English Game
description: The eight-part series adapted from Roberto Saviano's book of the same name looks into the international cocaine trade.

title: Tiger King
description: The reboot of the 1985 Steven Spielberg anthology series with the first season featuring episodes directed by Michael Dinner, Susanna Fogel, Chris Long, Mark Mylod, and Sylvain White.

title: Self Made: Inspired by the Life of Madam C.J. Walker
description: The four-part documentary series looks at Gary Stewart's search for his biological father and the evidence that reveal the man was the Zodiac Killer.

title: The Letter for the King
description: Lily Chan (Sonoya Mizuno), a young computer engineer, thinks a division of the San Francisco tech company she works for may be behind the disappearance of her boyfriend in this miniseries from Alex Garland. [FX on Hulu]

title: Altered Carbon: Resleeved
description: Aspiring writer/PA Hattie (Jonica "JoJo" T. Gibbs), film executive Marie (Christina Elmore) and ex-child-star-turned-yoga-instructor Nia (Gabrielle Graham) balance work, love and friendship in Los Angeles in the comedy series from Lena Waithe.

title: Tyler Perry's Ruthless
description: 20-year-old Dave (Dave Burd) seeks to convince everyone he is the all-time best rapper in this comedy series based on the life of rapper-comedian Dave Burd (aka Lil Dicky).

title: Feel Good (2020)
description: Paul (Martin Freeman) and Ally (Daisy Haggard) are raising their two children when Ally’s father (Michael McKean) shows up in this comedy co-created by Freeman, Chris Addison, and Simon Blackwell.

title: Motherland: Fort Salem
description: The Wilson family's lives are turned upside down by the arrival of their nephew Young Dylan (Dylan Gilmer), who is an up-and-coming hip-hop star in this comedy from Tyler Perry.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
description: Each week a group of experts will judge the unique pieces three teams of young builders design, build and test in the competitive reality show hosted by Justin Long.

title: Niall Ferguson's Networld
description: Queen Sono (Pearl Thusi), a spy with the secret Special Operations Group (SOG) looks into the assassination of her mother, a revolutionary leader, in this South African spy thriller created by Kagiso Lediga.

title: The Plot Against America
description: Struggling actress Natsume's (Elaiza Ikeda) life is changed after a photographer (Miki Nakatani) posts a picture of her on Instagram in this Japanese drama directed by Mika Ninagawa.

title: The Pale Horse
description: The Full Frontal with Samantha Bee correspondent seeks to help real people with personal issues like anxiety, body image, monogamy and revenge.

title: Beastars
description: The six-part documentary series from Brian Knappenberger looks into the case of an 8-year-old killed by his parents in 2013 and the cracks in the child protective services system that failed to protect him.

title: The Funny Dance Show
description: The six-part documentary series from Brian Knappenberger looks into the case of an 8-year-old killed by his parents in 2013 and the cracks in the child protective services system that failed to protect him.

title: Carmen Sandiego: To Steal or Not to Steal
description: The stand-up special from the Saturday Night Live cast member was recorded at New York's Gramercy Theater.

title: Marc Maron: End Times Fun
description: The six-part documentary series filmed over three years follows 15 infants during their first year.

title: Cosmos: Possible Worlds
description: Three Mexican-American cousins (Karrie Martin, JJ Soria, and Carlos Santos) struggle for the American Dream as their grandfather's (Joaquin Cosio) taco business is threatened by gentrification in this dramedy from Marvin Lemus and Linda Yvette Chávez.

title: Hillary
description: Set in 1977, Jonah Heidelbaum (Logan Lerman) seeks out the killer of his grandmother and finds himself involved with Meyer Offerman's (Al Pacino) group of Nazi hunters in New York City in this drama series created by David Weil and executive produced by Jordan Peele.

title: ZeroZeroZero
description: Hard-living Victorian detective Inspector Rabbit (Matt Berry) reluctantly investigates murders with a new straight-laced partner (Freddie Fox) and the adopted daughter (Susan Wokoma) of the chief of police in the British comedy written by Andy Riley and Kevin Cecil.

title: Amazing Stories (2020)
description: The Sean Evans-hosted YouTube talk show adds a game show spin-off for TruTV, teams of two compete by answering questions while eating hot wings (that get progressively more spicy) for a chance to win $25,000.

title: The Most Dangerous Animal of All
description: Jeff Daniels narrates the three-night, six-hour documentary miniseries about George Washington which includes dramatic recreations and interviews with historians as well as former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Colin Powell.

title: Devs
description: The six-part documentary series is based on Leon Neyfakh's podcast of the same name and features a look into Watergate and how it resonates in today's present political climate.

title: Twenties
description: Jesse Tyler Ferguson hosts the revival of the ABC home improvement reality show where families who give back to their communities are given a makeover of their home to be completed in a week.

title: Dave
description: The re-imagining of H.G. Wells' classic sci-fi story by Howard Overman follows survivors in present-day Europe after aliens attack Earth.

title: Breeders
description: The animated family comedy from Mike and Julie Scully focuses Duncan (voiced by Amy Poehler), a very average 15-year-old boy and high-strung his mother (also voiced by Amy Poehler).

title: Tyler Perry's Young Dylan
description: A few years ago, Sam (Jake Borelli) and Harry (Niko Terho) were high school enemies, but after a being forced to spend the night together, they find themselves falling for each other in this romantic comedy TV film written by Josh Senter and Peter Paige.

title: Shop Class
description: The documentary series narrated by Janet Mock, Margaret Cho, Asia Kate Dillon, Neil Patrick Harris and Lena Waithe features archival footage and new interviews to look at LGBTQ characters on television and the impact of the LGBTQ movement on the medium.

title: Queen Sono
description: In the near-future utopian colony of New Babyl, a group of teenagers are chosen to compete in the distinguished performing arts competition but the discovery of a secret archive of cultural artifacts makes them question everything they were told in the sci-fi musical drama from Joseph Mallozzi and R.T. Thorne.

title: Followers
description: Brooklyn record store owner (Zoe Kravitz) tries to get over her latest breakup in this second adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel of the same name.

title: It's Personal With Amy Hoggart
description: Nick and Vanessa Lachey hosts the reality dating series where 30 single men and women talk to each other over 10 days without seeing each other. After the 10 days, couples must decide they want to be engaged (and finally see each other as they prepare to get married in four weeks) or leave the show.

title: The Trials of Gabriel Fernandez
description: Top Gear's Richard Hammond travels the world to look at how some of the largest buildings and structures were built.

title: The Trials of Gabriel Fernandez
description: Each season of the anthology series from Ava DuVernay follows one couple's growing romantic relationship.

title: Pete Davidson: Alive From New York
description: Inmate Aaron Wallace (Nicholas Pinnock) passes the bar exam to become a lawyer to help represent other prisoners as he seeks to overturn his own conviction in this legal drama created by Hank Steinberg and inspired by executive producer Isaac Wright Jr.'s life.

title: Babies
description: The comedy special hosted by Mo'Nique and filmed at Atlanta's Variety Playhouse features comedy from Correy Bell, Just Nesh, Prince T-Dub, Donnell Rawlings, and Tone-X.

title: Gentefied
description: The comedy series executive produced By Rob McElhenney and Charlie Day follows a team of video game developers led by creative director Ian Grimm (Rob McElhenney) as they ready the launch of an expansion of its most popular multi-player game.

title: Hunters (2020)
description: After the murder of their father, the Locke siblings (Jackson Robert Scott, Connor Jessup and Emilia Jones) return to Keyhouse, the family home, where they discover mysterious keys that could be connected to their father's death in this drama based on graphic novels by Joe Hill and Gabriel Rodriguez.

title: Year of the Rabbit
description: NYPD officer Abigail "Tommy" Thomas (Edie Falco) is hired to become the first female Chief of Police for the LAPD in this drama from Paul Attanasio.

title: Hot Ones: The Game Show
description: The first season of the crime anthology series from Sam Esmail and Andy Greenwald features a story based on the Ross Thomas novel of the same name.

title: Washington
description: Detective David Russell (Peter Sarsgaard) arrests Eric Fisher (Kyle Gallner) is charged and convicted with brutally murdering his mother, but fights to prove he is innocent for the next 20 years in this based on a true story drama co-created by Anders Weidemann and John Mankiewicz.

title: Slow Burn
description: The Riverdale spin-off set in New York City and years after Riverdale the series follows aspiring fashion designer Katy Keene (Lucy Hale) and singer-songwriter Josie McCoy (Ashleigh Murray) as they pursue their dreams and meet socialite Pepper Smith (Julia Chan) and drag performer Ginger/Jorge Lopez (Jonny Beauchamp).

title: Extreme Makeover: Home Edition (2020)
description: Dave (Adam Pally) and Rebecca (Abby Elliott) think their lives will be more normal now that the kids are a little older, but the arrival of Dave's parents (Fran Drescher and Steven Weber), who come to stay with them after going into debt, changes everything in this comedy from Dan Levy.

title: War of the Worlds (2020)
description: Pharmacist Dan Schneider's search for who killed his 22-year-old son leads him to embark into another investigation into legal drug-dealing of opioid prescriptions by doctors in this four-part documentary series from Julia Willoughby Nason and Jenner Furst.

title: Duncanville
description: Based on the UK series of the same name, Will Arnett hosts the competitive reality series that features teams of two as they complete a series of Lego-building challenges to be named Lego Masters.

title: The Thing About Harry
description: The six-part documentary series looks into how a security auditor exploited the McDonald's Monopoly game for over a decade, stealing $24 million in cash and prizes.

title: Visible: Out on Television
description: Four people (André Benjamin, Sally Field, Jason Segel and Eve Lindley) discover a hidden puzzle that leads to a larger mystery in this anthology series created by Segel.

title: Utopia Falls
description: Magne (David Stakston) returns to his small rural Norwegian home town which suffers from natural disasters and soon becomes involved in trying to save it and the world from another Ragnarok in this coming-of-age drama.

title: High Fidelity
description: Adam Price's (Richard Armitage) happy life is changed when a stranger (Hannah John-Kamen) approaches him and tells him a secret about his wife (Dervla Kirwan) in the psychological thriller based on the Harlan Coben novel of the same name.

title: Love Is Blind
description: The nature documentary narrated by Samira Wiley features footage of animals at night, including bats, lions, primates, and creatures of the deep.

title: Richard Hammond's Big
description: Queer Eye's Tan France and British model Alexa Chung host the competitive reality series where 18 designers compete for a $250,000 prize and create a collection for Net-a-Porter.

title: Cherish the Day
description: Comedian Adam Conover hosts the Nickelodeon's version of the British game show of the same name where teams of families navigate thru a series of zones in a labyrinth maze.

title: For Life
description: The documentary series hosted by Gwyneth Paltrow and Goop Chief Content Officer Elise Loehnen talk about a variety of health and wellness topics with doctors, researchers and other health practitioners.

title: Mo'Nique & Friends: Live From Atlanta
description: Three of the four children of a New Jersey couple (Jason Biggs and Maggie Lawson) are geniuses in this comedy from Lon Zimmet.

title: Mythic Quest
description: Jean-Luc Picard (Patrick Stewart) leaves behind the Starfleet to begin a new life.

title: Locke & Key
description: 27-year-old Nora Lin (Awkwafina) seeks a grander life with help from her friends and her more accomplished cousin (Bowen Yang) while still living with her father (BD Wong) and grandmother (Lori Tan Chinn) in Queens.

title: Tommy (2020)
description: Hosted by Mia Kang, 10 contestants will live together, learn espionage skills from former agents and complete challenges for an opportunity to win $100,000 in the series inspired by the Station S, the World War II government program to train civilians as spies.

title: Briarpatch
description: Captain Ryan Clark (Hugh Laurie) and his crew must deal with its angry passengers when the cruise space ship experiences a variety of problems during their five-week voyage to Saturn in this comedy created and written by Armando Iannucci.

title: Interrogation
description: The spin-off of 9-1-1 focuses on a New York City firefighter (Rob Lowe) who moves to Austin with his son.

title: Katy Keene
description: The immigrant comedy anthology series includes stories inspired by real experiences written about in Epic Magazine.

title: Indebted
description: 12-year-old Cuban American Elena (Tess Romero) deals with everyday middle school issues as she also dreams of becoming president in the future.

title: The Pharmacist
description: Neurotic 25-year-old Nicholas (Josh Thomas) is forced to grow up when his father becomes deathly ill and becomes the legal guardian to his two teenaged half-sisters in this comedy from Josh Thomas.

title: LEGO Masters (2020)
description: The three-part documentary series directed by Geno McDermott looks into the life of New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez and how it may have contributed to his 2013 conviction for first-degree murder of his friend Odin Lloyd and eventual suicide in prison in 2017.

title: McMillions
description: Based on the Israeli television series Charlie Golf One, Army medics based in Afghanistan deal with both dangerous and more light-hearted moments while saving lives in this comedic drama produced by Brian Grazer and Ron Howard.

title: Dispatches from Elsewhere
description: The debut comedy special on Netflix for the Saturday Night Live alum was directed by Games of Thrones' David Benioff and D.B. Weiss.

title: Ragnarok (2020)
description: On a post-apocalyptic Earth, Kipo (voiced by Karen Fukuhara) searches for her father witht the help of fellow survivors Benson (voiced by Coy Stewart), Wolf (voiced by Sydney Mikayla), Dave (voiced by Deon Cole), and Mandu (voiced by Dee Bradley Baker) in this animated series created by Radford Sechrist.

title: The Stranger
description: The eight-episode sequel to The Young Pope adds Massimo Ghini, Henry Goodman, John Malkovich, Marilyn Manson, Sharon Stone, and Ulrich Thomsen.

title: Night on Earth
description: The adaptation of Stephen King's novel about the investigation into the murder of an 11-year-old boy in the Georgia woods by local police detective Ralph Anderson (Ben Mendelsohn) and Holly Gibney (Cynthia Erivo), a P.I. he brings in when he becomes unsure about the guilt of his prime suspect.

title: Next in Fashion
description: Charlotte Heywood (Rose Williams) ends up at the seaside village of Sanditon and meets Sidney Parker (Theo James) and Miss Lambe (Crystal Clarke), a West Indian heiress in this adaptation of Jane Austen's unfinished final novel by Andrew Davies.

title: Justin Bieber: Seasons
description: Two American doctors (Erinn Hayes and Rob Huebel) at a Brazilian pediatric hospital are tasked by the government to find the cure to a killer virus in this series from the creators of Childrens Hospital.

title: The Crystal Maze (2020)
description: The comedy series follows the adventures of a drag queen named Ruby Red (RuPaul Charles) and AJ (Izzy Gaspersz), the 11-year-old who stowawayed in Ruby's RV.

title: The Goop Lab with Gwyneth Paltrow
description: Tokyo Detective Kenzo Mori (Takehiro Hira) goes to London to search for his younger brother who may be linked to the death of a Yakuza boss in this BBC/Netflix co-production.

title: Outmatched
description: Dr. Tom Kendrick (David Tennant) is the prime suspect behind the house fire that killed his wife and three children in this crime drama Created by writer Daisy Coulam.

title: Star Trek: Picard
description: The documentary series follows the competitive cheerleading team at Texas's Navarro College as they go for another national title with their coach Monica Aldama.

title: Awkwafina Is Nora From Queens
description: Jeopardy's top winners James Holzhauer, Ken Jennings, and Brad Rutter compete in a special multi-day tournament.

title: Spy Games
description: San Francisco computer coder Zoey Clarke (Jane Levy) suddenly begins to hear people's inner thoughts and feelings through songs she can only hear and see.

title: Avenue 5
description: The Fugitive Task Force led by Jess LaCroix (Julian McMahon) and his team that includes Agent Isobel Castile (Alana de la Garza), Agent Lynn Khanna (Keisha Castle-Hughes), Agent Crosby (Kellan Lutz), Agent Sheryll Barnes (Roxy Sternberg), and Agent Clinton Skye (Nathaniel Arcand) search for those on the FBI's Most Wanted list in this spi...

title: 9-1-1: Lone Star
description: Mark Gatiss and Steven Moffat's version of Dracula (Claes Bang) is set in 1897 as the count sets out for new victims in Victorian London.

title: Little America
description: Deputy Bill Hollister (Stephen Dorff) is the new acting sheriff after the death of the Los Angeles County Sheriff in this drama from David Ayer and Will Beall.

title: Diary of a Future President
description: Detectives Molly McGee (Emma Booth) and Alex O’Connell (Ewen Leslie) investigation into the death of a woman leads to clues to other homicides, corruption and the occult in this supernatural thriller written and created by Victoria Madden.

title: Everything's Gonna Be Okay
description: Frances Cairnes (Cush Jumbo) seeks out the person who killed her son in an hit and run after the police fail to find the culprit in this drama series based on the Nicholas Blake/Cecil Day-Lewis novel of the same name. [Premiered originally in the UK on Britbox on 27 May 2021; in the US on AMC+ on 5 Jul 2021 and on AMC on 12 Jul 2021]

title: Killer Inside: The Mind of Aaron Hernandez
description: The reboot of the 1990s Fox drama finds the five Acosta siblings trying to stay together after their parents are deported to Mexico.

title: 68 Whiskey
description: The US version of the British reality show of the same name where contestants seek to be the most liked person on the a social media platform called The Circle, which they also use to communicate via a voice activated screen in their designated living space.

title: Leslie Jones: Time Machine
description: CIA's Eva Geller (Michelle Monaghan) is called in to help with the case of a street preacher the people call Al-Masih (Al-Masih), who seemingly disappears and appears elsewhere.

title: Kipo and the Age of Wonderbeasts
description: Former NYPD forensic criminologist Lincoln Rhyme (Russell Hornsby) was forced to retire when a serial killer left him paralyzed. He is drawn back and paired with detective Amelia Sachs (Arielle Kebbel) when it appears the killer has begun killing again in this series based on Jeffery Deaver's novel The Bone Collector.

title: The New Pope
description: Kat Baker (Kaya Scodelario) nearly quits figure skating after a fall takes her out of contention for the Olympics, but finds another opportunity as a pair skater with talented, but hard-partying Justin Davis (Evan Roderick) in this drama created by Samantha Stratton.

title: The Outsider (2020)
description: The competitive reality show hosted by Phil Keoghan sees 12 contestants tested by challenges that take place in real world job locations such as farms, construction sites and railroad tracks.

title: Sanditon
description: 16-year-old Frank Hardy (Rohan Campbell) and his 12-year-old brother Joe (Alexander Elliot) move to their parent's hometown of Bridgeport. When their detective father Fenton (James Tupper) begins investigating a case close to him, the boys decide to start looking into things themselves in the series based on the popular children's myster...

title: Medical Police
description: Jenna Dewan hosts the dating reality show where contestants learn a dance routine and select a potential life partner after dancing with them in the series based on the British show of the same name.

title: AJ and the Queen
description: The six-part documentary series features a look at the day-to-day life of the comedian/actor.

title: Giri / Haji
description: The musical comedy special from John Mulaney with a group of 15 kids aged between 8 and 13-years-old are joined by Annaleigh Ashford, David Byrne, Jake Gyllenhaal, Richard Kind, Natasha Lyonne, Shereen Pimentel, and Andre De Shields.

title: Deadwater Fell
description: Monster hunter Geralt of Rivia (Henry Cavill), sorceress Yennefer (Anya Cholatra), and Princess Ciri (Freya Allan) must learn to work together to survive as they journey through the Continent in the fantasy series based on the Polish book series by Andrzej Sapkowski.

title: Cheer (2020)
description: Originally planned as a miniseries, the now three-hour TV movie is a new version of the Dickens classic written by Steven Knight with Guy Pearce as Ebenezer Scrooge.

title: Jeopardy: The Greatest of All Time
description: The friendship between Addy Hanlon and Beth Cassidy (Herizen Guardiola and Marlo Kelly) is tested with the arrival of new cheerleading coach Colette French (Willa Fitzgerald) in the drama based on Megan Abbott’s novel of the same name.

title: Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist
description: Normal Lear and Jimmy Kimmel are back with new live TV stagings of a classic episode from All in the Family and Good Times.

title: FBI: Most Wanted
description: Homicide detective William Wisting (Sven Nordin) searches for an American serial killer in Norway with the help of FBI agents Maggie Griffin (Carrie-Anne Moss) and John Bantham (Richie Campbell) in this Norwegian crime drama based on the novels by Jørn Lier Horst.

title: Dracula (2020)
description: Songwriter/single father Sam (Paul James) and aspiring artist Nellie (Callie Hernandez) struggle with living in Los Angeles and finding love in the musical drama series from Josh Safran.

title: Deputy
description: The first stand-up special on Netflix for the former Daily Show contributor/writer includes topics such as hosting the White House Correspondents' Association Dinner, abortion, childbirth, feminism, and Instagram.

title: The Gloaming
description: The three-night special hosted by Ellen DeGeneres will feature celebrities such as Jennifer Aniston, Robert Downey Jr., Melissa McCarthy, Jason Momoa, and Justin Timberlake helping give gifts to deserving people.

title: The Beast Must Die
description: Life was not going well for Abby (Abby McEnany), but her life is changed when she starts dating a younger trans-man (Theo Germain) in this comedy created by McEnany and Tim Mason.

title: Party of Five (2020)
description: PR exec Dani Nùñez (Arienne Mandi), adjunct professor Micah Lee (Leo Sheng), assistant Sarah Finley (Jacqueline Toboni), and TV producer Sophie Suarez (Rosanny Zayas) interact with Bette Porter (Jennifer Beals), Alice Pieszecki (Leisha Hailey) and Shane McCutcheon (Katherine Moennig) in this sequel to the 2004-09 drama The L Word.

title: The Circle
description: Most of the Broadway cast of The SpongeBob Musical returns for a live production filmed in front of a live audience and set to air simultaneously on Nickelodeon, TeenNick and Nicktoons.

title: Messiah (2020)
description: The sketch comedy series features members of the New York-based improv comedy troupe who were part of the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre.

title: Lincoln Rhyme: Hunt for the Bone Collector
description: Robert Kenner and Taki Oldham's five-part docuseries looks into the case of Henry Lee Lucas, who claimed he killed hundreds of women across the country in the 1980s, but later revealed many confessions were aided by information given to him by corrupted law enforcement.

title: Spinning Out
description: Katherine Harlow (Abigail Spencer), now going by the name Doris, seeks vengeance against her brother (Rory Cochrane) and the gang who left her for dead when her niece is kidnapped by the same gang in this series created by Josh Corbin.

title: Tough as Nails (2020)
description: New evidence causes true crime podcast host Poppy Parnell (Octavia Spencer) to take another look into the conviction of Warren Cave (Aaron Paul), whose case made her famous in this drama based on Kathleen Barber's true-crime novel Are You Sleeping from Justified writer Nichelle Tramble Spellman.

title: The Hardy Boys (2020)
description: Nurse practitioner, Melinda "Mel" Monroe (Alexandra Breckinridge) moves from LA to the small northern California town of Virgin River for a new start.

title: Flirty Dancing
description: Dr. Luther Swann (Ian Somerhalder) finds himself at odds with his best friend (Adrian Holmes), who has been turned into a vampire in this adaptation of Jonathan Maberry and nd Alan Robinson's vampire comics.

title: Kevin Hart: Don't F**k This Up
description: Contestants are tested in challenges that mimic the skills bears use and some that actually involve one of the three rescued grizzlies in this competitive reality show filmed at the Utah bear sanctuary.

title: John Mulaney & The Sack Lunch Bunch
description: Sean Sr. and Ann Moody (Denis Leary and Elizabeth Perkins) welcome their three adult children (Francois Arnaud, Jay Baruchel and Chelsea Frei) home for the holidays in this comedy series based on the Australian series of the same name.

title: The Witcher
description: The comedy special for the comedian/actress was released on her 40th birthday and includes discussion of her newly found Jewish roots, her rise to fame and being a woman.

title: A Christmas Carol (2019)
description: The documentary series features a look into a workday of a variety of employees at Disney's many divisions, including ABC, Disney Cruise Line, Disneyland Resorts, Lucasfilm, Radio Disney, Walt Disney Imagineering, and Walt Disney Studios.

title: Dare Me
description: Lucky Flynn (Tim Minchin) and Meg (Milly Alcock), a teenager he meets along the way, travels 4,000km across Australia to see his dying mother in this comedy drama co-written by Minchin and creator Chris Taylor.

title: Live in Front of a Studio Audience: ‘All in the Family’ and ‘Good Times’
description: The animated comedy series follows Harley Quinn (voiced by Kaley Cuoco) after her break up with the Joker as she looks to become the "Queenpin" of Gotham and join the Legion of Doom with the help from Poison Ivy (voiced by Lake Bell).

title: Wisting
description: Dorothy (Lauren Ambrose) and Sean Turner (Toby Kebbell) hire a nanny (Nell Tiger Free) to help care for a lifelike baby doll after the loss of their own child in the M. Night Shyamalan thriller.

title: Soundtrack
description: Don Quinn (Dennis Quaid) meets his daughter's new boyfriend over Christmas in the comedy created by Tucker Cawley.

title: Michelle Wolf: Joke Show
description: Filmed over four years, the four-part documentary from Lynn Novick looks into the New York state prison system's college program that allows 300 inmates an opportunity to earn a degree and take classes taught by teachers from Bard College.

title: Ellen's Greatest Night of Giveaways
description: The anthology series based on Dolly Parton's songs features a cast that includes Ginnifer Goodwin, Julianne Hough, Melissa Leo, Camryn Manheim, Dallas Roberts, Sarah Shahi, Kathleen Turner, and Bellamy Young.

title: Work in Progress
description: Jules (Kat Dennings) has just been dumped and has to rebuild her relationships with her friends in this comedy created by writer Jordan Weiss.

title: The L Word: Generation Q
description: Airing simultaneously on AMC and SundanceTV over three nights, the five-part documentary miniseries looks at the 1968 murder of Jennifer Levin in Central Park by Robert Chambers.

title: The SpongeBob Musical: Live on Stage!
description: The 2017 special hosted by Kristen Bell returns as a reality series where the casts of several high school musicals are brought together to reprise their roles in performances at their school many years later.

title: Astronomy Club: The Sketch Show
description: The Toy Story 4 spork character voiced by Tony Hale is at the center of a collection of short films.

title: The Confession Killer
description: Each episode highlights an inspiring young person who have made a difference in their communities and how a comic book of their story was created.

title: Reprisal
description: The documentary series follows actor Jeff Goldblum as he looks into a variety of things that interest him including denim, ice cream, Korean barbecue, sneakers, and tattoos.

title: Truth Be Told (2019)
description: Auditioning is just the beginning of the real-life drama encountered by the students at East High School as the drama club prepares to stage a production of High School Musical in this series based on the trilogy of TV movies of the same name that aired on the Disney Channel.

title: Virgin River
description: The Mandalorian (Pedro Pascal) travels the galaxy, out of reach of the New Republic after the fall of the Empire in Disney+'s first Star Wars live-action series.

title: V Wars
description: The six-part documentary series narrated by Angela Bassett looks at the history of the Imagineers and includes behind-the-scenes footage of the Disney Parks from around the world.

title: Man Vs. Bear
description: Detectives Rob Reilly (Killian Scott) and Cassie Maddox (Sarah Greene) investigate two seemingly unrelated murders in this adaptation of Tana French's Dublin Murder Squad series of novels by Sarah Phelps.

title: The Moodys
description: The BBC comedy series written by Daisy Haggard and Laura Solon finds Miri Matteson (Daisy Haggard) returning to her hometown after 18 years in prison and trying to start over again.

title: Tiffany Haddish: Black Mitzvah
description: A girl named Kit (voiced by Kitana Turnbull) receives a rocket-powered jet pack and learns she's to become the next Rocketeer in this animated series inspired by the Dave Stevens’ comic book series and the 1991 movie of the same name.

title: One Day at Disney
description: Wildlife rescuer Sam I Am (Adam Devine) and inventor Guy I Am (Michael Douglas) are brought together by chance to return a rare animal to its home in the animated adaptation of the Dr. Seuss book "Green Eggs and Ham."

title: Upright
description: ABC's live musical adaptation of The Little Mermaid will feature Auli'i Cravalho as Ariel, Queen Latifah as Ursula and Shaggy as Sebastian.

title: Harley Quinn
description: The comedy special for the Late Night host was filmed at Pantages Theater in Minneapolis.

title: Servant
description: The adaptation of Philip Pullman's fantasy trilogy from the BBC and HBO follows Lyra (Dafne Keen) as she searches for her kidnapped friend, makes new friends and discovers secrets people want kept hidden.

title: Merry Happy Whatever
description: The documentary series about John Demjanjuk, a Cleveland grandfather accused of being the Nazi concentration camp guard known as "Ivan the Terrible."

title: College Behind Bars
description: Every two months, Oprah Winfrey interviews authors of books she selects as a part of the her book club featured in the Apple Books app.

title: Dolly Parton's Heartstrings
description: With the help of Ghostwriter, four kids (Amadi Chapata, Justin Sanchez, Isaac Arellanes, and Hannah Levinson) from the neighborhood help put fictional characters released by a haunted bookstore back into the books they came from in this reboot of 1990 PBS children's show.

title: Dollface
description: Cody and the Helpsters monsters solve problems in the pre-school series from the Sesame Workshop.

title: The Preppy Murder: Death in Central Park
description: A field trip to NASA for Charlie Brown and the Peanuts crew helps Snoopy realize his dreams to be an astronaut.

title: Encore!
description: The coming-of-age comedy set in the 1850s from Alena Smith about poet Emily Dickinson (Hailee Steinfeld) includes modern music and takes artistic license on aspects of her life.

title: Forky Asks a Question
description: In a post-apocalyptic world where humans have lost the ability of sight, warrior Baba Voss (Jason Momoa) seeks to protect his newborn twins from a queen who wants them destroyed in the drama from Steven Knight.

title: Marvel's Hero Project
description: The sci-fi series from Ronald D. Moore set in an alternate universe where the USSR had landed on the moon first and NASA continues the space race with a group of astronauts that include Edward Baldwin (Joel Kinnaman).

title: The World According to Jeff Goldblum
description: Power struggles, rivalries, and scandal are just some of the challenges for a popular morning news program in the drama executive produced by Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston.

title: High School Musical: The Musical: The Series
description: The Fab Five travel to Tokyo and with assistance from Kiko Mizuhara, help four Japanese women and men transform themselves in the four-episode special.

title: The Mandalorian
description: Charlie (voiced by Erika Henningsen), the princess of Hell opens a hotel where demons can rehabilitate and find a way into Heaven in the adult animated musical comedy created by Vivienne Medrano.

title: The Imagineering Story
description: 40-something Eve Fletcher (Kathryn Hahn) and her college freshman son Brendan (Jackson White) discover new things about themselves as they begin a new chapter in their lives apart from each other in this dramedy based on Tom Perrotta's novel of the same name.

title: Dublin Murders
description: The Jack Thorne drama is set in a small Welsh town where a large construction project explosion causes injury and death of several people, dividing the townspeople as they question who should be blamed.

title: Back to Life
description: 17-year-old Josh (Colin Ford) searches for his girlfriend Sam (Sophie Simnett) in post-zombie apocalyptic Glendale in this dark comedy based on the graphic novel by Brian Ralph.

title: The Rocketeer
description: In each episode, chef David Chang and a celebrity guest look at one city's food and culture.

title: Green Eggs And Ham
description: Four friends lean on each other as the deal with complications with their careers, relationships and life in the modern world in the drama written, directed and produced by Tyler Perry.

title: The Little Mermaid Live!
description: New President and First Lady, Hunter and Victoria Franklin (Ed Quinn and Kron Moore) move into the White House with their spoiled daughter (Paige Hurd) and troubled son (Daniel Croix Henderson) in this drama from Tyler Perry.

title: Seth Meyers: Lobby Baby
description: The comedy special for the comedian features a stand-up performance in addition to a documentary segment where she talks about her childhood and family.

title: His Dark Materials
description: Jameela Jamil hosts the game show based on the card game Sh*t Happens with Impractical Jokers' creators Brian "Q" Quinn, James "Murr" Murray, Joe Gatto and Sal Vulcano as part of the two teams with one contestant scoring events from a 1-100 scale.

title: The Devil Next Door
description: The four-part limited series focuses on the later years of the reign of Russian empress Catherine the Great (Helen Mirren) and her relationship with Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin (Jason Clarke).

title: Oprah's Book Club
description: Produced by Steven Soderbergh, Paul Pawlowski and David Check, the documentary series explores the appeal by Army lieutenant Clint Lorance of his murder conviction for ordering his platoon to shoot several local men riding a motorcycle in Afghanistan.

title: Ghostwriter (2019)
description: The Damon Lindelof series based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel of the same name is set in an alternative 2019, where there is no Internet, Robert Redford is president (28 years and counting), and the police wear masks to protect their identities.

title: Helpsters
description: The eight-part adaptation of John Green's novel of the same name where Miles "Pudge" Halter (Charlie Plummer) transfers to a boarding school and becomes friends with Alaska (Kristine Froseth), Chip (Denny Love), Takumi (Jay Lee) and Lara (Sofia Vassiliev).

title: Snoopy in Space
description: The John Carney romantic comedy anthology series based on the New York Times column of the same name features a cast that includes Sofia Boutella, Gary Carr, Olivia Cooke, Brandon Victor Dixon, Tina Fey, John Gallagher, Jr., Andy Garcia, Julia Garner, Anne Hathaway, Catherine Keener, Cristin Milioti, Dev Patel, Andrew Scott, John Slatter...

title: Dickinson
description: Miles (Paul Rudd) must convince the people in his life he the more worthy than the seemingly better version himself created after undertaking a spa treatment that promised to improve himself in this comedy created by Timothy Greenberg.

title: See
description: American Public Radio journalist Lia Haddock (Jessica Biel) looks into the mysterious disappearance of 300 people at a Tennessee neuroscience research facility in this drama based on the podcast of the same name.

title: For All Mankind
description: The beginnings of the CIA black-ops program Operation Treadstone that helped create agents like Jason Bourne is explored as sleeper agents are "awakened" to complete their missions in this spinoff series written by Tim Kring.

title: The Morning Show
description: Players answer trivia questions and count cards in their attempt to "catch" a "21" and win big bucks in this new game show hosted by Alfonso Ribeiro and Mikki Padilla.

title: Queer Eye: We're in Japan!
description: The six-part documentary series executive produced Alex Gibney and Steven Spielberg and directed by Geeta Gandbhir and Sam Pollard examines th history and science behind hatred.

title: Hazbin Hotel
description: Caroline (Penelope Ann Miller) and Bethany (Mia Kirshner) are two wealthy mothers who buy their children's way into prestigious universities with the help of Rick Singer (Michael Shanks) in this TV movie inspired by Operation Varsity Blues.

title: Mrs. Fletcher
description: The new members of The Midnight Society tell the tale of the Carnival of Doom in this revival of the long-running horror anthology series.

title: The Accident
description: The relationship between a teenager and the protector of the woods is at the center of the horror series based on the Webby Award-winning short film of the same name.

title: Daybreak (2019)
description: The weekly hip-hop competition series features a judging panel that includes Cardi B, Chance the Rapper and T.I.

title: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner
description: 18-year-old Nancy Drew (Kennedy McMann) was ready to leave for college when the death of her mother delays things and she becomes involved in a murder investigation in the series based on the classic mystery novels.

title: Tyler Perry's Sistas
description: The prehistoric animated adventure miniseries from Genndy Tartakovsky follows a caveman as he bonds with a tyrannosaurus rex.

title: Tyler Perry's The Oval
description: Tiffany Haddish hosts the revival of the mid-90s CBS series with both taped and in-studio interactions with children.

title: Jenny Slate: Stage Fright
description: With Batman/Bruce Wayne gone from Gotham, Kate Kane (Ruby Rose) takes the mantle as Batwoman in the Greg Berlanti and Caroline Dries series based on the DC characters.

title: The Misery Index
description: The comedy special from Gary Gulman and filmed in Brooklyn at the Roulette Intermedium covers a variety of issues including mental health.

title: Catherine The Great
description: Nicole Reese (Alisha Wainwright) struggles to raises her eight-year-old son Dion (Ja’Siah Young) after the death of her husband Mark (Michael B. Jordan). When Dion begins displaying unusual abilities, Mark's best friend Pat (Jason Ritter) helps Nicole to protect and hide the child's powers.

title: Leavenworth
description: Executive produced by Selena Gomez, Aaron Saidman and Eli Holzman, the six-part documentary series follows the lives of eight undocumented families as they face possible deportation.

title: Watchmen (2019)
description: Only child Julia Bechley (Brittany Snow) life is changed forever after it is revealed her fertility doctor father (Timothy Hutton) had used his own sperm on his patients, resulting in potential numbers of half-siblings, including Edie (Megalyn Echikunwoke) and Roxy (Emily Osment) in this drama originally titled Not Just Me and based on t...

title: Looking for Alaska
description: The animated comedy from Emily Spivey, Phil Lord, Christopher Miller and Seth Cohen follows Betty Hart (Maya Rudolph) and her family that includes Wayne Edwards (Ike Baerinholtz), his wife Jenny (Kristen Wiig) and their daughter Violet (Jillian Bell).

title: Modern Love
description: In the 1960s, crime boss Bumpy Johnson (Forest Whitaker) returns to Harlem after a decade in prison to find it under the control of the Italian mob and becomes friends with Malcolm X (Nigél Thatch) this drama from Chris Brancato and Paul Eckstein.

title: Living with Yourself
description: Saint Sebastian High School student Payton Hobart (Ben Platt) strives to become Student Body President and get into Harvard on his way to attaining his dream to become President of the United States in Ryan Murphy's dark comedy.

title: Limetown
description: Ex-Princeton music professor Arthur Cochran (Bradley Whitford) and a small-town church choir come together in this comedy from Lesley Wake Webster and Jason Winer.

title: Treadstone
description: Wade (Walton Goggins), a widower with two daughters reluctantly begins dating and discovers he is very popular in this comedy from Bill Martin and Mike Schiff.

title: Catch 21
description: David Acosta priest-in-training (Mike Colter) recruits Kristen Bouchard, a forensic psychologist (Katja Herbers) and Ben, a carpenter (Aasif Mandvi) to help him evaluate if the phenomena reported to the church has scientific explanations or are actually supernatural in this series from from Robert and Michelle King.

title: Why We Hate
description: With her two children grown and newly divorced, Carol Kenney (Patricia Heaton) retires from teaching and begins pursuing her dream to become a doctor as a 50-years-old in this comedy from Emily Halpern and Sarah Haskins.

title: The College Admissions Scandal
description: David Acosta priest-in-training (Mike Colter) recruits Kristen Bouchard, a forensic psychologist (Katja Herbers) and Ben, a carpenter (Aasif Mandvi) to help him evaluate if the phenomena reported to the church has scientific explanations or are actually supernatural in this series from from Robert and Michelle King.

title: Are You Afraid of the Dark? (2019)
description: Disgraced New York City Councilman Garrett Modi (Kal Penn) is living with his sister and feeling sorry for himself until a group of people seek his help in helping them become American citizens in this comedy co-written by Penn and Matt Murray.

title: The Birch
description: The half-hour anthology series featuring both animation and live-action shorts.

title: Rhythm & Flow
description: Army veteran Dex Parios (Cobie Smulders) works as a P.I. in Portland, Oregon in this drama series based on the graphic novel of the same name.

title: Nancy Drew (2019)
description: Police chief Jo (Allison Tolman) finds herself in the middle of a conspiracy when she takes in a child (Alexa Skye Swinton) she finds at the scene of a mysterious plane accident with no memory in this thriller from Michele Fazekas and Tara Butters.

title: Genndy Tartakovsky's Primal
description: The second spin-off for black-ish features Rainbow Johnson's (Arica Himmel) life in the 80s while growing up with an interracial family and adjusting to life in the suburbs after years in a hippie commune.

title: Kids Say the Darndest Things (2019)
description: After years of estrangement, Sydney Strait (Caitlin McGee) returns to the civil rights law firm her father (Jimmy Smits) runs after the death of her mother in this legal drama set in Memphis.

title: Batwoman
description: Criminal psychologist Malcolm Bright (Tom Payne) helps solves murders with the NYPD while dealing with his father (Michael Sheen), who was a serial killer and still wants a relationship with his son in this crime drama from Chris Fedak and Sam Sklaver.

title: Gary Gulman: The Great Depresh
description: Bob (Billy Gardell) a middle-aged sock businessman falls in love with his Nigerian cardiac nurse Abishola (Folake Olowofoyeku) in this Chuck Lorre comedy.

title: Raising Dion
description: Former deputy district attorney Lola Carmichael (Simone Missick) begins her first year as a judge under the guidance of Supervising Judge Judith Benner (Marg Helgenberger). Across the bench are Lola's best friend Deputy District Attorney Mark Callan (Wilson Bethel) and public defender Emily Lopez (Jessica Camacho) in this legal drama fro...

title: Living Undocumented
description: The three-part documentary created, directed and executive produced by Davis Guggenheim features interviews with Bill Gates and colleagues as it explores the rise of Microsoft and his philanthropic efforts.

title: Almost Family
description: Hayley Atwell and David Tennant are just two of a dozen suspects who go under intense interrogation in the Kay and Field Smith crime drama anthology set in France, Germany, Spain, and the U.K.

title: Bless the Harts
description: 30-something Layne Roberts (Tanisha Long) and her friends Veronica Yates (Angell Conwell), Tracey Davis (Rasheda Crockett), Deon Lewis (Chase Anthony), and Vince Carpenter (Tristen Winger) deal with work and love issues in Atlanta in the Will Parker comedy.

title: Godfather of Harlem
description: Lilly Singh enters as the only women hosting a late-night talk show on network television.

title: The Politician
description: The eight-part, 16-hour documentary written and produced by Dayton Duncan and directed by Ken Burns traces the origins of country music and its evolution with stories about such artists as Gene Autry, Garth Brooks, the Carter family, Johnny Cash, Merle Haggard, Emmylou Harris, Loretta Lynn, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, Charley Pride, Jim...

title: Perfect Harmony
description: The five-part documentary series based on Ethan Brown non-fiction book of the same name looks into the unsolved murders of eight women found around the town of Jennings, Louisiana between 2005 and 2009.

title: The Unicorn
description: Marie Adler (Kaitlyn Dever) reports she was raped in her home, but the police don't believe her. In another state, Detectives Grace Rasmussen (Toni Collette) and Karen Duvall (Merritt Wever) investigate a possible serial rapist in this limited series based on a Pulitzer Prize-winning article (and an This American Life radio episode) abou...

title: Evil
description: The rotoscope animation from Kate Purdy and Raphael Bob-Waksberg follows 28-year-old Alma (Rosa Salazar) as she seeks answers to her father's death after an accident nearly kills her and discovers an ability to travel through time.

title: Carol's Second Act
description: In the first original series for the Vudu streaming service, Greg (Hayes MacArthur) decides to try his hand at staying at home with his two kids after his wife Megan is offered her dream job in the comedy series based on the 1983 film of the same name.

title: Evil
description: The house made famous on the TV show The Brady Bunch undergoes a full renovation to recreate the interior seen on the 1970s sitcom with the help of the Brady "kids" and HGTV's renovation experts.

title: Sunnyside (2019)
description: Singer Kelly Clarkson adds daytime talk show host to her resume.

title: Cake (2019)
description: The broadcast journalist and former The Today Show host tackles daytime talk show that features topical interviews.

title: Stumptown
description: Comedian Anthony Jeselnik interviews fellow comics about their career and influences as well as take part in studio segments.

title: Emergence
description: The documentary series follows four couples in therapy with New York psychoanalyst Dr. Orna Guralnik.

title: mixed-ish
description: In the 1960s, Mossad agent Eli Cohen (Sacha Baron Cohen) infiltrates Syrian society and becomes friends with military leaders in this six-part limited series based on the real life of the Israeli spy written by Gideon Raff and Max Perry.

title: Bluff City Law
description: The 10-episode series co-created by RZA and Alex Tse is based on the true story of the formation of the Wu-Tang Clan.

title: Prodigal Son
description: The feature-length movie musical picks up two years after the series finale with Steven (voiced by Zach Callison), now a teenager, believing peace has come at last, only to have a new vengeful gem appear in Beach City.

title: Bob Hearts Abishola
description: Set in a neo-Victorian city where supernatural war refugees have settled, Detective Rycroft Philostrate (Orlando Bloom) reconnects with faerie Vignette Stonemoss (Cara Delevingn) and investigates a number of murders in the fantasy drama.

title: All Rise
description: The prequel to the 1982 movie The Dark Crystal follows Gelflings Rian (voiced by Taron Egerton), Brea (voiced by Anya Taylor-Joy) and Deet (voiced by Nathalie Emmanuel) as they set out to to save the world after learning the secret to Skeksis’ power.

title: Inside Bill’s Brain: Decoding Bill Gates
description: Bipolor Vinnie (Joseph Gilgun) and his best friend Dylan's (Damien Molony) days of making trouble around town may be numbered when Dylan's girlfriend (Michelle Keegan) wants to move in this comedy co-creator by Danny Brocklehurst and Gilgun. [Premiered originally on UK's Sky One on 22 Aug 2019; Airing in US in Jul 2020]

title: Criminal: UK
description: The world of a famous televangelist family led by Eli Gemstone (John Goodman) and his grown children: Jesse (Danny McBride), Judy (Edi Patterson) and Kelvin (Adam Devine) is explored in this comedy from McBride.

title: Bigger
description: The documentary series based on Dr. Lisa Sanders' New York Times Magazine column of the same name try to find answers to patients' illnesses that have stumped other doctors.

title: A Little Late with Lilly Singh
description: Krystal Stubbs (Kirsten Dunst) works at a water park in Florida while trying to make it to the top of a pyramid scheme run by Obie Garbeau II (Ted Levine)in this dark comedy set in the 1990s.

title: Country Music
description: Beth Ann, a 1960s housewife (Ginnifer Goodwin); Simone, a socialite in the '80s (Lucy Liu); and in 2019, lawyer Taylor (Kirby Howell-Baptiste) discover they each have been cheated on by their respective partners in the Marc Cherry dark comedy-drama.

title: Murder in the Bayou
description: David (Akili McDowell), a 14-year-old from the Florida projects attends a magnet school for academically gifted kids created and must decide whether to take advantage of his opportunity or return to the life as the neighborhood drug dealer in this drama series based on the life of series creator and co-writer by Tarell Alvin McCraney.

title: Unbelievable
description: Three Jewish teenagers are kidnapped and murdered in the Summer 2014 in Israel. A few days later a Palestinian teenager is also murdered and an agent with the Israel Security Agency investigates all four deaths in this 10-part limited series created by Hagai Levi, Joseph Cedar and Tawfik Abu-Wael.

title: Undone
description: The career of Philadelphia rapper Meek Mill, his history with the legal system beginning with his 2007 arrest, and his fight to clear his name after being imprisoned in 2017 are at the center of the five-part documentary series executive produced by Jay-Z, Eli Holzman, Aaron Saidman, Michael John Warren, and Paul and Isaac Solotaroff.

title: Mr. Mom
description: The documentary series looks into The Fellowship, a Christian fundamentalist organization and its influence on politicians in and outside of Washington, D.C.

title: A Very Brady Renovation
description: Rocko, Heffer and Philbert return home to O-Town after 20 years in space in this special for the 1990s Nickelodeon cartoon created by Joe Murray.

title: The Kelly Clarkson Show
description: San Diego chef Kai Jin (Iko Uwais) discovers he has been chosen to become the Wu Assassin and must stop five criminals from using the Wu power for evil.

title: Tamron Hall
description: Aine (Aisling Bea) is an English as a foreign language teacher who is trying to move on after her breakdown, as her sister Shona (Sharon Horgan) continues to be concerned about her in this comedy created by Bea.

title: Good Talk with Anthony Jeselnik
description: Hosted by Taye Diggs, contestants complete simple tasks after being hypnotized by the show's resident hypnotist Keith Bar on the comedy game show based on the UK show called You're Back in the Room.

title: Couples Therapy (2019)
description: Bishop (Noel Clarke) and Pike (Ashley Walters) are undercover police officers in London and best friends despite their different personalities in this British action buddy cop drama that first aired in the UK on Sky One.

title: The Spy
description: The six-episode "event series" reunites Gabrielle Carteris, Shannen Doherty, Jennie Garth, Brian Austin Green, Jason Priestley, Tori Spelling and Ian Ziering, to play versions of themselves who have come together to attempt to reboot Beverly Hills, 90210.

title: Wu-Tang: An American Saga
description: The animated anthology series from Owen Dennis feature a train with infinite carriages. The first two seasons originally premiered on the Cartoon Network and the third is scheduled for the summer 2020 on HBO Max.

title: Steven Universe: The Movie
description: Ashley Nicole Black, Quinta Brunson, Gabrielle Dennis, Robin Thede are some of the cast of this comedy sketch series from Thede.

title: Carnival Row
description: The six-part docuseries from Avi Belkin looks into the 1981 killing of Ken Rex McElroy in front of almost 60 people in Skidmore, Missouri. However, when the police talk to the witnesses, they all claim to have seen nothing.

title: The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance
description: Four friends are reunited at a London wedding but a revelation changes everyone's lives in this anthology dramedy based on the 1994 movie of the same name.

title: Brassic
description: The musical variety sketch comedy show created and written by Diallo Riddle and Bashir Salahuddin is hosted by Sherman McDaniels.

title: The Righteous Gemstones
description: The late-night series hosted by David Spade will include a roundtable discussion about pop culture as well as featuring sketches and in the field segments.

title: Diagnosis
description: A young Alfred Pennyworth (Jack Bannon) is fresh out of the SAS and begins a security job with Thomas Wayne (Ben Aldridge) in this drama series executive produced by Gotham's Bruno Heller and Danny Cannon.

title: On Becoming a God in Central Florida
description: Eric Kripke and Evan Goldberg's superhero series, based on the comic book of the same name by Garth Ennis and Darick Robertson focuses on a group of vigilantes that include Billy Butcher (Karl Urban), Hughie (Jack Quaid), Mother’s Milk (Laz Alonso), Female (Karen Fukuhara), and Frenchie (Tomer Capon).

title: Why Women Kill
description: Astronaut Niko Breckinridge (Katee Sackhoff) leads a team to look into an alien artifact in this sci-fi drama from Aaron Martin and Noreen Halpern.

title: David Makes Man
description: Fresh out of community college, the two friends (Bashir Salahuddin and Diallo Riddle) end up working at a rent-tow-own company in the South Side of Chicago in this comedy written by Salahuddin and Riddle.

title: Our Boys
description: Jessica Pearson (Gina Torres) moves to Chicago and begins working as Chicago Mayor Bobby Novak's (Morgan Spector) fixer in this spin-off of Suits.

title: Free Meek
description: The mockumentary from John Levenstein features David Harbour as a fictional version of himself as he looks into his late father's career and discovers "lost" footage of his father's final stage play.

title: The Family (2019)
description: Set in 2199, after the death of her parents, Jax (Priscilla Quintana) starts a new life at Space Training Academy, where her uncle (Noah Huntley) is a professor and cadets learn to fight alien and human threats. But when the truth of her true identity is revealed to her, it changes everything in this sci-fi series.

title: Rocko’s Modern Life: Static Cling
description: A group of prehistoric friends (Jillian Bell, Zac Efron, Anna Kendrick, Lamorne Morris and Paul Scheer) discover alcohol, fire, monogamy, and the wheel in the animated comedy created by Chris Bruno and David Howard Lee.

title: Wu Assassins
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Morgan Neville and Jeff Malmberg looks at music making at Rick Rubin's Malibu music studio.

title: This Way Up
description: Laura Chinn, Laci Mosley, Patty Guggenheim and Melanie Field star as four friends living in a small Florida beach town who try to better their lives after another friend moves away in this comedy inspired by creator Laura Chinn's life.

title: Hypnotize Me
description: Cocoa McKellan (Tia Mowry) and her husband Moz (Anthony Alabi) move with their four children from Seattle to the small Georgia town where Moz grew up in this family comedy from Meg DeLoatch.

title: Bulletproof (2019)
description: Contestants preform in front of a judging panel that includes Kenan Thompson, Chrissy Teigen and Jeff Foxworthy for a chance to win $250,000 in this comedy competition series hosted by comedian Amanda Seales.

title: BH90210
description: The comedy special directed by Spike Jonze was filmed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music over three days in May 2019.

title: Infinity Train
description: The US version of the British reality show where single contestants must couple up or risk being kicked off the island is hosted by Arielle Vandenberg.

title: A Black Lady Sketch Show
description: Fred Savage hosts an aftershow for a fictional sci-fi series called The Flare that includes interviews with the "cast," set visits and discussions with "fans."

title: No One Saw a Thing
description: The seven-part miniseries based on Gabriel Sherman's non-fiction book The Loudest Voice in the Room takes a look at the rise and ultimate fall of Fox News founder Roger Ailes (Russell Crowe).

title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
description: Based on the novel by Daniel O’Malley, the supernatural drama from Sam Holcroft and Al Muriel begins with Myfanwy Thomas (Emma Greenwell) waking up in London surrounded by dead bodies and no memory of who she is. She searches for answers when she learns she was part of the Checquy, a secret agency for people with paranormal abilities.

title: Sherman's Showcase
description: The sequel to The Hills includes Mischa Barton as well as Brandon Thomas Lee interacting with original cast members including Justin “Bobby” Brescia, Frankie Delgado, Brody Jenner, Heidi Montag, Audrina Patridge, Whitney Port, Spencer Pratt, Stephanie Pratt, and Jason Wahler.

title: Lights Out with David Spade
description: In a not-so-distant-future, despite a mandatory curfew to contain the spread of a deadly illness, a group of Londoners are given a chance to escape from the curfew if they win an illegal night-time street race.

title: Pennyworth
description: Spanning 15 years, Vivienne Rook (Emma Thompson) rises from vocal celebrity to controversial MP. The effect of her policies to British society are reflected in an ordinary Manchester family that includes Daniel (Russell Tovey), Stephen (Rory Kinnear) and his wife Celeste (T’Nia Miller), sisters Rosie (Ruth Madeley) and Edith (Jessica Hyn...

title: The Boys
description: High school teacher Gabe Iglesias (Gabriel Iglesias) works at his alma mater teaching gifted but troubled kids who Assistant Principal (Oscar Nuñez) want out in this comedy created by Kevin Hench.

title: Another Life
description: The game show executive produced by Justin Timberlake and hosted by Dax Shepard features contestants answering trivia questions: correct answers places prize money on a 40-foot wheel and wrong answers places chances of losing all of the prize money.

title: South Side
description: Hosted by Ayesha Curry, eight families compete for the $100,000 prize as their family dishes are judged by Curry, Cat Cora and Graham Elliot in this series based on the Australian show of the same name.

title: Pearson
description: Reformed thief Cat Chambers (Poppy Montgomery) works as the fixer for the governor of a pacific island but she soon crosses paths with people in her past including federal agent Jake Elliot (Ray Stevenson) and police detective Jake Wyatt (Desmond Chiam).

title: Frankenstein’s Monster’s Monster, Frankenstein
description: On each episode 12 contestants play three rounds on a super-sized mini-golf course for a chance to win $250,000, a trophy and a “Holey Moley” plaid jacket. Play-by-play commentary will be from Rob Riggle and Joe Tessitore with sideline reporting from Jeannie Mai in this game show that includes Stephen Curry as an executive producer.

title: Pandora
description: Ex-best friends Stephanie Lancaster (Givens) and Amara Hughes (Essence Atkins) face off against each other in Atlanta in this drama from Will Packer.

title: Human Discoveries
description: The sketch comedy series from Arturo Castro features more than 45 characters including Arturo as a Latin millennial.

title: Shangri-La (2019)
description: Santiago Mendoza (Demian Bichir) along with his second wife Gigi (Roselyn Sanchez) and their adult children run a luxury Miami Beach hotel but behind the scenes there is debt, scandal and secrets in this Eva Longoria produced-drama based on the Spanish series, Gran Hotel.

title: Florida Girls
description: In the fall of 1942, U-612 begins its first voyage with a crew of 40 men led by Captain Klaus Hoffmann (Rick Okon). In the port of La Rochelle, translator Simone Strasser (Vicky Krieps) soon finds life complicated when she becomes involved with the French Resistance in this sequel to the 1981 film of the same name.

title: Family Reunion
description: The teen drama based on the Israeli series of the same name about a group of teenagers including Rue (Zendaya), a 17-year-old drug addict, as they deal with school, love, friendship, sex and drugs.

title: Bring the Funny
description: The crime drama co-written by Ed Brubaker and Nicolas Winding Refn follows police officer Martin (Miles Teller) as he investigates the Los Angeles' underworld that includes hit men and assassins associated with the local gangs, Mexican cartel, Russian mafia, and the Yakuza.

title: Aziz Ansari: Right Now
description: The Spanish-language comedy from Fred Armisen is set in Mexico City where Renaldo (Bernardo Velasco) and his friends Ursula (Cassandra Ciangherotti), her sister Tati (Ana Fabrega) and Andres (Julio Torres) create a business from their passion for horror and gore.

title: Love Island (2019)
description: Former thief Daisy "Jett" Kowalski (Carla Gugino) wants to stay straight after a stint in prison, but crime boss Charlie Baudelaire (Giancarlo Esposito) offers her one "final" job that soon leads to several more in this drama created by Sebastian Gutierrez.

title: What Just Happened??!
description: Hosted by Joel McHale, the revival of the NBC/CBS game show where two contestants compete to win the $10,000 prize by predicting whether the next cards are higher or lower values than the previous ones.

title: The Loudest Voice
description: Three contestants compete against each other by answering questions to earn spins for the Big Board where they can win cash and prizes if they avoid the Whammy, which takes all winnings away in this revival of the 1980s CBS game show.

title: The Rook
description: The talent show hosted by Elizabeth Stanton and James Maslow features a variety of performers from around the world.

title: The Hills: New Beginnings
description: Escaping life in Connecticut, Mary Ann (Laura Linney) returns to San Francisco where her daughter Shawna (Elliot Page) and ex-husband Brian (Paul Gross) still live. She moves back to 28 Barbary Lane where Anna Madrigal (Olympia Dukakis) still rules the roost in this 10-part limited series inspired by the on books by Armistead Maupin.

title: Curfew
description: Set in 1990s Boston, FBI agent Jackie Rohr (Kevin Bacon) and ADA Decoucy Ward (Aldis Hodge) team up to catch a family who robs armored car that leads to a wider case of corruption in the entire criminal justice system in Boston.

description: Each episode of the documentary series follows a New York Times journalist as they investigate an issue.

description: Picking up 10 years after the end of season 3, South Dakota's statehood brings back many of the Deadwood residents including Al Swearengen (Ian McShane), Seth Bullock (Timothy Olyphant), Alma Ellsworth (Molly Parker), Trixie (Paula Malcomson), Sol Star (John Hawkes), Martha Bullock (Anna Gunn), Charlie Utter (Dayton Callie), Doc Cochran ...

title: Holey Moley
description: Ava DuVernay's four-part limited series based on the Central Park Five case where five Harlem teenagers--Antron McCray (Caleel Harris/Jovan Adepo), Kevin Richardson (Asante Blackk/Justin Cunningham), Yusef Salaam (Ethan Herisse/Chris Chalk), Raymond Santana (Marquis Rodriguez/Freddy Miyares) and Korey Wise (Jharrel Jerome) were accused o...

title: Ambitions
description: The adaptation of Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman's fantasy novel of the same name where the End of the World is fast approaching and after many years of living with mortals, Aziraphale the angel (Michael Sheen) and Crowley the demon (David Tennant) decide they must stop the Apocalypse but first they must find the 11-year-old Antichrist ...

description: The latest live-action series for DC Universe finds Abby Arcane (Crystal Reed) investigating what she believes is a swamp-borne virus in her Louisiana hometown and meeting biologist Alec Holland (Andy Bean) and eventually, Swamp Thing (Derek Mears). description: Cassie Bedford (Harriet Dyer) can communicate with the dead and her friend Detective Tom Hackett (Paul Blackthorne) and his new partner former FBI Agent Damien Asante (Justin Cornwell) ask for help on a case in this Moira Kirland drama series.

description: The songwriting competitive reality show features a panel that includes Ryan Tedder, Ester Dean and Shane McAnally.

description: The neo-noir thriller anthology series Mike Kelly is about the consequences of choices people make.

title: Card Sharks (2019)
description: In 1327, Franciscan monk William of Baskerville (John Turturo) and his novice Adso von Melk (Damian Hardung) investigate several mysterious murders at an isolated monastery in the Italian Alps while trying to avoid antagonizing Inquisitor Bernard Gui (Rupert Everett) in this eight-part drama based on Umberto Eco's novel (which was also w...

description: All in the Family and its spinoff, The Jeffersons are getting a live TV staging of a classic episode from each program hosted by Normal Lear and Jimmy Kimmel. Archie Bunker will be played by Woody Harrelson and Jamie Foxx will play George Jefferson.

title: The Weekly

title: American Princess (2019)
description: The four-part documentary from Sacha Jenkins takes a look at the hip-hop group's formation and long career with never-before-seen archival footage and interviews with all living nine members.

description: Restaurateur Nick Liberato, chef Dennis Prescott and designer Karin Bohn help renovate restaurants around the world.

title: Swamp Thing (2019)
description: The third series based on the Philippa Gregory's Tudor dynasty novels focuses on Catherine of Aragon (Charlotte Hope) as she arrives to marry Prince Arthur, only to have him die suddenly. With her future in doubt, she seeks to solidify her position with her husband's brother, Prince Harry (Ruairi O’Connor), the future King Henry VIII.

description: Produced by Greg Berlanti and Ava DuVernay, the event series based on creator's Caitlin Parrish play A Twist of Water looks at the impact of the shooting death of an innocent African-American doctor by a white police officer on three families connected to the case: the police officer's (Noel Fisher), the victim's husband (Noah Wyle) and ...

description: Directed by Hiro Murai, Donald Glover's "tropical thriller" filmed in Cuba about a musician putting together a festival also features Rhianna and Letitia Wright.

title: The Spanish Princess
description: The comedy about a gay man (Ryan O’Connell) with a mild cerebral palsy is based on Ryan O'Connell's memoir and executive produced by Jim Parsons.

title: Chambers
description: Colonel Eisa Turnbull (Dana Delany) heads up the staff of attorneys for the Marine Corps' Judge Advocate Division, which includes Capt. John "Abe" Abraham (Luke Mitchell), 2nd Lieutenant Harper Li (Phillipa Soo), Major Maya Dobbins (Anna Wood), Major Trey Ferry (Ato Essandoh), and Warrant Officer Carlton Prickett (Raffi Barsoumian) in th...

Eight years later, the same actor is again accused of murder and returns for another chance in this legal drama from Marcia Clark, Liz Craft and Sarah Fain.

description: The animated anthology series from David Fincher and Tim Miller features episodes that range from five to 15 minutes long.

title: Quicksand

description: The documentary series about the global economy from Adam McKay is hosted by Kal Penn.

title: Shrill
description: Desus Nice and The Kid Mero move their late-night talk show from Viceland to Showtime.

title: Turn Up Charlie
description: Writer-director Larry Charles travels around the world to explore comedy.
