James) in this legal drama from David Elliot ...

title: Videos After Dark
description: The four-part documentary series executive produced by Jordan Peele about the Lorena and John Wayne Bobbitt case was directed by Joshua Rofé.

description: Luther (Tom Hopper), Diego (David Castañeda), Allison (Emmy Raver-Lampman), Klaus (Robert Sheehan), Vanya (Elliot Page) and Number Five (Aidan Gallagher) are brought back together by the death of their adoptive father (Colm Feore) in this series based on the comics and graphic novels by My Chemical Romance's Gerard Way.

title: Formula 1: Drive to Survive
description: The four-hour documentary about Reconstruction after the Civil War hosted by Henry Louis Gates Jr.

description: The comedy co-created by Maya Erskine, Anna Konkle and Sam Zvibleman is set in middle school with Erskine and Konkle as 13-year-olds.

description: Amy Schatz's documentary short film focuses on Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School drama teacher Melody Herzfeld and her theater students as they return to school after the shooting to complete their annual production.

title: The Enemy Within
description: Set in the 1970s, the series takes a look at the life of Don Cornelius (Sinqua Walls) and the people who helped make Soul Train, including the dancers, the crew and musicians such as Gladys Knight (Kelly Rowland), Martha Reeves (K. Michelle), Diana Ross (Michelle Williams), Rufus Thomas (Bobby Brown) and Ike and Tina Turner (McKinley Fre...

title: Whiskey Cavalier
description: Elvis Mitchell interviews actors and filmmakers at locations that inspired them.

title: O.G.
description: The talent competition series hosted by James Corden features Drew Barrymore, RuPaul Charles, and Faith Hill as judges.

title: Desus & Mero
description: Jonathan Larson's award-winning musical is the latest live musical for Fox.

description: The four-part documentary series from Joe Berlinger features previously unheard audio of interviews with serial killer while on death row in Florida.

title: Doom Patrol
description: The comedy from David Caspe, Jordan Cahan, Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg takes a look at Black Monday--October 19, 1987, the worst stock market crash in the history of Wall Street through the lives of Rod “The Jammer” Jaminski (Don Cheadle), who was the self-made head of the financial firm where trading prodigy Blair Shmerman (Andrew Rann...

title: Dating Around
description: To investigate the conditions and treatment of patients of New York's infamous Women's Lunatic Asylum, reporter Nellie Bly (Christina Ricci) goes undercover and suffers under head nurse, Matron Grady (Judith Light) especially when Dr. Josiah (Josh Bowman) tries to help her in this TV movie inspired by real-life reporter Elizabeth Cochran...

title: Weird City
description: The dramatic look at the 2016 Vote Leave campaign led by Dominic Cummings (Benedict Cumberbatch) that resulted in the British voting to exit the European Union was directed by Toby Haynes.

title: Boomerang (2019)

description: Carmen Sandiego (Gina Rodriguez) and Player (Finn Wolfhard) return in this reboot of the animated series based on the 1980s educational video game Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego?

description: The reboot of the reality show that aired for three seasons on Fox returns with four couples and 24 singles.

title: Miracle Workers (2019)
description: The second adaptation based on the Roswell High book series by Melinda Metz finds biomedical researcher Liz Ortecho (Jeanine Mason) returning to her hometown after 10 years. She soon learns her teenage crush Max (Nathan Parsons) is now a police officer and he's an alien. Liz agrees to keep the secret that also includes Max's sister Isobe...

title: Song of Parkland

title: American Soul
description: Based on author Justin Cronin's trilogy of books about a secret government-funded medical facility has created a new virus that could end all diseases but could also end mankind. FBI Agent Brad Wolgast (Mark-Paul Gosselaar) is tasked to bring in a young girl named Amy Bellafonte (Saniyya Sidney) to the facility, but he begins to get seco...

title: Elvis Goes There
description: Matthew Carnahan's six-part limited series about the rise and fall of three early dot-coms: Netscape, the early web browser; TheGlobe.com, a social network; and Pixelon, a video streamer.

title: The World's Best
description: After being arrested and threatening to deport a family member, Raza (Nabhaan Rizwan), a second-generation British-Pakistani man from East London reluctantly agrees to become an informant for DS Gabe Waters (Paddy Considine), a Counter-Terrorism officer in this BBC thriller.

title: Russian Doll
description: Otis Milburn (Asa Butterfield) decides to form a sex therapy clinic with "bad girl" Maeve after it is revealed his mother (Gillian Anderson) is a sex therapist in this dramedy created by Laurie Nunn.

title: The ABC Murders
description: Navy-veteran-turned-P.I. Jennifer Marshall leads a team to look into some of the United States' biggest mysteries including Area 51 and the Salem Witch Trials.

title: Rent (2019)
description: Clem (Nina Dobrev) and her fiancé Jay's (Tone Bell) new life together is disrupted when Clem's half-sister Shannon (Odessa Adlon) arrives seeking escape from their father (who Clem claimed had died).

title: I Am The Night
description: The spinoff of The Goldbergs set in the 1990s follows the faculty of William Penn Academy, which includes Principal Glascott (Tim Meadows), new music teacher and WP alum Lainey Lewis (AJ Michalka), Coach Mellor (Bryan Callen) and Charlie "CB" Brown (Brett Dier).

title: Black Earth Rising
description: College professor Dr. J. Allen Hynek (Aiden Gillen) is recruited by the US Air Force to lead the secret Project Blue Book to investigate thousands of cases of UFO sightings in this series based on the real investigations conducted by the United States Air Force from 1952-1969.

title: The Other Two
description: Callie (Maia Mitchell) and Mariana (Cierra Ramirez) have moved to Los Angeles and face the challenges of new neighbors, new jobs, and new relationships in this spinoff of The Fosters.

title: Conversations With a Killer: The Ted Bundy Tapes
description: Terry Crews hosts the spin-off of the competitive talent series that will feature past contestants as well talent from the international "Got Talent" versions and will be judged by Simon Cowell, Mel B, Heidi Klum and Howie Mandel.

title: Black Monday
description: Hosted by executive producer Dwayne Johnson, competitors face challenges to become a Titan that will test both mind and body.

title: Escaping the Madhouse: The Nellie Bly Story
description: The six-part documentary series features interviews with the young women who allege to have suffered sexual, mental, and physical abuse from the R&B singer as well as music industry professionals, journalists, former employees and family members of Kelly.

title: Brexit
description: Nick Cannon hosts the celebrity singing competition based on the South Korean show where a judging panel that includes Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke must guess the identities of the 12 masked singers.

title: Butterfly
description: Japanese home organization consultant helps people find their sparks of joy as they declutter their houses.

title: Carmen Sandiego
description: Lindsay Lohan returns to television with another reality show - this one focused on her latest nightclub business in Greece.

title: Wayne
description: 30-something best friends John (Barry Brewer), Tom (Mahdi Cocci), Mike (Phillip Mullings Jr.) and Bill (Monti Washington) help each other with life and relationship issues in this comedy created by Tyler Perry.

title: Temptation Island (2019)
description: The eight-part miniseries chronicles the tainted blood scandal that infected thousand with HIV or Hepatitis C through two Canadian families in this eight-part drama created by Robert C. Cooper and based on personal experiences and non-fiction books: Bad Blood by Vic Parsons and The Gift of Death by Andre Picard.

title: Roswell, New Mexico
description: The animated series based on the books by Max Brallier follows 13-year-old Jack Sullivan (voiced by Nick Wolfhard) and his friends who live in a tree house, play video games and deal with zombies after a monster apocalypse.

title: Fyre Fraud
description: Kate Bosworth, Natalie Martinez, Alex Pettyfer, and Kyle Schmid are some of the 10 people who wake up on an island with no memory of who they are or how they got there in this seven-episode limited series written by Neil LaBute and Lucy Teitler.

title: The Passage
description: A young programmer starts to question reality when he adapts a mad writer's fantasy novel into a video game.

title: Valley of the Boom
description: The BBC four-part adaptation of the Richard Adams novel about a group of rabbits in Sandleford Warren who seek a new home when Fiver (Nicholas Hoult) has a vision of the destruction of their home there.

title: Informer
description: The Northern Irish comedy series set in 1994 focuses on 16-year-old Erin Quinn (Saoirse-Monica Jackson) and her friends at Our Lady Immaculate College. [Premiered originally in the UK on Channel 4 on 4 Jan 2018; in the US on Netflix on 21 Dec 2018]

title: Sex Education
description: Gwyneth Hughes' adaptation of the classic novel by Thackeray William Makepeace follows Becky Sharp (Olivia Cooke) as she makes her way from her pennilessness status to the court of King George IV.

title: Mysteries Decoded
description: Marcus (Benjamin Wadsworth) is recruited by an elite private academy called Kings Dominion, where the world's top crime families send their children in this series based on the Image Comics graphic novel by Rick Remender and Wes Craig.

title: Fam
description: The first stand-up special for the comedian since 2003 was filmed in Seattle's Benaroya Hall.

title: Schooled
description: The Boss tells personal stories and plays acoustic versions of some of his songs in his one-man show at Broadway's Walter Kerr Theatre filmed July 17 and 18, 2018.

title: Project Blue Book
description: The Hebrew/Yiddish-language drama series created by Ori Elon and Yehonatan Indursky follows a Haredi family led by rabbi Shulem Shtisel (Dov Glickman) living in an ultra-Orthodox neighborhood in Jerusalem. [Premiered originally in Israel on Yes Oh on 29 Jun 2013 and in the US on Netflix on 15 Dec 2018]

title: Good Trouble
description: Directed by Clay Tweel, the six-part documentary adaptation of John Grisham's non-fiction book centers on two 1980s murder cases in Ada, Oklahoma with interviews from friends, families, attorneys, journalists, town residents, and John Grisham as well as archival video and photos.

title: America's Got Talent: The Champions
description: The sports documentary series follows the Sunderland Football Club through the highs and lows of its seasons.

title: The Titan Games
description: After the sudden death of their friend and superstar rapper Lou (Jay Pharoah), Ronnie (Adam Pally) and Alf (Sam Richardson) return home and have to learn to adjust to a less high-flying lifestyle than the one enjoyed as part of a rap crew.

title: Surviving R. Kelly
description: Eight scientists and a telepath traveling on The Nightflyer space ship to make contact with alien life begin experiences strange and violent occurrences in this adaptation of George R.R. Martin's novella (which also was made into a 1987 film).

title: The Masked Singer
description: The anthology series created by Alexandra Cunningham was based on the articles and true crime podcast by Los Angeles Times reporter Christopher Goffard.

title: Tidying Up with Marie Kondo
description: Airing on consecutive nights, the three-part miniseries based on John le Carré's novel of the same name is set in the 1970s where a chance encounter in Greece between Charlie (Florence Pugh), an actress on vacation and a mysterious man named Becker (Alexander Skarsgård), soon becomes much more as she becomes part of high stakes spy plot ...

title: Lindsay Lohan's Beach Club
description: Oklahoma pageant coach extraordinaire Vicki Ellis (Catherine Zeta-Jones) is challenged to turn Samantha Stone (Belle Shouse) into a victorious pageant queen in this dark comedy created by Meaghan Oppenheimer.

title: Tyler Perry's Bruh
description: The four-part documentary from Alex Gibney focuses on the history of the conflicts between the FBI and presidents over the years including Richard Nixon and Donald Trump.

title: Unspeakable
description: The six-part documentary from Alex Gibney and Blair Foster takes a look at the Clinton-Lewinsky scandal with new interviews with Ken Starr and Monica Lewinsky.

title: The Last Kids on Earth
description: The adaptation of Elena Ferrante's novels tells the story about childhood friends Elena (Elisa Del Genio) and Lila (Ludovica Nasti) in 1950s Naples.

title: The I-Land
description: The companion series to Narcos focuses on the rise of Guadalajara Cartel as Félix Gallardo (Diego Luna) takes charge while newly posted DEA agent Kiki Camarena (Michael Pena) begins uncovering information about Felix's plans.

title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
description: Caseworker Heidi Bergman (Julia Roberts) works at a secret government facility to help returning soldiers like Walter Cruz (Stephan James) transition back to civilian life in this psychological thriller based on a fictional podcast.

title: Watership Down (2018)
description: Set in New York City, Kevin Williamson's psychological thriller based on fairy tales features high school teacher Nick (Billy Magnussen), unconventional grandmother Colleen (Kim Cattrall), her son Tim (Sam Jaeger) and her grandaughtr Kayla (Danielle Campbell), restaurateur Jordan (James Wolk) part-time bartender, drug dealer and thief Ed...

title: Derry Girls
description: 17-year-old Hope Mikaelson (Danielle Rose Russell) and Alaric Saltzman's twins, Lizzie and Josie Saltzman are some of the students at The Salvatore School for the Young and Gifted in this spinoff of The Originals.

title: Vanity Fair (2018)
description: War-veteran-turned-police Sergeant David Budd (Richard Madden) is promoted to the protection detail for controversial conservative Home Secretary Julia Montague (Keeley Hawes) in this drama series created by Jed Mercurio.

title: Deadly Class
description: Based on the movie by the same name, the dark comedy reboot finds J.D. (James Scully) and Veronica (Grace Victoria Cox) dealing with the Heathers led by Heather Chandler (Melanie Field), her second in command Heather Duke (Brendan Scannell), and cheerleader Heather McNamara (Jasmine Mathews).

title: Ellen DeGeneres: Relatable
description: 40-year-old John Nolan (Nathan Fillion) decides to move from his hometown to Los Angeles to pursue his dream to join the LAPD in this crime drama from Alexi Hawley.

title: Springsteen on Broadway
description: Forensic pathologist Dr. Daniel Harrow (Ioan Gruffudd) is known for ignoring authority so he can help solve a case, but he also has a secret that could destroy his career and family in this Australian crime drama.

title: Shtisel
description: The two-part miniseries about the rise and fall of R&B artist Bobby Brown.

title: The Innocent Man
description: The spinoff of Sons of Anarchy finds Ezekiel "EZ" Reyes (JD Pardo) out of prison and a prospective member of the Mayan MC near the California/Mexico border.

title: Sunderland 'Til I Die
description: The TV series based on the movie franchise is set in a small town in a totalitarian America where every year there is a 12-hour period when any crime is legal.

title: Champaign ILL
description: John Krasinski takes over the mantle as young CIA analyst Jack Ryan for the Amazon series.

title: Nightflyers
description: Jeff (Jim Carrey) plays Mr. Pickles, a children's television personality, who slowly begins to unravel as he tries to cope with family difficulties.

title: Dirty John
description: The audience learn more about a number of people connected in a multiple murder in a small middle American town as a single one-dollar bill passes through their hands in this mystery thriller created by by Jason Mosberg.

title: The Little Drummer Girl
description: The 10-part documentary series from Steve James takes a year-long look at Chicago's Oak Park and River Forest High School as students and staff deal with a variety of issues, including race, at one of the most diverse suburban public high schools in the U.S.

title: Queen America
description: Five Australians on a yachting vacation from Darwin to Indonesia come across a broken down fishing boat with refugees and offer to help them along. Sometime in the night, the fishing boat disappears and five years they discover someone had cut the rope, causing six refugees to die in this four-part psychological thriller from Australia.

title: Enemies: The President, Justice & The FBI
description: Harry (Percelle Ascott) and June (Sorcha Groundsell) run away together but there are powerful sources that want to separate them in this British supernatural teen series created by Hania Elkington and Simon Duric.

title: The Clinton Affair
description: 10 years in the making, the PBS special takes a look at the nearly 70 year long career of Betty White with clips, behind-the-scenes footage and interviews from costars and friends such as Pamela Adlon, Valerie Bertinelli, Carol Burnett, Georgia Engel, Tina Fey, Valerie Harper, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Gavin MacLeod, Carl Reiner, Ryan Reynol...

title: My Brilliant Friend
description: Billed as the final movie, Fin (Ian Ziering) must travel back in time to stop the first Sharknado from ever happening to save his family.

title: Escape At Dannemora
description: The animated morning kids series created by Dustin Ferrer and Amy Steinberg focuses on the adventures of Esme (voiced by Millie Davis) and her best friend Roy (voiced by Patrick McKenna), who also happens to be a monster.

title: Dogs
description: The Matt Groening animated comedy follows the adventures of hard-drinking Princess Bean (voiced by Abbi Jacobson), her elf Elfo (voiced by Nat Faxon), and her personal demon Luci (voiced by Eric Andre).

title: Narcos: Mexico
description: When hip-hop artist Joey Washington (Rev Run aka Joseph Simmons) decides to retire, his wife Justine (Justine Simmons) decides its time she starts her career and have Joey take care of their four kids (Nathan Anderson, Kiana Ledé, Leah Rose Randall and Maceo Smedley).

title: The Bisexual
description: The musical version of the Disney stage adaptation of the book of the same name (which were previously adapted for three non-musical films) sees Ellie (Cozi Zuehlsdorff) switching bodies with her mother Katherine (Heidi Blickenstaff).

title: The Kominsky Method
description: Rachel Argyll (Anna Chancellor) is murdered and her adopted son Jack (Anthony Boyle) is sent to prison for the crime. 18 months later, just as Rachel's husband Leo Argyll (Bill Nighy) is about to marry his secretary, Gwenda Vaughan (Alice Eve), a man (Luke Treadaway) arrives saying he has an alibi for Jack in this latest adaptation of Ag...

title: Origin
description: Disgraced-lawyer-turned-beauty-pageant-coach Bob (Dallas Roberts) helps Patty (Debby Ryan) to become a pageant queen in the dark comedy that was originally developed for The CW.

title: Real Country
description: 12 contestants are dropped off on various islands in Indonesia with few resources at their disposal, no idea where the others are or when the rescue boat will arrive, they must either learn to survive until the help arrives or quit in this reality competition series.

title: She-Ra and the Princesses of Power
description: Actor Harley Mackay (Jerry O’Connell) returns to his Canadian hometown after a public fight and helps solve crimes with his childhood friends: police detective Sam Shaw (Sydney Poitier Heartsong) and coffee truck owner Dave Leigh (Kristian Bruun).

title: Carl Weber's The Family Business
description: Former surfer Sean "Dud" Dudley (Wyatt Russell) joins a fraternal lodge hoping to recapture the happy and simple life he had with his father.

title: Westside (2018)
description: The late-night show from Terence Nance will feature a variety of vignettes that include "vérité documentary, musical performances, surrealist melodrama and humorous animation" to explore topics such as death, romance and history.

title: Momentum Generation
description: Eight contestants will create unique crafts that will be judged by Simon Doonan and Dayna Isom Johnson as well as series creators Amy Poehler and Nick Offerman.

title: Shut Up and Dribble
description: The six-part documentary series features home videos, family photos, and news footage about the life of 17-year-old Trayvon Martin, who was killed in 2012.

title: Homecoming
description: The true crime series focuses on female criminals and features commentary from O.J. Simpson prosecutor/author Marcia Clark.

title: Tell Me a Story
description: The anthology drama is based on the Stephanie Oakes' novel The Sacred Lies of Minnow Bly.

title: Busy Tonight
description: Corporate attorney Joanna Hanley (Kristin Kreuk) returns to to her hometown of Millwood to represent her client but after winning the case, she decides to stay.

title: Patriot Act with Hasan Minhaj
description: Death row attorney Henry (Andre Holland) returns to his hometown of Castle Rock, Maine after receiving a call from Shawshank in this psychological horror series from J.J. Abrams and Stephen King.

title: Chilling Adventures of Sabrina
description: Zachary Quinto hosts this revival of the 1970s-80s investigative series that was hosted by Rod Serling and Leonard Nimoy.

title: Deutschland 86
description: David Farrier travels to some of the most dangerous and or morbid tourist spots such as former nuclear spots in Kazakhstan & Japan, tours about JFK's assassination & Pablo Escobar, a voodoo festival, and a haunted house.

title: Legacies
description: DCI Cadi John (Sian Reese-Williams) and Detective Sergeant Owen Vaughan (Sion Alun Davies) investigate deaths in Wales in this crime drama created by Mark Andrew and Ed Talfan.

title: Bodyguard
description: Sacha Baron Cohen returns to television with a new satirical series.

title: Heathers (2018)
description: The comedy anthology created by Bobcat Goldthwait features a variety of genres.

title: The Woman in White
description: The game show hosted by Kevin Hart features contestants racing through an obstacle course while other four contestants try to knock them off course with.

title: My Dinner with Herve
description: Talon (Jessica Green) is the last surviving member of the Blackbloods. She discovers her supernatural powers and must learn how to control them as she tracks the killers of her family to a fortress on the edge of the civilization in this fantasy series created by Kynan Griffin and Jason Faller.

title: Wanderlust (2018)
description: St. Louis crime reporter Camille Preaker (Amy Adams) returns to her small Missouri hometown for a story about a murder of a young girl and the disappearance of another in this eight-part drama based on the novel by Gillian Flynn.

title: The Rookie
description: Mumbai police officer Sartaj Singh (Saif Ali Khan) is contacted by a thought-to-be-dead-gangster Ganesh Gaitonde (Nawazuddin Siddiqui) and told he has 25 days to save everyone in Mumbai from death in this India drama based on the book by Vikram Chandra.

title: The Kids Are Alright
description: 17-year-old Leila (Tallulah Haddon) meets Tess (Simona Brown) while in Azana, a virtual reality game world and they becomes friends in the real world. When Tess disappears, Leila goes into Azana as Tess to search for what happened to her friend in this adaptation of Lottie Moggach's 2014 novel of the same name.

title: The Conners
description: The three-part BBC miniseries set in 1960-70s follows member of Parliament Jeremy Thorpe (Hugh Grant) as he seeks to permanently hide his affair with stableboy Norman Scott (Ben Whishaw) to protect his political career in Russell T Davies's adaptation of John Preston's book of the same name.

title: The Alec Baldwin Show
description: Liza (Liza Koshy) works various jobs she receives from a gig economy app as she and her friends try to get ahead in the world.

title: Charmed (2018)
description: The game show famous for its green slime returns with Liza Koshy as host and original series host Marc Summers who provides commentary as two teams compete by answering trivia, performing stunts and completing the obstacle course.

title: Pod Save America
description: Doctor Mona Shirani (Archie Panjabi) is devastated when she learns her brother was kidnapped in Pakinstan and her nephew is wanted for questioning by the police after a terrorist bombing in this six-part series created by Paul Rutman and Natasha Narayan.

title: Light as a Feather
description: Former TV cop Sam Swift (Rachel Bilson) seeks a comeback after her televised breakdown by shadowing private investigator Eddie Valetik (Eddie Cibrian) to help with a potential comeback role in this crime drama from Terri Edda Miller and Andrew W. Marlowe.

title: The Romanoffs
description: John Dutton (Kevin Costner) deals with numerous issues involved with owning the largest ranch in the US including water usage, land/oil developers, an Indian reservation, and its neighbor, Yellowstone Park.

title: The Haunting of Hill House
description: Nuri (Michele Weaver) and Yasir (Will Catlett) look back on their lives in 1990s Los Angeles in this drama series created by Mara Brock Akil and Salim Akil.

title: Titans (2018)
description: Each episode features 10 contestants selected by a panel of matchmakers must make an impression to win a chance to win the heart of a "mystery suitor or suitress" in this dating reality show hosted by ex-NFL quarterback and Season 5 Bachelor Jesse Palmer.

title: All American
description: Former spy Max Easton (Mark Strong) is persuaded by ex-MI6 operative George White (Alistair Petrie) to lead The Section, a covert CIA/MI6 team, only to learn he has entered in the middle of an conspiracy to cause havoc in the Middle East.

title: Dancing with the Stars: Juniors
description: The drama based on George Pendle's novel Strange Angel: The Otherworldly Life of Rocket Scientist John Whiteside Parsons follows janitor-turned-scientist Jack (Jack Reynor) as he becomes involved in 1930s the dark underbelly of 1930s Los Angles and a disciple of occultist Aleister Crowley.

title: Dancing Queen
description: The latest Gordon Ramsay reality show finds the chef trying to save failing restaurants by revamping them in 24 hours.

title: Elite
description: Executive produced by Viola Davis and Julius Tennon, the seven-part documentary series follows the death row cases of Darlie Routier and Julius Jones.

title: Into The Dark
description: Set in the 1970s Los Angeles, Bonnie Nolan (Alica Silverstone) struggles to raise her two her two daughters as a single mother with the help of her two best friends, Kathleen (Mena Suvari) and Diana (Jennifer Bartels).

title: Queen of the World
description: Tandy Bowen (Olivia Holt), who grew up privileged until an accident changed her life, crosses paths with the working-class Tyrone Johnson (Aubrey Joseph). They soon discover their superpowers are linked together as their feelings grow for each other in this coming-of-age drama based on the comic book series.

title: Happy Together
description: 16-year-old Henrietta "Henry" Coles(Maddie Hasson) has always felt different, when she learns she can teleport after being in danger, in this Doug Liman sci-fi series based on one of Steven Gould's Jumper novels.

title: The Neighborhood
description: Based on James Grady's novel Six Days of the Condor and the 1975 film Three Days of the Condor, CIA analyst Joe Turner (Max Irons) must go on the run when his discovery of a plan that could jeopardize millions of lives causes the death of his colleagues.

title: Star Wars Resistance
description: Based on Sarai Walker’s book of the same name, the dark comedy follows Plum Kettle (Joy Nash) a ghost writer for her boss (Julianna Margulies), a fashion magazine editor, as she plans for weight-loss surgery and becomes involved with an underground feminist group.

title: The Cry
description: The latest Ryan Murphy series is set in 1980s New York City and will explore "the rise of the luxury Trump-era universe, the downtown social and literary scene and the ball culture world."

title: God Friended Me
description: When Logan Roy (Brian Cox) announces his plans to step back from running the family's multi-national entertainment company, a feud over who will be have control causes tension among his four children.

title: The Cool Kids
description: Cormoran Strike is a war veteran-turned-private detective in this series based on the novels written by J.K. Rowling under the pseudonym Robert Galbraith. It was released in the UK on BBC One under the name Strike.

title: King Lear
description: Former hostage negotiator Mara Kint (Sarah Shahi) is asked by her former boss (Dennis Haysbert) to help save people who have become lost within the virtual reality system created by the company he now works for in this sci-fi series created by Mickey Fisher.

title: A Million Little Things
description: After a series of murders in New York and Sweden, New York detective Tommy Conley (Dominic Monaghan) is sent to Sweden to work with Stockholm homicide detective Stockholm Mikael Eklund (Michael Nyqvist) to find the killer.

title: Single Parents
description: The Peter Kunhardt documentary about Senator John McCain's life and career features interviews, archival newsreel, home movies and personal photos.

title: The Mayo Clinic: Faith - Hope - Science
description: The four-part documentary series directed by Liz Garbus features the editors and reporters at The New York Times as they cover President Trump's first year.

title: New Amsterdam (2018)
description: The Daily Show writer/contributor Michelle Wolf is hosting a weekly half-hour talk show on Netflix.

title: FBI
description: The disappearance of three girls and a teacher from the Appleyard Ladies College in 1900 leads to an investigation that includes English headmistress Mrs Hester Appleyard (Natalie Dormer) in this drama series based on the Australian novel by Joan Lindsay and inspired by Peter Weir’s 1975 film of the same name.

title: Mr Inbetween
description: The British drama from Abi Morgan, divorce attorney Hannah Stern (Nicola Walker) leaves her family's firm after her mother (Deborah Findlay) refuses to give her a promotion. Hannah joins a rival firm where her ex (Barry Atsma) also works and soon faces off against her family in a case.

title: Magnum P.I. (2018)
description: The latest adaptation of Louisa May Alcott classic coming of age novel about the March sisters: Meg (Willa Fitzgerald), Jo (Maya Hawke), Beth (Annes Elwy), Amy (Kathryn Newton), as they learn about family, love and loss with the help of their mother Marmee (Emily Watson).

title: Manifest
description: The five-episode limited series based on the novels by Edward St. Aubyn spans several decades of Patrick Melrose's (Benedict Cumberbatch) life that included physical abuse from his father (Hugo Weaving), a mother (Jennifer Jason Leigh) who did nothing to stop it, alcoholism, heroin addiction, recovery, marriage, and fatherhood.

title: The Good Cop
description: The Dreamworks reboot of the classic cartoon about the adventures of Rocket J. Squirrel (voiced by Tara Strong) and Bullwinkle J. Moose (voiced by Brad Norman).

title: Maniac (2018)
description: A group of high school graduates celebrate Grad Night by attempting to complete their unfulfilled dreams before high school is over forever in this AwesomenessTV comedy series created by Jason Ubaldi.

title: Dead Lucky
description: The disappearance of one of the daughters of surgeon Tom Delaney (Michael C. Hall) leads him to the discover dark secrets about the people around him in this drama series created by Harlan Coben.

title: I Feel Bad
description: The second docuseries from the Duplass brothers for Netflix looks into a 2003 bank robbery in Pennsylvania by a pizza delivery man with a bomb around his neck.

title: The Hunt for the Trump Tapes with Tom Arnold
description: Estranged sisters Emma (Mishel Prada) and Lyn (Melissa Barrera) return to the Eastside of Los Angeles after the death of their mother, where they must deal with the family business and discover secrets about their mother in the half-hour drama.

title: Sorry for Your Loss
description: Julie Bowen, Candace Cameron Bure, Mark Cuban, Billy Eichner, Taraji P. Henson, Derek Hough, DJ Khaled, Lisa Kudrow, Brittany Snow, Wanda Sykes and Finn Wolfhard are some of the guests who will ask a panel of five-to-nine-year-olds for advice on everyday problems in this comedy series co-hosted by Carol Burnett and Russell Peters.

title: Warriors of Liberty City
description: The five-part docuseries follows tennis champion Serena Williams as she begins her journey into motherhood.

title: Forever (2018)
description: A brother and sister emerge from their shelter six years after a virus wiped out much of the Scandinavia's population in this Danish sci-fi horror created by Jannik Tai Mosholt

title: The First
description: 30 years after the 1984 All Valley Karate Tournament, Daniel LaRusso (Ralph Macchio) is running a successful car dealerships business while his old rival Johnny Lawrence (William Zabka) is seeking to turn his life around by reopening the Cobra Kai dojo.

title: The Dragon Prince
description: The four-part miniseries directed by Dawn Porter features interview, rare and never-before-seen footage, as it explores the career of the U.S. senator/U.S. Attorney General/presidential candidate before he was assassinated in 1968.

title: Norm MacDonald Has a Show
description: The British comedy panel game show hosted by Greg Davies and Alex Horne features five comedians who try to complete the tasks given to them to win the most points. [Premiered originally in the UK on Dave on 28 Jul 2015; in the US, the CW begins with episodes from Season 8 on 2 Aug 2020]

title: REL
description: The two-part three-hour film takes a look at the pop legend's life up until the 1976 Jungle Room recording sessions with new interviews, never-before seen pictures and video.

title: YOU
description: The late night show from the former The Daily Show writer and correspondent will feature documentary field report and commentary about social and cultural problems in America.

title: The Miniaturist
description: The six-part crime thriller from Harry and Jack Williams begins a murder suspect killed by a police sniper and scarred DCI Gabriel Markham (Richard Dormer) finding a crucial clue to a murder and works backwards to the beginning of the case.

title: Harrow
description: The remake of the 1960s series is set 30 years in the future where the Robinson family led by John (Toby Stephens) and Maureen Robinson (Molly Parker) are stranded with Dr. Smith (Parker Posey) and Don West (Ignacio Serricchio) on a planet far-away from their destination.

title: The Bobby Brown Story
description: Jason Hehir's documentary about the life of the WWE star features interviews from Billy Crystal, Ric Flair, Hulk Hogan, Vince McMahon, Rob Reiner, and Arnold Schwarzenegger.

title: Mayans M.C.
description: Kenneth Lonergan's adaptation of the classic E.M. Forster novel about sisters Margaret (Hayley Atwell) and Helen Schlegel (Philippa Coulthard) as they seek love and purpose in turn of the century England.

title: The Purge (2018)
description: Written by Phoebe Waller-Bridge, the adaptions of the novellas by Luke Jennings follows the cat-and-mouse chase by MI5 security officer Eve (Sandra Oh) for the international assassin, who goes by the name Villanelle (Jodie Comer).

title: Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan
description: Originally aired in the UK beginning in 2015, DCI Cassie Stuart (Nicola Walker) and DS Sunny Khan (Sanjeev Bhaskar) investigate cold cases.

title: Kidding
description: Directed by Barry Levinson, the film focuses on Penn State's football coach Joe Paterno (Al Pacino) as the story of the Jerry Sandusky sexual abuse scandal breaks and ultimately leads to Paterno's termination.

title: One Dollar
description: The Jersey Shore crew Deena Nicole Cortese, Paul “Pauly D” Delvecchio,” Jenni “JWOWW” Farley, Vinny Guadagnino, Ronnie Ortiz-Magro, Nicole “Snooki” Polizzi and Mike “The Situation” Sorrentino reunites as they go on vacation in Miami.

title: America to Me
description: Children's book author Stephen Lewis (Benedict Cumberbatch) and his wife, Julie (Kelly Macdonald) try to come to terms with the disappearance of their four-year daughter in this adaptation of Ian McEwan's novel of the same name.

title: Safe Harbour
description: NBC's latest live musical is be a concert staging of Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber's rock opera at Brooklyn's Marcy Armory with John Legend as Jesus, Sara Bareilles as Mary Magdalene, Brandon Victor Dixon as Judas, Alice Cooper as King Herod, Ben Daniels as Pontius Pilate, Norm Lewis as Caiaphas, Jin Ha as Annas, Jason Tam as Peter an...

title: The Innocents (2018)
description: Tracy Morgan is an ex-con who returns to Brooklyn after a 15-year sentence to find his ex-girlfriend (Tiffany Haddish) raising their twins (Taylor Mosby & Dante Hoagland) with her white husband (Ryan Gaul) in this comedy created by Morgan, Jordan Peele and John Carcieri.

title: Betty White: First Lady of Television
description: The eight-part documentary series produced by Mass Appeal about the impact of rap culture and the lives of hip-hop artists such as 2 Chainz, A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Dave East, G-Eazy, Logic, Nas, Rapsody, T.I., and producer Just Blaze.

title: The Last Sharknado: It's About Time
description: The McKenna boys (Gabriel Bateman, Drew Logan Powell and Kyan Zielinski) come to terms with the death of their father (Chris Diamantopoulos) with the help of a book he left them in this comedy from Bryan Cranston and Greg Mottola that was inspired by Conn and Hal Iggulden's book of the same name.

title: Esme & Roy
description: Marine biologists Ben (Alex Roe) and Maddie (Fola Evans-Akingbola) investigate the reasons Ryn (Eline Powell) appeared on the streets of Bristol Cove, a town where it said it once was the home to mermaids.

title: Disenchantment
description: In this sitcom based on Alex Blumberg’s Gimlet Media podcast "StartUp," a journalist (Zach Braff) quits his job to start his own company.

title: All About the Washingtons
description: Based on a Danish comedy of the same name, After 12 years of marriage Lena (Jenna Fischer) and Martin (Oliver Hudson) divorce but live in the same house with their three kids.

title: Freaky Friday
description: The two-part documentary by Judd Apatow about the comedian features interviews with over 40 friends and family, including James L. Brooks, Jim Carrey, Sacha Baron Cohen, David Coulier, Jon Favreau, Jay Leno, Kevin Nealon, Conan O’Brien, Bob Saget, Jerry Seinfeld and Sarah Silverman.

title: Ordeal By Innocence
description: The 10-part documentary series hosted by Will Smith from Darren Aronofsky and Nutopia features former astronauts talking about what makes Earth so unique to the universe.

title: Insatiable
description: Low-level hitman Barry (Bill Hader) travels to Los Angeles to kill an would-be actor and finds his calling may actually be to act in this comedy from Hader and Alec Berg.

title: Castaways
description: The Getty Family drama begins with John Paul Getty III's (Harris Dickinson kidnapping in 1973.

title: Carter
description: The fictional account of the Royal Navy's expedition led by Sir John Franklin (Ciaran Hinds) in 1847 to locate the Northwest Passage is based on Dan Simmons's 2007 novel of the same name where the crew on the HMS Terror are trapped in the ice and attacked by an unknown entity.

title: Lodge 49
description: Even as Alexa (Paris Berelc) deals with losing her hair from chemotherapy to treat her cancer and starting her freshman year at high school, she has the support of her best friend Katie (Isabel May) and her family, including her overprotective mother (Tiffani Thiessen).

title: Random Acts Of Flyness
description: The second spinoff of Grey's Anatomy focuses on lives of Seattle's Fire Station 19 that includes Captain Pruitt Herrera (Miguel Sandoval) and his crew of firefighters and EMTs: Andy Herrera (Jaina Lee Ortiz), Dr. Ben Warren (Jason George), Jack Gibson (Grey Damon), Victoria Hughes (Barrett Doss), Ryan Tanner (Alberto Frezza), Travis Mont...

title: Making It
description: The fate of the planet Krypton is in the hands of Superman's grandfather Seg-El (Cameron Cuffe) in this sci-fi series from David S. Goyer and Ian Goldberg also features Brainiac (Blake Ritson) and Adam Strange (Shaun Sipos).

title: Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story
description: Refugees from 150 years in the future seek refuge in a small town in the present time in this sci-fi drama written by Dan Dworkin and Jay Beattie.

title: Pink Collar Crimes
description: Hosted by Neil Patrick Harris, 12 teams of three children 12 and under compete over five rounds of intellectual challenges to be named Genius Junior.

title: Sacred Lies
description: Based on James Patterson's novel named Dr. Death centers on Dylan Reinhart (Alan Cumming), an ex-CIA operative turned professor who is pulled back into his old life when the NYPD seeks his help in apprehending a serial killer.

title: Burden of Truth
description: The Duplass brothers-produced six-part documentary series about an Indian guru who wanted to build a 64,000-acre utopia from Chapman and Maclain Way features archival footage and interviews with the people and followers in the small Oregon town.

title: Castle Rock (2018)
description: English teacher Lou Mazzuchelli (Josh Radnor) brings excitement and inspiration to his high school's theater department in this drama from Jason Katims and Jeffrey Seller inspired by the teacher at the center of Michael Sokolove's non-fiction book, Drama High.

title: In Search Of (2018)
description: The legal drama set in New York City's Southern District of New York Federal Court, Allison (Jasmin Savoy Brown) and her roommate Sandra (Britt Robertson) work at the Federal Public Defender’s Office.

title: Dark Tourist
description: After his illusionist career is ruined, Cameron Black (Jack Cutmore-Scott) wants to locate the man who exposed all his secrets. He tries to convince FBI agent Kay Daniels that a recent case was not an explosion but a illusion. and her partner Special Agent Mike Alvarez

title: Hidden
description: Amateur bakers compete for a $10,000 prize in the reality baking competition series hosted by Nicole Byer and Jacques Torres.

title: Who Is America?
description: An investigation in the shooting death of a pizza delivery man leads Detective Inspector Kip Glaspie (Carey Mulligan) includes corruption and cover-ups in this four-part limited series from David Hare.

title: Bobcat Goldthwait's Misfits & Monsters
description: The world of police gangs is explored in this drama series created by Joe Halpin finds Tom Hammond (Sean Bean), former leader of the police gang The Ravens, out from jail and seeking to return to his old role which had since been taken over by his son, Steve (Ryan Kwanten). While Tom was in prison, The Vipers, the rival cop gang led by T...

title: TKO: Total Knock Out
description: Brooklyn gym owner Vince (Anders Holm) lives with his younger brother (Andy Favreau) and was ready to sell his gym and move to Florida when his old high school fling Priya (Mindy Kaling) arrives with his 15-tear-old son (J.J. Totah) in this comedy from Charlie Grandy and Mindy Kaling.

title: The Outpost
description: While investigating the death of a hacker, Detective Chief Inspector Robert Hicks (Jim Sturgess) and Detective Inspector Elaine Renko (Agyness Deyn) discover proof the world has five years before an apocalyptic event destroys the planet in this drama from Neil Cross.

title: Sharp Objects
description: Stella (Lucy Hale) was told she had terminal cancer and for the past eight years had been living life as if she would die soon, including marrying after a whirlwind romance with Wes (Elliot Knight). However, when she discovers she's been cured, she and her family must learn to live life again.

title: Sacred Games
description: Stephen (David Mitchell) looks to take over running the family pub after the death of his father when Andrew (Robert Webb), a foster brother reappears in this British comedy created by Simon Blackwell. [Originally premiered in the UK on Channel 4 on 6 Sep 2017; aired in the US on Sundance Now on 16 Nov 2017 and on SundanceTV on 7 Mar ...

title: Kiss Me First
description: Directors Drea Cooper and Zackary Canepari along with photojournalist Jessica Dimmock followed the police department as they dealt with crime and budget cuts for over a year as the city of Flint welcomed a new mayor and new police chief.

title: A Very English Scandal
description: Despite orders to share information about potential terrorists with John O'Neill (Jeff Daniels), the head of the New York FBI's Counter-Terrorism unit, CIA analyst Martin Schmidt (Peter Sarsgaard) withholds it, believing only the CIA can handle terrorist threats in this 10-part drama based on Lawrence Wright's non-fiction book about how ...

title: Liza on Demand
description: Detective Greg Kading (Josh Duhamel) and Detective Russell Poole (Jimmi Simpson) revisits the murders of Tupac Shakur (Marcc Rose) and The Notorious B.I.G. (Wavyy Jonez) in this true crime drama.

title: Double Dare (2018)
description: Alex Godman (James Norton), the British-raised son of an exiled Mafia man, has honest career as a fund manager and happy life with girlfriend Rebecca (Juliet Rylance) when he is forced into the international crime underworld to protect his family in this drama created by Hossein Amini and James Watkins (Black Mirror, The Take) and inspir...

title: Next of Kin
description: Beth (Christina Hendricks), convinces her best friend Ruby, (Retta) and her younger sister Annie (Mae Whitman) to hold up a grocery store, but things become complicated after the store manager may have seen one of them in this drama from Jenna Bans.

title: Take Two
description: After the death of a friend, Chip Curry (Jay R. Ferguson) decides to live his life by the rules in the Bible in this comedy based on A.J. Jacobs' book The Year of Living Biblically.

title: Yellowstone (2018)
description: Astronaut Gary (voiced by Olan Rogers) befriends a cute alien named Mooncake (also Rogers) who is being sought after by the Lord Commander (David Tennant) to use for his own evil plans in the animated sci-fi comedy created by Rogers.

title: Love Is ___
description: The anthology crime drama from Veena Sud is set in Jersey City, New Jersey and based on the 2013 Russian film, The Major.

title: The Proposal
description: The documentary series follows chef David Chang and food writer Peter Meehan as they talk about food and culture while visiting restaurants from around the world.

title: Deep State
description: Set in 1827 London, river police Inspector John Marlott (Sean Bean) discovers a body composed of several other bodies in this Frankenstein re-imagined period crime drama created by Benjamin Ross and Barry Langford.

title: Strange Angel
description: The former The Soup host returns to talking about pop culture and news of the day with a new weekly half-hour series on Netflix.

title: Gordon Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
description: Set in 1996, teenagers in the high school's A/V Club and Drama Club come together to make a movie in their hometown of Boring, Oregon.

title: The Last Defense
description: The first of two standup specials on Netflix for Chris Rock is his first in over 10 years.

title: American Woman
description: Both Kate (Shoshanna Stern) and her best friend Michael (Josh Feldman) are deaf and they juggle life and relationships in this dramedy created by Stern and Feldman.

title: Marvel's Cloak & Dagger
description: The animated comedy about the 45th president and his White House was executive produced by Stephen Colbert, R.J. Fried, and Chris Licht.

title: Impulse
description: The seemingly perfect family of philosophy professor Greg Bishop (Tim Robbins), his lawyer wife Audrey (Holly Hunter), their three adopted children (Jerrika Hinton, Raymond Lee and Daniel Zovatto) and one biological daughter (Sosie Bacon) is tested when one of the kids starts seeing things in this Alan Ball drama.

title: Condor
description: The reboot of the Bravo series on Netflix begins in Atlanta and introduces a new Fab Five: food and wine advisor Bobby Berk, culture advisor Karamo Brown, fashion advisor France, stylist advisor Antoni Porowski, and design advisor Jonathan Van Ness.

title: Dietland
description: The documentary series from Matthew Heineman focuses on all sides of the drug epidemic, from the growers in Mexico, the police in Ohio and the two families impacted by addiction.

title: Pose
description: The sci-fi series based on Richard K. Morgan's 2002 novel Carbon is set 300 years in the future where soldier Takeshi Kovacs (Will Yun Lee/Joel Kinnaman) awakens in a new body when he is freed from prison by Laurens Bancroft (James Purefoy), who wants him to solve his murder.

title: Succession
description: FBI agent Emily Byrne (Stana Katic) disappeared six years ago while searching for a serial killer, when she reappears without any memory of those years, she finds her family has moved on and soon becomes a suspect in a string of murders.

title: C.B. Strike
description: The comedy podcast with Jessica Williams and Phoebe Robinson becomes a series of TV specials with guest appearances from Uzo Aduba, Tituss Burgess, Sarah Jessica Parker, and Jon Stewart.

title: Reverie
description: After losing out on a dream job, Harvard philosophy academic Jack Griffin (Glenn Howerton) returns to his hometown of Toledo, Ohio to teach AP (Advanced Placement) Biology and clashes with the Principal Durbin (Patton Oswalt) in this comedy from Mike O’Brien, Seth Meyers and Lorne Michaels.

title: 100 Code
description: Based on the Step Up film franchise, the drama series is centered at Atlanta's High Water Performing Arts School run by Sage Odom (Ne-Yo) and Collette (Naya Rivera) where twins Janelle (Lauryn McClain) and Tal (Petrice Jones) transfer to from Ohio and meet Dondre (Marcus Mitchell).

title: John McCain: For Whom the Bell Tolls
description: The five-part documentary series follows Rose McGowan as she gets ready to release her memoir and manifesto called BRAVE.

title: The Fourth Estate
description: The documentary series from Alex Gibney focuses on cases of fraudulence and misconduct by businesses including Volkswagen, TRUMP Inc., HSBC, the pharmaceutical industry, payday lenders, and the Canadian maple syrup industry.

title: The Break with Michelle Wolf
description: Joe (Matt Jones), the son of “The Godfather of Aerobics,” takes over his father's gym and faces off with his rival Barry Cross (Chris Diamantopoulos) om the National Aerobics Championships in this comedy created by Connor Pritchard, Dan Newmark and Ben Newmark.

title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
description: The six-part series chronicles the events that led to the 51-day standoff between the Branch Davidians, led by David Koresh (Taylor Kitsch); the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF); and the FBI, including lead FBI negotiator, Gary Noesner (Michael Shannon).

title: The Split
description: Detective Annie Ryder (Anna Paquin) investigates the disappearance of high school hockey star Jesse Sweetland (Sadie O'Neil) that may be related to a murder in the same small town 20 years ago while dealing with her on-and-off-again relationship with Eddie (Allen Leech), her boss Chief Peter Welland (Shawn Doyle) and someone from her pas...

title: Little Women (2018)
description: The adaptation of Caleb Carr's novel set in 1895 where after a series of murders of prostitutes in New York City causes police commissioner (and future president) Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Geraghty) to ask for help from an alienist (aka criminal psychologist) Dr. Laszlo Kreizler (Daniel Brühl) and New York Times society illustrator John ...

title: Patrick Melrose
description: Premiering on the Mosaic app as a branching narrative drama, the more linear six-part miniseries from Steven Soderbergh and Ed Solomon centers on the disappearance of children's book author/illustrator Olivia Lake (Sharon Stone) and the two men she knew: Joel (Garrett Hedlund), and Eric (Frederick Weller).

title: The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle
description: Senior resident Dr. Conrad Hawkins (Matt Czuchry) mentors first year resident Dr. Devon Pravesh (Manish Dayal) while juggling his on-and-off again relationship with nurse Nicolette Nevin (Emily VanCamp) and dealing with the Chief of Surgery Dr. Randolph Bell (Bruce Greenwood).

title: All Night
description: Airing simultaneously on AMC, BBC America, IFC, SundanceTV, and WE tv, the seven-part mini-series takes a look at life in the world's oceans with narration by David Attenborough.

title: Safe (2018)
description: Created by Jez Butterworth, Tom Butterworth and James Richardson, Gen Aulus Plautius (David Morrissey) leads the Roman Imperial Army to conquer Britannia, only to find not only druids but other Celtic tribes who will not willing bend to Rome's will in this co-production between Sky and Amazon Prime Video.

title: Evil Genius
description: Junior-executives-in-training Matt and Jake (Matt Ingebretson and Jake Weisman) deal with the pains of working for Hampton Deville CEO Christian DeVille (Lance Reddick) and his top executives, John and Kate (Adam Lustick and Anne Dudek) with only one helpful friend in Human Resources rep Grace (Aparna Nancherla).

title: Vida
description: Jefferson Pierce (Cress Williams) had retired from his secret identity of Black Lightning many years ago, but when danger threatens his twenty-something daughter, Jennifer (Nafessa Williams), and a student at her school is being lured by a gang, he returns to the fight.

title: A Little Help with Carol Burnett
description: The sci-fi anthology series based on Philip K. Dick's short stories features 10 standalone episodes adapted by such writers/producers as Michael Dinner, David Farr, Matthew Graham, Francesca Gregorini, Tony Grisoni, Peter Horton, Jessica Mecklenburg ,Ronald D. Moore, Dee Rees, and Alan Taylor.

title: Being Serena
description: David Letterman returns to the talk show world with a monthly series and the six-episode first season will include President Barack Obama, George Clooney, Tina Fey, Jay-Z, Malala Yousafzai, and Howard Stern.

title: The Rain
description: Esther (Esther Povitsky) and Benji (Benji Aflalo) are best friends who help each other deal with life in Los Angeles.

title: Cobra Kai
description: The coming-of-age drama from Common, Elwood Reid, and Lena Waithe follows a group of residents in the South Side of Chicago including Brandon (Jason Mitchell), who dreams of opening up a restaurant with his girlfriend (Tiffany Boone) but is torn by his responsibilities toward his younger brother Coogie (Jahking Guillory) and their alcoho...

title: Bobby Kennedy for President
description: Previously known as Five to Survive and hosted by Fred Savage, adult contestants must answer 10 questions correctly to win. If they answer incorrectly, they can ask for help from a group of kids between the ages of six and nine, who will be asked the question by Ricky Gervais.

title: Taskmaster
description: Hosted by Fergie, four finalists are challenged by new contestants each week in this singing competition reality series that includes Sean "Diddy" Combs, DJ Khaled, Meghan Trainor, and record label exec Charlie Walk as judges.

title: Elvis Presley: The Searcher
description: Sue (Miranda Richardson), Linda (Phyllis Logan), and Gail (Zoë Wanamaker) are three friends of a certain age who support each other through the trials and tribulations of life in this British drama created by Kay Mellor.

title: Wyatt Cenac's Problem Areas
description: Angela Bassett, Connie Britton, Kenneth Choi, Rockmond Dunbar, Aisha Hinds, Peter Krause, and Oliver Stark star as some of the first responders in this procedural drama from Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk.

title: Rellik
description: The spin-off of ABC's Black-ish follows eldest daughter Zoey Johnson (Yara Shahidi) as she begins her freshman year at Southern California University.

title: Lost in Space (2018)
description: Captain Dave (Dylan McDermott) and his flight crew fly every weekend from Burbank to Vegas in this workplace comedy produced by Will Ferrell and Adam McKay.

title: Andre the Giant
description: Nelson "Nelly" Rowe (Lennie James) searches for his missing estranged 13-year-old daughter who he has not seen for over 10 years. [Premiered originally in the UK on Sky Atlantic on 28 Feb 2018 and on Starz in the US on 6 Sep 2018; in the US, Season 2 to air on Peacock in Nov 2020 under the title: Save Me Too]

title: Howards End
description: The spin-off of Tyler Perry's TBS comedy "House of Payne" finds Ella and Curtis Payne (Cassi Davis and LaVan Davis) retired but a death in the family finds them going to Florida and getting involved in a real estate deal.

title: Killing Eve
description: The four-part documentary miniseries takes a look at the history, culture and influence of Native Americas in North and South America.

title: Unforgotten
description: 22-year old Tess (Ella Purnell) faces the fast-paced world of her new job at an exclusive restaurant in New York City in this adaptation the novel of the same name by series creator Stephanie Danler.

title: Paterno
description: The coming of age comedy co-created by Lauren Iungerich, Eddie Gonzalez, and Jeremy Haft follows Cesar (Diego Tinoco), Ruby (Jason Genao), Monse (Sierra Capri), and Jamal (Brett Gray) as they navigate high school and life in South central Los Angeles.

title: Jersey Shore Family Vacation
description: A teacher (Joe Pera) from Michigan's Upper Peninsula talks to the audience about a variety of everyday topics such as breakfast, sleeping and dancing in this comedy series created by Pera.

title: The Child in Time
description: Captain Joe Martin (Jeremy Neumark Jones) arrives with his new wife, Honor (Jessie Buckley), to take over the Royal Military Police unit in British-occupied Aden (in what is now Yemen) in the 1965.

title: Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert
description: The three-part BBC miniseries written by Ronan Bennet focuses on Robert Catesby (Kit Harington), a Catholic man who after seeing his fellow English Catholics persecuted by Robert Cecil (Mark Gatiss), plans to assassinate of King James (Derek Riddell) and blow up the Palace of Westminster in what would be called the Gunpowder Plot in 1605...

title: The Last O.G.
description: Many of the games seen on Ellen DeGeneres' daytime talk show appear on this hour-long reality competition series, where contestants compete over four rounds of games for a chance to win a cash prize.

title: Rapture
description: The Tony-nominated musical (itself based on the 1983 movie) is the latest live production for Fox, with adult Raphie (Matthew Broderick) telling the story how his mother (Maya Rudolph) disapproved of his desire for a Red Ryder BB gun as a nine-year-old.

title: The Dangerous Book for Boys
description: Eric Olsen seeks to find the truth behind his father death and his connection to the CIA in this series including interviews, archival footage and reenactments featuring Peter Sarsgaard, Molly Parker, Christian Camargo, Tim Blake Nelson, Bob Balaban, Jimmi Simpson and Michael Chernus.

title: Siren (2018)
description: Howard Silk (J.K. Simmons) works as a low-level employee at a Berlin-based spy agency when he discovers his employers protect an opening to a parallel dimension. In the other dimension, he meets his counterpart named Prime (J.K. Simmons) in this sci-fi thriller created by Justin Marks.

title: Alex, Inc.
description: Shawn Spencer (James Roday) and best friend, Burton “Gus” Guster (Dulé Hill) are working in San Francisco when one of their friends becomes a target.

title: Splitting Up Together
description: Nick Sax (Christopher Meloni) is a former-cop-turned-hit-man who meets an imaginary blue-winged horse named Happy (Patton Osw) after a hit job goes wrong in this series based on the graphic novel of the same name by Grant Morrison and Darick Robertson.

title: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling
description: Sir Landry (Tom Cullen) heads up the Knights Templar's search for the Holy Grail in the historical drama series about the the events that will eventually lead to the deaths of the knights on Friday the 13th, 1307.

title: One Strange Rock
description: The life and career of the Washington Post editor Ben Bradley is illustrated by archival footage, interviews, home movies, and photos in this documentary directed by John Maggio.

title: Barry
description: The disappearance of two children in a German town leads to secrets of four families and a link to something supernatural in 1986 in this mystery thriller written by Jantje Friese and directed by Baran bo Odar.

title: Trust
description: Spike Lee's 1986 film is updated into a 10-episodes series where Brooklyn artist Nola Darling (DeWanda Wise) deals with work, friends and three lovers: model Greer Childs (Cleo Anthony), investment banker Jamie Overstreet (Lyriq Bent) and “Da Original B-Boy Sneakerhead” Mars Blackmon (Anthony Ramos).

title: The Terror
description: The seven-part limited series created by Scott Frank focuses on Roy Goode (Jack O’Connell), who hides out in the women-dominated mining town of La Belle, NM after betraying his mentor, the criminal outlaw Frank Griffin (Jeff Daniels), who is hot on heels for revenge.

title: Alexa & Katie
description: Six teenagers: Alex Wilder (Rhenzy Feliz), Nico Minoru (Lyrica Okano), Karolina Dean (Virginia Gardner), Gert Yorkes (Ariela Barer), Chase Stein (Gregg Sulkin), and Molly Hernandez (Allegra Acosta) unite against The Pride (a.k.a their parents): Catherine and Geoffrey Wilder (Angel Parker and Ryan Sands); Robert and Tina Minoru (James Yae...

title: Station 19
description: The Daredevil spin-off follows Frank Castle/The Punisher (Jon Bernthal) as he tracks down a hacker named Micro (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) to locate those who killed his family while Homeland Security agents Dinah Madani (Amber Rose Revah) tries to locate Frank.

title: Krypton
description: Paul Reiser's period comedy about 19-year-old Andy Klavin (Ian Nelson) who joins The Tonight Show as a gofer in 1972 premieres on Hulu after Seeso announced it will shut down by the end of 2017.

title: The Crossing (2018)
description: After attaining the top score of his favorite video game, janitor Josh Futturman (Josh Hutcherson) is told by future warriors Tiger and Wolf (Eliza Coupe and Derek Wilson) he must travel through time to stop an invasion that will end humanity in this sci-fi action comedy from Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg.

title: Genius Junior
description: The adaptation of the Australian comedy of the same name from Will Ferrell, Adam McKay, and Funny Or Die features two cops (co-creator Patrick Brammall and Tim Meadows) working a drug cartel bust, two criminals who don't really know what is going on, two dispatchers who do not really get along and two Mexicans digging a very small tunnel...

title: Instinct
description: The comedy series about dating was created by Emily Axford and Brian K. Murphy.

title: Wild Wild Country
description: The eight-part limited series based on the book by ABC chief global affairs correspondent Martha Raddatz focuses on the ambush on the Fort Hood soldiers and their Iraqi interpreter on April 4, 2004 in Iraq's Sadr City.

title: Rise
description: Julia (Anna Maxwell Martin) struggles with balancing life as a mother without the help of her own mother when she meets Type A mom, Amanda (Lucy Punch); single mom, Liz (Diane Morgan); and stay-at-home-dad, Kevin (Paul Ready Utopia) in this British comedy from Sharon Horgan, Graham Linehan, Helen Linehan, and Holly Walsh.

title: For The People
description: 20-something Bridgette (Frankie Shaw) tries to balance relationships, work, sex, and life as single mother in this comedy adapted from Shaw's 2015 Sundance Film Festival Jury award-winning short film of the same name.

title: Deception (2018)
description: Faith Howells (Eve Myles) search for her husband Evan (Bradley Freegard), who disappeared on his way to work, uncovers corruption and crime in this Welsh drama created and written by Matthew Hall. [Premiered originally in Welsh on S4C under the name Un Bore Mercher on 5 November 2017. Aired in English on BBC Wales on 13 Feb 2018 and O...

title: Nailed It!
description: The second television series adaptation in 2017 from a Margaret Atwood novel is based on the true story of Irish immigrant in Canada named Grace Marks (Sarah Gadon), who in 1843 was convicted of murdering her employer and the housekeeper with the help of a stable hand named James McDermott (Kerr Logan).

title: Collateral (2018)
description: Former Marine Daniel “Hondo” Harrelson (Shemar Moore) is a S.W.A.T. sergeant given the task of running a specialized tactical unit in this police drama inspired by the Aaron Spelling's 1970s series and 2003 film of the same name.

title: The Oath
description: Mothers LeeAnne Walters (Betsy Brandt), Melissa Mays (Marin Ireland) and community activist Nayyirah Shariff (Jill Scott) team up to discover what is up with the water in Flint in this TV movie inspired by the real-life events.

title: Champions
description: Rapper Snoop Dogg hosts this reboot of the 1970s-80s game show with cameos from Wiz Khalifia, Karlie Kloss, Method Man, Kelly Osbourne, Regis Philbin, Seth Rogen, Michael Strahan, and Karrueche Tran.

title: Hard Sun
description: Method Man and Hailey Baldwin hosts this comedic rap battle competition based on a segment featured on The Late Late Show.

title: Life Sentence
description: The comedic homemaking show created by Amy Sedaris and Paul Dinello will feature a variety of comics such as Rachel Dratch, Chris Elliott and Paul Giamatti appear as guest experts.

title: Back
description: Based on the graphic novel by Charles S. Forman, the British dramedy follows Alyssa (Jessica Barden) and self-described psychopath James (Alex Lawther) as they go on a road trip to find Alyssa's father after she has a fight with her mother.

title: Flint Town
description: Josh Greenbaum's documentary about the short-lived comedy The Dana Carvey Show features interviews with Dana Carvey, Robert Smigel, Stephen Colbert, Steve Carell, Jon Glaser and Robert Carlock.

title: The Looming Tower
description: The Hastings funeral home in the town of La Rochelle, Georgia is not your average funeral home, they also provide "afetrlife care" and the family have deep knowledge of the dark arts to deal with the paranormal forces around town.

title: Unsolved: The Murders of Tupac and The Notorious B.I.G.
description: Ken Swallow (Jason Alexander) takes his family that includes his wife Maggie (Amy Pietz), daughter Ria (Natalie Sharp), oldest son Sam (Nick Marini), adopted son Jermaine (Tim Johnson Jr.) and youngest daughter Casey (Maddie Dixon-Poirier), on a tour bus to become the best family band.

title: McMafia
description: Up and coming comedian Floyd Mooney (Jay Pharoah) tries to keep his integrity as he gains mainstream fame in this comedy from Jamie Foxx and Tom Kapinos.

title: Good Girls
description: The David Fincher series set in the 1979 where two FBI special agents (Holt McCallany and Jonathan Groff) in the Elite Serial Crime Unit create profiling techniques to solve cases was based on the Mark Olshaker and John E. Douglas book Mind Hunter: Inside FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit.

title: Living Biblically
description: The late-night talk show hosted by former head writer for The Nightly Show With Larry Wilmore.

title: Final Space
description: Sarah Silverman hosts this half-hour variety/talk show produced by Funny or Die.

title: Seven Seconds
description: Fallon Carrington (Elizabeth Gillies) and her brother, Steven, (James Mackay) are called to the family mansion by their father, Blake Carrington, (Grant Show) to meet his new wife-to-be, Cristal (Nathalie Kelley) in this reboot of the 1980s Aaron Spelling nighttime soap opera.

title: Ugly Delicious
description: A failed secret mission by The Shadow Raiders, an elite unit of U.S. Army helicopter pilots, results with only Warrant Officer Nora Madani (Christina Ochoa) and her commanding officer, Captain Leland Gallo (Matt Barr) returning to base. When it is discovered one of their own (W. Tre Davis) is alive, they seek to return to duty and rescue...

title: The Frankenstein Chronicles
description: The life and career of director Steven Spielberg is the focus of Susan Lacy's documentary that includes behind-the-scene clips and interviews with the filmmaker himself, as well as friends and colleagues such as J.J. Abrams, Christian Bale, Drew Barrymore, Cate Blanchett, Francis Ford Coppola, Daniel Craig, Daniel Day-Lewis, Brian de Pa...

title: The Joel McHale Show with Joel McHale
