description: The first season of Ryan Murphy-produced anthology series focuses on how Joan Crawford (Jessica Lange) and Bette Davis (Susan Sarandon) came together to make What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? despite their heated rivalry.

title: The Defiant Ones (2017)
description: Georgia (Aisling Franciosi) joins a clique led by lecturer Jude McDermid (Louise Brealey) and her best friend Holly (Synnove Karlsen) becomes jealous then concerned about her friend's behavior, reluctantly joins in this British thriller created by Jess Brittain.

title: Tour de Pharmacy
description: Beloved comedian Paul Finchley (Robbie Coltrane) is accused of raping a woman in the 1970s in this British drama written by Jack Thorne.

title: Castlevania
description: The six-part documentary series examines the case of 16-year-old Kalief Browder, who ended up at Riker’s Island prison for three years while awaiting trial, after being accused of stealing a backpack (the charge was eventually dropped).

title: Snowfall
description: The latest Chicago P.D. spinoff focuses on the Chicago State's Attorney office run by Mark Jefferies (Carl Weathers) with lead Assistant State Attorney Peter Stone (Philip Winchester), investigators Laura Nagel (Joelle Carter), and Daren Okada (Ryan-James Hatanaka) who investigate and prosecute cases.

title: America in Color
description: The miniseries written and created by Dustin Lance Black focuses on the LGBT movement from its beginnings in the 1970s to the present with LGBT activist Cleve Jones (Guy Pearce); women’s rights leader Roma Guy (Mary-Louise Parker); her wife, social justice activist Diane Jones (Rachel Griffiths); African-American community organizer Ken ...

title: Top Gear America
description: The action series based on Luc Besson's franchise with Liam Neeson is a prequel that follows the young Green Beret named Bryan Mills (Clive Standen) as he learns those "very particular set of skills" he will utilize in the future.

title: Gypsy (2017)
description: The spinoff of The Blacklist finds Tom Keen (Ryan Eggold) teaming up with Susan "Scottie" Hargrave (Famke Janssen) to deal with dangerous situations governments can't.

title: Battle of the Network Stars (2017)
description: The eight-part limited series based on the Tony-winning musical "Million Dollar Quartet" follows the early years of rock'n'roll as Sam Phillips (Chad Michael Murray) guides the rise of such stars as Elvis Presley (Drake Milligan), Johnny Cash (Kevin Fonteyne), Jerry Lee Lewis (Christian Lees), and Jimmy Swaggart (Jonah Lees).

title: Tales
description: Nikki (Afton Williamson), David (David Call) and DeeVee (Mack Wilds) seek hip hop fame in 1990s New York that began in the TV movie of the same name based on Dan Charnas' nonfiction book "The Big Payback."

title: Prime Suspect: Tennison
description: The spinoff of The Good Wife picks up a year later as a financial scam forces Diane Lockhart and her goddaughter Maia Rindell (Rose Leslie) to join a law firm that includes Lucca Quinn (Cush Jumbo).

title: GLOW
description: The David E. Kelley adaptation of Liane Moriarity's novel of the same name about how seemingly perfect lives of three mothers of kindergartners--Celeste (Nicole Kidman), Madeline (Reese Witherspoon) and Jane (Shailene Woodley)--end in murder.

title: Boy Band
description: Narrated by David Attenborough, the sequel to the 2006 nature series features the use of 4K ultra high definition (UHD), aerial drones, and remote recordings to explore the habitats and animals on islands, mountains, jungles, deserts, grasslands and cities.

title: The Gong Show (2017)
description: Defense attorney Sadie Ellis (Katherine Heigl) becomes involved with a client (Steven Pasquale), who may have murdered a 15-year-old years ago.

title: The Mist (2017)
description: Tasked with rebuilding Paris' reputation in high fashion, Paul Sabine (Richard Coyle) must work with his brother Claude (Tom Riley) in this post-war drama from Olivier Goldstick.

title: I'm Sorry
description: Diagnosed as schizophrenic and now institutionalized, David Haller's (Dan Stevens) routine at a a psychiatric hospital is changed with the arrival of a new patient named Syd (Rachel Keller) and the discovery that the voices and visions may be real.

title: The Bold Type
description: The comedy special directed by Akiva Schaffer and Scott Aukerman features appearances from Eric Andre, Fred Armisen, Janeane Garofalo, Maya Rudolph, Andy Samberg, Michael Sheen, and Sarah Silverman.

title: Loch Ness
description: The Jason Sudeikis-produced comedy about two ad men (Sam Richardson and Tim Robinson) who make commercials for local TV in Detroit.

title: My Mother and Other Strangers
description: Billionaire Gideon Reeves (Justin Kirk) takes over the Chicago Police Department's 13th district and turns it into a private police force after his best friend is murdered.

title: T.J. Miller: Meticulously Ridiculous
description: After a breakup, Dr. Ruby Walker (Amrita Acharia) seeks a new start in a small South India hospital led by Dr. Lydia Fonseca (Amanda Redman) and Dr. Gabriel Varma (James Floyd).

title: Cardinal
description: The comedy series from Victor Fresco features Joel (Timothy Olyphant) and Sheila (Drew Barrymore), unhappy married realtors in the L.A. suburb of Santa Clarita, until Sheila makes a major change that alters their lives.

title: Riviera
description: Set 15 years after the 2001 film of the same name, Los Angeles Detective Frank Rourke (Bill Paxton) of the Special Investigation Section (S.I.S.) is assigned to Kyle Craig (Justin Cornwell), who works as a trainee while reporting their activities to the upper brass.

title: Blood Drive
description: In a world with superheroes, Emily Locke (Vanessa Hudgens) works at "one of the worst insurance companies in America" with her best friend Teddy (Danny Pudi), her new boss Del (Alan Tudyk) and his personal assistant Jackie (Christina Kirk) in this comedy based on the DC comic.

title: The Putin Interviews
description: The comedy from Bob Daily, Neil Goldman and Garrett Donovan based on the Tracy Letts' play of the same name is about the relationship a Chicago donut shop owner (Judd Hirsch) has with his new younger employee (Jermaine Fowler) and his customers.

title: Steve Harvey's Funderdome
description: The drama series focuses on new Georgia A&M University president Eva Fletcher (Anika Noni Rose) as she deals with staffers such as band director Cecil Diamond (Ruben Santiago-Hudson) and the incoming freshman class that includes Eva's daughter (Jazz Raycole), a rapper named Cedric (Peyton Alex Smith), saxophonist Noni (Zoe Renee), and wh...

title: Claws
description: The three-part miniseries based on the autobiographies, "Conversations With Myself" and "Nelson Mandela by Himself" chronicles Nelson Mandela's (Laurence Fishburne) beginnings as he meets Winnie (Terry Pheto), his second wife as well as important figures in the Anti-Apartheid Movement like Oliver Tambo (Orlando Jones), Walter Sisulu (Dav...

title: Sunday Night With Megyn Kelly
description: Sarah Phelps' adaptation of Agatha Christie's short story about the case against Leonard Vole (Billy Howle), who was accused of killing the very wealthy heiress Emily French (Kim Cattrall). Leonard tells his barrister John Mayhew (Toby Jones) his girlfriend Romaine (Andrea Riseborough) is his alibi only to have her become a witness for t...

title: I'm Dying Up Here
description: Greg Berlanti adds another comic series to his list by bringing Archie (KJ Apa), Betty (Lili Reinhart), Veronica (Camila Mendes) and Jughead (Cole Sprouse) to the CW in this present-day set series.

title: Big Star Little Star
description: The reality competition series based on the British show of the same name features nine teams of two who try to hide themselves from professional investigators for a chance to win the prize of $250,000.

title: The F Word (2017)
description: The remake of the 1988 film of the same name about the lifelong friendship between CC (Idina Menzel) and Hillary (Nia Long) is set in Los Angeles.

title: World of Dance
description: Set in the late 18th century during the North American fur trade, Declan Harp (Jason Mamoa), who runs the Black Wolf Company, seeks to destroy the Hudson’s Bay Company run by Lord Benton (Alun Armstrong) by utilizing Michael Smyth (Landon Liboiron), who in a deal with Benton, works as a spy for him.

title: Still Star-Crossed
description: The British TV series follows the young Queen Victoria (Jenna Coleman) from when she takes the crown at 18 to her marriage to Prince Albert (Tom Hughes).

title: Beat Shazam
description: New York cardinal Lenny Belardo (Jude Law) is elected as the new pope through machinations by Cardinal Voiello (Silvio Orlando) who thought the 47-year-old would amenable to his ideas. However, the new Pontiff who takes the name Pius XIII, prefers seeking advice from Sister Mary (Diane Keaton), who raised him at the orphanage. The 10-...

title: Love Connection (2017)
description: Violet (Malina Weissman), Klaus (Louis Hynes), and Sunny Baudelaire seek to solve the mystery of the death of their parents and foil Count Olaf's (Neil Patrick Harris) schemes to take their inheritance in this Netflix adaptation of the books by Lemony Snicket.

title: Dirty Dancing (2017)
description: Host Craig Robinson picks up unsuspecting contestants who are given an opportunity to win money by participating in karaoke challenges.

title: The Wizard of Lies
description: The TripTank sketch from Sean Donnelly and Alessandro Minoli about Jeff (voiced by Brett Gelman) and the three aliens sent to study him becomes its own show.

title: The Keepers
description: Set in 1800s, James Delaney (Tom Hardy) returns to London to build a shipping empire and avenge his father's death after spending 10 years in Africa in the miniseries created by Steven Knight with Hardy and his father, Chris Hardy.

title: Downward Dog
description: Former Army Ranger Eric Carter (Corey Hawkins) seeks CTU's help when something from his past puts his life and possibly the United States in danger in this reboot of the 2010 series.

title: Anne with an E
description: A recently single military mom is forced to see what single life is like firsthand with the help of her teenage daughter and tween son.

title: Money Heist
description: A modern retelling of the classic has 20-year-old Dorothy Gale (Adria Arjona) and her K9 police dog taken to another world via a tornado.

title: American Gods
description: Holden (Burkeley Duffield) wakes up from a 12 year coma with special powers and soon finds himslf in a conspiracy in this drama created by Adam Nussdorf.

title: Dear White People (2017)
description: The comedy from the co-producers of It’s Always Sunny In Philadelphia focuses on foul-mouthed Mackenzie “Mickey” Murphy (Kaitlin Olson) who moves to Greenwich, Conn. to take care of the three kids of her sister, who has left the country without them to avoid being arrested.

title: The President Show
description: Hannah Simone hosts the reality show featuring 10 expert survivalists are teamed up with partners who have no camping experience for a chance to win $500,000 prize.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: The three-part miniseries about the formation, and subsequent break-ups, careers post-break-ups, and reunions of the 1980 R&B boy band that included Michael Bivins (Bryshere Y. Gray), Ricky Bell (Caleb McLaughlin), Bobby Brown (Woody McClain), Ronnie Devoe (Keith Powers), Raplph Tresvant (Algee Smith), and Johnny Gill (Luke James).

title: Genius (2017)
description: New Kids On The Block's Joey McIntyre playing a fictional version of himself in this sitcom where he seeks a serious acting role but ends up with a late night talk show.

title: Genius (2017)
description: The animated comedy series from Carson Mell centers on tattoo artist Echo Johnson and the other residents of the Tierra Chula Resident Hotel.

title: Mary Kills People
description: Self-centered Kevin Finn (Jason Ritter) is chosen by God to save the world, but first Yvette (Christina Alonso), a messenger of God, must help guide Kevin toward the right path in this drama from Michele Fazekas and Tara Butters.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
description: Based on an Israeli series, a Silicon Valley tech guru Jeffrey Tanner (Jeremy Piven) creates an app to solve his daughter's murder with the help of Det. Tommy Cavanaugh (Richard T. Jones).

title: Girlboss
description: Maxine Robinson (Vanessa Williams) created and hosts a daytime talk show with her cohosts: comedienne Mo Evans (Tichina Arnold), ex-child star Kibby Ainsley (Chloe Bridges), investigative journalist Nina Sandoval (Camille Guaty), and conservative Heather Flynn-Kellog (Fiona Gubelmann) in this drama series based on Satan's Sisters, a book...

title: Bill Nye Saves the World
description: Josh Roberts (Mark Feuerstein) lives next-door to his parents (Elliott Gould and Linda Lavin) and his brother (David Walton) and his family in this comedy created by Feuerstein and his wife Dana Klein.

title: Famous in Love

title: Guerrilla
description: Dick Wolf expands his Law & Order franchise with the true crime series focusing on the 1996 murders by the Menendez brothers and murder trial that included their defense attorney Leslie Abramson (Edie Falco).

title: Class
description: Crisis and hostage negotiator Eric Beaumont (Luke Roberts) and his team travel around the world to help with difficult kidnap and ransom cases in this drama from David Vainola and Spotnitz was inspired by real life crisis negotiator Laurent Combalbert.

title: Ben 10
description: TV producer Jane Sadler (Kyra Sedgwick) life becomes a complicated mystery when her daughter disappears in the middle of the night in this thriller created and written by Tassie Cameron.

title: The Son
description: Produced by Gale Anne Hurd and based on Aaron Mahnke's podcast of the same name, the anthology series explores horror legends to discover the facts behind them.

title: First Dates
description: The latest late night show on Comedy Central is from Australian comic Jim Jefferies.

title: American Playboy: The Hugh Hefner Story
description: A young William Shakespeare (Laurie Davidson) arrives in London to start his theater career where he attracts the attentions of Alice Burbage (Olivia DeJonge), her actor brother Richard (Mattias Inwood), poet (and eventual rival) Christopher Marlowe (Jamie Campbell Bower) and wealthy and Richard Topcliffe (Ewen Bremner), the Elizabethan ...

title: The White Princess
description: A New York stand-up comedian (Pete Holmes) ends up couch surfing at other comedians apartments after his wife leaves him.

title: Brockmire
description: Originally called My So Called Wife, the dark comedy from Adam Brooks and Paul Adelstein follows con artist Maddie (Inbar Lavi) as she starts falling in love with her latest mark (Stephen Bishop) and three of her former victims (Rob Heaps, Parker Young and Marianne Rendón) team up to track her down.

title: Louis C.K.: 2017
description: Recovering alcoholic and substance abuse counselor Sam Loudermilk has a hard time getting his life back on track due to his negative attitude about everything in this comedy created by Peter Farrelly and Bobby Mort.

title: The Kennedys - After Camelot
description: In 2014, Navy SEAL Team Six (Edwin Hodge, Juan Pablo Raba, Kyle Schmid, Barry Sloane) are on a mission in Afghanistan to take out a Taliban leader when they discover an U.S. citizen is working with the terrorists in this military drama from William Broyles Jr. and David Broyles.

title: Five Came Back
description: Based loosely on the Elmore Leonard (which also spawned the 1995 movie of the same name), Nevada hitman Miles Daly (Chris O’Dowd) is in Hollywood seeking to make a career change after the estrangement from his wife and daughter. He runs into B-movie producer Rick Moreweather (Ray Romano) and convinces him to help him make a film.

title: 13 Reasons Why
description: Dan Kopelman's comedy focuses on three periods of the life of Alex Riley as a 14-year-old in 1991 (Jack Dylan Grazer), at age 40 in the present day (Bobby Moynihan), and at age 65 in 2042 (John Larroquette).

title: Imaginary Mary
description: The animated series from Guillermo Del Toro begins with 15-year-old Jim Lake (voiced by the late Anton Yelchin) finding an amulet that grants him the right to become a Trollhunter, a protector of the underground trolls that includes Blinky (Kelsey Grammer).

title: Nobodies
description: Parisian talent agency Agence Samuel Kerr (ASK) deal with a variety of issues from their clients in this French comedy series.

title: Harlots
description: Hosted by Chris Hardwick, the game show produced by LeBron James features two-person teams who must answer answer trivia questions correctly for a chance to have green balls fall down a 40-foot tall wall (that looks/work similar to The Price is Right's Plinko board) to win possibly over a million dollars, wrong answers bring red balls d...

title: Rebel
description: Blind Prairie Johnson (Brit Marling) went missing seven years ago, only to return her sight restored in this sci-fi drama from Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij.

title: To Walk Invisible: The Brontë Sisters
description: Star (Jude Demorest), her sister Simone (Brittany O’Grady) and her friend Alexandra (Ryan Destiny) form a band and move to Atlanta to try their hand at making it in the music industry in this Lee Daniels series.

title: Rapunzel's Tangled Adventure
description: Executive produced by Doug Liman, the documentary series features reenactments and interviews with those involved in high profile hostage cases.

title: Shots Fired
description: Charlie Haverford (Jeffrey Donovan) who oversees Romani clan leader Fonzo's (Angus Sampson) chain of fortune telling parlors in Los Angeles begins to question his life when he begins experiences visions.

title: Dave Chappelle: Deep in the Heart of Texas
description: Baltimore teen Tracy Turnblad (Maddie Baillio) dreams of dancing on the Corny Collins Show come true and with her new-found fame seeks to integrate the show so her friends can join her in this adaption of the movie-turned-musical with encouragement from her mother (Harvey Fierstein) and father (Martin Short).

title: Dave Chappelle: The Age of Spin
description: The reality show follows Mariah Carey as she prepares for her Sweet Sweet Fantasy tour in Europe and her wedding to James Packer.

title: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel
description: In 2062, corporations run the world and Ben Larson (Sean Teale) does whatever it takes at the SPIGA Biotech to locate and save Elena (Denyse Tontz), who had to sell herself to to pay for her family's debts.

title: Marvel's Iron Fist
description: Alyvia Alyn Lind as a young Dolly returns in this sequel to 2015's Dolly Parton’s Coat of Many Colors.

title: Striking Out
description: In the docuseries Leah Remini interviews former Scientologists about their experiences.

title: Snatch (2017)
description: The Ricki Stern and Annie Sundberg documentary made in association with the Boston Globe chronicles the investigations that led to the capture of the Tsarnaev brothers as well as the journey of recovery by three families who survived the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing.

title: Trial & Error
description: Former Top Gear hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to the United States, United Kingdom, South Africa and Germany for their new auto show on Amazon.

title: Amy Schumer: The Leather Special
description: Dory (Alia Shawkat) becomes obsessed with finding a missing girl she barely knew in college with reluctant help from her boyfriend Drew (John Reynolds), her narcissist friend Elliott (John Early), and actress friend Portia (Meredith Hagner). TBS will air all 10 episodes over one week, with two episodes per night.

title: Making History
description: The comedy series from Ali Wentworth is set behind the scenes of a late night show named "Nightcap With Jimmy" where head talent booker Staci (Ali Wentworth) must try to bring order to her staff and the celebrity guests.

title: The Arrangement (2017)
description: Barrister Maya Cobbina QC (Sophie Okonedo) is approached to become the Director of Public Prosecutions, only to find secrets from her husband's past threaten not only her family but also her 20-year-long appeal of death row inmate Rudy Jones (Dennis Haysbert) in this Peter Moffat drama.

title: Time After Time
description: Produced by Antoine Fuqua, the crime drama centers on Los Angeles diamond trade where Jake (Cam Gigandet) must deal with his half-brother Freddy (Jeremy Sisto) who killed a diamond dealer, bringing trouble to the family business run by their father Isaac (Raymond Barry) and uncle Cam (Ray Winstone).

title: FEUD
description: Sorority girl Jules (Eliza Bennett) and hacker Ophelia (Taylor Dearden) become vigilantes in college.

title: Clique
description: Just released from jail, Letty Dobesh (Michelle Dockery) is hoping to reunite with her 10-year old son, who was being raised by her mother Estelle (Lusia Strus) and get her life together when she overhears a contract killer's (Juan Diego Botto) plans to kill a woman in this adaptation based on the books by Wayward Pines author Blake Crou...

title: National Treasure (2017)
description: Ex-Marine sniper Bob Lee Swagger (Ryan Phillipe) returns to service when he learns of a plot to kill the president in this series based on the 2007 film of the same name.

title: TIME: The Kalief Browder Story
description: Produced by Ron Howard, the hybrid fictional miniseries/documentary set in 2033 as the first mission to Mars with humans begins includes documentary vérité interviews with experts such as NASA administrator Charles Bolden, X-Prize Foundation head Peter Diamandis, Elon Musk, Neil deGrasse Tyson, and The Martian author Andy Weir.

title: Chicago Justice
description: On the the 20th anniversary of the 6-year-old beauty queen's death, comes another dramatization with JonBenét (voiceover by Phoebe Lawrenson) narrating as Boulder detective Steve Thomas (Eion Bailey) questions her parents (Julia Campbell and Michel Gill).

title: When We Rise
description: The rise of Queen Elizabeth II (Claire Foy) is chronicled from her wedding in 1947 to present day in the series planned to air over six seasons.

title: Taken (2017)
description: Former sheriff Stan Miller (John C. McGinley), who was forced into retirement, must work with his replacement Evie Barret (Janet Varney) after they discover demons in their small New England town in this horror comedy series from Dana Gould.

title: The Blacklist: Redemption
description: Journalist Ozzie Graham (Wyatt Cenac) investigates a group who claim to be alien abductees.

title: Sun Records
description: The British sketch comedy show with Tracey Ullman airs in the US on HBO.

title: The Breaks
description: The medical drama created by Jason Katims about a Silicon Valley tech genius James Bell (Augustus Prew) who recruits surgeon Walter Wallace (Mulroney) to start a new hospital which uses cutting-edge ideas.

title: The Good Fight
description: An injury sidelines adventure reporter Joel (Joel McHale) to a desk job with the digital department for "The Great Outdoors" magazine he works for.

title: Big Little Lies
description: Contracter Adam (Matt LeBlanc) finds taking care of the kids is harder than he thinks when his wife Andi goes back to work as a medical lab technician.

title: Planet Earth II
description: The adaptation of Douglas Adams series (which also was made as a 2012 BBC comedy) follows holistic detective Dirk (Samuel Barnett) and his assistant Todd (Elijah Wood) as they investigate cases.

title: Doubt
description: Janet Weiss (Victoria Justice) and Brad Majors (Ryan McCartan) end up at Dr. Frank-N-Furter's (Laverne Cox) house where she is hosting an annual Transylvanian science convention where the birth of Rocky Horror (Staz Nair) is the centerpiece. Tim Curry is the narrator of this remake of the original movie musical.

title: The Collection
description: Based on the book by Kem Nunn, in the midst of a divorce, San Francisco forensic neuropsychiatrist Eldon Chance (Hugh Laurie) becomes involved with a married patient (Gretchen Mol) which brings trouble in the form of her abusive homicide detective husband (Paul Adelstein).

title: Legion
description: The Canadian series created by Brad Wright is set in the future where the few remaining humans can send their consciousness into the past to try save humanity from its fate. The team includes FBI Special Agent Grant MacLaren (Eric McCormack); Marcy (Mackenzie Porter); David (Patrick Gilmore); high school quarterback  Trevor (Jared Paul A...

title: Michael Bolton's Big Sexy Valentine's Day Special
description: Directed by Rod Lurie, the TV-movie based on Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard book dramatizes the events surrounding the attempted assassination of President Reagan (Tim Matheson) by John Hinckley Jr. (Kyle More).

title: Detroiters
description: Louisa Durrell (Keeley Hawes) moves her family to the island of Corfu in this adaptation of Gerald Durrell's triology of books called "My Family and Other Animals."

title: APB
description: An adaptation of the Norwegian drama Øyevitne, two teenage boys named Lukas (James Paxton) and Phillip (Tyler Young) secretly meet up in a cabin only to witness a brutal quadruple murder.

title: The Good Karma Hospital
description: CIA analyst-turned-field-agent Daniel Miller (Richard Armitage) arrives in Berlin and is assigned to discover the identity of a whistleblower going by the name Thomas Shaw with the help of his old friend and veteran agent Hector DeJean (Rhys Ifans).

title: Santa Clarita Diet
description: The David E. Kelley legal drama co-written with Jonathan Shapiro focuses on alcoholic, down-and-out attorney Billy McBride (Billy Bob Thornton) who sees a chance for redemption with a wrongful death case against an aerospace company represented by his former law partner (William Hurt) and the law firm he co-founded (and was fired from).

title: Training Day (2017)
description: Untalented Miranda Sings (Colleen Ballinger-Evans) with the help of her Uncle Jim (Steve Little), her Mom, Bethany (Angela Kinsey), and her best friend/neighbor, Patrick (Erik Stocklin), seek to convince the world she is a great singer in this comedy based on the YouTube character created by Ballinger-Evans.

title: Powerless
description: Three individuals (Lizzie Brochere, David Ajala and Will Yun Lee) are having dreams that are a part of a single dream that may hold the clues to world's fate in this thriller from Henry Bromell, Blake Masters and Gale Anne Hurd.

title: Superior Donuts
description: American tourist Eve (Lucy Fry) seeks revenge after her family is murdered by Mick Taylor (John Jarratt) in this spinoff TV series of the Australian horror movie franchise.

title: The Quad
description: Daniel McCallum (Luke McGregor) returns to his Tasmanian hometown to help his mother with her business when his best friend Emma (Celia Pacquola) runs from her honeymoon and marriage to his doorstep in this Australian comedy series created by Luke McGregor and Celia Pacquola.

title: Madiba
description: Originally titled The Second Fattest Housewife in Westport, the comedy focuses on Katie Otto (Katy Mixon) as she tries to raise her three children in Westport, Connecticut.

title: Agatha Christie’s The Witness for the Prosecution
description: The anthology series will feature a Creepypasta, a horror story usually based on a image or other media that was created and shared on the internet (Slender Man being one of the notorious ones).

title: Riverdale
description: A group of high schoolers fight for survival after a explosion at a chemical plant causes those exposed to become zombies in this teen horror series created by Beth Szymkowski.

title: Hunted (2017)
description: The new weeknight news program from Vice News and airing also on HBO.

title: Beaches (2017)
description: In the comedy created by Sharon Horgan, Frances (Sarah Jessica Parker) decides she wants to end her decade-long marriage to Robert (Thomas Haden Church).

title: Frontier
description: The comedy follows the lives of best friends Issa Dee (Issa Rae) and Molly (Yvonne Orji).

title: Victoria (2016)
description: Based on the 2000 film of the same name, Detective Raimy Sullivan (Peyton List) discovers she can speak to her estranged father Frank (Riley Smith) in the past, who died in 1996 while undercover, through a old ham radio.

title: The Young Pope
description: Based on the Brazilian show, cautious Evie Callahan (Tori Anderson) who works at a distribution center falls in love with a man (Joshua Sasse) who believes an apocalypse is coming.

title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2017)
description: Hayes Morrison (Hayley Atwell) takes a job with the Conviction Integrity Unit run by District Attorney Wayne Wallis (Eddie Cahill) to avoid being charged with drug possession and hurting her mother's senate campaign.

title: Caraoke Showdown
description: Timeless Some stories must be told. Legends that last a lifetime. Tales that are Timeless. In the world of sports, some stories transcend the calendar and the whims of pop culture; they're simply timeless. ESPN2 captures these stories in a new 30-week series Timeless, airing Saturdays at 11:30 am ET on ESPN2. Each week, the half-ho...

title: Jeff & Some Aliens
description: The sci-fi western series from Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy was inspired by the 1973 Michael Crichton film of the same name and is set at a Wild West theme park created by Dr. Robert Ford (Anthony Hopkins) with human-like androids where guests are encouraged to indulge their desires.

title: Taboo
description: Set in 1667 where 28-year-old King Louis XIV (George Blagden) is determined to build a grandest palace in Europe as he seeks destroy his enemies and obtain more power in this Anglo-French historical drama created by David Wolstencroft.

title: 24: Legacy
description: Woody Allen's debut comedy TV series set in the 1960s features the director along with Becky Ann Baker, Joy Behar, Lewis Black, Rachel Brosnahan, Miley Cyrus, Christine Ebersole, David Harbour, Margaret Ladd, Elaine May, Michael Rapaport, and Rebecca Schull.

title: One Day at a Time (2017)
description: Introduced in Marvel's Jessica Jones, Luke Cage (Mike Colter) gets his own show where he meets Claire Temple (Rosario Dawson) again and deals with nightclub owner Cornell "Cottonmouth" Stokes (Mahershala Ali), politician Mariah Dillard (Alfre Woodard), former prison mate Shades (Theo Rossi) and a pair of detectives (Simone Missick and Fr...

title: Emerald City
description: Joshua and Karen Copeland (James Tupper and Anne Heche), and their children Dana, Brianna and Matt fight to survive the fall of civilization as plagues and supernatural creatures threaten to destroy the world.

title: Beyond (2017)
description: The adaptation of William Blatty’s 1971 book focuses on Father Tomas Ortega (Alfonso Herrera) and Father Marcus Lang (Ben Daniels) as they face a case of demonic possession in Angela Rance's (Geena Davis) family.

title: The Mick
description: Vanessa Helsing (Kelly Overton), the daughter of the legendary vampire hunter Abraham Van Helsing awakens five years in the future where vampires rule the world.

title: Kicking and Screaming
description: 20-something Angus "Mac" MacGyver (Lucas Till) and former CIA agent Lincoln (George Eads) travel around the world as part of the Department of External Affairs in this reboot of the 1985 series.

title: The New Edition Story
description: Moderated by Michael Ian Black, two teams of two comedians debate a variety of topics.

title: Return of the Mac
description: The professional and personal lives of Attorney Jake Gregorian (Daniel Sunjata) and TV news producer Julia George (Piper Perabo) are the focus of this drama series based on the real lives of criminal defense attorney Mark Geragos and cable news producer Wendy Walker.

title: Tarantula
description: The anthology series from Joe Swanberg is set in Chicago where characters played by such actors as Malin Akerman, Orlando Bloom, Hannibal Buress, Michael Chernus, Dave Franco, Jake Johnson, Marc Maron, and Gugu Mbatha-Raw deal with culture, love, sex, and technology.

title: Kevin (Probably) Saves the World
description: The British series focuses on a group of detectives who investigate a murder of a doctor in a children's playground.

title: Wisdom of the Crowd
description: Ginny Baker (Kylie Bunbury) is called up by the San Diego Padres to pitch in the major leagues and must prove herself among the players including team captain, catcher Mike Lawson (Mark-Paul Gosselaar).

title: Daytime Divas
description: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development Tom Kirkman (Kiefer Sutherland) is left as the Commander in Chief after an explosion during the State of the Union address kills the President and those in line of succession.

title: 9JKL
description: The 1987 movie is adapted into a television show where former Texan and Navy SEAL Martin Riggs (Clayne Crawford) moves to Los Angeles and is partnered with Roger Murtaugh (Damon Wayans Sr.)

title: Damnation (2017)
description: Maya DiMeo (Minnie Driver) takes charge of her family that includes her husband Jimmy (John Ross Bowie) and their three sons: Ray (Mason Cook), Dylan (Kyla Kenedy) and JJ (Micah Fowler), who has special needs.

title: Law & Order True Crime: The Menendez Murders
description: Dr. Jason Bull (Michael Weatherly) runs a trial consulting company to help analyze juries in this drama series based on Dr. Phil's career before he became a daytime talk-show host.

title: Ransom (2017)
description: The Dan Fogelman dramedy features people (Sterling K. Brown, Justin Hartley, Ron Cephas Jones, Mandy Moore, and Milo Ventimig) who share the same birthday and how their live cross each other.

title: Ten Days in the Valley
description: Kevin James is a retired policeman who finds life at home with his wife and three kids is tougher than it was on the streets.

title: Lore
description: Eleanor Shellstrop (Kristen Bell) enters the afterlife and discovers they have mistaken her for someone else and she seeks to rectify this with the help of her afterlife mentor Michael (Ted Danson).

title: The Jim Jefferies Show
description: Previously known as Case Closed, the true crime limited series focused on the JonBenét Ramsey murder.

title: Will
description: Based on the play by Phoebe Waller-Bridge, the BBC3 comedy series focuses on an angry, self-loathing 20-something nicknamed Fleabag who struggles with running her cafe and the memory of the death of her best friend.

title: Crashing
description: The web series created by Katja Blichfeld & Ben Sinclair about a marijuana dealer (Ben Sinclair) in New York City moves to HBO.

title: Imposters
description: In 1953, Prime Minister Winston Churchill (Michael Gambon) had a stroke and his condition was hidden from everyone while he recovered in this TV-movie that appears as a part of PBS' Masterpiece series.

title: Loudermilk
description: The live-action/animation hybrid comedy where the Zephyria warrior Zorn (voiced by Jason Sudeikis) returns to Orange County and complicates the life of of his teenage son (Johnny Pemberton) and ex-wife (Cheryl Hines), who is engaged to a psychology professor (Tim Meadows).

title: Six
description: Based on the series of novels by Max Allan Collins, Mac Conway (Logan Marshall-Green) returns from Vietnam to Memphis in 1973 only to struggle with acceptance and his experiences as a Marine sniper. He is recruited by The Broker (Stellan Skarsgård) to join a group of contract killers who work along the Mississippi River.

title: Get Shorty
description: The Pamela Adlon and Louis C.K. co-created comedy series focuses on a single mother/actress (Pamela Adlon) raising three children.

title: Me, Myself and I
description: Based on the novel by Natalie Baszile, focuses on New Orleans activist/journalist Rutina Wesley (Nova Bordelon) and the return of her sister Charley Bordelon (Dawn-Lyen Gardner) from Los Angeles after the death of their father to claim an inheritance in the form of am 800-acre sugar cane farm.

title: Trollhunters
description: In Miami, FBI agent Phil Rask (Martin Freeman) has been investigating Nick Talman's (Adam Brody) father, who asks his son to hide the dirty money. Nick invests the cash in a digital currency start up run Izzy Morales (Otmara Marrero), which also brings the interest of Ronald Dacey (Edi Gathegi), a local Haitian gang leader.

title: Call My Agent!
description: Earnest "Earn" Marks (Donald Glover) returns to his hometown of Atlanta to discovers his cousin Alfred Miles (Brian Tyree Henry) is seen as a hot upcoming rapper and seeks to guide his career to the big time.

title: The Wall (2017)
description: In Mary + Jane, best friends Jordan (Scout Durwood) and Paige (Jessica Rothe) sell marijuana in Los Angeles in this comedy created by Deborah Kaplan and Harry Elfont.

title: The OA
description: The three-part miniseries tells how Walter & Arthur Davidson and Bill Harley built the now well-known motorcycle company.

title: Star
description: The musical game show hosted by Shad Moss a.k.a. Bow Wow where contestants are only given an instrumental track to help identify a song.

title: Captive (2016)
description: The Italian crime drama series based on the best-selling non-fiction book by Roberto Saviano (which also inspired the 2008 film of the same name) is set in Naples where Ciro Di Marzio (Marco D’Amore) works for Camorra godfather Pietro Savastanno (Fortunato Cerlino).

title: Shut Eye
description: After her affair with a married senator hits the news, Anna (Danielle Savre) is forced to return to her Alabama hometown to face the family and friends she had cut-off when she moved to the nation's capital.

title: Hairspray Live!
description: Jill Soloway and Sarah Gubbins' adaptation of Chris Kraus' novel how a professor named Dick (Kevin Bacon) changes the lives of a New York filmmaker (Kathryn Hahn) and her husband (Griffin Dunne) in Marfa, Texas.

title: Mariah's World
description: Jean-Claude Van Damme unretires and works as a private contract killer under the name Jean-Claude Van Johnson after he runs into his ex (Kat Foster) in this comedy written by David Callaham.

title: Incorporated
description: Elvis Presley (Jonathan Nation) faked his death in 1977 and agrees to testify against a crime syndicate in this made-for-TV movie from the Sharknado producers.

title: Dolly Parton's Christmas of Many Colors: Circle of Love
description: Accountant Arthur Everest (Griffin Newman) discovers the city is owned by a supervillian (Jackie Earle Haley), but the only person who believes him is a superhero called the The Tick (Peter Serafinowicz) in this latest adaptation of Ben Edlund's comic.

title: Leah Remini: Scientology and the Aftermath
description: Based on F. Scott Fitzgerald's final unfinished novel, studio exec Monroe Stahr (Matt Bomer) faces off with studio head Pat Brady (Kelsey Grammer) as Brady's daughter Celia (Lily Collins) seeks to become a producer in 1930s Hollywood.

title: Marathon: The Patriot's Day Bombing
description: The remake of the 1997 film of the same name, finds babysitters Jenny (Sabrina Carpenter) and Lola (Sofia Carson) search the city for one of their charges who snuck out.

title: The Grand Tour
description: Uncle Buck (Mike Epps) takes care of his brother's children after their nanny quits in this latest remake of the John Candy film (CBS attempted a series in 1990).

title: Search Party (2016)
description: Asif Ali, Zach Cregger, Rhys Darby, Brooke Dillman, Ginger Gonzaga, Will Greenberg, Jessica Lowe, Ally Maki, and Brian Sacca are stranded on a deserted island after a plane crash in this comedy from Justin and Jordan Shipley.

title: Nightcap (2016)
description: Anthony Anderson hosts the latest revival of the game/variety show that includes appearances from Betty White and NeNe Leakes.

title: Undercover
description: The death of 17-year-old Joshua "J" Cody's (Finn Cole) mother causes him to move in with his relatives that includes his grandmother Janine "Smurf" Cody (Ellen Barkin), and her sons: Baz (Scott Speedman), Pope (Shawn Hatosy), Craig (Ben Robson), and Deran (Jake Weary), in this drama based on the 2010 Australian film of the same name.

title: ICE
description: When Grace Atwood (Daisy Head) is accused of murdering her roommate Molly Ryan in London, her sister Natalie leaves Boston to be with her with the help of lawyer Stan Gutterie (Billy Zane). However, as she learns more about the case, she begins to question her sister's innocence and if the people around them are really there to help.

title: Sweet/Vicious
description: New congressional staffer Laurel (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) discovers aliens have eaten the brains of a number of people on the Hill in this Robert and Michelle King comedy-drama set in Washington, D.C.

title: Good Behavior
description: Attorney Kit (Bellamy Young) travels to San Quentin, determined to get the infamous serial killer Richard Ramirez (Lou Diamond Phillips) to confess to murders a Texas inmate is currently incarcerated for.

title: Shooter (2016)
description: The Walking Dead actor travels across the United states to talk to fellow motorcycle enthusiasts and explore the biker culture with a new companion each week.

title: Mars
description: Robert Redford and Stephen David limited series utilizes dramatic scenes, documentary footage and visual effects to tell the story of the Wild West between 1865 to 1890 when such legends as Billy the Kid, Wyatt Earp, Jesse James, Crazy Horse and Sitting Bull changed history.

title: Who Killed JonBenét?
description: The reboot of the 1984 series Voltron: Defender of the Universe, introduces Keith (Steven Yeun), Lance (Jeremy Shada), Pidge (Bex Taylor-Klaus), Hunk (Tyler Labine ), and Shiro (Josh Keaton) as they discover their ties to Voltron.

title: The Killing Season
description: Set in the near future, creatures called Hairypeople seek to survive amongst humans who want to either use them or destroy them when a series of murders is blamed on them. Koen (Hunter Page-Lochard) West--who is destined to unite the world--must find a way to work with his estranged brother Waruu (Rob Collins) to save the world.

title: The Crown
description: The comedy from Cameron Crowe focuses on the road crew for the arena rock band that includes tour manager Bill (Luke Wilson), production manager Shelli (Carla Gugino), road manager Phil (Ron White), electric tech Kelly Ann (Imogen Poots), Kelly Ann's twin Jesse (Colson Baker aka Machine Gun Kelly), sound mixer Donna (Keisha Castle-Hughes...

title: Stan Against Evil
description: The variety show hosted by Maya Rudolph and Martin short will be aired live.

title: People of Earth
description: The second adaption of Alex Haley's book is a four-night, eight-hour miniseries about the journey of Kunta Kinte (Malachi Kirby) from Gambia into slavery in colonial America and eventual freedom of his family.

title: Tracey Ullman's Show
description: During World War II, a small English regional theatre is hosting a touring production of Shakespeare's King Lear. An hour before the show, actor/manager Sir (Anthony Hopkins) who is playing Lear, is missing and it is up to his dresser Norman (Ian McKellen) to keep the show going in this adaptation of Ronald Harwood's play.

title: Pure Genius
description: Kyle Barnes (Patrick Fugit) has been suffering from demonic possessions his entire life. With the help of Reverend Anderson (Philip Glenister), Kyle seeks answers that could end life on Earth in this TV adaptation of the comic created by Robert Kirkman and Paul Azaceta.

title: The Great Indoors
description: Texas preacher Jesse Custer (Dominic Cooper), his ex-girlfriend, Tulip (Ruth Negga), and an Irish vampire named Cassidy (Joseph Gilgun) go on a journey to find God in this drama based on the comic by Garth Ennis and Steve Dillon.

title: Man With a Plan
description: Bryan Cranston reprises his Tony-winning role as President Lyndon B. Johnson during his first year in office in this adaptation of the Robert Schenkkan's play of the same name.

title: Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency
description: The comedy series inspired by comedian Maria Bamford's life will feature guest stars such as Ana Gasteyer, Tig Notaro, Patton Oswalt, Adam Pally, Brandon Routh, Sarah Silverman, and Mira Sorvino.

title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show: Let’s Do the Time Warp Again
description: The seven-and-a-half-hour documentary chronicles O.J. Simpson's rise from the San Francisco housing projects to football fame in college and the NFL to his post-football career and infamy with the 1995 trial for the killings of his ex-wife, Nicole, and Ron Goldman. The first episode will air on ABC with the subsequent four episodes airin...

title: Chance
description: The adaptation by Julian Fellowes based on the book series by Anthony Trollope focuses on Dr. Thomas Thorne (Tom Hollander) and his niece Mary (Stefani Martini), who Lady Arabella Gresham's (Rebecca Front) son wants to elope with instead of marrying the rich American heiress Martha Dunstable (Alison Brie).

title: Travelers
description: In each episode a group of volunteers are asked to try to answer some of the universe's biggest science questions in this six-part series hosted by Professor Stephen Hawking.

title: Killing Reagan
description: Hosted by Terrence J, the reality dating series from Mark Burnett set in the Caribbean features 12 single women and men.

title: The Durrells in Corfu
description: Chelsea Handler's talk show on Netflix will air three times a week (Wednesday, Thursday and Friday).

title: Eyewitness
description: Marseille mayor Robert Toro (Gérard Depardieu) plans a casino in the center of the marina. but his ambitious protege Lucas Barrès (Benoît Magimel), seeks to stop the project in this French drama series.

title: Berlin Station
description: The British dark comedy from Will Sharpe focuses on Deborah Flowers (Olivia Colman), her depressed children's-book author husband Maurice (Julian Barratt), and their two twenty-something twins Donald (Daniel Rigby) and Amy (Sophia Di Martino).

title: Goliath
description: Co-produced with RTÉ, the five-part miniseries dramatizes the 1916 Easter Rising for Ireland's independence from Britian through the eyes of three families.

title: Haters Back Off
description: The three-part miniseries for the comedy based on a skit by Ilana Glazer where two cousins (Ilana Glazer and Paul Downs) time travel with the help of a bong.

title: Falling Water
description: Based on John le Carre's novel, ex-British soldier Jonathan Pine (Tom Hiddleston) is recruited by MI-6's Angela Burr (Olivia Colman) to infiltrate the inner circle of an arms trader named Richard Onslow Roper (Hugh Laurie).

title: Wolf Creek
description: Based on a Belgian series, an epidemic in Atlanta forces a large quarantine that separates love ones from each other.

title: Rosehaven
description: The 1991 Clarence Thomas Supreme Court nomination hearings are dramatized with Kerry Washington as Anita Hill and Wendell Pierce as the future Justice.

title: American Housewife
description: 16 contestants in teams of four compete in military-styled challenges with the help of John Cena and mentors in the form of real-life members of U.S. Armed Forces.

title: Channel Zero
description: Co-produced with Sky Atlantic and Canal Plus, the heist drama follows the theft of diamonds by Milan Celik (Goran Bogdan) and his crew in Marseille. Naomi Franckom, a British insurance agent (Samantha Morton) is assigned to find the diamonds for her company and clashes with French investigator Khalil Rachedi (Tahar Rahim).

title: Freakish
description: 25 years ago, Jackson (David Lyons) Gil (Michael Raymond-James), Shawn Polk (Larenz Tate) and Boots (Derek Phillips) Jessie (Bre Blair) caused an accident that sent them to the Quitman Youth Detention Facility. The secret the four kept from their time there reemerges in this drama series based on the Turkish series Suskunlar (which was b...

title: Vice News Tonight
description: The latest documentary from Ken Burns is about the life and impact of African-American baseball player Jackie Robinson.

title: Divorce (2016)
description: Baltimore FBI agent Flynn Carroll's (Nathan Phillips) search for his missing wife leads him to the classified alien Exo-Terrorism Unit (ETU) and is paired with Regan (Britne Oldford), who may be more than she seems in this sci-fi drama based on Whitley Strieber's novel Alien Hunter.

title: Insecure
description: The comedy created by Jason Jones and Samantha Bee follows Nate (Jason Jones), his wife Robin (Natalie Zea) and their two children as they take a road trip from upstate New York to Florida.

title: Frequency
description: The semi-autobiographical comedy series features Andrew Dice Clay as he seeks a career comeback after living life in the suburbs of Las Vegas.

title: No Tomorrow
description: The drama series based on Steven Soderbergh 2009 film of the same name follows law student Christine Reade (Riley Keough) as she becomes a call-girl who provides the "girlfriend experience" to her clients.

title: Conviction (2016)
description: Gloria Vanderbilt and her son, CNN's Anderson Cooper, discuss her life in this Liz Garbus documentary.

title: Timeless
description: Doctor Gemma Foster (Suranne Jones) seemingly perfect life is turned upside down when she suspects her husband (Bertie Carvel) of cheating on her and she starts investigating his secrets.

title: Westworld
description: The zombie post-apocalyptic Western TV movie written by Backstreet Boys' Nick Carter includes his bandmates A.J. McLean and Howie Dorough, as well as *NSYNC's Joey Fatone and Chris Kirkpatrick, 98 Degrees' Jeff Timmons, and O-Town (except for Ashley Parker Angel).

title: Versailles
description: After a short-lived career as a semi-pro football player Colt Bennett (Ashton Kutcher) returns to Colorado to help his brother Jimmy (Danny Masterson) and father (Sam Elliott) run the family ranch.

title: Crisis in Six Scenes
description: Wynonna (Melanie Scrofano), the great granddaughter of Wyatt Earp, returns home to tackle demons and other supernatural with the help of Doc Holliday (Tim Rozon) and Agent Dolls (Shamier Anderson) in the the adaptation of the comic series created by Beau Smith.

title: Marvel's Luke Cage
description: The police drama based on the 1998 movie of the same name finds by-the-book Hong Kong detective Lee (Jon Foo) reluctantly paired with LAPD detective Carter (Justin Hires).

title: Aftermath (2016)
description: The third sitcom for George Lopez has the comedian playing himself and exploring the problems of not fitting in with the working-class nor the life of a celebrity despite his success.

title: The Exorcist (2016)
description: Eddie (Aaron Paul), his wife Sarah (Michelle Monaghan), and current leader Cal (Hugh Dancy) are some of the followers of religious sect called The Meyerist Movement in this drama originally called The Way and created by Jessica Goldberg.

title: Van Helsing (2016)
description: Based on the life of Dr. Kathy Magliato, Dr. Alex Panttiere (Melissa George) juggles life as one of the few women heart-transplant surgeons in the world.

title: MacGyver (2016)
description: Tyler Perry hosts and narrates the live musical about Jesus' last hours from New Orleans.

title: Debate Wars
description: The second spin-off of Criminal Minds follows FBI's International Division Unit Chief Jack Garrett (Gary Sinise), profiler Matthew Simmons (Daniel Henney) and tech analyst Russ “Monty” Montgomery (Tyler James Williams) as they work to help Americans abroad.

title: Notorious
description: Mike (Patrick Warburton) and Martina's (Carrie Preston) retirement is interrupted when their two grown daughters (Miranda Cosgrove and Mia Serafino) move back in.

title: Easy
description: Filmed before a live audience at New Orleans club, Cafe Brasil, Audra McDonald reprises her Tony Award-winning role as Billie Holiday in the Lanie Robertson's play.

title: Paranoid
description: The sketch comedy series The Lonely Island (Andy Samberg, Akiva Schaffer and Jorma Taccone) and Paul Scheer features Nicole Byer, Jessica McKenna, and Alison Rich.

title: Pitch
description: Morgan Freeman travels to seven countries to explore topics such as God, creation of life, death/afterlife, the End of Days, and evil.

title: Designated Survivor
description: The comedy co-created by Will Arnett and Mark Chappell follows Chip's (Will Arnett) life and image as a guru is upturned after he falls for a waitress named London (Ruth Kearney), who his best friend (David Sullivan) also likes.

title: Lethal Weapon (2016)
description: Eight comics: Kate Berlant, Dr. Brown, Paul W. Downs, John Early, Lauren Lapkus, Natasha Rothwell, Tim Robinson, and Natasha Rothwell, were given an opportunity to write and appear in a 30-minutes episode of this comedy sketch series.

title: Speechless (2016)
description: The reality show features seven innocent volunteers posing as prisoners at an Indiana jail known for corruption for 60 days in hopes of discovering the problems in the facility and learn first-hand about life as an inmate.

title: Bull (2016)
description: A group of slaves from Georgia led by blacksmith Noah (Aldis Hodge) travel with the help of the underground railroad more than 600 miles towards freedom.

title: This Is Us
description: The variety show hosted by Steve Harvey features talented kids 12-years-old and under.

title: Kevin Can Wait
description: Originally set at Lifetime, the horror series based on the 1976 movie The Omen, follows the now 30-year-old Damien Thorn (Bradley James), who had little idea about his past before discovering he is the Antichrist.

title: The Good Place
description: Sarah Bennett (Sarah Bennett) returns to her small hometown to discover a series of killings that are identical to the murders of her parents in Chiller's first original scripted series.

title: The Case Of: JonBenet Ramsey
description: Originally titled Flesh and Blood, Claire (Joan Allen) is in the midst of planning a run as governor when her presumed dead son (Zach Gilford) reappears after having been kidnapped more than ten years ago.

title: Fleabag
description: Based on the series by Joe R. Lansdale where best friends Hap Collins, a white ex-con (James Purefo) and Leonard Pine (Michael K. Williams), a black, openly gay Vietnam veteran, try to keep out of trouble in East Texas in the 1980s.

title: High Maintenance (2016)
description: The seemingly perfect Catholic O'Neal family that includes Chicago policeman Pat O'Neal (Jay R. Ferguson), his wife Eileen (Martha Plimpton), 17-year-old Jimmy (Matthew Shively), 14-year-old Shannon (Bebe Wood), and 16-year-old Kenny, is revealed to be not so flawless after an incident between Kenny and his girlfriend causes the others t...

title: Churchill's Secret
description: The eight-part documentary series look into the history and growth of recording music with interviews with a variety of artists including Beck, Bon Iver, Brian Eno, Elton John, Quincy Jones, Daniel Lanois, Beatles producer George Martin (who also produced the series before his death in March), Paul McCartney, Joni Mitchell, Tom Petty, Q-...

title: Son of Zorn
description: The Tanner family returns with D.J. Tanner-Fuller (Candace Cameron Bure) recently widowed and working as a veterinarian in San Francisco. Her sister Stephanie Tanner (Jodie Sweetin), best friend Kimmy Gibbler (Andrea Barber), and Kimmy's teenage daughter Ramona (Soni Nicole Bringas) move in to help take care of D.J.'s three sons--12-year...

title: Quarry
description: The documentary series from Alex Gibney and Michael Pollan focuses on the four elements--Air, Earth, fire, and water--and how they are used to make food around the world.

title: Better Things
description: Nice guy Gus (Paul Rust) moves into a new apartment after the end of his relationship and meets free-spirit Mickey (Gillian Jacobs) in the comedy from Judd Apatow, Paul Rust and Lesley Arfin.

title: Queen Sugar
description: Craig Ferguson debates the latest topics with a panel of celebrities, comedians, and experts including Judd Apatow, Jason Biggs, Jack Black, Julie Bowen, Courtney Cox, Jimmy Kimmel, Lisa Kudrow, Jay Leno, Joel McHale, and Elijah Wood.

title: StartUp
description: Dan Harmon's comedy series finds him talking to historic figures played by comedians such as Jason Sudeikis as Thomas Edison, Kristen Schaal as Amelia Earhart and Jack Black as Ludwig van Beethoven.

title: Atlanta
description: High school history teacher Jake Epping (James Franco) travels back in time to stop the assassination of JFK in the adaptation of the Stephen King novel produced by J.J. Abrams.

title: Mary and Jane
description: Set in 1970s New York City, record label president Richie Finestra (Bobby Cannavale) tries to save his company and find the next big artist in this series from Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger and Terence Winter.

title: Harley and the Davidsons
description: Terry Bradshaw, Jeff Dye, George Foreman, William Shatner, and Henry Winkler travel across Asia without assistants in this remake of the South Korean series "Grandpa Over Flowers."

title: Tracks
description: The weekly series with the comedian features taped segments, interviews fellow comics, and experiments on topics she often used in her stand-up routines.

title: Gomorrah (2016)
description: The former Daily Show correspondent hosts her own late-night talk show on TBS.

title: Tyler Perry's Too Close to Home
description: The Canadian comedy about a group of friends that include siblings Wayne (Jared Keeso) and Katy (Michelle Mylett) who run a produce stand with their friends Daryl (Nathan Dales) and Squirrelly Dan (K. Trevor Wilson) in the small Ontario town of Letterkenny.

title: I Love Dick
description: The animated comedy about creatures such as pigeons and rats living in New York City was created by Phil Matarese and Mike Luciano.

title: Jean-Claude Van Johnson
description: Ahead of the HBO movie with Robert De Niro, ABC's miniseries explores the rise and fall of Bernie Maddoff (Richard Dreyfuss), the man behind the $65 billion Ponzi scheme.

title: Elvis Lives!
description: Grawlix stand-up comics Adam Cayton-Holland, Andrew Orvedahl and Ben Roy are teachers at Denver's James Buchanan High School in the comedy that was originally a pilot for Amazon before the series was picked up by TruTv.

title: The Tick (2017)
description: The live adaptation of the musical where Sandy (Julianne Hough) transfers to the high school of Danny's (Aaron Tveit).

title: The Last Tycoon
description: Louis C.K. drops a surprise dramedy show on his website.

title: Adventures in Babysitting
description: After the announcement of a comet hitting Earth, British bank manager Jamie Winton (Mathew Baynton) seeks his missing wife and biological mother, Rhonda MacNeil (Jenna Fischer) meets a white supremacist named Leanne (Megan Mullally) in jail, Rhonda's brother, Scotty (Kyle Soller), and his boyfriend, U.S. General Arnold Gaines (Paterson J...

title: Uncle Buck (2016)
description: The Farrell Clan of Shay Mountain that includes Big Foster (David Morse), his son Lil Foster (Ryan Hurst) face a power struggle with Lady Ray (Phyllis Somerville) and a coal company who wants to mine the mountain.

title: Wrecked (2016)
description: Based on the novel by Blake Nelson, high school junior Maddie Graham reluctantly becomes a patient at the Springtime Meadows rehab facility or risk expulsion from school.

title: To Tell the Truth
description: A bored Lucifer (Tom Ellis) settles in Los Angeles and helps the LAPD.

title: Animal Kingdom
description: Before her talk show for Netflix premieres, Chelsea Handler returns with a four-part documentary series where she covers such topics as drugs, marriage, racism and Silicon Valley.

title: Guilt
description: The documentary series narrated by Lauren Terp explores the more hidden and darker parts of the Internet and technology including 3-D printing of weapons, cults, hackers, and pornography.

title: BrainDead
description: Chip Baskets (Zach Galifianakis) dreams of being a French clown but real life interferes with his plans.

title: The Night Stalker
description: Rip Hunter's (Arthur Darvill) mission is to form a team that includes Ray Palmer/the Atom (Brandon Routh), Dr. Martin Stein (Victor Garber) and Leonard Snart/Captain Cold (Wentworth Miller) to help save the world and it's future.

title: Ride with Norman Reedus
description: Countess Natasha Rostova (Lily James) becomes engaged to Prince Andrei Bolkonsky (James Norton) but eventually falls in love with Pierre Bezukhov (Paul Dano) in this adaptation of Leo Tolstoy's epic novel by Andrew Davies.

title: The American West
description: The cop comedy from from Steve Carell and his wife Nancy focuses on the Los Angeles Police Department's Really Heinous Crimes Unit that includes Angie Tribeca (Rashida Jones), her new partner J. Geils (Hayes MacArthur), and their Captain (Jere Burns).

title: Voltron: Legendary Defender
description: Produced by Ridley Scott, the drama follows the lives of two Civil War nurses: Mary Phinney (Mary Elizabeth Winstead), a New England widow working and Emma Green (Hannah James), a young southern belle, whose family's luxury Alexandria hotel has been turned into a Union Army hospital they both volunteer at.

title: Cleverman
description: The latest Real Housewives franchise moves to Potomac, Maryland, to follow the lives of Gizelle Bryant, Ashley Darby, Robyn Dixon, Karen Huger, Charrisse Jackson-Jordan, and Katie Rost.

title: Roadies
description: The political documentary series featuring Bloomberg Politics managing editors Mark Halperin and John Heilemann and campaign strategist Mark McKinnon takes a look behind-the-scenes of the 2016 presidential race.

title: Maya & Marty
description: In a future occupied Los Angeles, former FBI agent Will Bowman (Josh Holloway) and his wife (Sarah Wayne Callies) are given an opportunity to be reunited with one of their sons if they cooperate with the occupying authorities.

title: Roots (2016)
description: The Lookinglass Project founded by Otto Goodwin (Adhir Kalyan) and his twin sister, Mary (Dilshad Vadsaria) bring back to life Jimmy Pritchard (Robert Kazinsky), a LA County sheriff murdered by corrupt police in this drama originally called The Frankenstein Code (also Frankenstein and Lookinglass) was inspired by Mary Shelley's Frankens...

title: The Dresser (2016)
description: Based on a web series created by the Katydids, the comedy series follows the lives of six elementary school teachers (Caitlin Barlow, Katy Colloton, Cate Freedman, Kate Lambert, Katie O'Brien and Kathryn Renée Thomas).

title: Outcast
description: The television adaptation of Cassandra Clare's The Mortal Instruments series follows Clary Fray (Katherine McNamara) after she discovers she is a Shadowhunter, an human-angel hybrid who hunt demons. When her mother is kidnapped, Clary and her best friend Simon (Alberto Rosende) meet Shadowhunter Jace (Dominic Sherwood) and embark into th...

title: Preacher
description: Outspoken Amy (Jane Lynch) declares she is Allison's (Maggie Lawson) guardian angel in this comedy from Tad Quill and Don Scardino.

title: All The Way (2016)
description: Single mother and Brooklyn police detective Harlee Santos (Jennifer Lopez) finds herself working as an informant against her own unit for the FBI's anti-corruption task force after being caught doing something illegal.

title: Lady Dynamite
description: Retired Louisiana detective Rodie Sanchez re-opens the 1987 case of the body of LSU graduate student Eugenie Boisfontaine with Aubrey St. Angelo, the son of the detective he worked with.

title: O.J.: Made in America
description: The adaptation of the fantasy book series by Terry Brooks set thousands of year in the future where follows Elvin Princess Amberle (Poppy Drayton); Eretria (Ivana Baquero), a Human Rover; and Wil(Austin Butler), a Half-Elf, Half-Human, seek to stop a Demon army from destroying the world.

title: Julian Fellowes Presents Doctor Thorne
description: The comedy created by Jay Lacopo follows the misadventures of 26-year-old Cooper Barrett (Jack Cutmore-Scott), his married brother (Justin Bartha), and his two roommates (James Earl and Charlie Saxton), as they struggle with dating and work life.

title: Genius by Stephen Hawking
description: The animated comedy from Mark Hentemann and Seth MacFarlane focuses on two families living near the US/Mexico border.

title: Coupled
description: Jermaine Dupri mentors five young hip hop artists, ages 12 to 16-years-old in this reality series executive produced by Queen Latifah and Shakim Compere.

title: Chelsea
description: Hedge fund king Bobby ‘Axe’ Axelrod (Damian Lewis) comes under investigation by U.S. Attorney Chuck Rhoades (Paul Giamatti). It’s a high stakes war set in the fast-paced, ego-driven world of high finance where both men are forced to answer the question: What is power worth?

title: Marseille
description: Billy Ray Cyrus is Burnin' Vernon, a one-hit-wonder who is sent to a church as a handyman as part of his parole. He fools everyone into thinking he is the new minister and discovers he has a 15-year-old daughter (Madison Iseman).

title: Flowers (2016)
description: The comedic talk show hosted by Christian Finnegan and Sherrod Small cover race in America through sketches and discussions with celebrity guests.

title: Rebellion
description: The historical epic focuses on King Saul (Ray Winstone) and the young shepherd David (Oliver Rix), who will take over.

title: Time Traveling Bong
description: Former President Richard Graves (Nick Nolte) seeks to overturn many of his administration's accomplishments just as his wife Margaret (Sela Ward) decides she wants to run for office.

title: The Night Manager
description: Jamal, Grover, and Milk are friends who are benchwarmers on their high school basketball team with big dreams in this animated comedy.

title: Containment
description: Originally aired on the BBC in Dec 2015, the adaptation of Agatha Christie's novel of the same name, begins with eight people invited to a small island off the coast of Devon and at dinner hear a message that accuses them all of murder. One by one, the guests and the two servants of the house are killed.

title: Confirmation
description: Moira Demos and Laura Ricciardi's 10-part documentary focuses on the case of Steven Avery, a man convicted of sexual assault, before being exonerated by DNA evidence 18 years later. A few years later, he is convicted in the disappearance and murder of another woman.

title: American Grit
description: Baggage handler Frank Murphy (Bill Burr) and his wife (Laura Dern) raise their three children (Justin Long, Haley Reinhart) in 1973 in the animated comedy created by Bill Burr and Michael Price.

title: The Last Panthers
description: High school senior Quentin Coldwater (Jason Ralph) secretly loves the fantasy novels about the adventures of five children in a magical land called Fillory. He soon is accepted into an exclusive, secret magicians university called Brakebills in upstate New York and discovers Fillory is a real place in this adaptation of Lev Grossman's t...

title: Game of Silence
description: The adaptation of Arthur C. Clarke's science fiction novel where aliens called Overlords, led by its ambassador Karellen (Charles Dance), promise through human liaison Ricky Stormgren (Mike Vogel) technological advances for the planet.

title: Jackie Robinson
description: In the Tennessee Great Smoky Mountains, nine-year-old Dolly (Alyvia Alyn Lind) and her family (Jennifer Nettles, Ricky Schroder, and Gerald McRaney) overcome misfortune in the TV movie inspired by Dolly Parton's life.

title: Hunters
description: The docuseries follows seven young adults with down syndrome in Los Angeles.

title: The Detour
description: Originally titled Hot & Bothered, the comedy where telenovela actress Ana Maria (Eva Longoria) deals with real life drama in her life as she tries to stay at the top of her world.

title: Dice (2016)
description: The Christmas special directed by Sofia Coppola and written by Coppola, Bill Murray and Mitch Glazer, is set in New York's Carlyle Hotel with Murray acting and singing in sketches with a variety of artists including Michael Cera, Miley Cyrus, George Clooney, Miley Cyrus, Rashida Jones, Jenny Lewis, Phoenix, Amy Poehler, Chris Rock, Maya ...

title: The Girlfriend Experience
description: NBC's latest live musical is an adaptation of the retelling of The Wizard of Oz with 18-year-old newcomer Shanice Williams as Dorothy; Queen Latifah as the Wiz; Mary J. Blige as Evillene, the Wicked Witch of the West; David Alan Grier as the Cowardly Lion; Elijah Kelley as the Scarecrow; Ne-Yo as the Tin Man; Common as the Bouncer of the...

title: Nothing Left Unsaid: Gloria Vanderbilt & Anderson Cooper
description: The scripted comedy series written, produced and starring Rob Schneider is about how Schneider tries to balance his career and family while dealing with his assistant (Jamie Lissow), and a stalker (Max Amini).

title: Doctor Foster: A Woman Scorned
description: The workplace comedy from The Office producer Justin Spitzer features America Ferrera, Ben Feldman, Mark McKinney, Lauren Ash, Colton Dunn, Nichole Bloom and Nico Santos as workers at a big-box superstore.

title: Dead 7
description: Narrated by Mandy Patinkin, the documentary focuses on the controversial methods used by the agency after 9/11 with interviews with 12 former CIA directors, several operatives, and critics.

title: The Ranch
description: The horror series set in Charleston, South Carolina from Eli Roth and Jason Blum follows demon hunters Maria Abascal (Mena Suvari) and her brother, David (Zachary Booth) as they seek exorcise evil from others while Maria also battles Abigail, the demon inside her.

title: Wynonna Earp
description: Based on the book series by Daniel Abraham and Ty Franck (under the pen name James S. A. Corey), Detective Miller (Thomas Jane) is given the assignment to find a missing heiress and meets Holden (Steven Strait), who works on a freighter called the Canterbury.

title: Rush Hour (2016)
description: Simba's (Rob Lowe) son Kion (Max Charles) selects the new Lion Guard that includes Bunga (Joshua Rush), a honey badger; Fuli (Diamond White), a cheetah; Beshte (Dusan Brown), a hippo; and Ono (Atticus Shaffer), an egret.

title: Lopez
description: Based on an idea from Jim Henson and Jerry Juhl, freshly divorced Ron Emmerson (Jay Harrington) takes his two kids Tim (Graham Verchere) and Annie (Genevieve Buechner) to visit his Aunt Cyd (Mary Steenburgen), where they look into rumor of the Howling Hoodoo creature of Turkey Hollow.

title: The Path
description: Former superhero Jessica Jones (Krysten Ritter) has opened a detective agency called Alias Investigations and meets Luke Cage (Mike Colter) on one of her cases as a man (David Tennant) from her past resurfaces in the second of four live-actions series based on Marvel characters for Netflix.

title: Heartbeat (2016)
description: Crackle's first scripted drama is set in the world of auction houses where former soldier Graham Connor (Christian Cooke) uses the connections he made while in Iraq to gain a mentor in eccentric art collector Arthur Davenport (Cary Elwes) and crosses paths with Roxanna Whitney (Kate Bosworth), the daughter of the CEO of an auction house...

title: The Passion
description: The Chicago Fire spin-off takes place at a Chicago hospital run by Sharon Goodwin (S. Epatha Merkerson), whom with head of psychiatry Dr. Daniel Charles (Oliver Platt); ER surgeon Dr. Lilly Manning (Torrey DeVitto); nurse April Sexton (Yaya DaCosta), emergency room intern Dr. Sarah Reese (Rachel DiPillo), help the injured and ill.

title: Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders
description: Loosely based on Journey To The West, warrior Sunny (Daniel Wu) and a young boy named M.K. (Aramis Knight) must travel across the Badlands controlled by seven barons in a post-apocalyptic America in this martial arts drama from Alfred Gough and Miles Millar .

title: Crowded
description: Co-created by Ed McCardie and Corinne Marrinan, Jean Bastiere (Marc-André Grondin) runs a crime scene cleaning business in London when his estranged brother, Martin (Denis Ménochet), returns with secrets from Jean's past and a dead body that brings mob boss Nelson Clay (Brendan Coyle) into their lives.

title: Lady Day at Emerson's Bar and Grill
description: The sketch comedy show reunites many of Mr. Show's writers including Bob Odenkirk and David Cross.

title: Party Over Here
description: Aspiring fashion designers between 14 and 17 compete on the latest Project Runway spin-off where they are judged by Kelly Osbourne, Christian Siriano, and executive fashion editor at Cosmopolitan and Seventeen Magazine Aya Kanai.

title: The Story of God With Morgan Freeman
description: After the death of her husband, Natalie Maccabee (Sharon Stone) runs for office and becomes the first female Vice President. She learns she has been assigned to Agent X, who is there to help her protect the Constitution.

title: Flaked
description: 30-year-old Dev (Aziz Ansari) is a New York actor who has no idea what he wants in the comedy that will includes guest appearances from Claire Danes, Noah Emmerich and Ansari's parents.

title: The Characters
description: Tig (Tig Notaro) returns to her hometown after the death of her mother and is reunited with her older brother (Noah Harpster) and her stepfather (John Rothman) in this dark comedy loosely based on the comedian's own life.

title: 60 Days In
description: Intelligence officer John Tavner (Michael Dorman) is given an assignment to stop Iran from getting nuclear armaments while working at Milwaukee's McMillan Industrial Piping in this dark comedy from Steven Conrad.

title: Underground
description: The life of Zelda Fitzgerald (Christina Ricci) is chronicled from her first meeting with F. Scott (Gavin Stenhouse in the pilot and David Hoflin in the rest of the season) in 1918 in the drama series created by Dawn Prestwich and Nicole Yorkin.

title: Little Big Shots
description: In 1969, three female researchers (Genevieve Angelson, Anna Camp, and Erin Darke) at “News of the Week” seek to be treated fairly.

title: Damien
description: Former Los Angeles Laker Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (born Lew Alcindor, Jr.) talks about his life and career in this documentary narrated by Liev Schreiber with archival footage and interviews with fellow NBA players, coaches, and friends.

title: Slasher
description: A dashing English con man's scheme to marry into a prominent East Coast family is threatened by the arrival of his unhinged, ne'er-do-well brother on the eve of his wedding to the daughter of a U.S. senator. Feature directorial debut for Jason Mann, the winner of the fourth season of HBO's "Project Greenlight."

title: The Family (2016)
description: The eight-episode drama series follows Claire (Sarah Hay), a ballerina with a troubled past as she joins a prestigious New York's ballet and faces a volatile artistic director (Ben Daniels) and her own past.

title: Hap and Leonard
description: The six-part series features focuses on the latest research in science with each episode by a different director and narrator that includes Peter Berg, Brett Ratner and Adrien Brody, Paul Giamatti, Ron Howard, Akiva Goldsman and Jason Bateman, and Angela Bassett.

title: The Real O'Neals
description: The two-part miniseries about the first Thanksgiving with the Pilgrims led by William Bradford (Vincent Kartheiser) and the Native Americans led by Massasoit (Raoul Trujillo) with English-speaking Squanto (Kalani Queypo) acting as an ambassador.

title: Soundbreaking
description: Former CNBC talk show host Donny Deutsch plays a fictional version of himself in the comedy series.

title: Fuller House
description: The comedic horror series from by Sam Raimi and Bruce Campbell finds Ash trying to keep away from the Evil Dead for the past 30 years. When a Deadite plague breaks out, a reluctant Ash with the help of Pablo Simon Bolivar (Ray Santiago) and Kelly Maxwell (Dana Delorenzo) try to end Evil once and for all.

title: Cooked
description: Set in 1982, a murder of a girl who met a man (Ed Westwick) on the Sunset Strip brings together amateur journalist Karen McClaren (Taissa Farmiga) and Los Angeles detectives Jack Roth (Jeremy Sisto) and Paco Contreras (Gabriel Luna) as they seek the killer.

title: Love (2016)
description: Superman's 24-year-old cousin Kara Zor-El (Melissa Benoist) lands on CBS with Calista Flockhart, Mehcad Brooks, Chyler Leigh, and David Harewood rounding out the cast of the superhero drama from Greg Berlanti.

title: Join or Die with Craig Ferguson
description: Directed by Chris Rock, the HBO stand-up special was filmed in May 2014 at the famed New York theater.

title: Great Minds with Dan Harmon
description: Best friends and neighbors Mitch (Mark-Paul Gosselaar) and Russell (Tone Bell) talk about race, sex and life in the DJ Nash comedy originally titled People Are Talking.

The British crime drama series from Abi Morgan focuses on Detective Inspector John River (Stellan Skarsgård) who is haunted by the murder of his partner Detective Sergeant Jackie “Stevie” Stevenson (Nicola Walker).

title: Vinyl
description: Originally developed for sister channel Showtime, the revamped show follows a young woman (Rachel Bloom) who gives up her job at a law firm in New York City to move to West Covina, California to seek love and happiness.

title: Better Late Than Never
description: After his noble Saxon parents were killed by the invading Vikings, a young Uhtred (Tom Taylor) was taken in and raised by the Vikings. As a grown man (Alexander Dreymon) finds himself in Wessex, where King Alfred the Great has thus far kept the Vikings from conquering his lands in this adaptation of Bernard Cornwell's series, The Saxon S...

title: Not Safe with Nikki Glaser
description: The stop-motion animation series finds Titanium Rex (voiced by Bryan Cranston), leader of The League of Freedom struggling to keep his group of super heroes relevant in the face of younger champions.

title: Full Frontal with Samantha Bee
description: Alex Cole, a bachelor brother (Tommy Dewey) and his newly divorced sister, Valerie Cole (Michaela Watkins) live together and raise her teenage daughter (Tara Lynne Barr) in this comedy from Zander Lehmann.

title: Letterkenny
description: Lifetime's latest "Unauthorized Story" TV movie is about the '90s Aaron Spelling teen soap Beverly Hills, 90210 and focuses on the first four seasons of the show with Shannen Doherty (Samantha Munro).

title: Animals
description: Inspired by the Julie Summer book, Jambusters, Frances Barden (Samantha Bond) clashes with Joyce Cameron (Francesca Annis) over their branch of the Women’s Institute in this drama set in the small English village of Great Paxford.

title: Madoff
description: The reality show follows Tito Jackson’s sons: TJ, Taj, and Taryll as they attempt to record a new album.

title: Those Who Can't
description: Dr. Ken (Ken Jeong) is a medical practitioner with no tact with his patients or his family.

title: Grease: Live
description: Recently widowed Gertrude "Gigi" Rotblum (David Krumholtz) uses the money in a bank account left by her late husband's will to travel and experience life.
