title: Horace and Pete
description: The sports comedy from Denis Leary, Tom Sellitti, and Jim Serpico focuses on the amateur hockey club led by Paul Rosenberg (Andrew Schulz), with his friends Anthony (Chris Distefano), Dicky (Mark Gessner), and Sebalos (Ruy Iskandar).

title: You, Me and the Apocalypse
description: The medical drama based on the 2014 documentary of the same name, Residency Director Dr. Leanne Rorish (Marcia Gay Harden) with the help of senior nurse Jesse Sallander (Luis Guzman), leads a group of first-year residents that includes: Christa Lorenson (Bonnie Somerville), Malaya Pineda (Melanie Kannokada), Mario Savetti (Benjamin Holli...

title: Outsiders
description: After eight years of playing a lawyer on television, Dean Sanderson (Rob Lowe) moves to join the family law firm in Idaho where his brother (Fred Savage) is an actual lawyer.

title: Recovery Road
description: Bachelor Jimmy Martino (John Stamos) is surprised to learn he has a grown son (Josh Peck) with a young daughter.

title: Lucifer
description: The oil boom in North Dakota draws Billy (Chace Crawford) and Cody Lefever (Rebecca Rittenhouse) to North Dakota where they cross paths with wealthy businessman Hap Briggs (Don Johnson).

title: Chelsea Does
description: Set in 1932, Ralph Whelan (Henry Lloyd-Hughes) and fellow members of the Indian Civil Service move to Simla for the summer where socialite Cynthia Coffin (Julie Walters) runs the whites-only Royal Club.

title: Dark Net
description: Security expert Alex Kane (Philip Winchester) seeks revenge for the murder of his wife when he is approached by Mr. Johnson (Wesley Snipes) to become part of a high stakes game where wealthy individuals bet on Kane's ability to stop crimes from happening.

title: Baskets
description: The sequel to the 2006 series Heroes features the return of Masi Oka (Hiro Nakamura), H.R.G. (Jack Coleman), and The Haitian (Jimmy Jean-Louis), as a new batch of extraordinary people such as Luke Collins (Zachary Levi) and Miko Otomo (Kiki Sukezane) discover their abilities.

title: DC's Legends of Tomorrow
description: Miami private pathologist Dr. Beaumont Rosewood Jr. (Morris Chestnut) teams up with Miami police detective Villa (Jaina Lee Ortiz).

title: War & Peace
description: Based on the film of the same name, with the help of the NZT drug to utilize all of his brain's capabilities, Brian Finch (Jake McDorman) works with the FBI in New York with Special Agent Rebecca Harris (Jennifer Carpenter) and Special Agent Boyle (Hill Harper).

title: Angie Tribeca
description: Ryan Murphy's latest anthology series begins its first season with a series of murders at a sorority house.

title: Mercy Street
description: The family comedy from Justin Adler focuses on John and Joan Short (James Brolin, Dianne Wiest) and their three grown children: Greg (Colin Hanks), Heather (Betsy Brandt), and Matt (Thomas Sadoski).

title: The Real Housewives of Potomac
description: Set ten years after the 2002 film of the same name, precog Dash (Stark Sands) only has flashes of crimes when he crosses paths with detective Lara Vega (Meagan Good), who may help him locate his twin.

title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth
description: A woman (Jaimie Alexander) covered in tattoos, including the name of a FBI agent (Sullivan Stapleton) is found naked in Times Square with no memories.

title: Colony
description: The one-hour special features more than a dozen women who are interviewed about their experiences and feeling about Bill Cosby.

title: Second Chance
description: The animated comedy series inspired by 1980s crime dramas, Detective Dazzle Novak (Rob Lowe) deals with his tough boss Chief Pizzaz Miller (Elizabeth Banks) and an ambitious rookie named Rad Cunningham (Will Forte) who is waiting for Novak to fail.

title: Teachers (2016)
description: Neil Patrick Harris host this live variety show based on the British show, Ant & Dec’s Saturday Night Takeaway.

title: Shadowhunters
description: Former sci-fi star Wray Nerely (Alan Tudyk) journeys through the convention circuit in this Emmy-nominated comedy series that first premiered on Vimeo VOD and Comic-Con HQ. Season one's 13 episodes back-to-back on Syfy.

title: Angel From Hell
description: Wilkin Brattle (Lee Jones), a former knight in charge for King Edward I who after many wars turned over his sword, only to have war seek him out.

title: Shades of Blue
description: To raise funds for scholarship charity Cancer for College, comedian Will Ferrell played 10 positions in five spring training games in Arizona for 10 different teams on one day in this comedy special.

title: Killing Fields
description: Stephen Colbert moves from his satirical late night show, "The Colbert Report" to take over David Letterman's seat at the long-running CBS late night talk show.

title: The Shannara Chronicles
description: Alex Weaver (Priyanka Chopra), Ryan Booth (Jake McLaughlin), Shelby Wyatt (Johanna Braddy), Nimah Anwar (Yasmine Al Massri), Caleb Haas (Graham Rogers), Simon Asher (Tate Ellington) and Eric Packer are new FBI recruits trained by FBI academy director Miranda Shaw (Aunjanue Ellis) and Special Agent Liam O’Connor (Josh Hopkins). However, o...

title: Cooper Barrett's Guide to Surviving Life
description: The reality series follows the YouTube star and his team as they plan and create music parodies.

title: Bordertown (2016)
description: The drama about the 1980s Medellin cocaine cartel run by Pablo Escobar (Wagner Moura) and the efforts of DEA agents Steve Murphy (Boyd Holbrook) and Javier Peña (Pedro Pascal) to capture and kill him.

title: The Rap Game
description: The comedy focuses on Jerrod's (Jerrod Carmichael) relationship with his girlfriend Maxine (Amber West), his brother (Lil Rel Howery), and parents (David Alan Grier and Loretta Devine).

title: Billions
description: The Ed Burns crime drama set in 1967 where Public Morals Division officer Terry Muldoon (Ed Burns) tries to keep his family safe from his work.

title: Still the King
description: Mari McCabe (Megalyn Echikunwoke) discovers a necklace from her biological parents allows her to mimic the powers of any animal and becomes the heroine Vixen. First aired on CW Seed, it airs both seasons on The CW as a two-hour movie.

title: Black and White (2016)
description: The Walking Dead spin-off is set in Los Angeles where a divorced teacher named Travis (Cliff Curtis), his fiance Madison (Kim Dickens), and her two children (Frank Dillane and Alycia Debnam-Carey) face the coming zombie apocalypse.

title: Of Kings and Prophets
description: British newsman Walter Blunt (Patrick Stewart) moves to Los Angeles with his manservant Harry (Adrian Scarborough) to host a cable news show in this comedy created by Jonathan Ames.

title: Graves
description: After 2014's The Unauthorized Saved by the Bell Story, Lifetime returns with one for the 1980s family comedy featuring some stories from Bob Saget's memoir Dirty Daddy: The Chronicles of a Family Man Turned Filthy Comedian.

title: Legends of Chamberlain Heights
description: Fred Armisen and Bill Hader put a comedic spin to documentaries in this six-episodes series created with Seth Meyers.

title: And Then There Were None (2016)
description: Ten young adult entrepreneurs enter a seven-week program at Draper University and after they finish, they pitch their ideas to venture capitalists for a chance to receive funding.

title: Making a Murderer
description: American Rob Norris (Rob Delaney) decides to return to England to be with Sharon Morris (Sharon Horgan) after learning she is pregnant after their short affair.

title: F is for Family
description: The Matt Nix series focuses on a Dr. John Ellison (Jason O’Mara) who is still grieving the death of his daughter when he saves a young boy's life and kills one of the would-be killers. His decision to keep the boy safe when he learns he is still a target, causes major changes in Ellison's life and his thoughts on his career.

title: The Magicians (2016)
description: Based on Lily Koppel’s book of the same name, the drama series focuses on the wives of the astronauts from the Mercury, Gemini and Apollo missions.

title: Childhood's End
description: Set in 1980s Germany, 24-year-old East German Martin Rauch (Jonas Nay) is sent by the Stasi to spy on the West German army in this German-language drama.

title: Dolly Parton's Coat of Many Colors
description: Dr. Carolyn Tyler (Jennifer Beals) is recovering from the loss of one of her children and the end of her marriage when a millionaire (Matthew Modine) convinces her to investigate cases of reincarnation and out-of-body experiences.

title: Born this Way
description: Former high school classmates find themselves working at the same Massachusetts barbershop in this sitcom originally called Buzzy's Barbershop.

title: Telenovela
description: Based on Susanna Clarke’s novel set in 1806 London where the magician Mr Norrell (Eddie Marsan) delights an England at war with Napoleon until he is challenged by Jonathan Strange (Carvel).

title: A Very Murray Christmas
description: Based on the graphic novel of the same name, the crew of a spaceship awaken with no memories of themselves or how they joined the trip.

title: The Wiz Live!
description: The eight-part documentary series follows last year's "The Sixties" with clips and interviews to illustrate a decade of change in culture and politics.

title: Real Rob
description: The reality series follows the journey of 17-year-old Ben as his father Charlie transitions to becoming Carly.

title: Superstore
description: Author Jill Weber (Jill Kargman) struggles with fitting in the world of New York City's Upper East Side mothers in Bravo's first scripted comedy series.

title: The Spymasters - CIA in the Crosshairs
description: The sci-fi series from J. Michael Straczynski and the Wachowskis is about eight strangers (Freema Agyeman, Aml Ameen, Naveen Andrews, Doona Bae, Jamie Clayton, Tena Desae, Max Riemelt, and Brian J. Smith) who after a death discover they are emotionally and mentally connected to each other and must work together to save humanity and thems...

title: South of Hell
description: Covert operative Kirsten (Emma Ishta) works with neuroscientist Cameron (Kyle Harris) to be integrated (stitched) into the minds of recently deceased to use their memories to investigate crimes.

title: The Expanse
description: FBI child specialist Claire Bennigan (Lily Rabe) is sent in to investigate after a dangerous event caused by a group of children in Washington, D.C. who claim an imaginary friend named Drill told them to do it.

title: The Lion Guard: Return of the Roar
description: Rachel (Shiri Appleby) will do anything, including manipulating the contestants for Julia (Constance Zimmer), the executive producer of the hit dating show they work on.

title: Jim Henson's Turkey Hollow
description: Based on J. Randy Taraborrelli's novel, Marilyn Monroe (Kelli Garner) struggles with fame, her husbands, her mental illness, and always haunted by her mother Gladys (Susan Sarandon), who was secretly institutionalized.

title: Marvel's Jessica Jones
description: The documentary reality series follows five people who work and party late into the night in New York City.

title: The Art of More
description: Los Angeles police Sgt. Sam Hodiak (David Duchovny) is paired with officer Brian Shafe (Gray Damon), who poses as a hippie in 1967 for a missing person case that will later be revealed to be connected to Charles Manson (Gethin Anthony).

title: Chicago Med
description: Kellan Lutz hosts the reality show where eight contestants will use their bodies as human darts on targets on land, air and water for a $50,000 prize.

title: Into the Badlands
description: Two families in need are each given a briefcase that contains $101,000 and are given 72 hours to make a decision to keep it all or give some to another family.

title: Spotless
description: The reality show based on the British show with Bear Grylls has 14 men filming themselves as they try to survive on a deserted island with only minimal tools and the clothes they are wearing.

title: W/ Bob & David
description: The beginnings of The Texas Rangers and General Sam Houston's (Bill Paxton) fight for independence from Mexico's rule by General Santa Anna (Olivier Martinez) are covered in the eight-hour miniseries.

title: Project Runway Junior
description: The Canadian thriller from Michael McGowan is about the small town of Pretty Lake where a unknown disease has killed everyone except those 21-years-old or younger.

title: Agent X
description: Airing over nine consecutive nights, the game show hosted by Richard Quest features a contestant trying to answer 500 general knowledge questions and is only allotted ten seconds for each question.

title: Master of None
description: The Dee Rees film dramatizes the rise to fame for blues singer Bessie Smith (Queen Latifah).

title: One Mississippi
description: Secret Service agent Ethan Burke (Matt Dillon) search for two missing federal agents in a small Idaho town uncovers his ex-partner (Carla Gugino); nurse Pam (Melissa Leo), who turns out to be more dangerous than she first appeared; psychiatrist Dr. Jenkins (Toby Jones); Sheriff Pope (Terrence Howard); toymaker Harold Ballinger (Reed Diam...

title: Patriot
description: Long-time adversaries Grace (Jane Fonda) and Frankie (Lily Tomlin) are unexpectedly brought together when their husbands (Martin Sheen and Sam Waterson) fall in love with each other.

title: Z: The Beginning of Everything
description: The Lifetime TV movie about the kidnapping and abuse of Michelle Knight (Taryn Manning), Amanda Berry (Samantha Droke), and Gina DeJesus (Katie Sarife) by Ariel Castro (Raymond Cruz) is told from Knight's point-of-view.

title: Good Girls Revolt
description: The Shark Tank spinoff takes a look at what happens after the entrepreneurs make a deal with the Shark(s) as they take the next step to grow their businesses.

title: Kareem: Minority of One
description: The miniseries based on J.K. Rowling's non-Harry Potter novel is set in the English village of Pagford where parish council Chairman Howard Mollison (Michael Gambon) battles Barry Fairbrother (Rory Kinnear) over turning the charity Sweetlove House into a spa. When Barry dies suddenly, a heated election exposes secrets of many of the vill...

title: The Leisure Class
description: Originally set with Philip Seymour Hoffman before his death in 2014, the dark comedy from Shalom Auslander follows Thom Payne (Steve Coogan) as he reevaluates his life after facing his new 25-year-old boss.

title: Flesh and Bone
description: The documentary series from David Gelb focuses on international chefs and their work in their kitchens.

title: Breakthrough
description: Based on Neil deGrasse Tyson's podcast, the daily talk show will feature interviews about science with a variety of guests.

title: Saints & Strangers
description: A group of five strangers (Diogo Morgado, Shantel VanSanten, Sofia Black-D'Elia, Jon Fletcher, JD Pardo) thought to be dying after an object falls onto Earth are soon mysteriously revived to learn they must stop an apocalypse.

title: Donny!
description: The British comedy known as Scrotal Recall during its first season on Channel 4 focused on Dylan (Johnny Flynn), who after discovering he has chlamydia must track down his former lovers to let them know of his diagnosis.

title: Ash Vs. Evil Dead
description: The Paul Feig comedy set in the 22nd century, where mankind had explored space only to find no other alien life. But one day, a spaceship with a ragtag crew of rookies, robots, and burned-out pros stumbles into an alternative universe.

title: Wicked City
description: Russell T. Davies, the creator of Queer As Folk returns with two (three if you count the web series, Tofu) separate but connected series. This half- hour series focuses on younger characters including Dean Monroe (Fisayo Akinade) and Freddie Baxter (Freddie Fox), two colleagues of Henry Best (Vincent Franklin) from Cucumber, its sister s...

title: Supergirl (2015)
description: Cedric The Entertainer hosts the reality series where the best barbers from across the United States are judged by a panel that includes Curtis Smith, Rich the Barber, Bashan “B.G. Cutta” Gibbs and Lena Piccininni, on their unique styling and hair designs.

title: Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo
description: In New York City's Hell's Kitchen neighborhood, Matt Murdock (Charlie Cox) fights for justice as a blind lawyer in the daylight and as Daredevil at night.

title: Truth Be Told (2015)
description: The comedy based on the Swedish series Ulveson and Herngren is set behind the scenes of a late night sketch comedy show where veteran comic Billy (Billy Crystal) is set up with Josh (Josh Gad), an up-and-coming comedian.

title: River
description: The comedy from Elizabeth Banks focuses on the lives of a team college dorm advisers led by head RA Olivia (Jamie Chung).

title: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend
description: The comedy based on the Israeli show with the same name is about a young married couple Kelli and Oliver Weston (Kat Foster and Kyle Howard) and each week it will alternate the story between the two in-laws families (Ed Begley Jr., Richard Dreyfus, Cynthia Stevenson, and JoBeth Williams).

title: The Last Kingdom
description: The docuseries follows six female comedians from Los Angeles as they seek a career as comics while balancing the demands of their day-time job, dating and family life.

title: SuperMansion
description: The documentary directed by Alex Gibney features interviews with his family, co-stars, journalists, as well as a variety of footage of Ol' Blue Eyes performing (including his 1971 "retirement" concert) to illustrate his life and influence on America.

title: Casual
description: After Sgt. Odelle Ballard (Anna Friel) discovers a computer file that implicates a major US corporation of funding Jihadists, her unit is murdered by US Special Forces, just as former U.S. Attorney Peter Decker (Peter Facinelli) tackles a merger with the corporation, and political activist Harrison Walters (Jake Robinson) hears from a ha...

title: The Unauthorized Beverly Hills, 90210 Story
description: The effects of the death of Christ on his disciples, Mary and other leaders are explored in this miniseries from Mark Burnett and Roma Downey.

title: Home Fires
description: The adaption of Hilary Mantel's novels about the rise of Thomas Cromwell (Mark Rylance) during the reign King Henry VIII (Damian Lewis).

title: The Jacksons: Next Generation
description: The mythology drama follows the journey of Hero (Tom York) who eventually leads a few men and women to banished the Gods to the Kingdom of Hades.

title: Dr. Ken

title: Gigi Does It

title: Code Black (2015)
description: Based on the Pulitzer Prize-winning book by Siddhartha Mukherjee, the six-hour documentary directed by Barak Goodman (and executive produced by Ken Burns) explores the history of cancer and the latest medical advances with stories of real-life patients.

title: Blood & Oil
description: Internet billionaire Jake Tullus (Andrew Santino) finds owning a new Las Vegas pro basketball team is harder than he thought and clashes with the NBA commissioner's special assistant, Dusty Halford (Malin Akerman) in the Yahoo! Screen comedy.

title: Indian Summers
description: British actor/comedian James Corden takes over for Craig Ferguson.

title: The Player
description: The return of eldest son Danny Rayburn (Ben Mendelsohn) to his Florida keys hometown for the anniversary of his parents' (Sissy Spacek and Sam Shephard) hotel causes tension and secrets to spill out amongst his family including his three siblings: John (Kyle Chandler), Kevin (Norbert Leo Butz), and Meg (Linda Cardellini).

title: Heroes: Reborn
description: The YouTube series from Rainn Wilson about two celebrity impressionists Ross Marquand and Jim Meskimen who want to be taken as serious drama actors moves to Pop.

title: Rosewood
description: Best friends Lizzie (Elisha Cuthbert) and Luke (Nick Zano) decide to have a baby together, but when Luke fall in love and marries Prudence (Kelly Brook), it complicates their original plan.

title: Limitless (2015)
description: Based on the DC comic of the same name, Olivia "Liv" Moore (Rose McIver) was a medical student who after becoming a zombie takes a job in a coroner's office where she has access to brains to eat. She soon discovers she takes on the traits and memories of the person whose brain she had consumed. With encouragement from her boss Dr. Ravi C...

title: Scream Queens (2015)
description: The first scripted drama for the E! network follows the lives of a fictional British Royal family that includes Elizabeth Hurley as Queen Helena, Vincent Regan as King Simon, William Moseley as Prince Liam, Alexandra Park as Princess Eleanor and Merritt Patterson as Ophelia, Liam's American lover.

title: Life in Pieces
description: Originally developed for FX, the first series on the Playstation Network is based on the graphic novel series by Brian Michael Bendis and Michael Avon Oeming, where detectives Christian Walker (Sharlto Copley) and Deena Pilgrim (Susan Heyward) solve homicide cases that involve superpowers.

title: Minority Report (2015)
description: Carlton Cuse's American adaption of the French drama Les Revenants (shown on Sundance as The Returned) is also set in a small town where the dead reappear. The returned include Simon (Mat Vairo), a musician who died ten years ago and twin sisters (Sophie Lowe and India Ennenga) who died in a bus accident four years ago. Sheriff Tommy Mor...

title: Blindspot
description: Kimmy Schmidt (Ellie Kemper) moves to New York to start over after escaping from a doomsday cult in this comedy originally created by Tina Fey and Robert Carlock for NBC.

title: Cosby: The Women Speak
description: FBI agent Peter Connelly (Jason Isaacs) relocates to Israel where he works with his boss (and lover) Lynn Monahan (Anne Heche). During a murder investigation, he discovers a thousand year long conspiracy that could change history.

title: Moonbeam City
description: The John Ridley anthology crime drama series features a cast that includes Felicity Huffman, Timothy Hutton, Regina King, and Lili Taylor.

description: The latest CSI spin-off focuses on Special Agent Avery Ryan (Patricia Arquette) and her fellow agents of the Cyber Crime Division of the FBI in Quantico.

description: The dramady from Vince Gulligan finds FBI agent Milton Chamberlain (Josh Duhamel) setting up a field office in Battle Creek, Michigan, and clashing with Detective Russ Agnew's (Dean Winters) methods.

title: Narcos
description: Young men and women narrate reenactments of the one event that changed their lives.

title: The Carmichael Show
description: 40-year-old Liza (Sutton Foster) returns to the working world as single mother with the help of a makeover from her best friend Maggie (Debbie Mazar), she passes herself off as a 26-year old and lands a job as an assistant to marketing executive Diana (Miriam Shor) and becomes friends with 20-something Kelsey (Hillary Duff) in the comedy...

title: Public Morals
description: The Gotham Chopra documentary focuses on the Lakers guard as he recovered from Achilles injury with interviews about his early years, players he admired, and what the future hold for him.

title: Vixen
description: The comedy series features Jack McBrayer and Triumph the Insult Comic Dog as former child stars who are reunited 15 years later.

description: The Neil Simon play that became a comedy series is updated with Matthew Perry as the messy Oscar Madison and Thomas Lennon as the very neat Felix Unger.

description: 11-year-old Eddie Huang (Hudson Yang) and his family move from Washington D.C.'s Chinatown to the suburbs of Orlando in this comedy inspired by Eddie Huang's memoirs.

title: Sneaky Pete

description: 16 new restaurants compete on all aspects of their business in this new The reality competition show hosted/judged by Tom Colicchio. BlackboardEats.com CEO Maggie Nemser and ‘Wichcraft co-founder Jeffrey Zurofsky also will be judging who will win $100,000, a feature in Bon Appetit, and a spot in the Las Vefas Uncork'd food festival.

title: Cold Justice: Sex Crimes
description: With Stephen Colbert moving to CBS, Larry Wilmore moves to the daily late night desk full-time.

title: Descendants
description: The Lifetime movie about the relationship between Whitney Houston (Yaya DaCosta) and Bobby Brown (Arlen Escarpeta) was directed by Angela Bassett.

description: Originally a digital series, this network version of Ari Shaffir's live show of the same name has Shaffir and his comedian friends such as Rob Corddry, D.L. Hughley, Keegan-Michael Key, Marc Maron, Steve Rannazzisi, Joe Rogan and Paul Scheer tell funny stories in front of a live audience at the Los Angeles's gentlemen's club, Cheetahs.

description: The 1995 film is remade as a TV show with James Cole (Aaron Stanford) time-traveling from 2043 to the present time to stop a virus before it can decimate the population.

Julianna (Alexa Davalos) leaves San Francisco for Japan to search for her sister's killer and new resistance recruit Joe (Luke Kleintank) is in New York to be assigned his first mission.

description: Based on the British series of the same name, Milo's (Billy Zane) early retirement brings together his college friends (Ben Chaplin, Michael Imperioli, Romany Malco and Steve Zahn) in Belize where their vacation exposes secrets and involves them in murder.

description: The adaptation of R.L. Stine's novel follows 21-year old hacker Lindy Sampson (Victoria Justice) as she searches for her sister and solves crimes in New York.

title: Tut
description: Tina Morris (Amanda Peet) moves in with her sister Michelle and her husband, and Brett (Melanie Lynskey and Mark Duplass) and Brett’s friend Alex (Steve Zissis).

description: The reality show begins with the wedding between actor/New kinds On The Block singer Donnie Wahlberg and former The View co-host Jenny McCarthy.

description: Furniture designers compete for a $100,000 prize in this reality competition show hosted by Common.

Once there, Kyle finds a dead body in a lagoon while snorkeling, but when the police come to investigate, the body is gone. Kyle convinces Budgie to help him solve the mystery and they will discover the real meaning behind t...

title: The Spoils Before Dying
description: Jose Antonio Vargas traveled across the United states to talk to young people about race for his documentary.

title: Zoo
description: Three experts: Chris Donaghue, Fran Walfish, and Yvonne Capehart discuss relationship and sex issues with three different couples before and after they have sex in the on stage cube in the reality show based on a British show.

description: The latest spin-off from the the Madagascar film series comes to Netflix as 22-minutes episodes of Julian's reign before the Zoosters appear on Madagascar.

description: The Netflix series explores the early days of Marco Polo's (Lorenzo Richelmy) time in the court of Kublai Khan (Benedict Wong).

description: A female mercenary team, armed with unique power armor suits, battle the forces of the corrupt mega-corporation, Genom in futuristic Tokyo.

title: Dark Matter
description: Three families decide to live without electricity or running water on TLC's latest reality show.

title: The Seventies
description: CIA analyst Charleston "Charlie" Tucker (Katherine Heigl) advises President Constance Payton (Alfre Woodard) on national security matters.

title: Aquarius
description: Based on the comic book series "Hellblazer," demon hunter John Constantine (Matt Ryan) is drawn back to the battle against evil.

title: Bullseye
description: Six undrafted players are followed as they prepare for the Super Regional Combines to try to earn a spot on a NFL roster.

title: The Island
description: Based on a novella from Stephen King, mystery writer Tess Thorne (Maria Bello) seeks revenge against a serial killer (Tim Harris) who attacked her.

title: Texas Rising
description: The documentary series directed by Dave Grohl follows his rock band as they recorded their eighth studio album in eight cities: Austin, Chicago, Los Angeles, Nashville, New Orleans, New York, Seattle, and Washington, D.C.

title: Between
description: A six installment series starring science writer and professional theorist Steven Johnson which examines at six big ideas and the impact they've made.

title: 500 Questions
description: After six years of dating, Annie (Casey Wilson) and Jake (Ken Marino) are ready to get married, but after many botched proposals, they decide to wait until they can get it right.

title: Bessie
description: After being told by her telenovelas-obsessed grandmother the importance of being a virgin until she married, 23-year old Jane Villanueva (Gina Rodriguez) finds herself pregnant after being accidentally artificially inseminated with donor sperm.

title: Wayward Pines
description: The series focuses on Hamptons waitress Alison (Ruth Wilson) as she tries to recover from a personal tragedy while her husband Cole (Joshua Jackson) struggles to keep the family ranch and their marriage together. The ramifications of Allison's affair with Noah (Dominic West), a New York City teacher married to his childhood sweetheart (M...

title: Grace and Frankie
description: The comedy special from the late night talk show host and comedian was filmed in Chicago.

title: Cleveland Abduction
description: Cristela (Cristela Alonzo) juggles law school, a job, and her skeptical family that includes her mother (Terri Hoyos), sister (Roxana Ortega), her brother-in-law (Carlos Ponce), and cousin (Gabrielle Iglesias).

title: Beyond the Tank
description: Alvey "King" Kulina (Frank Grillo) runs a mixed martial arts gym in Venice, California while training his sons Jay (Jonathan Tucker) and Nate (Nick Jonas).

title: The Casual Vacancy
description: The docuseries follows a group of friends who try to film a zombie movie in their hometown of Jasper, Alabama.

title: Happyish
description: The spinoff of The CW's Arrow finds Central City forensic assistant Barry Allen (Grant Gustin) with superhuman speed after being hit by a bolt of lightning during an accident at a particle accelerator. With the help of three scientists at Harrison Wells’ S.T.A.R. Lab, he helps the citizens of Central City as he seeks answers about his mo...

title: Chef's Table
description: Narrated by Matt Bomer, director Ben Steele's documentary takes a look at violence perpetrated by the various anti-gay groups formed in the wake of Russia's anti-gay "propaganda" law.

title: StarTalk
description: 29-year old stand-up comic John Mulaney juggles advice from his friends, roommates and neighbors just as he is hired as a writer for egotistical comedy legend and game show host Lou Cannon (Martin Short).

description: Cam Calloway (Jessie T. Usher) signs a multi-million dollar contract with a professional basketball team and moves with his cousin Reggie Vaughn (RonReaco Lee) to Atlanta where they face the challenges of fame and opportunistic family members in this comedy.

title: Lovesick
description: The romance of Andrew Lofland (Ben Feldman) and Zelda Vasco (Cristin Milioti.

title: Other Space
description: Los Angeles criminal court Judge Rebecca Wright (Kate Walsh) likes to party and play in a band when she's not at the courthouse.

title: Banana
description: Lt. Beth Davis (Maggie Q) leads the Threat Assessment Unit of the Los Angeles Police Department that includes recent transfer Det. Jack Larsen (McDermott), Det. Ben Caldwell (Victor Rasuk), and Det. Janice Lawrence (Mariana Klaveno).

description: At a fairytale theme park, Lucy (Bianca Santos) falls for Ian (Shane Harper), the son of the new president of the park.

description: The differences between men and women are seen through the thoughts of Dana (Analeigh Tipton) and Peter (Jake McDorman) as they begin dating each other.

description: The latest Star Wars animated series is set five years before Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope. The Imperial forces have been forced to a remote planet where a small group on the starship Ghost seek to end the Galactic Empire's grip on the galaxy.

description: Andre 'Dre' Johnson (Anthony Anderson) tries to impart his family's heritage to his four children while living in the suburbs while facing conflicting ideas from his wife (Tracee Ellis Ross), his very opinionated father (Laurence Fishburne), and his own children.

description: The New Orleans field office is led by Special Agent Dwayne Pride (Scott Bakula) and his team that includes Special Agent Christopher LaSalle (Lucas Black), Special Agent Meredith “Merri” Brody (Zoe McLellan), and coroner Dr. Loretta Wade (CCH Pounder).

description: A team of people guess the names of famous celebrities, based on descriptions and categories. The series won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Game Show Host - Craig Ferguson.

description: Before he was Commissioner James Gordon (Ben McKenzie), he was a young detective, partnered with the legendary policeman Harvey Bullock (Donal Logue). Their first case together is the murders of Thomas and Martha Wayne, where Gordon first meets young Bruce Wayne.

title: Wolf Hall
description: New York City medical examiner Dr. Henry Morgan (Ioan Gruffudd) seeks the answers to his immortality as he helps Detective Jo Martinez (Alana de la Garza) solve cases.

title: Olympus
description: Federal agent Cabe Gallo (Robert Patrick) recruits Walter O’Brien (Elyes Gabel) and his team of geniuses that includes behaviorist Toby Curtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas); mechanical prodigy Happy Quinn (Jadyn Wong); and math prodigy Sylvester Dodd (Ari Stidham).

title: Lip Sync Battle
description: Former CIA analyst Elizabeth McCord (Téa Leoni) is appointed as Secretary of State after the death of her predecessor.

title: The Dovekeepers
description: The coming-of-age dramedy set in the pediatric ward of Los Angeles' Ocean Park Hospital, is narrated by comatose 12-year-old Charlie (Griffin Gluck). He is friends with cancer patients 16-year-old Jordi (Nolan Sotillo) who sneaked into the US to get treatment; defactor leader of the group, Leo; Dash (Astro), who has cystic fibrosis; Emm...

title: Weird Loners
description: An American adaptation of the Spanish series Los Misterios de Laura, follows New York detective Laura Diamond (Debra Messing) as she balances life as a mother of twin boys and catching criminals.

title: Cancer: The Emperor of All Maladies
description: An actor tries to get a spinoff of "Veronica Mars" off the ground.

title: Killing Jesus
description: Dan Reed's one-hour film documents the terrorist attack that killed 71 people at a mall in Kenya on Sept. 21, 2013 with interviews with survivors and surveillance video.

title: Sin City Saints
description: The 14-hour documentary series from Ken Burns covers the history and influences the family had from the birth of Theodore Roosevelt in 1858 to the death of Eleanor Roosevelt in 1962.

title: The Late Late Show with James Corden
description: With her husband presumed dead from fighting in the Civil War, Belle Barlowe (Lauren Ambrose) deals with neighbors who want her family's ranch, her outlaw brother, while growing closer to sheriff Nate Cooper (Wes Ramsey) and raising her three children in Deliverance Creek, Missouri.

title: Bloodline
description: Set three years after a zombie virus nearly kills everyone, a team that includes leader Hammond (Harold Perrineau), second-in-command Garnett (Tom Everett Scott), and a computer hacker who goes by the name Citizen Z (DJ Qualls), seek to move a survivor of the virus from New York to the only functioning lab in California to produce an an...

title: Impress Me
description: Directed by Liz Garbus, the documentary about the people who work as New York City firefighters includes interviews from Steve Buscemi, who was a fireman in the 1980s as well as archival footage, some Buscemi shot while he helped out his former company in the aftermath of 9/11.

title: One Big Happy
description: Online daters meet face to face in a one-bedroom island house with 40 cameras capturing their interactions.

title: iZombie
description: Two first-time directors, Shane Dawson and Anna Martemucci, work on the same script by Dan Schoffer in the documentary series from Project Greenlight's Chris Moore. Ticket sales and digital voting will determine the winner of the $250,0000 prize.

title: The Royals
description: Loosely based on Dustin Diamond's memoir of his time on the NBC teen show as Screech (Sam Kindseth as Diamond) with Mark-Paul Gosselaar (Dylan Everett) as Zack Morris, Mario Lopez (Julian Works) as A.C. Slater, Tiffani-Amber Thiessen (Alyssa Lynch) as Kelly Kapowski, Elizabeth Berkley (Tiera Skovbye) as Jessie Sapano, and Lark Voorhies ...

title: Powers
description: The rise to fame by Harry Houdini (Adrien Brody) is illustrated in this two-night miniseries.

title: The Returned (2015)
description: Judge Pernell Harris (Ron Perlman) suffers a breakdown and believing he is receiving messages from God, seeks vengeance against the rapist who destroyed his family.

title: Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt
description: Set in the summer of 1985, David Myers (Craig Roberts), is working the summer at Red Oaks Country Club as an assistant tennis instructor, before he returns to college for his junior year.

title: Dig
description: The series focused on various murders in the fictional suburban English town of Middleford. The crimes are solved by two female police detectives, Inspector Kate Ashurst and Sergeant Emma Scribbins, aka "Ash and Scribbs".

title: American Crime
description: Set in a OB/GYN unit in a 1960s London hospital where Dr. Otto Powell (Jack Davenport) and his staff perform illegal abortions, deal with other patients, and their own love lives.

title: CSI: Cyber
description: Based on Michael Marshall Smith's 2007 novel The Intruders, former Los Angeles cop Jack Whelan (John Simm) finds his retired life disturbed after his wife, Amy disappears (Mira Sorvino) and drawn into a murder case by a his high school friend, Gary Fischer (Tory Kittles) that may be related to a secret society seeking immortality.

title: Billy & Billie
description: An animated comedy about the struggles of the former sitcom half-horse, half-man star (Will Arnett) while living in Los Angeles.

title: Arthur & George
description: Magicians compete for the chance to face professional illusionists and a $10,000 prize.

title: The Last Man on Earth
description: One day Eliza Dooley (Karen Gillan), who has 263,000 followers, realizes she has no real friends and hires marketing man Henry Higenbottam (John Cho) to help her learn how to interact with people face-to-face.

title: Battle Creek
description: Deep cover FBI agent Martin Odum (Sean Bean) returns from an assignment to learn he may not be who he thinks he is in this adaptation of Robert Littell's novel of the same name.

title: Secrets and Lies
description: The reality show follows the first season of the Los Angeles KISS arena football team, who are owned in part by Paul Stanley and Gene Simmons of KISS.

title: Good Witch
description: The talk show inspired by New York Magazine's Approval Matrix page is hosted by comedian Neal Brennan.

title: One Bad Choice
description: Married World War II nurse Claire Randall (Caitriona Balfe) time travels to 1743 century Scotland, where she meets Jamie Fraser (Sam Heughan) in this adaption of Outlander series by Diana Gabaldon.

title: Younger
description: Directed by Steven Soderbergh, the drama set in 1900 in New York City follows the lives and works of the staff of Knickerbocker Hospital including Doctor John Thackery (Clive Owen); Dr. Everett Gallinger (Eric Johnson); Dr. Bertie Chickering Jr. (Michael Angarano); Dr. Algernon Edwards (Andre Holland); and Cornelia Robertson (Juliet Ryla...

title: Kobe Bryant's Muse
description: The latest comedy series from Chris Liley finds 14-year-old Jonah back in Sydney with his father after living in Tonga with his uncle for four months.

title: The Jack and Triumph Show
description: The reality series examines the extreme alternative measures parents use to raise their children.

title: The Odd Couple (2015)
description: The comedy series follows the adventures of comedy-folk duo of Riki Lindhome (Garfunkel) and Kate Micucci (Oates).

title: Repeat After Me
description: The live-action Adult Swim comedy series from The Boondocks creator Aaron McGruder follows Black Jesus (Gerald "Slink" Johnson) and his Compton crew around Los Angeles.

title: The Book of Negroes
description: Hosted by Curtis Stone, former Top Chef and Top Chef Masters' contestants compete in one-on-one rounds for a chance to win $100,000 and a feature in Food and Wine Magazine.

title: Fauda
description: The latest Bachelor spinoff finds past contestants of The Bachelor and The Bachelorette living together at an exotic location to find love or face elimination.

title: The Slap (2015)
description: Hosted by Dean Cain and filmed in front of a live audience, illusionists perform a variety of complex magic tricks.

title: Schitt's Creek
description: The documentary series from Morgan Spurlock explores the modern interpretations of the seven deadly sins: gluttony, envy, lust, wrath, pride, greed, and sloth.

title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
description: Israeli-British CEO Nessa Stein (Maggie Gyllenhaal) has steered her family's company away from being a suppliers of weapons for Israel into a charitable foundation. Soon after announcing a contract, the suspicious death of one of her Palestinian business associates brings interest from MI5's Sir Hugh Hayden-Hoyle (Stephen Rea).

title: Better Call Saul
description: Hosted by Jonathan Ross, magicians try to fool the audience as well as Penn and Teller to win a trip to Las Vegas and perform with Penn & Teller. [Originally aired in the UK on ITV on 7 Jan 2011 - 28 Aug 2011]

title: Allegiance (2015)
description: Another freak storm, this time off the coast of New York City, sets Fin (Ian Ziering) and April (Tara Reid) back into battle with hundreds of sharks in Manhattan.

title: Fresh Off the Boat
description: Survival specialist Bear Grylls takes celebrities such as Tom Arnold, Zac Efron, Deion Sanders, Ben Stiller, Channing Tatum, and The Today Show‘s Tamron Hall to remote areas around the world for a 48-hour adventure.

title: Mel Brooks Live at the Geffen
description: Created by Sam Shaw, the drama follows the (mostly fictional) scientists and their wives as they settle in New Mexico to work on the Manhattan project.

title: Beautiful & Twisted
description: Russ (Nat Faxon) and Lina Bowman (Judy Greer) are parent to three young daughters in the Andrew Gurland comedy.

title: Fortitude
description: Self-absorbed writer Jimmy Shive-Overly (Chris Geere) and cynical PR rep Gretchen Cutler (Aya Cash) meet at a wedding and fall in love with each other in this Stephen Falk comedy.

title: Sons of Liberty
description: Los Angeles Dr. William Rush (Tom Ellis) is a private and discreet on-call physician to the very rich.

title: Backstrom
description: After Neil Truman (Matt Passmore) discovers his wife, Grace (Stephanie Szostak) hired an escort, he decides to secretly become one himself.

title: Nightwatch
description: Each week the docu-series will explore the stories of four young people on their decisions when to have or not have sex for the first time.

title: Best New Restaurant
description: Christine Rosa (Marin Ireland), working with The Innocence Initiative, clashes with district attorney, Adam Page (Damon Gupton) over a 11-year-old murder case in this legal drama created by Tony Goldwyn and Richard LaGravenese.

title: The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore
description: The parody series based on Bravo's "Real Housewives" franchise follows the lives of trophy wife Tawny (Casey Wilson), Crystal (Angela Kinsey), her sister Amanda (Kristen Schaal), British housewife Veronica Von Vandervon (Andrea Savage), Phe Phe (Tymberlee Hill), and Shauna (Danielle Schneider).

title: Grantchester
description: Dr. Ephraim Goodweather (Corey Stoll) and the Center for Disease Control Canary Team in New York City investigate a mysterious virus that may have roots to something ancient and deadly.

title: Whitney (2015)
description: On his 21st birthday, Axl Johnson (Emmett Skilton) discovers his family are Norse Gods in this imported New Zealand comedy.

title: This Is Not Happening
description: Bruce Evans (Greg Poehler) quits his job as an accountant to move to Sweden with his Swedish girlfriend Emma (Josephine Bornebusch).

title: 12 Monkeys (2015)
description: Astronaut Molly Woods (Halle Berry) returns from a 13-month solo mission to her husband and son.

title: The New Yorker Presents
description: High schooler Carter (Kathryn Prescott) discovers she was abducted as a child and the woman (Milena Govich) who raised her, was her kidnapper. She is reunited with her biological parents (Cynthia Watros and Alexis Denisof), a twin sister (Anna Jacoby-Heron), and a little brother (Zac Pullam) she never knew she had.

title: The Man in the High Castle
description: Based on a Danish reality show, relationship experts match six people to get married at their first meeting.

title: Mad Dogs (2016)
description: DEA agent Tony "Matador" Bravo (Gabriel Luna) is recruited by the CIA and goes undercover as a professional soccer player with the L.A. Riot soccer team owned by billionaire Andres Galan (Alfred Molina).

title: Rock This Boat: New Kids on the Block
description: In Charleston, South Carolina, former Chicago attorney Jamie Sawyer (Anna Wood) defends her clients against City Attorney Roy Rayder (Cam Gigandet).

title: Man Seeking Woman
description: The drama series based on Tom Perrotta's novel of the same name finds the town of Mapleton three years after "The Sudden Departure," where two percent of the world's population disappeared in a thin air.

title: Eye Candy
description: Freddie Thornhill (Ian McKellen) and Stuart Bixby (Derek Jacobi) have been living in their flat together for nearly 50 years, and now spend their days entertaining guests, arguing and taking care of their old dog Balthazar.

title: Togetherness
description: The TV movie chronicles the rise and fall of Warren Jeffs (Tony Goldwyn) after the death of his father, Rulon Jeffs (Martin Landau).

title: Donnie Loves Jenny
description: The sequel to ABC's Boy Meets World finds Riley Mathews (Rowan Blanchard), the daughter of Corey (Ben Savage) and Topanga (Danielle Fishel), about to start 7th grade with her best friend Maya (Sabrina Carpenter).

title: Empire (2015)
description: New York detective Caitlyn "Cat" Sullivan (Chyler Leigh) has been seeking her father's killer when she was demoted to foot patrol. Taxi driver Leo Romba (Jacky Ido) makes a deal with Cat after she discovers he lied on his immigration forms.

title: Framework
description: Former TV detectives Charlie Contour (Jennie Garth) and Holly Hamilton (Tori Spelling) team up once again to solve real life mysteries.

title: Marvel's Agent Carter
description: Gabi (Emily Osment), a food blogger, lands an opportunity to be the personal chef for Josh (Jonathan Sadowski), a young tech entrepreneur, but she has to prove herself to Josh's personal aide, Elliot (Rex Lee).

title: Galavant
description: Dr. Barry Al-Fayeed (Adam Rayner) and his family travel from California to his homeland for his nephew's wedding, where he must confront his dictator father and the issues he left behind 20-years ago.

title: Breaking Greenville
description: The reality series follows CeeLo Green and the Goddie Mob.

title: The Fighting Season
description: Based on an Israeli show, the singing competition show hosted by Josh Groban allows viewers to vote live via an app as the contestant sings. Groban, Kesha, Ludacris, and Brad Paisley will offer feedback and represent only seven percent of the votes.

title: Tatau
description: Based on the William Brinkley novel, the drama finds Captain Tom Chandler and the crew of the U.S.S. Nathan James are the few survivors of a pandemic that has killed off more than half of the earth's population.

title: White People
description: The latest adaptation of Alexander Dumas' classic novel follows the adventures of D'Artagnon (Luke Pasqualino), Athos (Tom Burke), Aramis (Santiago Cabrera) and Porthos (Howard Charles) as Cardinal Richelieu (Peter Capaldi) seeks more power and control.

title: Sex Box
description: Brother-and-sister aristocrats Georgie (Ed Gamble) and Poppy Carlton (Amy Hoggart) travel across to America.

title: The Lizzie Borden Chronicles
description: Contestants compete for a role on an online series on WhatThe Funny.com in this comedy competition show hosted by Marlon Wayans.

title: Hindsight
description: The series based on the 2010 movie Legion is set 25 years after the "Extinction War" between angels led by archangel Gabriel (Carl Beukes) and mankind-- with Archangel Michael on humanity's side. The few cities left standing include Vega (previously known as Las Vegas) where two families battle for control. A young soldier named Alex Lan...

title: All Hail King Julien
description: Steven Bochco's latest police drama is set in San Francisco where the series follows the investigation of two case by homicide detectives Terry English (Taye Diggs) and Hildy Mulligan (Kathleen Robertson).

title: Elf: Buddy's Musical Christmas
description: After being fired from her executive job, Jennifer Doyle (Jaime Pressly) moves in with her mother (Jessica Walter) and finds work at a bar.

title: Friends to Lovers?
description: The show follows one family who move to Los Angeles with the goal of becoming famous in 12 weeks.

title: Ascension
description: Set 1983, former IBM sales executive Joe MacMillan (Lee Pace) recruits reluctant Cardiff Electric engineer Gordon Clark (Scoot McNairy) and programmer Cameron Howe (Mackenzie Davis) to reverse engineer IBM's BIOS system.

title: Marco Polo (2014)
description: John Barrowman hosts the celebrity competition show where Landry Fields, Jon Lovitz, China Anne McClain and Lisa Rinna are transformed to look and perform like famous musicians and judged on their accuracy by Debbie Gibson, Darrell Hammond, and Sebastian Bach.

title: Bubblegum Crisis
description: Pirate Edward "Blackbeard" Teach (John Malkovich) leads a group of thieves on the island of Santa Compana in 1729. After an attack on an English ship to steal a longitude chronometer, the pirates capture Tom Lowe (Richard Coyle), a spy sent to kill Blackbeard and ensure the chronometer doesn't fall into pirate hands.

title: The Librarians (2014)
description: The comedy from Cougar Town's Bill Lawrence follows the lives of Danny Burton (Chris D'Elia), bar owner Justin Kearney (Brent Morin), Danny's recently divorced sister Leslie Burton (Bianca Kajlich), as well as bar regulars: Shelly (Ron Funches), Burski (Rick Glassman) and Brett (David Fynn).

title: The Red Tent
description: Actor Wil Wheaton's weekly talk show discusees popular culture and entertainment.

title: How Murray Saved Christmas
description: The night shift at San Antonio Memorial includes manager Michael Ragosa (Freddy Rodriguez), Afghanistan vet Dr. TC Callahan (Eoin Macken), Dr. Jordan Alexander (Jill Flint), Dr. Topher Zia (Ken Leung), Dr. Drew Alister (Brendan Fehr), Dr. Landry de la Cruz (Daniella Alonso), resident Paul Cummings (Robert Bailey Jr.), nurse Kenny (JR Lem...

title: One Child
description: Narrated by Jeremy Renner, this three-part, six-hour miniseries covers World War I and World War II by utilizing reinactments, commentary from Sen. John McCain, British Prime Minister John Major, and Gen. Colin Powell, to illustrate the experiences and decisions that went into the wars.

title: Peter Pan Live!
description: Ned Weeks (Mark Ruffalo) faces conflicts with his brother (Alfred Molina), his lover Felix (Matt Bomer), and Bruce Niles (Taylor Kitsch), a closeted investment banker, as he tries to organize awareness about a new disease killing gay men. While Ned's doctor and friend, Dr. Emma Brookner (Julia Roberts) does her best to council her patien...

title: Toy Story That Time Forgot
description: Ryan Lopez (Ramon Rodriguez) is partnered with Cassuis Green (RZA) to take down one of the biggest gangs in Los Angeles as part of the city's Gang Task Force led by Sam Chapel (Terry O'Quinn).

title: Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce
description: Originally aired in Canada in 2012, the four-hour miniseries is an adaptation of Kate Mosse's novel about the parallel hunt for the Holy Grail by 13th century Alaïs (Jessica Brown Findlay) and current-day Alice Tanner (Vanessa Kirby).

title: Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever
description: Maya Rudolph hosts a variety show with guest appearances from Fred Armisen, Kristen Bell, Sean Hayes, Janelle Monáe, and Andy Samberg.

title: Hello Ladies: The Movie
description: Hosted by Australian comedian Rove McManus, celebrity guests such as Jason Alexander, Mayim Bialik, Steve Carell, Tom Green, and D.L. Hughley compete in a variety of games with a set that can tilt on this reality show based on the Australian show called Slide Show.

title: An En Vogue Christmas
description: Rosemary Woodhouse (Zoe Saldana) becomes suspicious of her husband and neighbors after moving into an apartment in Paris in this adaptation of Ira Levin's novel of the same name (it was also made into a feature film in 1968).

title: A Royal Christmas
description: Four years after the end of season eight, Jack Bauer (Kiefer Sutherland) is still on the run and ends up in London.

title: Atari: Game Over
description: Emma Crawford (Jessica St. Clair) gives up her career in China to return to her hometown to help her best friend Maggie Caruso (Lennon Parham) raise her baby after the end of her marriage.

title: Risking It All
description: As West Yorkshire police sergeant Catherine Cawood (Sarah Lancashire) works on a kidnapping case, she spots Tommy Lee Royce (James Norton), the man she believes drove her daughter to commit suicide, in town.

title: State of Affairs
description: In Victorian London, Vanessa Ives (Eva Green) and Sir Malcolm (Timothy Dalton) encounter Dorian Gray (Reeve Carney), Dr. Frankenstein (Harry Treadaway) and his creature (Rory Kinnear) in this psychosexual horror series created by John Logan.

title: Aaliyah: The Princess of R&B
description: Originally aired in 2014 in the UK, the crime thriller finds Detective Constable Marcus Farrow (John Simm) is accused of murder and goes on the run to clear his name.

title: The Missing
description: The Daily Show's John Oliver hosts his own a half-hour satirical news show for HBO.

title: The Game (2014)
description: Meredith Davis (Ari Graynor) poses as a teacher at her friend's step-daughter's school after convincing Principal Carl Gaines (David Alan Grier), but not everyone is so easily fooled in this comedy based on the 2011 film of the same name.

title: Olive Kitteridge
description: Dr. Catherine Black (Kelly Reilly), an expert in neuroscience hides her bipolar diagnosis from everyone except her psychiatrist, Dr. Helen Hartramph (Vanessa Redgrave).

title: Eat: The Story of Food
description: After being mistaken as lesbians, best friends Karma Ashcroft (Katie Stevens) and Amy Raudenfeld (Rita Volk) continue the rouse as they become popular.

title: The McCarthys
description: In 1692 Massachusetts, John Alden (Shane West) returns from war to find his friend Cotton Mather (Seth Gabel) leading the Salem witch trials and his former lover Mary Sibley (Janet Montgomery), married to the elderly and wealthy George Sibley.

title: Benched
description: Actors, directors, writers, and visual effects people such as John Carpenter, Chris Carter, Richard Dreyfuss, William Gibson, Nichelle Nichols, William Shatner, David Tennant, and Phil Tippett discuss the concepts and ideas explored in science fiction in this four-part series.

title: Death Comes to Pemberley
description: The scripted reality show focuses on the life of Alan Thicke, his third wife Tanya, and his youngest son, Carter.

title: Constantine (2014)
description: Ken Burns' latest documentary follows a group of boys attending The Greenwood School, a boarding school where many of the children have learning issues such as ADHD or dyslexia.

title: Undrafted
description: The series based on the Coen brothers’ Oscar-winning film begins with the arrival of Lorne Malvo (Billy Bob Thornton) to Minnesota. Lorne's actions brings major changes to the lives of insurance salesman Lester Nygaard (Martin Freeman); Officer Molly Solverson (Alison Tolman), the daughter of former chief (Keith Carradine); and Duluth De...

title: Project Runway: Threads
description: Don Cheadle, Matt Damon, Harrison Ford, Michael C. Hall, and Ian Somerhalder are some of the actors, along with journalists such as Mark Bittman, Thomas Friedman, Chris Hayes, and Lesley Stahl who explore environmental issues in this documentary series executive produced by James Cameron, Jerry Weintraub, Arnold Schwarzenegger, 60 Minute...

title: Big Driver
description: The Mike Judge comedy follows the lives of software developers in the Silicon Valley (T. J. Miller, Thomas Middleditch, Kumail Nanjiani, Martin Starr, and Zach Woods) who try to develop a new software platform.

title: Foo Fighters: Sonic Highways
description: Based on Alexander Rose’s book Washington’s Spies, the historical drama series focuses on Abe Woodhull (Jamie Bell), who forms the first spy ring with his friends.

title: How We Got to Now With Steven Johnson
description: Executive produced by ShadowMachine's Alex Bulkley and Corey Campodonico, this comedy series showcases a variety of animated shorts created by different animators.

title: Marry Me
description: Newly divorced Will (James Van Der Beek), engaged couple Jules (Brooklyn Decker) and Lowell (Rick Donald), single career woman Kate (Zoe Lister-Jones), and married couple Andi (Majandra Delfino) and Bobby (Kevin Connolly) are friends who think each other situation is better than their own.

title: Jane the Virgin
description: Based on Justin Halpern's book I Suck at Girls and set in the 1990s, Jack (Christopher Meloni) is left in charge of his children, Frankie (Connor Buckley) and Rachel (Claudia Lee), after his wife decided to enroll in law school.

title: The Affair
description: 10 aspiring artists compete for a $100,000 prize and a contract with Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. They are mentored by Creature Shop artists Peter Brooke and John Criswell and judged by Brian Henson, chairman of the Jim Henson Company and Jim Henson’s son; creature designers Beth Hathaway (Jurassic Park, The Walking Dead, and Edward Sciss...

title: Chelsea Handler: Uganda Be Kidding Me
description: The semi-improvised comedy drama series created by Emily Mortimer is about actress Em (Mortimer) who hires her best friend Doll (Dolly Wells) to be her personal assistant.

title: Cristela
description: Based on the Alloy books by Kass Morgan, 97 years after a nuclear war destroyed Earth and forced survivors to flee to space stations, a secret project by leaders of the group sends 100 juvenile prisoners back to Earth to see if it is viable once again.

title: Kingdom (2014)
description: When a school bus of students from Ballard High is taken a national crisis is created as one of the students is the niece of an FBI agent and another is the son of the president.

title: Town of the Living Dead
description: Robert Rodriguez returns to his film "From Dusk Till Dawn" for this new series that looks deeper into the people who stumble upon the infamous strip club.

title: The Flash (2014)
description: The reality show follows the lives of Atlanta-based self-made multimillionaire Todd Chrisley, his wife Julie and their five children.

title: Hunted: The War Against Gays In Russia
description: 10-year-old Bo (Johnny Sequoyah) had been raised by a group of "True Believers" including Milton Winter (Delroy Lindo) since she was orphaned, but as her powers have grown, the danger from sinister forces causes them to turn to Tate (Jake McLaughlin), a convict, to keep her safe.

title: Mulaney
description: The docuseries follows actress Lindsay Lohan as she moves to New York to try to stay sober and restart her career after her sixth stint in rehab.

title: Survivor's Remorse
description: The drama series based on the Jason Mott novel The Returned (not inspired by the French show of the same name) follows the lives of families in Arcadia, Missouri who discover family members long dead have returned as if nothing had happened.

title: A to Z
description: Based on the Carl Sagan's original Cosmos series, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson hosts this new version.

title: Bad Judge
description: Carrie Watts (Cicely Tyson) is a widow frustrated with living in Houston with her son Ludie (Blair Underwood) and his wife, Jessie Mae (Vanessa Williams). She seeks to make the final journey to her hometown of Bountiful in this adaption of 2013 Broadway revival of Horton Foote's play.

title: Stalker
description: Narrated by Mark Konkol, the series takes a look at how policies and politics influence the people who live and work in the Windy City.

title: Happyland
description: George Lopez, an entrepreneur and recently divorced man juggles the demands from his ex-wife, Mackenzie (Jenn Lyon); his mother, Alma (Olga Merendiz); his son, Harper (Kaden Gibson); his uncle Tio (Danny Treho); cousin Junior (David Zayas) and teaching history at night school.

title: Manhattan Love Story
description: Pittsburgh homicide detective Catherine Jensen (Chloë Sevigny) tracks serial killers with the help of forensic psychologist Thomas Schaeffer (James D'Arcy).

title: Peaky Blinders
description: Directed by Robert Epstein and Jeffrey Friedman, the documentary uses clips and interviews to look back on the history of the award show.

title: Star Wars Rebels
description: Hosted by Nate Berkus and judged by Berkus, Eddie George, and interior design expert Monica Pedersen, each week two teams will compete in redesigning and renovating a space.

title: How to Get Away With Murder
description: Jonathan Creek, a magician with a natural ability for solving puzzles, works from his home in a converted windmill. He uses his abilities to solve impossible crimes and mysterious murders.

title: Black-ish
description: Forrest MacNeil (Andrew Daly) reviews life experiences such as addiction or sex.

title: NCIS: New Orleans
description: An uneasy alliance is formed after a situation in the Ramapo Mountain area brings together sheriff Harold Jensen (Martin Henderson) and Phillip Kopus (Jason Momoa), an ex-con and a member of the Lenape Tribe.

title: Celebrity Name Game
description: Gene (Jillian Bell) is under house arrest in her family's mansion with a nanny Billie (Charlotte Newhouse) in the comedic web series that makes the jump to television.

title: Gotham
description: Former con man Ross (Christian Slater) and his ex-professor brother Clark Edwards (Steve Zahn) are partners in Edwards and Associates, where they help people through the use of psychological manipulation.

title: Forever (2014)
description: Seth Meyers takes over Late Night with Jimmy Fallon's move over to the Tonight Show.

title: Scorpion
description: Loosely based on creator D.J. Nash's life, adult Henry Fisher (voiceover by Jason Bateman) looks back on his life as a 11-year-old (Eli Baker) with his sister Katie (Ava Deluca-Verley) after the divorce between his father, Mel Fisher (J.K. Simmons), a blind lawyer and his mother Joyce (Jenna Elfman).

title: Madam Secretary
description: Will Freeman (David Walton), an unemployed songwriter living off his royalties, finds his life changed by the arrival of Fiona (Minnie Driver) and her son Marcus (Benjamin Stockham) in this comedy based on the Nick Hornby novel of the same name.

title: Red Band Society
description: Ten years ago, a spaceship crashed just outside of Baton Rouge and some of the surviving Atrians are now being integrated into Earth society including seven Atrians into Marshall High School.

title: The Mysteries of Laura
description: The Tonight Show moves to New York City with Jimmy Fallon taking over for Jay Leno.

title: Play It Again, Dick
description: The one-hour comedy special for The View's co-host was filmed over two nights at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Las Vegas includes sets from Paula Bel, Tiffany Haddish, Lynne Koplitz, Justine Marino, and Tammy Pescatelli.

title: Terror at the Mall
description: 13-year-old Gortimer Gibbon (Sloane Morgan Siegel) and his best friends, Ranger (Drew Justice) and Mel (Ashley Boettcher) meet the people of Normal Street in this children's series from Amazon Studios.

title: Lilyhammer
description: The comedy based on the Blair Tindell memoir "Mozart in the Jungle: Sex, Drugs & Classical Music," follows the life of New York Symphony oboist Hailey (Lola Kirke) as Rodrigo (Gael Garcia Bernal), a new conductor who has unique methods, takes over the orchestra.

title: The Roosevelts: An Intimate History
description: Los Angeles homicide detective Harry Bosch (Titus Welliver) is under trial for killing a serial killer as he searches for another killer of a child in this series based on the books by Michael Connelly.

title: Deliverance Creek
description: In Jill Soloway's dark comedy Maura (Jeffrey Tambor), who previously was known as Mort Pfefferman, announces his transition to his ex-wife Shelly (Judith Light), and his three kids--Ali (Gaby Hoffmann), Josh (Jay Duplass, and Sarah (Amy Landecker).

title: Z Nation
description: The journey of Gabby Douglas to become an Olympic gold medalist (Imani Hakima and Sydney Mikayla).

title: A Good Job: Stories of the FDNY
description: 12 contestants from the US travel to England for a chance to win the heart of Prince Harry. The only problem is he's not a royal, just a lookalike.

title: Love Prison
description: During World War II, James Bond author Ian Fleming (Dominic Cooper) was a rich playboy who failed as a stockbroker and army soldier before finding his calling with a position with British Naval Intelligence that would later influence his future writings.

title: The Chair (2014)
description: The infamous murder trial of Lizzie Borden (Christina Ricci) for the killing of her father and stepmother in 1892 is dramatized in this TV movie.

title: The Unauthorized Saved By The Bell Story
description: Created by creator Jonathan Steinberg as a prequel to Robert Louis Stevenson's novel Treasure Island set in 1715, pirate Captain Flint (Toby Stephens) and his crew prepare to fight the British Royal Navy over New Providence Island with the help of Eleanor Guthrie (Hannah New), a daughter of a local smuggling kingpin.

title: Houdini
description: A remake of the Australian series of the same name, Keegan Deane (Greg Kinnear) is a self-destructive defense attorney who butts heads with his ex-wife (Miranda Otto), his friends Ben (John Ortiz) and Scarlett (Necar Zadegan), as well as his bookie and even the IRS.

title: Hand of God
description: The reality shows follows Paul Wahlberg, the older brother of actors Donnie and Mark, as they decide on expanding his burger restaurant.

title: Red Oaks
description: Produced by Amy Poehler, the web comedy about two twenty-something best friends (Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer) in New York City comes to television.

title: Murder in Suburbia

description: They came to Earth, disguised as friends. But instead, they took the planet's water and its people for food. But there's a resistance... to save the people and the planet.V: The Series is preceded by two miniseries, V and V: The Final Battle.

title: Batman: The Animated Series

title: Goof Troop

title: The Heights
description: Dr. Heathcliff "Cliff" Huxtable was an OBGYN (obstetrician/gynecologist), and his wife Clair was a successful attorney. They had five children: Sondra, Denise, Theo, Vanessa and Rudy. title: Martin
description: Highway to Heaven was Micheal Landon's second pairing with Victor French (the two both starred on Little House on the Prairie). title: 2000 Malibu Road
description: "Every time I turn around, I see the girl who turns my world around..." Seven-year-old Punky Brewster certainly turned Henry Warnimont's world around. title: The Larry Sanders Show
description: Miami Vice was one of the most innovative and powerful TV series of all time. title: Are You Afraid of the Dark?
description: Danger Mouse is about a cartoon mouse being a secret agent and living in a mailbox in London, England. This show originally broadcast in England/UK only until the fledgling network, Nickelodeon, picked it up and ran with it.

title: Melrose Place (1992)
description: The show centers around twin sisters Allison and Kate Foster. They begin as 17-year-old high school students in Des Moines. By the start of Season 2, they are young women pursuing their dreams in New York City.
